review:
It's unfortunate because this game has potential. I'm happy i did not pay for this game since there are so few people who play it. I always end up with bots. Haven't encountered a player yet. If i have to force myself to join a community just to play with actual players, then its not worth it.

edit:
12 juin 2018 - I had given this game a thumbs down. I have changed my mind and bought the game regardless of playerbase. the game is simply fun online or not. I recoomend to any 90s fps arena fans out there. there aren't many like this these days, honestly.
developer_response:
Hi there and thanks for your review!

If you generally liked the game, but gave it a "Thumbs Down" review because of its playerbase, please allow a quick word from the devs behind TOXIKK:

A) You're reviewing the game, not its playerbase. Note that Steam automatically reduces the visibility of games with many "Thumbs Down" reviews (assuming these games are less worth playing) which results in less people finding (aka playing) TOXIKK.

B) Arena FPS is a niche genre and you'll not find the figures of mainstream shooters in TOXIKK. More info about server activity and the game's playerbase can be found at: https://steamdb.info/app/324810/graphs/

C) During main hours, you should easily find multiple active matches. However, if you want to play during less populatd hours and don't find enough matching challenges, you may want to visit the community's live chat hangout on our Discord server at http://chat.toxikk.com

D) Last but not least, TOXIKK features an extensive single-player/bot mode that allows you to either play missions (contracts) or freely configurable matches in the full version of the game. In the free version, empty slots on the online servers are filled with bots.


So, you can always play a few matches with the full and the free edition of TOXIKK, when you have that Arena FPS itching.


Thanks and have a great day,
REAKKTOR Studios

review:
bro this game is trash. i'm dumbfounded that it has such great reviews. ive owned this game for [EDIT: a year] now, and i keep coming back to it hoping its gotten better. 

it has, but its not much.


how does spawning with only a pistol and 9 men, vs looters with aimbot and 5 more men than you sound like fun? 
cannot believe thats still how a campaign starts.

i get ambushed before i can even get to a town to buy anything and even if i make it, i can't buy shit. and i can't see them cuz its all long range aimbots vs you with a pistol and iron sights.

author: {'steamid': '76561197965768250', 'num_games_owned': 583, 'num_reviews': 164, 'playtime_forever': 2973, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2973, 'last_played': 1445999156}
review:
If you are considering buying this game, even on sale: DON'T!

Long story short: devs are incompetent and painfully amateur.

I had high hopes for this game, played it a lot, bought copies for friends, posted in the forums, the whole nine yards.

But patch after patch was ridiculous, drastic, buggy, game changing updates from the devs along with constant item wipes. They have no concept of game design and no idea what they want. They are also vindictive and immature when they delete negative forum threads and insult their user base.

This game should STILL be early access, 2 years after release. Crying shame that it's considered "finished". Oh well, I guess I expected too much. At least I know to avoid these devs and Panic Art Studios.

EDIT: Haha the developer response, I just can't stop laughing. Hero Siege still needs to be early access, just look at the patch notes to see what I mean. Seriously take a read, or check the forums, the perpetual churn is STILL happening.
A "final product on Steam" doesn't drastically change core mechanics and systems 2 years after release (just figure out mana, attack speed, item progression, HUD style, levelling, and waves, etc. already). Also excellent strategy to blame the community, I'm happy to see you guys are still unprofessional, immature, and rude.
Nice try Panic Art Studios, but your game is still junk and this review is still 100% accurate.

EDIT: 2017 update, 3 years since release, they are removing the core wave system and adding quests to their game. Seems like a drastic change for a "mature" and "finished" product that's "totally out of early access". What a joke.

EDIT: 2019 update, well I forgot 2018 because this game is terrible, but hey look they're rewriting it from the ground up! Because why not when the finished product is basically early access anyway?! https://steamcommunity.com/games/269210/announcements/detail/1720837069012973330

EDIT: 2020 update, in case you missed it the CEO of this terrible company is really racist and xenophobic, search "Hero Siege racist" or (if the link is still up) look at https://www.reddit.com/r/Gamingcirclejerk/comments/f7vli0/ceo_of_panic_art_studios_posted_this_on_twitter/

EDIT: 2023 update, oh hey there's an entirely new "2.0" release for this endlessly tweaked and poked game. I have never seen devs flounder and rewrite their game so consistently for so long: https://store.steampowered.com/news/app/269210/view/3711586011325739655

EDIT: 2024 update, in case you needed anymore proof the devs are absolute terrible people who don't care about their crummy indie game or their players, here's the edgelord lead dev saying "they can fuck off" about customers: https://imgur.com/577qgWQ

Just play Chronicon instead, it's actually a proper, finished product instead of the laughable Hero Siege.
developer_response:
First of all the game was released as a final product on STEAM when it first came out. Its the community who wanted more and more and more, so we decided to bring them more content.

Multiplayer was added about a year after relase as an alpha / test mode. It ofcourse had tons of problems because we did not have the proper knowledge or skillset to make a multiplayer game, but due to the community's pressure to make it into multiplayer we kept on working it and today its a pretty final product that works.

Just because we added something as "BETA" post release doesnt mean the game has to be EA.

author: {'steamid': '76561198137541868', 'num_games_owned': 298, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 326, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 326, 'last_played': 1490049844}
review:
So, after having the developer respond to my earlier review I feel like I can now recommend this game whole heartedly.  

My previous complaints were that the way the inventory system works can potentially leave you in a spot that makes it impossible to progress.  In short, whenever you use an item in your inventory that item is gone forever, even if you exit the game and reload.  As it turns out, there is a way to acquire more healing potions and other items necessary to progress, though the way you do so, while allows you to avoid getting stuck forever, brings with it a whole host of lesser problems.  Basically, there's a "Quest Mode" in the main menu, which you can hop on over to at any time and fight a series of enemies which allows you to grind for XP and healing items.  The obvious problem with this is that it basically forces the player to exit the main game and grind the items necessary to continue.  And while I have nothing against grind, so long as it's optional and the player is allowed to do it at their own volition, it is never a good idea to force the player into doing it.  Because while there are people out there who find the exercise fun (I being among them) there's a whole host of others who will find it very tedious and very tiring very fast.  To a lesser annoyance, this mechanic also forces you to exit the main game mode and play what basically amounts to a side activity before you can continue, which breaks the flow of the game somewhat.  The annoyance is lessened in this instance since the loading screen are few and brief, and you'll be back in the main meat of the game relatively quick, but it's still there, and I still can't help but feel this whole problem could be avoided simply by allowing items to respawn after you die in combat, or reload your game.

Now this has been a lot of negativity so far, but I put it up front because these were serious problems which prevented me from enjoying the game as fully as I'd like to, and the last thing I want to do is give the impression that this game is not worth your time, because it absolutely is.

The combat mechanics are very well executed, similar to other turn-based games such as Final Fantasy, Dragon Quest, and Stick of Truth.  And like all good turn based RPG's you'll start off being able to get through by bashing your way through brute force, but sooner or later you will have to adopt a strategy to go along with muscle, and you'll need to think through each of your actions in order to succeed.  It starts off simple enough but quickly becomes more complex and difficult as more characters are introduced and new combat mechanics are thrown in.  Turn based strategy nerds will find themselves right at home here, and there's also a nice learning curb for newcomers as well.

What sets this game apart from its contemporaries, however, is the unique art style and overall aesthetic of game and story.  It literally feels like you're playing a comic book, which may sound like a concept which has been done before, but not like this.  Infamous was done in a comic book style, but it didn't feel like you were playing a comic book.  TellTale games are done in comic book styles, but they don't feel like you're playing a comic book.  This, from beginning to end, feels like you're literally playing a comic book.  From the cartoony art style of the characters to the how the whole story is told using speech bubbles and pop-up text, to how every cutscene and even gameplay sections are transitioned using comic book panels, every detail has been fine tuned to give off this vibe colorful comic book goodness.  The developer really should be applauded for how much thought went into every detail to make the game feel this way.

Story wise, Light Apprentice is your basic fantasy affair, though with some slight alterations to make things a little more interesting.  You play as Nate, a boy who's been trapped in time for a few hundred years, and is suddenly awakened in order to save the world with his mystical power granted to him by the earth.  Yes, I'd be lying if I said I didn't see the avatar similarities as well.  But where avatar was sort of Disneyfied in its storytelling Light Apprentice is a little darker, allowing you to choose whether to kill or spare your opponents and even decide on some other moral choices throughout the plot.  These moral choices spice up the story, though they're not really as complex as we've seen in other games like The Walking Dead, nor are they played around with like they were in Undertale.  It's a good addition to the game, but not as well implemented as it could be.

Overall, I would absolutely recommend this game, especially if you're one for a good story and unique style this is a definite buy for you, and I look forward to what the developer has in store for this game as well as their future endeavors.
developer_response: Hi! Thank you very much for your honest review. We are working on the balancing together with the community and your feedback is very welcome! (the beta branch has the latest build with the new difficulty levels, more details in the latest News). In any case, another thing the game is not being explicit about right now is that if anyone finds themselves in this situation, they can go to Quests in the title menu to get some extra XP, potions etc. About the temple items disappearing, we understand this is quite frustrating and will be taking a look at that, it's the first time we hear about it. Thank you again and please stay tuned for updates.

author: {'steamid': '76561197970247553', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 447, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 169, 'last_played': 1471454208}
review: I paid the full price for a Humble Bundle on the strength of this game and feel ripped off. It's a very absorbing game, but only for about 5 hours - by which time you will have abandoned your first two games thinking you've made unrecoverable mistakes in an overly hard and badly balanced game, and your third game knowing you couldn't have done any better and that the game is actually broken. I'm now stuck, unable to do anything because I have no plastic. I've got starch piling up in my bio-dome and a couple of Bioplastic processors waiting for supplies, but my carrier bot and, apparently, some of my colonists, are just wandering aimlessly around the corridors.
developer_response:
Hello there, thank you for your feedback, 
 
We are always listening to the community and fixing any issues in the game. 
 
We would suggest that you play the tutorial as it explains all the major mechanics in the game. If you've already done so, maybe you can have a look at some of the YouTube [url=https://www.youtube.com/results?search_query=planetbase]let's plays[/url] as they will take you step by step on how to build a viable base.
 
We assure you it is possible, and not even that hard, to progress in Planetbase, as you can see by the numbers of people getting the game's [url=http://steamcommunity.com/stats/403190/achievements]achievements[/url], but it has some tricky mechanics that might take some time getting used to. 
 
Kind Regards. 
Martiño.

author: {'steamid': '76561198179624186', 'num_games_owned': 386, 'num_reviews': 22, 'playtime_forever': 3655, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2275, 'last_played': 1620686993}
review:
a game about making  Video Games....oh yah sign  me up. I first started out with the Demo  and the  pirated verstion that they them self  released. Once  when I played it I  just knew I had to play it. The game is good but hard. The only issue is with how they deal with steam workshop.  This game NEEDS mods because while it is fun it gets done after you 6th time you played it. 

The game  is fun, but  ir really needs mods. Most of the mods are based on one  mode  UltraLib. This mod no  longer works. In order to get a  working version you have to go to  a  modified version and compile  it  from scource. 85% of all mods use THIS ONE package and now none of them work. As mentioned  they own the source code so there is no  excuse. The devs claim they  have a good mod API, and sure it might be from the  dev's side. The end user finds it annoying and  a pest.  You only have one menu to enable or disable mods.  This  has no effect on your following status on there steam workshop page. This  means the  game has no way to stop you from downloading broen mods. This means you  need to  have both the steam workshop and game open at the same time. Finding mods that  are broke is now harder  thanks to steam workshop's new css layout. They should at l east have a button for  ultralib so you can filtuer them out.

Then you have the  broken warning messages.  When ever some thing goes wrong you get  a warning message. When you have a bunch of mods this measn a bunch of messages that  do not go away until you click them. It has been YEARS and  we still can not  turn them off.  If a mod breaks some thing I should know what one it is in the  message.  This game is old so if the api was so  good as the dev claimed why did it not have it 2 years ago when they broke the steam workshiop.  Kind of funny t hat the pirated  copys still work a s they do not  updated when the legitmant copys break on start because steam workshiop  turns on all mods at once.  The fact  that the devs have never thought about any of  these features shows they do not use this feature. 

oh and then there is whole "hate speach" thing. I  know this  is  because Valve sold out to chinese investor. I know your not responsable for this, but your buyers need to know that steam does and will censor those who have  real problums with games for the  "right side  of  history".
developer_response:
We have put a big focus over the years to both support old save files and not break any modding API's. We once even modded a mod in our update to ensure that it kept running smoothly, if we detected it was installed. This is just to say that we're not aware that we ever broke any modding features. Without specifics, it's hard to tell where you experience comes from. We are doing our best to support mods.

To be clear: I'm not saying that these issues don't exist - I believe you - I just wanted to point out that any such issues are likely due to unexpected side effects, not because we ever changed our modding features.

author: {'steamid': '76561198104443758', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 1641, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1641, 'last_played': 1509285769}
review:
I always loved the Dungeon Keeper series and hence, looked forward to buying War for the Overworld. I bought the Gold Edition and luckily, it retains all of the atmosphere of the originals, while at the same time adding new elements to it.
I like the new races and their trivia during the loading screen, it's even more descriptive than the information we got from the creatures in the originals(!) Likewise, the Cultist and the Succubus better fit the dark theme of the series than the Warlock and the Mistress did, in my humble opinion.
Overall the game has great enjoyability, with the singular exception of the time achievements. Which to be fair, are still being recalibrated by the developers in order to keep the game fun and balanced.
developer_response:
Hi Marijn,

I'm glad that in general it seems you've enjoyed the game with the exception of the timed achievements for the campaign levels. Thought I'd drop by and offer our current perspective on them.

By design these achievements are intended to be particularly tough, because earning all the achievements grants a unique reward in the form of a special worker skin we want to make sure that worker skin remains desirable and prestigious. In that way we want the time runs to be a real achievement.

Oftentimes if you're struggling with the achievements you can ask help from the community and they can usually provide some insight in the best way to approach a level.

As far as we are aware all these achievements are within the intended brackets of difficulty with extremely well practiced and experience players being able to beat the level with multiple minutes to spare, you'll find many guides online though some may be out of date with re-balancing (to which we've loosened some of the time restrictions as necessary).

With all that said we have another big balance pass on the way in the coming months during which we'll also have to consider the impact it has on the timers. I'll be passing your feedback along when we discuss them and we'll consider whether we want to loosen the difficulty as a whole.

Hope that helps provide some insight.

Cheers,

Lee

author: {'steamid': '76561198160183648', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 14, 'playtime_forever': 2506, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 15, 'playtime_at_review': 1209, 'last_played': 1711838601}

author: {'steamid': '76561198152549950', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 70, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 70, 'last_played': 1616801375}
review: ill try to be thorough with this review. I was surprised with how much i liked this game, in the beginning battles are challenging and there are few options of play style, there are some interesting ideas here that were refreshing to see and it all worked well. i expected to get frustrated with this game and stop pretty quick but i loved the sense of progression. my biggest complaint is it is so short, though worth the money because i had a good time, i beat it in just over an hour but i was heavily invested the whole time. i was interested in the loose story but at the end i might have accidentally found the ending too soon which was upsetting, but playing the whole thing again doesnt sound too bad so i might just do that later to see if i did miss some things. a lot of games these days fail to keep me and this one did so thats something. if you want a shorter experience that'll give you just over an hour of fun i for sure recommend this game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198061525011', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 170847, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 104819, 'last_played': 1706659061}
review:
Edit 4/15/19: So I want to update this a week later after the DLC update. My issue with SE right now isn't paid DLC, it isn't the price. It's the principle of the matter. 6 weeks after the game came out of early access for a full/gold release the first update they do is paid DLC. Steam doesn't allow me to set a "I enjoy this game, but I don't agree with what the Devs are doing" That's what this review is about, I don't agree with the direction they are going. It's not that I can't recommend the game, it's that I can't recommend what the Devs are doing. This review is a statement. This is my opinion of the game in it's current state. There is far too much potential that is being wasted and that worries me. 

I have been playing Space Engineers for almost most of it's development time. I have over 1700, and at least that much in modeling and modding for this game. Things have been going down hill for some time now. This recent update (the first after the official release and coming out of Early Access) added Paid DLC to the game. These blocks are "decorative" blocks, as keen calls them, that look similar to mods on the workshop already. They also have functions to them, such as a cockpit (which has a good amount more health than the other cockpits in game) a holo table that projects a small projection of a Blueprint, and a locker that stores your equipment. These are more than decorative blocks, these are functional blocks. I find it sad and scummy that Keen finally added blocks to the game that users have been asking for for years not even 6 weeks after "release" and expect money for them. They claim it's for future support and development, but why now after 6+ years of development do they suddenly need to offer paid DLC? I think about the potential this game has, and how it's going to waste trying to turn it into a AAA game with loot boxes and paid DLC. In a game about building blocks and creativity, locking blocks behind a paywall makes no sense for the consumer. Also it wasn't about the price ever but I love how I'm being attacked for my opinion.
developer_response:
Hi Spacebar,

Thank you for writing this review.

We really appreciate your feedback.

We are continuing to release free features for Space Engineers via updates, (Customizable LCD Screens, Replay Tool, Steam Badges. Steam Backgrounds, etc.) and optional paid DLC (the Decorative Pack), which is designed to not split our community. For more information please see Marek Rosa's blog: https://blog.marekrosa.org/2019/04/space-engineers-customizable-lcd.html

We are also continuing to optimize Space Engineers and fix numerous bugs in the game.

If you are experiencing any issues, please message us via our support site: https://support.keenswh.com/spaceengineers/general and we'll be happy to assist you.

Kind regards,

Keen Software House

author: {'steamid': '76561198128813131', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 2039, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1086, 'last_played': 1682258690}
review:
I'm going to start by saying that if you enjoy stories about robots, post-apocalyptic worlds, questions about identity, making peace with one's past, finding hope among things that seem hopeless, forming genuine connections and staying true to yourself and your ideals no matter how much the world tries to wrong you, then you should definitely play this game. It’s the kind that stays with you long after you have finished playing it.

Primordia is a game with outstanding writing, stunning artwork, soulful music and simple, but charming animations, all of which come together to create a truly captivating and memorable world.

The puzzles are fun and personally I had a blast exploring the world and hearing what the characters have to say in order to solve them, Memento’s being my favorite. Some might seem difficult, but the solution tends to be pretty simple. I haven’t played a point and click game in ages and it took me a bit to re-familiarize myself with the mechanics, so if you’re finding yourself struggling, that’s probably why!

The amount of voice lines written and recorded for the game is incredible, from simply inspecting things and interacting with them to idle banter and using items on something that you wouldn’t even expect to have a custom line. If you think you’ve heard most of what the characters have to say, chances are you haven’t!

Friendly banter between the characters gives me life. The fact that Horatio and Crispin care so deeply and genuinely for each other not despite their differences, but rather thanks to them, is really heartwarming. I am absolutely in love with these guys.

I’ve had only two problems with the game, first being misleading wording on the second question of a certain logic-related puzzle, which damaged my perfectionist I-solved-every-puzzle-myself pride a bit, but it’s nothing I can’t live down, especially considering this seems to have been discussed with and heard by the developers dozens of times by now. The other one is, in my understanding, an engine-specific bug, which causes music playing in the background to move to the audio setting, essentially causing two tracks to play at the same time. It affects your entire save and it cost me my second playthrough and quite some footage I'd been gathering due to me not realizing it was happening on time. (Moral of the story? Keep more save files!)

I’m not a particularly eloquent person in either of two languages I speak, but hey. This game pushed me to actually try and put my thoughts and emotions into words for a review for the very first time, so that has to mean something. I have been thinking about this game for the past few days and probably will continue doing so for years to come. Horatio and his friends have etched themselves deep into my soul, right next to stories I hold very near and dear. Did my personal history amplify that resonance? Probably. But that’s what stories do, don’t they? Among other things, they show you that you are not alone in whatever you’re going through.

Very grateful for being able to experience such a gem, even if I am a decade late. Thank you for creating and sharing it and good luck with your future projects, WWS.

P.S. Primordia-game dot com has a few treats for enjoyers of the game. I suggest you check them out!
P.P.S. Would really like to see a recording of that anniversary stream you guys did, if that’s possible.
developer_response:
What a beautiful review -- "not eloquent" indeed!  (Was particularly pleased you noticed the variety of banter/reactions.)

I'll ask Vic about getting the stream posted to YouTube. Hopefully he can do that.

You might enjoy Strangeland, although it's a very different game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198126765060', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 1888, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 686, 'last_played': 1677110491}
review:
Note that this is still in early access:
=============================
TL;DR
Ups: Good Concept. Good mechanics. Can be really fun to create your own drone. PvP with automated drone.
Downs: Not as fun as when it was in beta, Upgrade and progress can be halted by procedural generation.
6/10
=============================
NOTE THAT THERE IS SPOILERS:

The game was fun in beta (befoer the eraly access on Steam), getting random weapons and upgrades as rewards for progression. Just focus on making weird and wonderful drones that fits your imgination.

Now? Nah. Upgrades? You need to spent time digging. Special guns? Nope, just a skill tree now. Progress? Nope, all the remining missions are the ones you dont like ... Fun? Well ...

Excluding the PvP drones, which are still really fun.

Most of the other missions are basically the same thing. The snake eggs are annoying, because they can be quite hard to find in a large planet. So everything else seems .. the same. There is the barrel mission, but there is special place in hell for it later.

Amongst the other missions, (which ae mostly the same thing anyways) there is only one that i hate fromthe bottom of my soul. Perhaps it is because i dont find it interesting, or maybe it really is a stupid mission. I would like the devs to take a serious note.

The barrels, oh god the barrels. To put this simply, you are asked to design a drone with a magnet, in order to pick up 5 barrels to clean up a planet. What they dont tell you is that every barrel is guarded by ITS VERY OWN PERSONAL tower that outputs a large amount of damage, and explodes when you shoot it down. (Who guards interplanetary bio trashwith high tech towers?) These towers are generally placed practically next to the barrels, so have fun picking the barrel up and carrying it back to your mothership ^^. Oh, did i mention that the barrels are destructable? and they explode? and sometimes they explode for no reason? And that while 5 barrels may not seem like a lot, most of the time they only give you around 7 per mission? And that there may or may not be other enemy which may or may not explode which will blow up the barrels if they hit it a couple of time? So its just reset after reset, and hope that the barrels' gurdian angel dont shoot the barrel to ruin your mission every reset.

This will be bearable if you effort is rewarded, but guess what? the only reason you do them is to progress to later stages (like every other stage). You get nothing from doing them. NOTHING, not even resources. Thanks to procedural generation, sometimes, you may be as unlucky as I am. Where all your missions are done except for the barrel missions (I have like 5 of them ...) and every barrel, in each stage, is nearly impossible to pick up. I can kill the enemies and scout out where the barrels are. However, if i do that, the towers will explode with the barrels (because they are touching, not just close to each other, touching), and the mission is a fail. 

Your may think that i am stuck .. but no. I am already on my second run of this game, and the same problem occurs. Its not that it is impossible. No, it is simple not fun after a while (after you created a robot that can finish each type of mission with no problems, and when you try to make something else work it fails miserably) And trying on the literally same mission on different planets just adds to that misery.

Since this is still in early access, I wont grill the game itself, I likse the game, a lot in fact. 
But some of these things, like a single pixel of terrain that cant be removed by a LASER scan. Can completely stop your ship and force a reset. i dont even want to mention the number of times i had to reset because the bloody tower shoots the barrels that are your mission criteria. 

Maybe when the game is officially out, i will review it again. But right now, the game is only about a 6/10 in my book, better than most, but still needs a lot of work.
developer_response:
Hi FuyuMoro

Serious note taken!

Thanks for the detailed feedback, we really appreciate it :)

Edit: We reworked the barrel mission and added two more mission types so that you won't encounter it so often.

We also indeed need to find a solution for those tiny parts that can block the way.
If you'd like to discuss different kinds of unlocking and progression with us, please come join the forums! https://strayfawnstudio.com/community/index.php?/forum/4-nimbatus-the-space-drone-constructor/

Edit (April 2020): Nimbatus is now finished and will leave Early Access in 3 weeks.
Many things new features and lots of content has been added and many things have been reworked and improved. It would be great if you could take another look at the game and let us know what you think!

Cheers,
Philomena

review: Most realistic open world, 4d space game with endless possibilites i ever seen for single player or mmo.    Now that i played this game more.  I can be more thorough.  You can trade, farm, bounty hunt, pirate even do big space battles if your good enough as a fighter which im not. My only complaint is the Reputation to get the endgame ships takes sooooooooo long.  I never been a fan of something like that. author: {'steamid': '76561198046144500', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 1772, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 199, 'last_played': 1650160029}
review:
TL;DR: decent game that does decent at everything it tries to do, but comes out kinda flat. A decent romp for genre lovers that is riddled with too many bugs and crashes to be worth it. 

I enjoyed this game. I really like their choice of setting, I think they chose their mechanics well in how they mesh together. 

It's a solid game. But it gets repetitive. Enemy variety is a big problem, for one thing. They introduce more enemy types as you go on, and there's actually a decent few, but you interact with most of them in exactly the same ways. Because of this it doesn't feel like there's very much variety. While there are a good number of characters, a lot of them play similarly and they all lack variety when it comes to in-battle choices. It doesn't feel like it brings much new to the tactics genre besides, everything it wants to do FTL and X-Com have already done better. 

The only thing it really adds to the table is a blessing and a curse: it's low stress. It's not deep. It can be boring. But in that, it can also be quietly satisfying if you're just a fan of the genre. Personally, because of that I enjoy the game. 

But why am i thumbs downing? Crashes and bugs aplenty my friend. They've recently updated the game and now when I start my old adventure the game just crashes. At least I got to the battle first, last time! And this isn't the first time I've been locked out of an adventure because of constant crashing. As far as I'm concerned, releasing a game that doesn't work is fraud. It's inexcusable this is allowed to be a norm. Fix your game, then release it. Not the other way around.
 
I'd urge you to avoid this game on principle. But honestly, you're not missing all that much. 
This game is recommended only to die-hard tactics genre fans who need a fix.
developer_response:
Hi there,

Thanks for your feedback - it's noted. We're actively working on addressing some of the issues you've brought up.

I wanted to specifically address the crash you're experiencing as I think this is something we can fix for you. In general we do extensive testing on everything, but sometimes we miss things and that sucks. I can totally understand your frustration and as a developer there's nothing more frustrating than realizing we missed something. However, we are totally committed to fixing these issues.

Unless I'm mistaken I think the problem you're experiencing has already been fixed in the latest patch. When we released 1.0.9 there was indeed an issue that caused a crash for some people when finishing a combat. We fixed that issue quickly in the first 24 hours after the update. If the game still crashes for you on the latest build, I'd love to take a look at your save and see what causes the issue. If that's the case, could you send us an email at hello@robotality.com?

Thanks again!
Bach | Robotality

author: {'steamid': '76561198212352023', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 23, 'playtime_forever': 1269, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1263, 'last_played': 1697028836}
review:
Absolute gem of a point and click. Originally played this back in 2015 (ish) and held it as my favourite video game for quite a while. Replayed it just now, wondering if it'd still hold up, and it absolutely does. I think the main thing I love is that there's SO many (idle and active) voice lines, with absolutely exquisite voice acting. Yes, the point of post-apocalyptic dystopian wasteland that's all sorts of unfriendly comes well across. But the game also feels alive and makes me want to spend time with it. 
The characters are interesting, the puzzles generally make sense (within the world at least... pretend robot tech is magic sometimes), you can ask your companions for hints if you're stuck (and you can turn automatic hints off in the settings), the art is beautiful, there's a built in notebook so you don't need to physically take notes yourself (although I find that that helps for at least one puzzle). I honestly kinda don't remember the music, but blending that well into the world that you don't notice it might be the highest compliment one can give to a soundtrack?
developer_response: Thank you so much for this lovely review! I love reading about how all the parts fit together so well for you! That hint system was nightmare for James to code (as well as from a design/writing standpoint for me), so it’s always a balm to hear it helped a player engage with the game! :)

author: {'steamid': '76561198026138231', 'num_games_owned': 814, 'num_reviews': 37, 'playtime_forever': 951, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 254, 'last_played': 1652307797}
review:
Space Bob vs. The Replicons is by the same guy that created the legendary 6DOF title called Neon XSZ and from the minute you open the game several things are very apparent, you realise that Space Bob vs. The Replicons is very slick, colourful, enjoyable and that the creator (Paul) has coated his new baby in a rich covering of love - in other words Paul has poured his heart and soul into a very original and refreshing indie game which will appeal to gamers of all walks of life, young and old alike.
I found the game (so far) to be incredibly enjoyable and it made me smile from ear to ear when even just dipping my space boots into the enticing environs of the game world.  There is a ton of stuff to do and learn but I found the game mechanics/controls to grasp and it was not a major chore (as with some games) to get into.  Controls are logical but I will point out that I have only just scratched the surface but on what I have seen so far, I will wholeheartedly recommend Space Bob to all my fellow spacefaring travellers.
9/10 and well worth the asking price.
Neon XSZ was in EA for quite a time but it turned out to be mind blowing when it came to the final build.  Paul updates his games on a very regular basis.  Very true of Neon XSZ and also of Space Bob vs. The Replicons.
Space Bob vs. The Replicons has a sound footing and it has only just been released.  There is much to do, but to be fair, I love the dev's work and for me (and maybe loads of others out there), Space Bob ticks all the rights boxes for a game that is not overly complicated but FUN and that is what gaming is all about.  Just pure fun!

author: {'steamid': '76561198186558261', 'num_games_owned': 50, 'num_reviews': 30, 'playtime_forever': 17851, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 17851, 'last_played': 1637118118}
review:
After a long time, ive decided to review this game, as one of the very first pre-alpha players.. I've played AE since the very early days of AQ and DF, i was invited to the alpha, and as you can see by my play time, i have.... Far too many hours in this game, but.. That being said? Was it worth it? And im sorry to say this, but no... In fact, in the last year, ive barely touched it, the updates have been "okay" - but there are major, major problems with this, that hasnt been adressed for many years

Pay to win, is an obvious thing to call this game, and it very much so it, its a very manipulative tactic used by this game, often - in fact, they spend more development time, creating new "collections" for you to buy, using their currency, than they do actually improving their systems, that should have changed since the beginning of this title! 

Its been years and the combat, is still, one of the dullest combat experiences of my life, when the akriloth (dragon boss fight) came it, and many other boss fights came in, THAT improved it a bit - however.. The combat of your character itself is just, mash 4 buttons and do the same skills OVER AND OVER AND OVER AND OVER, you can alter -1- ability by grinding a lot and getting one of a handful of classes up, and then you get option to change that 1 skill, but that is the extent of what you can bring to the table, the only way for your character to feel -you- is by doing "transmogs", its incredibly unsatisfying and havent changed in years

The grind.. Oh the grind, the major reason why i stopped, EVERY few months, a new update would come out, and "here we go again, lets kill 500 of the same 3 mobs, using the same dull combat system, over and over, to get "that new random currency to buy those random transmogs and items which makes the previous progress nullified at least to some extent" 

Dont get me wrong, i LOVE artix and the devs, they are amazingly good, kind, and wonderful people! And they DESERVE the success, more than ANY other devs, and i mean this thoroughly - nobody else has stuck as much with their games through their years... And i've played them since i was but a teen! So you have NO IDEA how much it pains me, to write -this- review, and not a glowing one filled with love, because thats what i thought, hoped, wished, that this game could become. 

But its sadly just become; A monotonous grind, hoping for whales & sales, with dull, unsatisfying repeatedly grindy systems, and the most boring combat, that i've seen.

And with how much i love AE... You can trust me when i say; i dont recommend it.. If you WANT nostalgia, and a chuckle? Go ahead, give it a spin, but PLEASE do not give in and support WHAT IT HAS BECOME...

And if AE sees this? Please... Change your ways? I love, respect you, i was one of your first, ive even supported you through 5-10 collections, dragon guardian, multiple other ways... And in other games, too.. I WANT to support you, but -THIS- is what you've done to someone that genuinely supported you all these years... PLEASE be the change, be the developers i know you -CAN- be... Thankyou for reading.
developer_response:
Hiya Frost. Artix here. I was deeply concerned and saddened to read your review. As a long time player with nearly 300 hours of play time, you have been with us from the start. I would like to make this better for you and any others who feel the same. What changes or features would to see? 

Over the past year we have added new features such as PvP and Captstones. I think it would be challenging to overhaul our combat system at this point, but we could add new classes and skills. 

I was confused by your pay to win comment. We do not have any pay to win content in the game. The game keeps its servers online by selling cosmetic items. Over the past year or so we also added free troves which players can build through quests. 

Please give us a chance to win you back. What specific things could we do to improve the game for you?

Battle on!
Artix

author: {'steamid': '76561197968401303', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 22, 'playtime_forever': 22958, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1398, 'last_played': 1652256369}
review:
This game is incredibly cool.  There is such a fine balance between the people living in the base and the various resources gathered and produced.  I just lost several hours without realizing it and now will be dead tired for work tomorrow... but it was just that much fun.  

The only major improvements I could see being added to make it more playable are as follows:
I think the game needs is the ability to create more than one connection between buildings, water, and energy sources.   I can see where some more management of resources could be added, such as within a single building, setting the priorities on the various components.
Add a level of variety between the food varieties and general health.  ie, meat or veggies = food.  Instead, perhaps different types of food that are required, such as calorie heavy, citrus (can't let them get scurvy!), and such.
Adding non-synthetic meat sources would be a pretty cool addition.

Everything else is great.  All in all, I would have to give this a solid 8/10.

author: {'steamid': '76561199212354508', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 477, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 477, 'last_played': 1709985064}
review:
I review games after 100% them (the base game without it's DLCs) and I have to say this is a nice backing simulator. There isn't much of a story but the graphics and gameplay makes up for it. After playing thru the whole game I have to say I enjoyed every minute of it and would deffinetly revisit if it got any updates.

I rate this game a 10/10. The simplicity of it makes it engaging and quite fun. I have never thought of being a backer but this game has made me take that into consideration.

Do I recommend this game? Absolutley, it is a fun simulator with fun and easy achivements to obtain.

author: {'steamid': '76561198070693158', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 2677, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2675, 'last_played': 1568664022}
review: War for the Overworld is claimed to be a "spirtual Dungeon Keeper 3." From what I learned about the original Dungeon Keeper games (I did not play Dungeon Keeper first hand), it seems to be an accurate description. The gameplay was funny and challenging and I had an absolute blast playing through the main campaign. I am not normally a strategy/rts fan, but I found the mild dark humor quite entertaining, and a break from more traditional hero-centric game plots.

author: {'steamid': '76561198242721592', 'num_games_owned': 99, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 11880, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1216, 'last_played': 1692425597}
review:
I have played Illy, off and on, since 2010. I love that you can play how YOU want to, and the Global chat is the best one I've ever been in. Many players have been playing full time for years. It is NOT a scam, nor is it a PTW- and if you think it is, then just don't play it- simple as that. Yes, I'll buy Prestige- but only to help speed up some buildings, and/or building times. 
I suspect most who give this game a negative review, are the "lock and loaders"- the ones who prefer to play a "war" game where they can build up to the killing part in a few weeks, or maybe a month.
 Illy is LONG term. It is the most complex RTS I have ever played. It also has the most freindly community of any other game I've played- idiots will be hammered very quickly, veteran players will happily send you resources if you ask (politely) in GC.
I've never been able to dedicate as much time to Illy as I needed to- but this time, I'm here for the long haul. 
Illyirad is definitely NOT a FB game *laughs*

author: {'steamid': '76561198025580551', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 136, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 32, 'last_played': 1686886309}
review:
Now please note at the time of reviewing it I have only made it through the first new area as part of the new update and not got a chance to play through the rest so some things I list might come later. I will start off by saying thank you for not leaving this game I am really glad to see you trying your best to fix this game with that you have my full honor and respect and I hope to see more updates in the future for I will keep an eye on it and would recommend it on the fact that he is truly sticking by his game and could end up being something cool like Castle Torgeath Descent into Darkness or Dungeons & Darkness and at that price why not..

To start off here are a few things I ran into that I feel need work, sometimes when I attack with my short sword or mace the attack does not land where as the enemy keeps hitting me it's like Morrowind all over again. sometimes when the wizard skeleton hits me even with the mana shield active I fly back or up like 30ft I have also been hit so much to the point I clip through the map fall and die. The level up system seems to not work fully or unnecessary when I level up my weapons do the same amount of damage but the enemies do double even though they are my level and the last glitch is sometimes the enemies get stuck in a attack animation loop 

Now for things I feel you can add later on, 1) add a brightness bar or torch because the starting cell is super dark. 2) would be nice to have a map, 3) I would love to see armor, bows, and magic added later on, 4) maybe add some hands to the weapons so it does not look like I am a floating sword, and 5) if you can I would love to see you add more swords to the game or make the weapons level up with you.

author: {'steamid': '76561198087098968', 'num_games_owned': 184, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 22, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 22, 'last_played': 1555684193}
review: do not buy this game if you check the creators website you'll see that this is just a copy paste of another game of theres just retextured
developer_response: Aesthetic Arena is not just a re textured boom island. While they share an alike gameplay loop, they are different in their own ways. Boom island has beach balls that are only hit on impact and do damage. In aesthetic arena, cars do that, but there are also spiders that gradually damage you over time. Boom island doesnt have this type of enemy. Also, Boom island has an economy mode where you have to buy your weapons while this game doesnt. There is a difference between simply re texturing, and having a game with another atmosphere. Boom island is for those who like the old timey aesthetic, with old guns, and music, and camera effects. This game is more outrun style with sci fi guns, music, and themes. In short, while they have alike gameplay mechanics, its not fair to simply call it a retexture as there are also gameplay and atmospheric changes that make them unique.

author: {'steamid': '76561198054432410', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 17, 'playtime_forever': 33, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 33, 'last_played': 1586219035}
review: Never in my life have I been so pissed off by a video game. This game has one of the coolest mechanics I have ever seen in a puzzle game, great puzzles and graphics, the whole shebang. The problem is that this game so desperately wants to be Portal, that it becomes almost obnoxious. The announcer very clearly wants to be GladOS, and the place very clearly wants to be Aperature Science. My immersion for this game is constantly ruined by snarky remarks the announcer makes that fall flat on their face. It's kind of like how Poppy's Playtime would be a incredibly creative and fun game if it didn't constantly try to be Five Night's at Freddy's.

developer_response:
Hi, thanks for your support and sorry for this situdation, it would be great if you can give us the following info via email titled [Chinese Parents Bug Report], with the following info. The mail address is contact@coconutislandstudio.com to help us fix this problem, thanks very much in advance. 

[h1]Bug Report Info List[/h1]
[olist]
[*]Game version number (e.g. 1.0.6.0)
[*]Your operating system (e.g. Win 7 x64)
[*]Bug description, including how to trigger it, the more detailed the better. You can use screenshot or a short video to describe how does the problem happen.
[*]Your save data files.
[/olist]

[h1]Data Path[/h1]
[b]★★★Need to show the hidden files first[/b]
【win】C:\Users\"current user name"\AppData\LocalLow\moyuwan\中国式家长\Save
【Mac possible path 1】/Users/"current user name"/Library/Application 
【Mac possible path 2】/Users/"current user name"/Library/Application Support/unity.Dogleft.wenming/Save

You can also find the location of data files by searching JobMap.sav in your C: drive, you shall find all the save data ended with ".sav" there.

author: {'steamid': '76561198767696167', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 16, 'playtime_forever': 373, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 373, 'last_played': 1708749839}
review: Honestly the devs seem to have over-prioritized realism with this game, exhaustion is just a constant overbearing force that requires you to rest sometimes for multiple irl hours at a time, reloading is a pain requiring you to drag ammo to a magazine then to drag the magazine to the gun making firearms rarely useful, and I'm not personally a fan of inventory tetris. There are definitely positives to the game notably the nutrition system works quite well and real life medical problems with the exception of exhaustion flow very well within the game. It is also quite funny to have to remove your pants so as to prevent your character simply squatting and taking a deuce directly in your underwear, a misstep requiring many a rare bars of soap to clean.
developer_response:
Hi CopLegacy! We're sorry to see that the game left you disappointed in certain aspects. The exhaustion mechanic kicks in if you are bringing your character always to the brink of his/hers physical abilities, meaning that things such as prolonged sprinting sessions with weights on your back can bring your character down quickly. That is why sometimes it is a good idea to rest on chairs, beds, or simply lying on the ground so that your character doesn't get exhausted.

As for the reloading, you do not have to manually place a magazine into your weapon each time you want to reload. The only manual thing that you have to do is place bullets into the magazine. However, if you have a magazine in your inventory that has bullets in it, you can simply press 'R' to reload your weapon.

Also, we checked the situation with defecation and we have found that the character does not soil themselves if you pick the 'Poop' option through the Tab menu. You only do so if you do not manage to do that intentionally, which then results in your character relieving themselves with their clothes on.

Hope this clears it up for you and we hope that you'll consider giving the game another chance eventually.

author: {'steamid': '76561197993866401', 'num_games_owned': 610, 'num_reviews': 22, 'playtime_forever': 56, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 56, 'last_played': 1434590256}

To check on that, we have a [url=https://support.ubisoft.com/en-us/Article/000060572]helpful guide here[/url]! Should the issue persist, do not hesitate to reach out to our team on the [url=https://www.ubisoft.com/en-gb/help/contact#en-GB]Support Portal[/url], and provide your [url=https://support.ubisoft.com/en-US/Article/000061449]system files[/url] as well as a [url=https://www.ubisoft.com/en-us/help/article/taking-a-screenshot/000063164]screenshot[/url] of your [url=https://www.ubisoft.com/en-gb/help/connectivity-and-performance/article/setting-up-port-forwarding/000061022]forwarded ports[/url] from the connection article above as they have more specialized assistance to provide!

author: {'steamid': '76561198006959600', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 349, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 195, 'last_played': 1670996319}
review:
Had this game for a while in my library. Played couple years ago, then moved away from the game. Recently decided to play a bit. First of all, now I have to run some launcher. Why? Then, this stupid launcher did not start, telling me something about needed updates. All updates have been installed, and yet, the game does not start. Very disappointed.
Updates:
After sending a ticket to tech support was contacted by their tech and told that they fixed the issue. I tried again and nothing has changed.
developer_response:
Hi there,

Usually when you get an update required message, it means you're trying to log into an account which doesn't have the game license on it. Do you have an old account? Try to log into that if you haven't tried alreay.

If you're still having issues, get in touch here:

https://customersupport.frontier.co.uk/hc/en-us

And we'll sort you out.

- CMDR Zenit

author: {'steamid': '76561198185225318', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 370, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 370, 'last_played': 1479767251}
review: I honestly think ARTIX should have kept their 2d game theme, even though this is a nice try. Even if I haven/t played much, I really did not enjoy the gameplay. The graphis were quite bad, the quests were to long to do, and everything seemed kind of basic. There was no real "thing" in the game that lets it stand out from the hundreds just like it. Even though I loved Dragon Fables, Adventure Quest, AQW, Mech Quest (and etc), I'll have to say no for this one.
developer_response:
Thank you so much for your review and feedback. AdventureQuest 3D is inspired by our original games AdventureQuest and DragonFable. It has always been our dream to create a 3D MMO and first started creating AQ3D in 2012, before Flash decided to drop support on its new 3D program, so we were forced to learn Unity 3D then opened the Tech Demo for AQWorlds Members in November 2014. The headway we make on AQ3D, which is our first cross platform game, will help us work on improving our older 2D games and make them cross platform as well!

The devs are constantly working on fixing and improving issues and releasing updates/patches almost weekly. This has been a constant balance as an indie game company with a small staff. Please check out the Game Plan and Design Notes for updates - https://aq3d.com/news/ & https://aq3d.com/game-plan/.

author: {'steamid': '76561198044658754', 'num_games_owned': 2633, 'num_reviews': 21, 'playtime_forever': 478, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 253, 'last_played': 1462129984}
review: Colonist AI is terrible.  Like, my "Biologists" (the only people allowed to grow food) ignored the BioDome for five entire days while every plant was red (not growing because it hadn't been tended for too long) and just walked in and out of the airlock (tying it up and slowing every other colonist down that needed to pass through) for five days until everyone starved.  RIP my third base.  If there was any way to get a colonist to DO HIS JOB occasionally this game might be really good.  I wouldn't know.
developer_response:
Hello there,

If your Biologists are not doing their jobs this is likely because they are sick, or incapacitated.

Please have a look at the AI section of our FAQ here to fund out more info about how to prevent this:
http://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=577310241

But if you think this is a genuine bug, please send us an email to "bugs at madrugaworks dot com" and we gladly investigate the issue.

Kind Regards.
Martino.

author: {'steamid': '76561198064287020', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 240, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 240, 'last_played': 1579495182}
review:
I, like many, was introduced to this game via Pewdiepie. No foul play on his part, the game is OK and paid sponsorships aren't bad. (unless its raid shadow legends). But this game is exceedingly mediocre. Every PVP round feels the same, and the single player stuff is as stale as a loaf of bread that's been left out for a week. Very much pay to play, unless you want to be grinding forever. There is almost SEVEN HUNDRED FUCKING DOLLARS worth of dlc. That alone is a massive red flag. The vehicle building is kinda neat but that's about the only thing I've found entertaining in this game. If the game was say, $35 and wasn't a massive grind fest, sure. I'd probably buy it. But I'd rather not spend hours grinding to get cooler cars, and I'm not spending thirty bucks just for that and some bits and bobs.
 
TL;DR. EHHH.
developer_response: Hello! The game is free to play, and it can and is played by many people without purchasing any packs - everything there is in the game can be obtained by unlocking parts while levelling up, trading the loot and resources, crafting and looking for good deals on the ingame market. Speaking of the similar types of vehicles in the beginning - players start with a small variety of basic parts and encounter first bots as training wheels of sorts to get used to the game, and then, after a few first levels, players of the similar beginning levels. Once the new players get past this learning stage, they unlock and craft more parts and encounter other developed players where the fun and build diversity really starts. If you look into the Exhibition in the game, you'll see a great many unusual and clever builds, from X-Wings to spider-legged tanks. Thank you for your feedback!

Hey there and I'm sorry that you have not been able to play UNO! I'd like to see if we can get this fixed by completing some troubleshooting. Please try the steps below and try the game again: 

- Ensure the game is installed on the same drive as both Steam and Ubisoft Connect
- Clear the cache in [url=https://help.steampowered.com/en/faqs/view/6AD7-820D-8BE5-E51F]Steam[/url]
- Clear the cache in [url=https://www.ubisoft.com/en-gb/help/connectivity-and-performance/article/emptying-the-cache-of-ubisoft-connect-pc/000061966]Ubisoft Connect[/url]
- Complete our guide [url=https://www.ubisoft.com/en-us/help/connectivity-and-performance/article/troubleshooting-technical-issues-on-pc/000061047]here[/url]
- Run Microsoft's [url=https://support.microsoft.com/en-us/topic/use-the-system-file-checker-tool-to-repair-missing-or-corrupted-system-files-79aa86cb-ca52-166a-92a3-966e85d4094e]System File Checker tool[/url] to repair any missing or corrupted files
- Reinstall the [url=https://www.ubisoft.com/en-gb/help/connectivity-and-performance/article/reinstalling-supporting-software/0000]supporting software[/url] for the game

However, if you are still unable to play the game afterwards then please create a [url=https://www.ubisoft.com/en-us/help/contact]support case[/url] with us and [url=https://www.ubisoft.com/en-us/help/connectivity-and-performance/article/submitting-files-to-ubisoft-support/000063176]attach[/url] your [url=https://www.ubisoft.com/en-us/help/connectivity-and-performance/article/generating-a-microsoft-system-information-report/000078753]MSinfo[/url] and [url=https://www.ubisoft.com/en-us/help/connectivity-and-performance/article/generating-a-directx-diagnostic-report/000078583]DxDiag[/url] files.

author: {'steamid': '76561198129828353', 'num_games_owned': 204, 'num_reviews': 16, 'playtime_forever': 13, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 13, 'last_played': 1543321839}
review: Unplayable and fake positive reviews.
developer_response:
We have nothing but honest reviews, as you can see, since we left Early Access we've had 1 positive and the others have been negative. The positive reviews are from Early Access where starting issues were not present due to one or two players starting fresh. We went through a process the first day of finding issues with the flood of people trying the new starting scene which broke our event system. 

Since then we've simplified the starting intro and the News, Daily Cards and 'Press V' windows can not show on the first map nor inside the 'Old Man's House' which eliminates the lock caused by those interfaces. 

I hope this speedy update will enabled you to come and give us a try again and join everyone else levelling up!

author: {'steamid': '76561198411163791', 'num_games_owned': 162, 'num_reviews': 37, 'playtime_forever': 1373, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 545, 'last_played': 1609372850}
review:
Difficult to recommend. I like the music, but it gets repetitive after a while. There are 10 or so enemy types, which could get boring. The story overall is short but slow, I can finish in around 10 hours given that I don't go hunting for all the collectibles. 

It is an interesting adaptation of the Journey to the West story, which was, arguably, better executed by the movie. I would suggest this game to those who like Sun Wukong or younger children if the game is on sale for around 50% off or less.

author: {'steamid': '76561198051362575', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 28, 'playtime_forever': 418, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 418, 'last_played': 1696606125}
review: Not for me. Days and weeks pass, but seasons and years do not. Meaning that although I've played countless days--since it is October in the real world, it is Halloween in the game. And it will continue to be Halloween, no matter how many days pass in-game, till mid-November. (And why mid-November? I'm already sick of it now, I can't imagine how I'll feel on like,  November 10). The game gives me a trapped feeling, and it makes me feel like I'm not progressing.
developer_response: I’m sorry you’re not enjoying the Halloween event! For future reference, there’s a setting to turn off seasonal content like the Halloween/Winter/Spring events. If you go to settings > extras, there should be a toggle labeled “Seasonal Content:” which you can set to “off”. I hope that helps!

author: {'steamid': '76561197977455550', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 28, 'playtime_forever': 672, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 383, 'last_played': 1583320631}
review:
I think this might be my first review ever.  I was a huge fan of Dungeon Keeper and Dungeon Keeper 2 and was so excited about this game, I was a backer for the game and have followed it for quite some time.

It isn't nice to play, I know it is meant to be evil but the problem is the units don't work well.  When fighting they bounce and float around, they all stack and pile on each other, deselecting things is sometimes quite hard (potions for example) and you can't cancel build orders for potions either.

The game feels like Dungeon Keeper in a lot of respects but not just in the good ways, it feels like a game from 10 years ago.  I was hoping for a new & improved game with lots of awesome extra little things, information and a game that really got you involved.  This game is not that, I wouldn't recommend spending the money on this semi finished fairly lame attempt at Dungeon Keeper 3 which ended up being Dungeon Keeper 1.5.  If you've played DK before skip this game as there is nothing that feels new or exciting and if you haven't then skip this game as it will feel outdated and buggy.
developer_response:
Hi Chaz,

I'm truly sorry to hear that you're dissapointed with the game, especially as you've been following the project for such a long time and are responsible for helping to make it a reality. Firstly I'd like to thank you for that support that helped to get this game off the ground.

I would like to say we're commiteted to continuing our support of the game with new features and improvements over the coming months. Perhaps you'll see some things make it in that will 

With regards to deselecting and cancelling potions, once you've got a potion in your hand you can either drop it into a cauldron in the world or onto the free cauldrons tab in the potion interface, this will drop it into a random cauldron if one is free. I do think these needs to be made clear to the player at some point and I'll see if there's anything we can do on that.

Cancelling potions I'm personally in agreement on. Originally it was possible to cancel a potion order by right-clicking the interface, however to make it consistent with the rest of the tabs we simply had it zoom to the in-progress potion (Which a slap will cancel) but after playing with it following your review I think it needs to be looked at again.

I'll have a chat with our designer about that.

Finally on combat, that's much more of a difficult area, we're making some improvements in Patch 1.4 (Which releases alongside the first campaign expansion ) that will make the leveling process a bit more interesting. We're also making changes to Unit Shields so combat is more visible.

I can't make any promises on any other area but if enough people feel that combat ends up clumping too much we're always happy to take that feedback on board and maybe experiment a little with it.

In the mean time I hope you'll keep your eye to see what we do in the future, we've learned a lot of lessons from WFTO and we'll keep improving that and take the lessons we've learned into future projects!

Cheers,

Lee

author: {'steamid': '76561198016924361', 'num_games_owned': 172, 'num_reviews': 36, 'playtime_forever': 475, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 152, 'last_played': 1703210214}
review:
Un juego que vengo esperando hace mucho tiempo. Jugué la demo y el juego no decepciona.

Muchos dicen que es un "Papers, Please" en 3D. Es similar, pero hay más mecánicas y temas de movilidad, obviamente. La exploración por el mapa es interesante, como el sistema de economía y las decisiones.

Recomiendo totalmente.

author: {'steamid': '76561198018862288', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 72, 'playtime_forever': 6373, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 6259, 'last_played': 1658385333}
review: Well... it's a cute idea, and I had fun with it for a few rounds while I was figuring out how to get things rolling - but I've just gotten to the point where I needed to make a second district to get dynamite and now I'm... instantly bored.  Another reviewer mentioned the issue with districts, and I have to agree - having restarted several times in order to take advantage of things I'd learned, going through all the early setup again, the grind, the wait, the slow building up - now I need a new district, and now I find out that that district can't just simply share resources with any other district, no, you have to arrange to have it shipped in, or you have to set up the whole system again.  And there's nothing else to do EXCEPT set up the whole system again.  So... eh.  Thirty bucks for early access was pretty steep, I took a risk based on the "overwhelmingly positive" rating but I regret having spent that money - for now.  As it *is* early access there's a chance things will change/improve enough to make it much more playable, so we'll see.  One thing I would really love to see is a sandbox mode - so when you're kind of worn out from facing and overcoming challenges, you can go to a world with unlimited resources and items and play around with builds, setups, supply chains, etc.
developer_response:
Hello!

Hello Doomdrvk,

thank you for your feedback. Keen Software House does not ban anyone anywhere. We are more than open for comments and feedback. And we are trying to work with our community very closely. We always say, that without our community, the game would not be where it is these days. 

The video you've added has been discussed very often. Our CEO had several Q&A discussions with our players and he openly discussed about all topics. 

https://blog.marekrosa.org/2018/03/space-engineers-answering-community.html

As already said, we are open to the feedback. We have just launched new support site where you can submit your ideas, let us know about bugs, but also vote for the topics, or ideas you like. You can find it here:  https://support.keenswh.com/

I see that you have 0 hours played in last 2 weeks, so I would recommend to run the game and play the multiplayer which was significantly improved and changed. 

I hope you'll enjoy it and in case you'll experience any problem, please let us know. 

Thank you and have a great day!

author: {'steamid': '76561198917372142', 'num_games_owned': 136, 'num_reviews': 73, 'playtime_forever': 1997, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 212, 'playtime_at_review': 1665, 'last_played': 1712428120}
review:
Built an economic empire and then went to war with France

10/10 would wage war on the French again

On a more serious note, this game is quite cool if you're the right kind of person. Only critique that I have after 27 hours of playing is that waging war on a country gets boring really fast. All enemy convoys will have the same ships and very boring captains. They are super easy to beat manually, but if you choose automatic you take heavy losses. Clearly the AI is just very bad. So yeah, if you are at war with a country it will get boring really quick, but aside from that the game is great.

author: {'steamid': '76561198212339955', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 274655, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 157658, 'last_played': 1706137436}
review:
build a weaponised vehicle, then ride out and kill with it, simple right? wrong. Crossout has some amazing depth to it's physics. in terms of format the game is a little repetitive but in actual gameplay the diversity is brilliant. 2500hrs in and i'm still seriously interested in the game and learning about new mechanics and metas.
 
The devs have gotten a lot better with updates and they now have a test server for all to go and try and give feedback on updates in the pipeline. they listen to the feedback.

Ppl give out about matchmaking sometimes, usually coz they don't understand its complexity, a higher powerscore opponent only means they are less skilled than u and that they are being matched against lower powerscores to improve gameplay all round for everyone. 

Its a slow grind if u intend on putting zero money in, but it is possible to do it, with the help of crossoutdb.com for market work. it will be a few months before u feel like u have any proper progress happening, but if u can afford 1 or 2 middle of the road packs to start off, totalling say 30 or 40 euro, then u can get stuck into the proper grind early and use the market to flip ure coin as you go (be careful it takes some skill/experience), from there on its very possible to grind ure way to the endgame, will just take some decent time input (months to years!). 

on the flip side if u have the time to put in, it's a very enjoyable game even at newbie stage. this is pretty much the only game i play for a good while now. The Clan wars content at end game is great too, and the rewards are tasty to be fair.

developer_response: Hey ChevyAndVW! I'm sorry to hear you've been unable to launch the game. I can understand how frustrating this can be. There are reasons outside system requirements as to why you could be encountering this, so we can look into it if you'd like. As a rule of thumb, it's recommended to check over our general troubleshooting [url=https://support.ubisoft.com/en-us/Article/000061047]steps[/url] as these can resolve many assorted performance issues, and also improve PC optimization. Sometimes background applications can cause conflicts with games, so it would be worthwhile to [url=https://support.ubisoft.com/en-US/Article/000063761]disable them[/url] in order to determine which one could be causing an issue. Our guide shows softwares that sometimes interfere. Should the issue persist, do not hesitate to reach out to our team on support.ubi.com and provide your [url=https://support.ubisoft.com/en-US/Article/000061449]system files[/url] so that the technical team can further investigate the game's failure to load on your machine, and provide further specialized assistance.

author: {'steamid': '76561198168848389', 'num_games_owned': 90, 'num_reviews': 14, 'playtime_forever': 651, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 400, 'last_played': 1549941494}
review:
I wish i could rate this game in the middle i really like the game for what it is a free super smash bros. melee, but it has to many problems.

1. Lag is by far the worst problem i have some games with very little to no lag at all, but most games consist of alot of lag and even just the small lag spikes can cause you to not be able to recover or miss a kill. (Makes the game somewhat unplayable)

2. It is almost impossible to unlock characters besides now your first one. i get that it is f2p but this is way over the top for difficulty. At least they added that you can see their moves in training, but the bot for training doesn't work.

3. This adds more into the character thing. Getting the currencey is nearly impossible because you have to get a duplicate from a crate that takes a bit to get for the lack of a reward in them. You should at least be able to sell legendary items that you get for currencey or do quests or even just from leveling up yourself or a spacific character. (it would also give more insentive to play other fighters)

These to me are the 3 big problems in the game. There are lots of smaller problems, but they don't hurt the game to badly. Hopefully sense this is in early access the unplayable lag gets fixed and they do something to help with getting characters and rewards for free. I really like this game and see potential with combos fitting together nicely and the game flow being very smooth when it isn't lagging, but for now i will have to rate it a thumbs down until it is fixed.
developer_response:
Thank you for the review! We've been reading through every single piece of feedback and we're humbled by the outpouring of responses. I'm excited to share the recent steps we've made to address your feedback.

We're working on several new features to make the game fun and engaging right from the get go. This includes granting a character much earlier and giving more ways to earn spectra. We expect those to start coming online soon.

This is just the start. We entered Early Access so that we can work directly with you to make Icons ready for the world. You can read about the roadmap here:
https://steamcommunity.com/app/684200/discussions/0/3160848559782811668/

Thanks again for the feedback. Please feel free to send any more ideas and thoughts our way. We're excited for what's in store.

author: {'steamid': '76561198288777697', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 28, 'playtime_forever': 5676, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 123, 'last_played': 1648154476}
review:
Performance is much worse than CMANO.
Nothing has improved.
UI bugs causing weird glitches.
Tried to play "Hail Mary" to compare performance to CMANO.
It came to a grinding halt just an hour or so into the scenario when ICBMs launch against Iwo Jima.
It took me about 16 real life seconds (on full time warp) to pass 1s in game.

So that answers the question if devs have optimized the game engine.
NO. They have not. They have instead managed to make it a lot worse than before.

Took me just over 2h to test this all out so now refund is also out of the question.
developer_response:
Hi shakamaca,

We are sorry the game does not seem to live up to your expectations. However, I would like to point out a couple of things related to your review.

First of all, the game is measurably faster than CMANO ever was and the code has been optimized significantly. If you are not seeing this reflected on your end. Please contact your support team (support[at]slitherine.com) and they will help you assess the situation.

Secondly, I would like to point out that CMO has vast improvements over CMANO. Both from a UI/UX perspective and when it comes to the fidelity of the simulation. A full breakdown can be found in the link below.

http://www.warfaresims.com/?p=4990

I hope you will find time to contact our support team to help you get the most out of your game purchase.

- Surtur
