author: {'steamid': '76561198137221761', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 1521, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1519, 'last_played': 1573944440}
review:
I've never reviewed before but i believe this game deserves it so here goes.

Gameplay: The mini-games based on equipment you wear were fun and even if you find them tedious you can skip them with the story mode option in the options menu which is nice. Although i think since it doesn't have a description in what it does "Story mode" should be replaced with "Mini-games" on/off switch instead, because it isn't very apparent in what it does without experimenting if you only have "story mode" to go off of when figuring out what it does. Unless there's more to it than i know.

Graphics: The Art and ambiance of it is awesome all around except the background which is moderate in some places and the character art is to drool for. Much better than most visual novels i've played. 

Story: 
I like all the characters since they got good depth to each one. 
The story has a few good twists to it. 
I'm not a big fan with dialogue systems based on morality because its so simple and generic but they used it quite well in this game so i've got no complaints on it. 

Stability: I came across 2 bugs where once i got attacked by the random goblins in that pumpkin room then after the battle the UI didn't come back so i had to manually quit the game. The other where i had finished a battle at the end of the game and it got stuck at a black screen so i had to manually quit there as well. Didnt happen again with either thankfully.

Summary: Its a great game overall and i heard this was made by three people which is impressive so i look forward to AGL Studios future endeavors in the gaming industry.

Its not the best of reviews, i know that but i do hope it was somewhat useful.
developer_response:
Thank you for the nice review, you should do more often :) 

We will consider the Minigame on-off text change instead of story mode. That's a good point actually!
The morale is simple but also very important, make sure you join our discord if you didnt unlock everything in the gallery. It requires some planning to achieve certain things! 

We fixed the gonlin door issue and also the black screen in the recent version (unless it was an other black screen issue). 

And yes we are 3 people, one of them which also writes to you guys haha :D We are a very small team without even any community managers, but we have an amazing fan base that helps us test and improve our game with feedback :)

author: {'steamid': '76561198444806463', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 38, 'playtime_forever': 1470, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 294, 'last_played': 1674495662}
review:
I have updated this review to positive because it is a decent game and I want it to do well.  Having said that, I stand by everything said below and hope to see improvements. 

As it stands right now it is a downgrade from T1 in every way.  It's basically the exact same game but worse with slightly changed graphics.  The most fun weapons are gone.  A couple of the new ones are decent, but most aren't worth using.  The helmet and armour are gone so all you get to loot are weapons and shields.   You end up with so many useless weapons that you need to travel back to the merchant every single floor just to unload garbage because there are no longer merchants on the floors.  You now have to carry the key so blocking or attacking drops it.  This makes you unable to block in certain circumstances so you take damage.  Regen is gone as well, so again you gotta travel back almost every single floor to heal.  The Zaerie is now the most troublesome enemy.  His HP is crazy high and just walks through weapons.  It also gets stuck on corners leaving you no way to kill it.  Which leads to the biggest issue.  The balance just sucks.  You need to manage your upgrades between health and attack.  Cool.  Except you can never get your attack to a decent level unless you ignore health altogether.  Most of the game is spent very slowly chipping away at enemies.  It's boring as hell.  Then take one hit from poison and game over.  I was so pumped when this was announced years ago.  Then it looked as if it was never coming so I didn't get too hyped.  Suddenly here it is!  and it's a massive disappointment.  Do yourself a favour and grab T1 on sale and have fun for hours and hours.  Leave this alone in the hopes it gets playable at which point I will update my review.  Straight up biggest disappointment in gaming for 2020.
developer_response:
Hi Boogs, thanks for your review.

Tallowmere 2 is very much Early Access; not everything is in nor complete yet.

More weapons are coming. Will be looking at bringing back some weapons from Tallowmere 1.

Item and inventory management will be getting an uplift in an upcoming version.

Will be looking at ways to make key-holding more enjoyable. Wanted to try something new in T2 compared to T1, but realise there's room for improvement here.

Health regen is scarce – perhaps too scarce. Will look at increasing its roll availability in v0.3.

Enemy health – yes, many comments are saying enemy health scales too high. Will be investigating and making some number changes for v0.3.

Zaerie AI – will look at improving their behaviour.

Damage & Poison – Will be investigating this for v0.3 as well.

As a general disappointment from the announcement years ago – I hear ya. A good two-three years of my life during Tallowmere 2's development has been spent suffering from the onset of a chronic autoimmune disease, which has slowed my development right down (constant pain, feeling tired all the time, unable to think straight – doesn't help when trying to program). Only in recent months, specialist doctors have finally found a medicine that works on me with a positive effect. As such, T2's development has been much slower than desired. But things are looking brighter lately.

So, onwards from here. I will make improvements to the game. Thanks for your patience and feedback.

author: {'steamid': '76561198130622025', 'num_games_owned': 55, 'num_reviews': 15, 'playtime_forever': 11467, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 6755, 'last_played': 1675543477}
review:
Over 2k hours on PS4, Just hit 100 on PC.
 Pros - Graphics, explosion physics, maps, gameplay are great. Reminds you a lot of a fully customizing Twisted Metal. The game is a blast... If you have HOURS to dump into it or money to dump into it.
 
 Cons - While I wouldnt call it "Pay to Win" I would call it "Pay to Progress", you start with the bare minimum, get thrown into battle against bots a couple times, have fun, then get hit with someone who either has money to burn or a lot of time in the game. You get minimal in return for playing the game, it is a HUGE grindfest to achieve something as simple as a new weapon, cabin, or wheels.

 The game was pretty healthy when it launched in '17 hitting 10k players retaining 6k on average, now it averages between 3k-5k on a good day.

 New players are forced to buy one of the packs, just to be able to have a cool functional vehicle in battle, and if they are unfortunate enough to not be able to spend spare income, they play a few matches and uninstall.
 
 Really a shame, GREAT game, Greedy Devs.

author: {'steamid': '76561198008091679', 'num_games_owned': 465, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 674, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 674, 'last_played': 1518079004}
review:
A puzzle adventure where the only enemy is your own problem-solving ability. If you're not up to puzzles, guides work just fine without ruining the narrative aspect, which is truly the gem of the game. (If you avoid spoilers of course.)

The atmosphere is excellent, being a post-apocalyptic setting that does not feel as used and abused as the label. The reds and browns feel fresh despite their lifelessness, the barren, blasted landscape seems alien rather than cliche, and the ruins impart a sense of history, the sensation of a world frozen in its last moment as the sands and rust slowly consume it. 

The inverted parallels with our own society I found interesting. The way revelations wove disparate elements together was also great. The story was touching, with the opportunity of a best ending but also *choices!* and *consequences!* that allow one to explore other paths. It won't completely change everything, but enough to not feel arbitrary. 

I did not feel it was too short. The pacing was right, it was a complete story, and everything was grounded in the overall narrative. If absolute length is a concern consider it a novella, short yet satisfying. 

There is a short story, "Fallen" on their website, that follows but is otherwise unrelated to events in the game, that adds to the world and I would recommend as well.

author: {'steamid': '76561198310220260', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 14061, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1016, 'last_played': 1687762952}
review:
I would really like to recommend this game as although I have only been playing it for just under 17 hours it has now begun to freeze without the ability to save or even exit the game without turning off the PC completely. This major bug has rendered the game totally unplayable as I now have to shut down my computer by turning it's power off rather than saving and exiting and then powering down.
Up until this point I have really been enjoying the game but until this issue is resolved unfortunately I can no longer stay positive as the game is unplayable in it's current state.
In-case anyone wants to know, the specs of my PC are more than adequate to play the game and all of the drivers are up to date and the game files have been verified in steam.

Update: So long as I don't play in full screen the game has been stable, this is not ideal as a small section of the lower tool bar is slightly cut off but still accessible so the game is playable.
developer_response:
Hello!

Sorry to hear about your problem. Would you be able to provide us with more information by sending us your log files (https://forums.mechanistry.com/topic/2-how-to-report-bugs/)? You can reach us by email at support@mechanistry.com, on Steam discussions or on our official Discord (discord.gg/timberborn).

We hope we can fix your issue as soon as possible.

author: {'steamid': '76561198296079350', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 42, 'playtime_forever': 12629, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3761, 'last_played': 1702086095}
review: This game is tremendously fun once you get good at it, and a good challenge through and through. Yes, it is very frustrating and discouraging, but the feeling of finally beating something you've been stuck on in this game is way more invigorating than any game ever. I'm so happy I finally beat this game, it is by far the hardest well made game in the entire world. Happy to join the 1.2% of people who've reached the mountain top.
developer_response:
Thank you! :)
And congratulations/ conglaturations!

author: {'steamid': '76561198241463450', 'num_games_owned': 200, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 5606, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1818, 'last_played': 1655241633}
review:
Pros: 
The game is fun there is always something to do (if you pay).
Lots of items 
Team oriented in a good way its awesome when you can get randmos to help you complete a difficult quest

Cons: 

Pay to play. 
After level 5ish you have to pay in order to continue on with the story. And unless you want to spend god a lot of money on crowns you can unlock the worlds 750 per relm or pay the monthly subscription. I think what they should have done is relased the whole game at a flat price but theyre a greedy company so we get what we get.

Terribly optimized. 
I have a gtx 1060 3gb which runs this 10 year old game at about 10-60 fps (1080p on low) whereas mondern AAA titles run smothly at 60+ with medium to high settings.

Worlds are saved in a temp flie (i think)
I hate the fact that the worlds are not saved on to my pc. I recently tried playing this at a different location then my house on my laptop and had to "redownload/reload" all the relms, then when i got home they had to reload again. Im not sure where the world data is saved but i believe its a temp file. 

I do enjoy this game (and will continue to play) but would not recomend it unless you seriously want to play. The actually free part of the game is about 30 minutes-3 hours of game play (depending if you do the side quests and if you skip the dialogue). After that youll have to pay to do anything else.
developer_response:
Thanks KryptoniteQueen for the review! Awesome name by the way :).

Here are some ways you can get through the game without having to worry about paying for Crowns: https://www.wizard101.com/game/earn-crowns

Let us know if you have any other questions or concerns!

author: {'steamid': '76561198000781188', 'num_games_owned': 473, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 32, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 32, 'last_played': 1555100544}
review:
This game is a well polished roguelike. Had to be tagged as such, it's straight misleading.
Cover system works well ONLY for the enemy. Which is an odd decision to be honest.
In order to move around the map, you need to find gas canisters which is very sparse to come around.
Randomized loot table is poor. Killing 2-3 enemies gives you nothing to fortify your next step (at least at early stages).
No option to safely travel on foot (otherwise your team dies).
Story nodes are repetitive and a bit uninteresting.
Other than these, game looks very promising.
developer_response:
Hi _HGH_,

We recently released a significant free update to Pathway with "Adventurers Wanted". I think quite a few of the issues you had with the game have been addressed in this update.

We've reworked the loot system completely. There are more events and combat has received significant reworks.

Hope you can check it out and give the game another chance :) We'd love to hear what you think!

Bach | Robotality

author: {'steamid': '76561198385531998', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 18, 'playtime_forever': 12137, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 11972, 'last_played': 1710594355}

author: {'steamid': '76561198041617665', 'num_games_owned': 14, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 13625, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 10102, 'last_played': 1602333065}
review: Elite Dangerous, especially with the Horizons DLC, has a lot for players to do. If you are attracted to science or astronomy you'll love being able to fly around within a very large representation of the galaxy. Note that this game is not an arcade-level casual shoot-em-up. It has elements of a very light flight sim combined with the mining, exploration, trading, etc. of most space based games. I very much recommend the project, doubly so when it is on sale. And now we have the Odyssey paid DLC coming up next year. We don't yet have the details, but we'll be able to walk around on planets, at least.

author: {'steamid': '76561198145549541', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 4521, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 85, 'last_played': 1685738255}
review:
Don't buy it YET!!

The game is fun, honestly fun. However, it is unplayable at the moment. The game keeps crashing on me. 
I crash twice within minutes on my first play and now it would crash within minutes of launching. I have not been able to play a full campaign because it will crash right before I win or kick me off right as the campaign starts. In skirmish mode I can't even get to the game before it kicks me off. 

I don't think it is my computer since it runs Farcry 4 and Skyrim (with dozens of mods) fine with no lags. But I lag like nobody's business. On the second campaign my game will freeze up 10 seconds when my minions engage the enemy. It's great when it works, but right now it just isn't working.
developer_response:
Hi redd.mao,

I'm not sure when you last played but we've made huge sweeping improvements since your review in 2015. We released the game in an unfortunate state in April 2015 but never stopped updating it. With over 80 updates since then, 7 major updates containing tonnes of new features it's an entirely different game.

Most importantly the performance and stability of the game has been now greatly improved after thousands of man-hours of development from our two-man code team. 

As an early access supporter, you even have the first expansion for free, and the second expansion was free for everyone! 

If you've not tried the game for a while now might be a great time for you to jump in and see how far we've come since release! We'd love to hear what you think now.

Cheers,
Cian

author: {'steamid': '76561198010333936', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 11, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 11, 'last_played': 1610969839}
review:
This game has no offline mode despite having a single player mode.
If you are like me who does not like playing online then this game is not for you.
I wish that they had been forthcoming with the fact that it has no offline mode.
developer_response:
Hey CMDR, the solo mode in Elite: Dangerous still take place in the online persistent world. Your action will affect other players indirectly. 

Solo mode only mean that you will not encounter others on your journey.

author: {'steamid': '76561197995253821', 'num_games_owned': 670, 'num_reviews': 40, 'playtime_forever': 24971, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 22523, 'last_played': 1710439745}
review:
I love Elite Dangerous I really do the sounds of the ship creaking as you fly or the FSD charging to jump to another system or to travel through system or the sounds of the capitals warping in or out is some of the best sound designs I've ever heard in a game. The Visuals of planets or the feeling warping in to a sun feeling your whole screen to flying through the rings of a gas giant with nothing but you and the emptiness of space there is nothing more spectacular.

I loved elite I really did, I still do but there is just one thing that I just can't stand anymore with it and its the Nerf's the endless nerf after nerf to credits Core mining was amazing I loved to do it hearing the asteroid explode and the ship rumble and creak to the cockpit glass freeze over if its icy. I loved to do it and the credits where worth the risk of blowing yourself up if your to close. the Cores you needed where hard to find sometimes but was exciting when you found one as it was a gold mine but not anymore they nerfed it as it apparently was to much credits and wasn't just a little nerf no they killed it and the fun with it.

Then they nerfed other things as well and it just keeps happening then comes the cost of buying ships its ok to start the prices are reasonable but once you get to buying the larger ships then and the cost of fittings the price goes from this is fine to hell no. but hey have fun grinding 24hrs a day 7 days a week from months to get anywhere don't get me wrong there should be some work to get there but its a game and it should also be fun but it used to be but after the nerfs it isn't fun anymore its just work very grindy work FDEV seem content on nerfing things but not boosting anything. 

So this is where I stand with elite dangerous. I love it and it will always have a special place in my heart but I can't recommend it and as things stand the future isn't positive for this game unless the devs choose to boost profits or something else to make the grind less boring its not getting better its just not fun I have all the ships I've travelled to the centre and back but I still want to play for fun but it's just not worth it. I hope they can sort this out but they keep catering to the minority of the player base who enjoy the grind and its pushed alot of the other players away and with the latest release it seems the devs are giving up themselves slowly.

I really recommend it for cheap as a tourist and to just experience how detailed it is but be warned it is very, very grindy. its the most grindy games i've ever played but also the most detailed.

El juego está completamente lanzado ahora (con 3 nuevos capítulos llenos de jugabilidad y mucho pulido). Hicimos cambios en el equilibrio del juego: ahora el nivel básico de oxígeno es de 75 segundos, algunas herramientas tienen más durabilidad, algunos elementos son más fáciles de construir y mucho más.

Háganos saber sus pensamientos enviándonos un mensaje a info@breathedge.com o visite nuestro canal de discordia: https://discord.com/invite/eyURQXG y háganos saber lo que piensa.

Gracias otra vez.

PD: ¡El idioma español ahora también está disponible!

author: {'steamid': '76561198207835595', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 5462, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 674, 'last_played': 1604674015}
review:
Edited after developer's reply. Some criticisms moved to the bottom as they are no longer relevant, so that anyone who's reading developer's reply would understand the context more. Any new comment will be marked as "new". Most comments remain the same.

TLDR: Amazingly realistic tennis game for any tennis lovers. Well worth the price. Use the Maxou MOD. Developer is great.
---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
I have been a passionate tennis player for 10 years and this is by far the most realistic tennis video game I have ever seen / played in terms of the positioning, timing and strategy. Everything matters here just like in real life; the realism makes hitting a good shot to get out of a bad situation satisfying, making silly mistakes frustrating. I clap in real life to applaud my opponent when I lose to a good shot - this is how realistic it feels. Also, any tennis lover would sincerely appreciate the realism in the different hitting styles the game shows, although ultimately I believe these do not relate to the stats - you can hit a ground stroke with continental grip and still generate tons of top spin if your stats are right, so to speak.

Overall, this is  the best tennis game that has ever existed imo. It gives you the feeling of playing tennis and you have to respect how the control is on a gaming platform. I trust that once I get used to the mechanism on volley and player movement it will be all fine, ultimately no game can be exactly like controlling your own body. And this is what the game is all about - understanding how it plays and improving your skills.

Graphic is quite bad and you won't find you favourite players here, but the mods solve most of the problems. Some players might want more "gaming" features like "super power shot" or mini-games and they won't find it here - this is tennis and that's it.

Another good thing I like is the difficulty setting has many sublevels - I don't even know how many - but everyone will find one that fits their level.

Bottom line: amazing game for anyone who wants a game that feels like real tennis. If I knew how the game plays before buying, I'd happily pay $30 USD for it, $45 if it has funnier game modes to add some variety. Creator of the game seems to be a very hands-on nice guy too.
----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
New comment:
Tried the Maxou MOD recommended by the developer. Movement feels way more fluid than the ITST MOD I was using, certain balls you can actually chase them like Murray / Nadal etc., and you get way less ridiculous wrong foot (see my original criticisms for context). Volley seems to feel better also somehow. Another thing I like is the "winner speed" they show in this MOD. I have no complaints about the controls so far because this MOD solves all the problems I had.

This MOD is last updated in Dec2016 so the graphics aren't as good as ITST's, and the sound when you hit the ball is quite bad to be honest. You can very likely improve these if you MOD harder but I don't bother to yet.

I typed a long whining section about players' stats in this MOD as a joke but it ended up being longer than the whole review - just make sure you check and tweak the stats to your liking - Monfils' speed is 61 and Murray is extremely OP - with overall 90+ stats in FH, BH, Serve and Fitness. Some players (i.e. Tomic) shouldn't exist anymore but you can keep them around with all stats at 1 as a joke.
-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Original comment on the Mod I used:

The mod I've downloaded (ITST) gives the latest ATP players with updated stat & clothes, but it made it impossible for me to play career mode and doubles or connect with any other player so I can't say much about those things. Another small complaint with this mod is my Federer does his first serve with a backhand grip which probably explains why I keep losing against Djokovic and why my eyes bleed so much lately.


------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Original criticisms:
One downside for me is the lack of clarity in how the timing of clicking each button interacts with each other - e.g. does holding the button longer when serving change anything? What about the time you click the shot button? Does it matter whether you click up / left first, or together, or release one before another? It's intuitive to pick up the game, but when things happen you're not sure whether it's due to the minute differences in your control or RNG. This makes improving your skill in the game harder than improving in real tennis. The most reliable thing you can do to improve is better positioning and choosing better shots. This leads to a big issue for me in playing volley since nothing I do seems to give me a high quality shot, and I get frequently passed by shots that are fast but clearly within my striking zone. My only net points won are when I seriously drive my opponent out of the court - I have less confidence in my volley than when I'm playing volley against three opponents in real life which I hate because volley is one of my favourite elements in tennis. Arguably though, this lack of clarity creates certain "superstitions" as to how you click what buttons would create different effects, which I occasional find enjoyable...because sometimes feeling what you've done means something is more important than it actually working.

Another control-related issues for me that I dislike the most is the mechanics behind player movement. I believe the main basis of movement here is momentum, considering how you start very slow and run faster the longer you keep going towards one direction, and very difficult to go to the opposite direction; this is realistic in terms of how you can get wrong-footed and how you can chase balls. The issue is the game doesn't differentiate your first step with other steps. Any tennis player would know how split step allows you to jump start your motion, or very quickly shift your body weight to the opposite direction (e.g.shifting your weight to your left foot then jump to your right hand side for a forehand). This does not exist in the game, which makes change of direction unrealistically unforgiving - you step to the left by 1mm but the difficulty in going back to the right side is as if you have been sprinting to the left - and I got aced by 2nd serves quite a few times because I try to split step and "adjust my balance". To be fair this is likely caused by my mental habit of leaning left and right in real life and the movement buttons represent actual movements instead of shifting balance. Still, it would be ideal if these mechanisms can be included, or create a sprint / jump button so that sudden change of direction is possible, even though punishing.
developer_response:
Hello, I'm going to try to answers the questions raised in your review. :-)

0) But 1st a little disclaimer : the ITST is a very nice Mod, but it changes a bit the gameplay and thus some things don't work exactly as I intended them to do ; I don't know it well enough to tell you this or that exact point is because of the ITST Mod, but it might be worth to try out the game without it to check it doesn't do better in some of the points you have exposed.

I can recommend you the Maxou Patch instead which does the same thing, but for the World Tour instead of the online mode (so you can't play online with it), but without the gameplay changes (except maybe for a few courts, as each one has its own physics parameters).

1) So the main thing to understand how works the game (especially at the net!) is to play in the Training Club -> Warm Up mode, after have activated the Danger Zone and the Aiming Preview through your Preview setting in your Character Sheet.

2) Like this, you'll see that the earlier you prepare your strike, the more accurate it gets and also the longer or shorter, depending on the type of strike

3) You'll also easily see that aiming left/right too early will send the ball out, and that releasing left/right makes the aiming zone quickly comes back to the center of the opposing court, so it's better to time your aiming so you never release left/right before striking the ball

4) The service works in a similar way for the aiming, but there's no accuracy involved, so pressing the strike button early or late doesn't influence the quality of your serve

5) The documentation explains also all that and many other things : https://www.managames.com/tennis/doc/Tennis_Elbow-Tennis_Game.html

6) The game does consider your 1st step, and gives it a boost ; moreover, doing left/right will also gives you a little speed boost like it does in real life (ie: your player will convert some of his speed to the right when starting to go to the left) ; but you have to do it really very softly, because if your speed is above the maximal convertible speed then you'll get wrong-footed as you have noticed (IIRC, this is where it might feel the most different in ITST from the original game)

7) Your connection issues are likely not because of the ITST Mod, but because of your router or your firewall requiring some configuration (check the doc for more info, and here for a few tips: https://www.managames.com/Forum/topic8-9923.php )

8) And if you have other questions, I'm usually around ! ;-)

PS: thanks for the recommendation ! :-)

author: {'steamid': '76561198015752882', 'num_games_owned': 763, 'num_reviews': 96, 'playtime_forever': 77, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 77, 'last_played': 1664967409}
review:
Fun co-op game, cheap (5.99 on sale) and has remote-play-together, 

the art design of the maps is interesting and intuitive to navigate. you can re-play the same map on different modes as you unlock more of the game but with my friends we ended up only picking the normal run as we didn't like the time limit in other modes. 

the initial unlock mechanic is very annoying because after you clear a level and earn the tokens you have to see all the next worlds and replay-modes you have unlocked and you can't skip that, but it's a minor issue but would be nice if devs allow you to just cut it out.

author: {'steamid': '76561198039709014', 'num_games_owned': 454, 'num_reviews': 123, 'playtime_forever': 2623, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1654, 'last_played': 1629370213}
review:
I enjoy this game, however there is significant problem.
When your character dies, it loses all the buff relics collected. Relics, that can give big bonuses.
This would be good motivator for careful play and nice game mechanic, if the game was not full of mysterious death causes.
When you die, without even knowing how ("what killed you picture" is useless most of the time) and lose 30 relics its usually alt + f4 situation. Maps have traps and a lot of monster use abilities. That would normally be plus, but not with this "lose your treasure" mechanic.
Usually more relics you collect, more frustrating game becomes, from fear of losing them. Thats not fun.
developer_response: The 3.0 patch of the game will make the progression feel better and has much less random causes for deaths. 2.5 (current live) is very badly balanced.

author: {'steamid': '76561198084247931', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 14, 'playtime_forever': 821, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 701, 'last_played': 1607127216}
review: The game needs a lot of work.  It's hard to find villagers that are unhappy to correct the issue that's making them mad.  The income tab doesn't show what the sources of income are or deficiencies to help you understand where your money is going or how to grow it.  The game is elegant and fun to play, but it can be a real challenge to understand.  I kinda think the developers rushed it a bit.
developer_response:
Hi calvingibson195,

Thank you for taking the time to leave a review.

The game is still in Early Access and in development so there a lot of improvements still to come as well as more content, gameplay and polish. We are currently working on a complete UI overhaul which will address much if not all of your concerns.

However some of the information you are looking for is there already. For example, you can open the villager list from the bottom left menu and sort this list by happiness. This will allow you to find unhappy villagers much easier.
You can also hover over income and expenditure in the budget window which will give you more detailed information.

That being said, the current UI has always been a placeholder and all of this will be improved with the new UI.

Cheers
Ash

author: {'steamid': '76561198082612211', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 74, 'playtime_forever': 13317, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 4998, 'last_played': 1561817285}
review:
Artix Entertainment are passionate gamers first before developers. I've played their games for over 7 years with their consistent weekly releases, their communication with the community is top notch and I supported the kickstarter but I'm not going to sugarcoat my words. Unless you like playing unfinished games, or just like testing things out and helping the developers grow the foundation of the community from early access, I'd not recommend it as it is in very, very early stages of development. Beta will last for a long period of time (I'd say 4-6 years if they even want to compete with other games in the market and with their limited resources) from what's here and needed to be worked on. As the game adds content to convey what to expect from the full release the review will change dramatically as the game itself.

There's a lot of work to be done. In the state the game is in it's really, really boring and sucks quite frankly. I don't even want to play it. But I have if you look at my hours. Probably even more if you count pre-beta and unaccounted time on mobile. I'll say one thing quests are like this:

Artix: "I need bone dusts" 
"Need more" 
"I'll never be satisfied no matter how many skeletons you kill" 
"Lol, you're still going at it?!?!"
"Keep killing skeletons"
"Here...kill some shadow wolves"
"BACK TO SKELETONS!!!!"
"Great work keep it up, now more"

Also getting a group for dungeons is horrible. There's no queue and you literally will be joining dungeons that are halfway or more done already. Therefore wasting keys. And progress in the dungeons don't affect everyone so if one of your teammates goes around killing everything without you you will have to use another key everytime for a new run to make sure you attack the monsters. You can only invite people if they are your friend which is dumb. And even with that said, the party system doesn't even work like an actual party system. Monsters feel way too powerful and makes the grind and questing even worse. Additionally, your player character feels absolutely underpowered during the grind to 15.  After every battle, resting and potions would be required as if you're fighting a mini boss. And that's literally just one field monster. You'd need a group of players to make it feel less of a chore.

One major issue though though AE, AQ3D is not AQWorlds. Do not bother to push out any further crazy cash grabs business models like in AQWorlds. Hell, I'll admit I've spent too much money for me to quit in AQWorlds but it ain't no pay to win MMO. Everything is for fashion only. HOWEVER, remove the Pay2Win microtransactions to skip farming materials to obtain the gears right away from this game. REMOVE IT. Focus on the MMORPG aspects of its 3D counterpart. Make it an MMORPG. There's no need to follow a similar guideline as its 2D counterpart. AQW is more of a fashion MMO game with RPG elements. We need an RPG like those are your single player browser games but evolved and something people would expect in the years to come. And please just because the game is also on mobile as well...don't think you cannot do as good as other MMOs in the market. Though, it's the mobile part that worries me if it affects development for this game making it a crappy mobile mmorpg on PC. Even if it's a good port. I know you guys want to make this game a multiplatform friendly game that anyone can play and enjoy but from what's here it ain't gonna cut it. It's time to get serious and make a game that can pull in serious competition.
developer_response: Hello! Thank you for your review and we apologize it was missed! We are going back through some older reviews so we can gather more feedback. The game has grown a lot in the last year or so and the devs are constantly working on fixing and improving issues and releasing updates/patches almost weekly.  This has been a constant balance as an indie game company with a small staff. We also have a Game Plan posted here that is updated every Monday - https://aq3d.com/game-plan/. We appreciate your valued feedback and hope you will check the game out again in the future! It is always an honor when a legacy player of ours checks out our new games.

author: {'steamid': '76561198015195615', 'num_games_owned': 1291, 'num_reviews': 23, 'playtime_forever': 8, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 8, 'last_played': 1639326821}
review:
I originally had this as a "not recommends" vote due to concerns about the achievements (detailed below). However, per the dev reply on this review, it looks like they are some kind of placeholders for the early access phase that will be invested in closer to launch. While I would still advise anyone who is concerned about achievements etc. to be aware that this game _currently_ has some pretty bleh achievements, the game itself does seem like it has solid potential (though probably is best played with a bring-your-own-friends mindset, or solo for speedrunning, as the matchmaking population is small at the time of writing). It's comforting to know that the game itself is being prioritized over relative trivialities like achievements, but that they aren't just going to be a slapped-on afterthought to tick that box.

== original review ==

Potentially a fun party game but I'm not recommending this due to the thoughtless achievements. It's always disappointing when they boil down to a mindless grind and Fling manages just that. All achievements are essentially a series leading up to 1000 matchmaking wins. A race probably takes about 2 minutes once you get the hang of it, meaning you're looking at 30-40 hours of playing matchmaking to claim that achievement. I've not seen very many party games have that kind of lifespan, and this one clearly isn't one of them - I've tried matchmaking a few times and gotten no randoms to join. They recommend a Discord server in-game to go find players, but I'm not interested in doing even more work to play a game. 

More thoughtful, skill-based achievements or at least more reasonable win targets for the grind based achievements would go a long way towards the image for me. (If you're just slapping on bad achievements, it makes one wonder what other corners were cut for design..)

Based on the gameplay I did go through, it's probably not a 15$ game if you have to have each person in your group buy it. Maybe Remote Play Together would benefit there. I got this as part of Humble Choice (Dec 2021), so not sure what a good-feeling price point would be. Would probably need to experience how much variety, etc. is available; I'm just not encouraged to do so by the current achievements.
developer_response: The game achievements are something we're committed to changing for the better before the game leaves early access, I agree they need some work right now. Thanks for the feedback.

author: {'steamid': '76561197990380710', 'num_games_owned': 855, 'num_reviews': 60, 'playtime_forever': 751, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 751, 'last_played': 1619300687}
review:
[h1]Early Access Review:[/h1]

[b]TLDR: yes it's good once you get into it, but it has quite a steep learning curve and it will test your frustration! [/b]

This game is very challenging, there is no hand-holding and can be quite frustrating in the beginning. (Your character miss majority of shots, while enemies seem to crit-hit constantly. Every fight will have the odds against you more or less).

My first character build was useless, so I had to restart with a new combat oriented one. It was still hard, but manageable. [i](pro tip: prioritize 1 weapon, not multiple. Also, Jack-of-all-trades might not be your best bet, as you'll quickly realize you suck at everything instead. Specialize in a few things, let your Partymembers cover the rest)[/i]

Initially I thought this game was close to Fallout 1-2 and XCOM series. But both those games are much easier compared to Colony Ship. Then it hit me, this game reminds me of Planescape Torment. Its atmosphere, moody music, story telling and difficult combat; [i]now I enjoy the game. [/i]

The game works almost like a puzzle-game in the sense that I could not progress in certain storylines, and had to find sub-quests / fights / things to lockpick / steal to earn enough EXP or money to improve my party. After a while you get better and fights you thought you were never going to beat, were suddenly very beatable. In a sense, this was quite rewarding. 

The art, music and writing is all very good and I enjoyed those aspects the most.

There are a lot of things I'd like to see improved, but since this is Early Access I have no doubt they'll be addressed in the future!

Currently there's only 1 chapter, but it took me roughly 12 h (with a restart)

author: {'steamid': '76561197999364786', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 6687, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3346, 'last_played': 1537041251}
review:
*EDITED* 15/9-2015

I still really want to love this game because of what it wants to achieve, but instead i find myself in an unhealthy and abusive relationship with a game that constantly rapes my hopes and dreams. I start it up every now and then and try my best to find the spirit of the dungeon keeper series but it simply isn't there. The campaign seems like something that the developers just wanted done quickly. Every level is about rushing. There's no planning, no lovingly construction of your dungeon, no clever use of traps or spells. Only; get creatures -> plant rally flag -> win level -> repeat. And it really sucks because of all the other work the developers has put in this game. It overflows with GREAT ideas, AWESOME effects and simply a cornucopia of tools that beckons your inner evil overlord to come out and play. BUT HE IS BLUEBALLED EVERYTIME BY THAT FEKKIN RUSH MENTALITY!!!!

As a bonus, your "home realm" in the campaing still suffers from a bug that teleports your creatures to the bottom left corner of the map, making them unable to be picked up, and makes the level inacessible when you try to re enter the level.

___________________________________________________________________________________

*Old review*

To many bugs, i am currently unable to complete lvl 4 due to the game CONSTANTLY crashing and making savegames corrupted...

I backed this game in the very early bedrock beta. Loved the ideas it had. Loved the potential. And in all fairness, the developers did a great job to carry on the spirit of the GREAT dungeon keeper. 

HOWEVER!!!!! Why on EARTH! would you leave the level design to a guy with utter and complete claustrophobia!? The levels does in NO way encourage dungeon building as much as it promotes a kind of shabby colony expansion on islands where every "room" (if you will waver your every definition of what constitutes a room) has its location and usefulness pre deciced FOR you by the shear lack of land to develop on.

Furthermore...whats the use for reinforced walls in your dungeon when a normal dwarf can plow through it in seconds with NO way to save it...

I would love to see this game ressurect my favourite game of all time, but first the game has to be playable...
developer_response:
Hi Kamicarden,

I'm not sure when you last played but we've made huge sweeping improvements since your review in 2015. We released the game in an unfortunate state in April 2015 but never stopped updating it. With over 80 updates since then, 7 major updates containing tonnes of new features it's an entirely different game. We have added so much content that the install size has more than tripled to a still tidy 5GB! 

We'd love to know what you think of the game and the new stuff, here are some features we've added since release:

- Map Editor & Workshop Support with full scripting to create custom campaigns
- Overhauled Main Campaign
- Four Expansions with dozens of new features each. Two of these are completely free for you!
- New Game Modes
- Improvements across the board to the core game.
- Aesthetic Improvements
- Vastly improved framerate

Looking forward to hearing what you think,

Cian

author: {'steamid': '76561197991465987', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 276, 'playtime_forever': 283, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 283, 'last_played': 1678052377}
review:
Primordia was a huge surprise for me. Not sure how, but I managed to not know of the existence of this game, let alone the fact that it's a cult classic - so I launched into it with guarded curiosity, and I was completely hooked in a matter of minutes. The setting, the low-res but very atmospheric visuals, the haunting music and then the excellent writing and no less excellent voice acting drew me in for the opening act like few other games ever did.
While the first act in the wasteland was almost perfect, the second one in the city was less so. There were two things that didn't work that well:
- The game wanted to tell too much backstory compared to the gameplay. This resulted in text dumps, more of them as we approached the end of the game. They were interesting, I would have liked to read them as a novel - but this is a video game, not a novel.
- Several puzzles were opaque to the point of WTF-ness. I may have enjoyed them in the 90s, but now I simply couldn't find the patience to tinker with them all. May be the game's fault, may be mine, hard to tell.

Altogether, Primordia was a very satisfying experience, it's renown is well deserved. Don't miss it if you like point-and-click adventure games!
developer_response: Thanks so much for the kind words!

author: {'steamid': '76561198257895172', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 14850, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 720, 'last_played': 1707023708}
review:
Like many 'city builder' games, you have to build up your civilization (of beavers) by researching new technologies to build better and faster ways to accomplish the early game stuff. The management of the 'drought' which hits from time to time adds a doomsday timer which increases the difficulty. There seems to be a random duration of the droughts. Overall, i feel the pacing is too slow unless you run at 2x or 3x speed, then it seems about right. 
The game appears solid in it's early stages but once you manage to stabilize your initial settlement, there aren't a lot of huge challenges. It really needs more end-game content. I feel like once you get robots it's kind of late with not a lot else to do but terraform and make your city 'pretty'. I still do enjoy the game, but i honestly feel like it needs just a bit more to do in end-game.
Oh and it REALLY needs a random map generator!

review: Recently I gave this a go. It is better than it was during early access. Still is a challenge but the humor and being on a progressive scale with your nuggets is now better than it was. Kinda of fun of having random events take place to use what you need. I still find that it is hard to make your nuggets 100% love you though. I don't know if there is a way to do it as I haven't tried it enough to see everything but so far definitely better .
developer_response:
Hi Sanctus Lupus, 
Thank you for your feedback and I am sorry to hear that certain things in the game made your experience unpleasant. The game is still in development and a lot of issues that you addressed here currently being reviewed and they will be addressed. Unfortunately the development takes time and we are doing our best to release the new content and revisit some old mechanics as soon as it is possible. Certain issues that you mentioned here will be resolved within the upcoming build that will be released this week. The overall mechanics of getting believers is currently being reviewed and it will be addressed in the next upcoming patches. 

I hope you will give the game another chance with our new upcoming patch and you can let us know how you feel about those changes on our discord server https://discord.gg/Wb4JKfS. 

We really appreciate your feedback and we will do our best to make your experience pleasant and keep your interested. 

Thank you once again. 

Sincerely,
Sasha

author: {'steamid': '76561198084941348', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 1120, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1120, 'last_played': 1659900087}
review:
Here I go, back at it again with my list of pros and cons! 
*I have completed the game, with 18 hours of play time at the time of review.* 

In one word?: Yummy! 
Would I recommend it?: Yes. 

[b]Pros[/b]
- There is lots to upgrade! 
- There are a few different ingredients. 
- I love the variety of recipes - you can bake so much. From simple bread loaves to buns, doughnuts to baguettes. 
    - Each bakery product comes in a variety of different recipes, too. I hope you know your cheat day muffins from your magma buns! 
- There are lots of different machines. Nearly every machine can be upgraded. 
- You can customise your kitchen to your liking. 
- EXP gain isn't too hard, but not too easy. There is a medium grind. 
- I love the textures for things in this game, especially the doughs. I dare you to add pumpkin seeds to everything. 
- It is moderately difficult not to run out of money, whilst also making sure you don't run out of ingredients. I like the element of challenge this adds. 
- I do like the TAB menu. 
- [spoiler]You unlock new bakeries to work for as you go along.[/spoiler] I like that. 
- The recipes you unlock get progressively harder and lengthier as you go along. 
- It does become a challenge to balance your time correctly! But not annoyingly so. 
- I [i]love[/i] the "pluck" feature. I wish baking in real life was that convenient! 
- [spoiler]The "completion" cutscene looks like something out of FNAF, and as a FNAF fan, I'm into that. [/spoiler] 

[b]Cons[/b] 
- Everything about the driving. It's so janky and controls very poorly. 
   - Why do the other cars lose a tire when you collide with them (which is inevitable?). Also, why so many roadblocks? Are the other cars as janky? 
     - Yes, this can be forgiven, as driving isn't the main focus of the game. But it is a key gameplay element, which means I really can't not mention it. 
- There's no setting to hide the UI for screenshots / no photo mode. 
- [b]Distinct lack of repeatable tutorials[/b], aside from the initial one. I feel like an improvement would be to add one for each machine, and maybe each time you go to make a different style of baked product for the first time. 
- Parts of the text overlaps when you go to order ingredients. It makes the text unintelligible. 
- I would like more ingredients to play with. 
- I feel this game would benefit from more baked goods. Tarts, more pastries, etc! 

And there we have it - my review of Bakery Simulator. Bon appetit!
developer_response: Thank you for your opinion! We are glad that you enjoyed our game.

author: {'steamid': '76561197983992895', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 320, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 22, 'last_played': 1632203767}

author: {'steamid': '76561198116215153', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 6280, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 217, 'last_played': 1666272649}
review:
11-Oct-2021 - this review is still accurate!!!!

TLDR: At this stage the game is laborious to build, rewards/requires afk-ing, simplistic and is just really easy for for veterans in this genre. Wait until it gets better (hopefully?)

I have been eagerly awaiting this game because I love these genre games and I've always wanted a good hotel sim.

 paused the game immediately and started away but boy was I disappointed in the first edition.


Building walls was fine but I ran into my first problem with building a set of windows I wanted a row of full length glass across the front of my reception like I see in great hotels... they just didn't fit like I'd expect, no biggie, early access and all but everything about trying to move them was just so clunky. After a half hour of googling and trying stuff, I ended up selling them and just settling for simple windows.

I liked the option to build to a grid, only the grid it builds to isn't the grid on the screen.

Then came building my first hotel room, I built the bedroom and a separate bathroom. There was this option to add a bathroom to the bedroom but I couldn't link them, I tried everything and ... another half hour later... I don't think you can link them. So I named the rooms "Room 1" and "Room 1 bathroom" (more on this later). I still hadn't started the clock (but oh wait, the clock starts automatically for some unknown reason as I then discovered - paused again.) 

After meticulously creating my room, adding furnishings colours etc. I was happy with room, even with the limited furniture it was nice. I liked the amount of swatches and even though some of the building was clunky, not too bad at all. Then I went to copy the room ... another hour gone, nope not possible.

2 hrs in I was yet to start the game but oh well, I'll just suck it up and build stuff manually. No you can't edit the size of rooms, for some reason the outside is considered a room, naming rooms is done twice, one of them shows up in a list, the other doesn't but not in the order you would think ... I don't even know what these are for?

I hired staff, they just work 24hrs and I never had to look at them again (except I upgraded them each time I unlocked a star - dunno if it made a difference).

... and this was pretty much where the game-play finished.

I just built some rooms, fast forwarded until the next star, built more rooms with the new stuff, fast forwarded etc. Most of the time, I was watching YouTube or out of the room because there is no reason to monitor what's going on. If you are used to these types of games, you know how to build good rooms and all my guests were always happy and left good reviews. I have never had a bad review.

As you unlock stuff in the game, there are fewer and fewer items and it really shows that this game still lacks a lot of content. I think adding multiple floors will also add of lot spice to the design aspect of the game (please tell me there are elevators as well as stairs) but it really is a massive hole in the game at it's current stage.


What I would like to see in the game:

I want to see guests that have personalities and quirks like hates or loves windows, big or small room, needs to be close to a toilet or close to a vending machine, that would encourage us to build unique rooms and also cater for special circumstances.

I would love to see like events such as corporate groups who require a free meeting room, school groups whom all require the same floor, or separate floors for boys and girls and a teacher for each with bunkbeds for the kids.

I would love to see family groups, with games-rooms for the kids in a safe/monitored area.

I would love a convenience store that can be visited by the public and guests.

... We need a pool, this is a given, but also an Onsen

Different styles of restaurants for the guests personalities or those who like variety Japanese Teppanyaki? Luxury? Seafood? Bistro?

Other services like hairdressers, massage, (airport?) shuttle, butlers, valet, porter, room service


I really want this game to be good because I strongly desire a good hotel management game but right now this is far from it. I really hope the devs can achieve what we all hope this game can be.

Pro's
+ nice swatches 
+ saving swatches is great (although see negative to this)
+ building walls/rectangle rooms is easy and great
+ connecting the kitchen/dining works seamlessly (this a pro because it's the only rooms that connect properly)
+ it's in early access ... so I give the dev's some leeway

Con's
- the game is expensive ... it's a risk paying this much for what you get
- editing rooms is not really possible
- copying rooms isn't possible
- multiple floors isn't available
- furniture/doors/windows doesn't snap to the same grid as the walls
- creating a connected suite isn't possible (a bathroom isn't connected to a bedroom if they are walled - wtf?)
- there are no events, so the game is just make profit and AFK
- very few items/rooms in the game
- guests/staff feel lifeless without a personality (maybe like speech bubbles at the very least)
- only single guests ever come? (why have double beds?)
- the disco room (the flashing floor is just ... no, it ruins any theming and is just annoying on screen, can't we have a nightclub instead with options?)
- too easy for veterans of the genre
- shortcuts stop working, game requires a restart to continue
- key mapping isn't available
- seems like there is no punishment for having a negative balance?
- game loses saved swatches when restarted
- no colour-pick/rgb etc. for swatches
- can't lower/invis walls
- placing objects in different rooms render them unusable e.g. a dining table and chairs in a bar will never be used
- loading your save loads an older autosave instead of your most recent manual save
developer_response:
Hello,

Thank you for taking the time to write your review and provide feedback.

I was wondering if you have played the game recently and encountered the same level of frustration. Would love to hear your opinion on the changes and where we can improve.

Thanks!

author: {'steamid': '76561198045697832', 'num_games_owned': 627, 'num_reviews': 27, 'playtime_forever': 1826, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 743, 'last_played': 1654209570}
review:
Command Modern Operations (CMO) is an amazing game that offers the same experience as the previous iteration Command Modern Air Naval Operations (CMANO) so if you have that then don't buy this.

I bought CMO with the hopes that it would deliver more than just a UI re-skin. The most disappointing aspect of this release was the 3D war view that you have to pay an additional €60 for unless you use the free version which is extremely lacking in features.
Maybe it was me not reading into this release more before purchasing but I don't recall the devs mentioning that the 3D war view was a 3rd party addition (Using 3rd party software). I was under the impression it was shipped as part of the game, but I assumed incorrectly.

Overall buy CMO if you don't have CMANO, if you have CMANO then save your cash!
developer_response:
Hi,

We are very sorry that you had the impression that Tacview was an internal feature. We have been very clear in all our public announcements and feature listings that it was a separate product that had to be purchased independently in order to work with CMO.

Some examples of this mention:
http://www.warfaresims.com/?p=4948
http://www.warfaresims.com/?p=4975
https://www.matrixgames.com/game/command-modern-operations (Tab "Features")
https://store.steampowered.com/app/1076160/Command_Modern_Operations/ (paragraph "Features")

Again, we are sorry for your confusion. We are glad that you like the game itself.

Thanks.

author: {'steamid': '76561198184517067', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 19, 'playtime_forever': 139, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 139, 'last_played': 1519185151}
review:
I'm going to give this another bash (again) but let me first WARN YOU this is a VR VOMIT COMET. I need to take dramamine before I try this again. 

I want to really like this, but dude the zero G is sickening (literally). Want a quality VR experience? Get Subnautica. Not knocking the game or gameplay per se, just stating that the opening of the game makes me want to hurl, turn it off, and not look at the computer for the rest of the day. 

10/10 would play again.
developer_response:
Hi!

Sorry to hear that Detached makes you feel uncomfortable. We try to warn all the players (also in the game description here on Steam) that Detached is intense game and it's not suitable for everyone. Especially for players with nausea problems.


I would like to remind that we prepared few control schemes for each controller (Touch controllers, Gamepad, Keyboard). You can choose the best one, which can be more recognizable from FPS games or VR. Player can also enable steering assist or Eagle Eye View to limit field of view in the most nauseating moments (pitch, yaw, acceleration etc.)

I hope maybe you will give Detached another chance soon.

Regards,

author: {'steamid': '76561198066654696', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 1203, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1098, 'last_played': 1690811071}
review:
Meh.

Play 18 hours over a week or so.
Total noob.

You HAVE to use videos to be able to start this game. Very hard almost impossible without youtube.
This guy is good: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=kL8XQ1Avz-0&ab_channel=Splitsie

Start building. Cannot find Cobalt. Start again. Do this +10 times. 

Guy must be playing a different game to me...
Get through first video dig holes and build equipment.

Get to second video: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=SrDI1_MAokE&ab_channel=Splitsie

Grind down everything and start building. 
Connector does not fit. OK....
Dig hole for connector. After a day, get connector fitted.
Drill does not fit. Ok....
Spend hour trying to get the drill to match the front of the ship.
Have idea. Follow the rest of the video, move the ship to different location and try fit drill there....

Build Cockpit, build engines. Fit engines. Engines run. Ship does not fly.
18 hours on the game and more hours than that spent in forums looking for answers..  
Ship still does not move.

Uninstall game.

Be prepared to get frustrated for no reason at all.

author: {'steamid': '76561198037228389', 'num_games_owned': 990, 'num_reviews': 29, 'playtime_forever': 512, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 40, 'last_played': 1674308658}
review: It's a solid concept so far, just needs a lot polish behind it to be much more enjoyable. The movement feels incredibly janky, making the diving feel a little unsatisfying to pull off at the moment. The gunplay is pretty solid but could do with some improvements, namely holstering and equipping weapons could be a little more intuitive. There aren't many levels to pick from but there is a level creator which much like the rest of the game, is very buggy and unpolished. I wouldn't recommend it in its current state as charging 20 bucks for this level of quality is a bit much and I'd wait until the game receives more updates so that it plays more smoothly.
developer_response: We've been updating and polishing the game frequently now hope you'll check it out again SOON!

author: {'steamid': '76561197992003262', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 525, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 219, 'last_played': 1578270807}
review:
Fantastic beginning but way to short. I can not recommend this game with less then 3 hours of story. my recommendation is to wait until the next chapter comes out and maybe it will be worth $20 usd. The story is just to short. The bad part is, that I cant return the game because the story takes you just under 3 hours. I am just disappointed and bitter at this point because I don't have more of the story to keep me going. I need more story. Don't misunderstand I love the game but TOO short. i need the next chapter. 

1/5/20 So i just finished the last part of the game. I recommend this game but it still feels short. It took me 5 hours to finish. Still love the story. Cant say much without giving something away but worth my $20. I want there to be another part to this. There are so many questions left unanswered. I need closure.
developer_response:
Hey Imo,

I would like to inform you that the concluding DLC has been released October 10, 2019. You should have an update ready. We hope you will continue your journey on the moon! 

You can read more information on the new release here: 
https://steamcommunity.com/games/428660/announcements/detail/3580850447637647064

author: {'steamid': '76561198037173360', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 35, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 35, 'last_played': 1544448081}
review:
I quite liked this game to start with, for the sale price it provided some retro styled fun...

Then I came across Steredenn and realised that SEF is obviously heavily influenced by it but fails to deliver the same quality.
I say heavily influenced ... well actually it's not far from a complete rip off. The style, the colours, animation, layout, powerups even the menus are so close it goes beyond influence or homage.

Rather disappointing really, it could have been a good game in it's own right.

It's cheap enough, but ultimately (for me) unsatistfying when compared to what it's trying to be.
developer_response:
Thanks for the feedback, I'm reading all the reviews left in my first two games. Most people tell me to be more original, so I'm working hard on games that are a bit simpler but more original and solid.

In 2019 I will launch several games from a series called 'Moraes Studio: Arcade' I hope this pleases all fans and critics of the last two games released.

[Code]Thanks again for the feedback!
Alysson Moraes - Developer[/Code]

author: {'steamid': '76561198078455526', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 36684, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 36684, 'last_played': 1685877292}
review:
I've been playing Artix Entertainment games since Adventure Quest. 
I continued to play their games for a while now. 
I've sunk a stupid amount of time in to this game. 

Artix Entertainment has a cheeky identity to its games and a recognizable style that makes the player laugh and cringe at the many puns, references and wall breaking jokes. None of that is delivered in this game or any of their games for quite a while. 

This is just a grind. You can't pay to win, which is good, money is mostly cosmetics other than the 1 time subscription payment. But the amount of time it takes to get certain items is easily comparable to other major MMO's with a key difference: THE ITEMS AREN'T GOOD, AND ARE OFTEN RE-SKINS. The amount of grind of items that quite frankly have no effort put into them is crazy for nothing in return. 

Basics like swimming, mining, dragging items, cursor changing when hovering over clickable's, minimaps, AN ACTUAL MAP, decision making, and so many other things are simply not included and seen as not important by the devs, who instead will sit there and feed you aimless quests, missing story and shotty random live events for gatekeeping players to talk about later to keep newer players trying to get the same items when it would take giving you soul to this game to get everything, like it taking over 100 level ups past max level just to get a brown re-skin of some armor you get in the one of the first areas. It's a joke.

Games like this are a reminder why you should never delve in to something or get look the other way because of nostalgia with a companies past products. It's a free game so I guess there's that but it really just seems like a money hole for people holding on to nostalgia and a mobile game for bored kids.
developer_response:
Hey there, we appreciate your honest, in-depth review and your 611+ hours of time spent in-game. We are sorry to hear that you are not happy with the current direction of AQ3D, but we really appreciate you spending the time to give it a shot and let us know what we can improve upon. We will pass your feedback on to our dev team, so they can use your perspective to improve our gameplay. Thanks again for all of the time and participation that you've given AQ3D. We are sorry to hear that your experience was not a positive one, but we seriously appreciate your honesty-- it helps our team grow.

If you would like to reach out to our devs directly with any other concerns, you can always contact us at artix dot com slash contact. Again, thank you so much for taking the time to leave us a review and share your perspective with us.

developer_response:
Hi Seige,

I'm not sure when you last played but we've made huge sweeping improvements since your review in 2015. We released the game in an unfortunate state in April 2015 but never stopped updating it. With over 80 updates since then, 7 major updates containing tonnes of new features it's an entirely different game.

We'd love to know what you think of the game and the new stuff, here are some features we've added since release:

- Map Editor & Workshop Support with full scripting to create custom campaigns
- Overhauled Main Campaign
- Four Expansions with dozens of new features each. Two of these are completely free for you!
- New Game Modes
- Improvements across the board to the core game.
- Aesthetic Improvements
- Vastly improved framerate
- Entirely new Skirmish AI

Looking forward to hearing what you think,

Cian

author: {'steamid': '76561198118239254', 'num_games_owned': 119, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 2693, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2025, 'last_played': 1492510572}
review:
Life Forge is a fun up and coming game, classic pixel style rpg game. The game itself is still in alpha and is being worked on diligently by some very great folks and a great community that I've so far enjoyed being apart of. There are bugs, etc., like any other alpha but the game is making headway with constant updates and features being added. 

If you enjoy a classic rpg with a focus on open world play and interacting with others in pvp and pve elements then I think you should give Life Forge a shot, developers are constantly looking for player feedback on how the game can improve and I'm sure they'd to see your suggestions. 


Rarian~ See you all in-game <3

author: {'steamid': '76561197966938065', 'num_games_owned': 186, 'num_reviews': 24, 'playtime_forever': 5056, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3716, 'last_played': 1691111330}
review:
A great game that got ruined by the 1.9 update unfortunately.
Sitting staring at the screen for over an hour with nothing to do and waiting for trade cash to trickle in is not my idea of a fun game.

Patch 1.9.0.37
So I've continued to play and the economy side is a bit better now after some changes.
I still find the building UI quite confusing with all its parts and functions. Like church, cloister and so on.
And I'm still not a fan of the penalties for the different progressions. It kind of forces you to use the penalty reduction ones for labor and clergy.
developer_response:
Hi Gazer75,

Thanks for taking the time to leave a review. We have been reading and listening to player feedback since the 1.9 update was initially released and have since worked to address a number of balancing issues. In particular the 1.9.0.35 patch released on November 9 brought a large amount of balancing fixes that should hopefully have addressed the gold trickle and speed that you have raised in your review.

We will continue to monitor feedback from the community and will no doubt make further tweaks where required as we want the game to be fun and not tedious.

We hope that these changes rectify the slow pace that you found at the start of the game and hopefully we can earn a positive review in the future.

Cheers
The Polymorph Games Team

author: {'steamid': '76561197971636562', 'num_games_owned': 749, 'num_reviews': 175, 'playtime_forever': 505, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 440, 'last_played': 1558273357}
review:
It keep getting me surprised that the smaller games like Primordia games are so much more fun than bigger tripple-A titles.

I was nervous getting the game, because it didn't look very appealing to me based on the screenshot but positive reviews convinced me to give the game a chance. Never regretted the decision.

Although the game is kinda short it's very fun to explore it. You have a chance to learn a lot about the lore of the game in the city in the info kiosk. Once you read up on the world, War of the Four Cities and Humanist religion you'll see that the game has a very developed world which shows through environment and characters really well.

Puzzles are also great. I wouldn't say they're hard but in some cases you'll need all your brain power to solve them.

The only downside that this game looks pretty bad  on a 4K screen. There are some setting to make visuals less painful and more sharp but it doesn't help a ton. Still it's playable and great story overshadows visual issues.

Overall I highly recommend the game. It's a great journey into the post-humans world ruled by the machines. Great game!
developer_response: So glad you enjoyed it!

author: {'steamid': '76561197980190373', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 29, 'playtime_forever': 275, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 275, 'last_played': 1678508719}
review:
Not quite on the level of papers please sadly...

Now don't get me wrong this is a pretty good game, and if you liked the bureaucratic gameplay of that game then this will scratch that itch... To an extent. However its completely bogged down by superflous and completely mediocre gameplay elements that just have no real reason to be in the game. I'm a border control officer so why would I be driving around doing bloody tailing missions? I mean it doesn't make sense from a gameplay or logical standpoint. The constant phonecalls to go do some other random thing that has nothing to do with the border control is honestly annoying although mostly ignorable. I haven't completed the game so I've no idea if ignoring them has an effect though.

It's just not necessary. In fact none of the "open world" elements are necessary or even fun at all. It just detracts from the main gameplay and lets face facts this isn't a triple AAA game, the shooting and driving mechanics are severely lacklustre at best. So why they decided to force you to drive around (being ambushed constantly) and do these really out of place missions and busy work is beyond me.

It also detracts from the relatively rare moments that made papers please special. Like a dude begging to be let in to help his family but with a minor problem in his paperwork. This game does have that but so far I've had a lot more "chase this guy" "go follow that guy" "go here and do this" missions which, as I said, just feel out of place here.

I'm also REALLY not a fan of the vehicle inspection elements. For some reason I just can't seem to ever get them right. Finding broken parts of vehicles sounds easy but almost all the vehicles are rusted piles of crap anyway and its super annoying to have a perfect score ruined by a missing bumper that you had no idea was supposed to be there in the first place.

Now you're probably wondering why I'm recommending this game when I have quite a lot of problems with it? Well the fact is it is a pretty good game and doesnt deserve a negative review. It was released in better state than most AAA games and the devs seem active in the forums and are addressing at least the most egregious issues people have with the game. Namely the bad ambush system. So while I'm giving it a postive review I'm not gonna sugarcoat it. Basically i recommend it but don't expect it to become your most favourite game of all time.

It's like the opposite feeling I had from papers please. Where I expected to hate that game and ended up absolutely adoring it. I expected to love this game and found myself thinking it was "just okay"
