author: {'steamid': '76561198000422381', 'num_games_owned': 826, 'num_reviews': 229, 'playtime_forever': 481, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 481, 'last_played': 1385721232}
review:
This game is a point and click adventure set in a post-apocalpytic world where all humans are (presumably) dead.  Although I haven't really read books or played other games on this topic, I think it does a pretty good take on the setting, enough so to spark some creative interest of my own.  The characters and full-game voicework are for the most part fairly well done but dialogue kind of falls flat in a few places, mostly because of the script writing and not because of the voice actors.  The story is fairly cohesive and events therein are weighty and interesting, but in a few places I feel like the scenes were not given -enough- weight.  This is especially true of all the alternate endings and post-game cinematics, which although included to give the player some logical options, needed a bit more fleshing out.  It is also interesting to point out, it is impossible to game over although some decisions can change your endings.

The visual aesthetic of the game is quite nice, as is the music.  While pleasant to listen to and not annoying in any way, none of the tunes were especially catchy or easily memorable, and in a few of the dramatic scenes a stronger musical touch would have gone a long way.  Sound effects are unfortunately fairly weak, lacking thematic when operating devices and having little oomph when explosions occur, and in some places the game seems bugged and plays no sound effect at all.  The voice work has a nice robotic emulation added, although some characters seem to exhibit multiple variances in recording quality or style that doesn't seem to be a character quirk.

Performance-wise the game runs fine.  Although it resizes itself and forces fullscreen (thus making dual-monitor setups a little wonky), the resolution is not a complaint.  I never had pathing issues or pixel-hunts (just me being blind).  The game interface is functional and unobtrusive, as well as autosaving.  There are some included commentaries as well in the options menu.

All in all, I really did enjoy the game despite some of its flaws.  Its not very expensive, and it's about 7 hours of gameplay for one playthrough, with low replayability.  The setting is done very nicely and the story is good, what's there to complain about is mostly some rough edges and needed spitshining.  It doesn't ruin the game at all.  I'd say pick it up.

author: {'steamid': '76561198165836458', 'num_games_owned': 119, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 68, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 6, 'last_played': 1643816191}

author: {'steamid': '76561198179205666', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 742, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 402, 'last_played': 1689921122}
review:
Here is my prospective from someone who played the last 2 games and had legit so much hype for this game that as soon as the listing was on steam i put it on my wishlist. So here we go why i dont recommend this game. 


1. So for starters this game was released SUPER buggy. it almost seems like it was rushed in development and they didn't get everything done/fixed. Like for instance on one of the chapters (i wont spoil it) my game crashed 2 times before we could move on from the puzzle AND when we tried to go back to our same roles they were swap'ed around completely! Also there are SO many spots where parts of the maps were unfinished and you could see threw the map and it ruined my immersion.

2. The puzzles were just lack luster and boring. the first few puzzles started out ok but then it just turned into pretty much the same puzzles with different formats. like "oh this color makes this color" or this symbol goes here" it was repetitive and just overall boring

3. The story. The story in the last 2 games connected so well but the story in this just put SO many plot holes in the old ones. Like where did the old characters that made it go? what happened to them? what difference did there existence make?

4.No fear factor. the first game was so scary. you get this spooky cut scene at the beginning  that tells you the basics of how you got to where you are and that's it. It wasn't fancy or anything,and then you get into where you are and you pick up the walkiey talkey,you cant see or interact with each other so you FULLY have to trust him to be your eyes and ears threw the game and the weird castle. also it was super dark and eerie. You had SO much incentive to GTFO in this i just didn't have  that same incentive like "OHHh im GOnnAa die owell" idk how but the last 2 games did this way better. 


Now this all being said. Yes as a WHOLE the game was a decent game but not for the standards this story has set. the first 1 was phenomenal, the 2nd one was GREAT, and this is just meh. 




As it sits i dont think its worth 13$ i recommend waiting for it to go on sale. because it IS worth a play but at 13$ no. sorry this was so long and i dont want to seem like im completely bashing the game because im not trying to. Im just extremely passionate about this series and was SOO disappointed with this game. it really was a let down. anyways i hope they improve with the next game and i hope this review helps people decide whether or not to get this game at its current state.
developer_response: We're sorry to hear that you didn't enjoy the game as much as our previous ones. We have released multiple updates since release which included fixes for the sorts of issues you describe with some puzzles. We hope it'll be a more smooth experience now.

author: {'steamid': '76561198028129706', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 34, 'playtime_forever': 2161, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2134, 'last_played': 1540576399}
review:
looks promising, but is not super inovative. 

what I liked so far:
The dev´s are carring, They answer questions/suggestions fast! That is a great thing!
There is a strategic depth:
-Lanes: every player has a summon lane and a shared "attack" lane, if u are dominant in a lane you can summon a backup
-also most "buffs" are ground based, if u put it in the attacklane the enemy might destroy it by taking the lane.
-there is a spell order simular to instant/interrupt in MtG
-picking your colour is balanced (u have 3 slots to pick, cards have up to 3 needed colours. So the "strongest" cards only work in mono decks, strong ones only with priorized decks and weak ones in up to 3 coloured decks. 
-you can freely pick summoner spells but lose HP for every one u take.

What I dont like:
-ranked battles are the only thing to do after the story
-depending on daytime you have to wait quite some time till a battle pops up
-there is no NPC mode /just story that gives you differnt tasks (without standard situations)

but of cause the game is still early Access and as far as I can tell the devs do this to really sort out problems, bugs and things like that and as long as it doesn´t stay in early access for years (like some other games) I really hope they will do well.
developer_response:
Thank you very much for your support and great game guide!
We are also very aware of the current problems of the game, and we are currently working hard to develop new game modes.
Enjoy the game~

author: {'steamid': '76561197977820099', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 39, 'playtime_forever': 469, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 74, 'last_played': 1623531289}
review:
This is what happens when a game misses a key element of gaming - being "fun".

While it's interesting, it's semi-unique and enjoyable from the engineering/programming standpoint, the game lacks the basic concept of actually being fun. 

There's zero, in terms of story to be told and there are no characters to keep you engaged or caring about. "Ok then, there are other game like that, that are quite enjoyable though!" you're thinking, I bet. Other games are like that and I have enjoyed many of them, but many of those games have an overall "character" to them; be it in their design, art work, theme, etc. Nimbatus vehicles, however, are just a bunch of dull two-dimensional blocks with flashy lights that do stuff.

The building is repetative and "monotone"; you simply take similar parts and move them around in similar ways to get the desired effect. You can simple make a square for everything and get the same results as any other ship. There's no reason or incentive to make anything more complex than that. And beyond the same handful of similar "missions", the game gives you no reason to expand your ship building abilities.

It has no unique art style that grabs the eye. It has no meaningful characters to relate to. It has no immersive atmosphere to keep you engaged. Other games have that going for them, this game, though, doesn't.

Best I can say, is that it is to this very niche genre, as Avorion is to it's equally niche genre. They are both games that techncially do everything right, down to the core mechanics, but both are games that lack any real "flare" in terms of their gameplay.

In addition, the game is very "simple" comapred to other titles in its price range. For instance, BeamNG was in the same price range when it first came out, as a tech demo. However, that was a pioneer in soft body physics, never seen before in any other racing/driving game. Nimbatus doesn't pioneer anything new, or add incredible features to an already stable design.

This game would have best been left as a tech demo for a much larger, immersive Adventure/RPG style game.
developer_response:
[edit]
Hi Lizzard

We're now done with the early access and will release the game in three weeks. Quite a few things you mentioned we tried to address over the duration of the last 1.5 year. We added a story, a challenging survival mode with part unlocking and much more. We think we found quite a unique twist on the building genre, so we would love to hear back from you if we succeeded with that.

If you try the game again, please tell us how you like it now :)



---
Hi Lizzard

Thanks for the detailed feedback.
I'll give you a heads up once I believe we managed to give the world more character and improved the feeling of progression :)

Kind regards,
Philomena

author: {'steamid': '76561198184897393', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 652, 'playtime_forever': 3247, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2574, 'last_played': 1545013687}
review:
After a quick and promising response from the developers (even more surprising considering this review was and still is [i]positive[/i]), I can confidently say the game is much more stable as of 2.0.4. Performance is still below my expectations based on my hardware vs. the requirements/recommended specifications, and I imagine much of that is due to the game engine. I will continue to play and enjoy WftO!

Original review below
=============================================================

"Mixed" would best sum up my feelings of this game. I had fairly high expectations for this after playing another recent dungeon simulation release, and I was unfortunately disappointed with poor performance. It seems this game was too ambitious for the developers, with more potential than anything else. 

Performance in the menus is always poor, while performance in-game degrades to the point of nearly unplayable.  After several crashes and reviewing the logs on my own, I found entries such as:

[code][Coherent GT] (Warning) Coherent GT: Performance warning on View 0 View drawing time (Paint() call - CPU time) is high. The execution time on graphics API is in ms. Threshold value: 2 Detected value: 20.377 [You can customize this warning][/code]

There were other similar "warnings" which makes me think I must rally fewer units at a time, otherwise the game crashes. My system far exceeds the requirements and recommended specifications so, while I should not need to, I followed other recommendations for dealing with crashes (disabling [b]Screen Space Ambient Obscurance[/b] and [b]Anti-Aliasing[/b] as well as running on lowest Texture Quality - 12%). 

After continuing to dig, I found I could adjust game speed, which came with a warning that increasing the game speed could increase CPU load. Since adjusting the game speed [i]down[/i], crashes have become a lot less consistent. 

Additionally, so much of the game is locked away in DLC (higher total costs than the game itself!), there are disappointments everywhere I look.  

That said, while WftO does not meet its promises, it is fun to play. 

[h1]System Info & Performance Report[/h1]
[table]
   [tr]
        [td]Operating System[/td]
        [td]Ubuntu Linux 16.04 x64[/td]
    [/tr]
    [tr]
        [td]CPU[/td]
        [td]Ryzen 5 1500x[/td]
    [/tr]
    [tr]
        [td]GPU[/td]
        [td]GTX 1050, nvidia-396[/td]
    [/tr]
    [tr]
        [td]Game Saves[/td]
        [td]Manually, automatically (though this is not enabled by default for some reason)[/td]
    [/tr]
    [tr]
        [td]Notes[/td]
        [td]Thanks to verbose logging, I was able to eliminate most crashes[/td]
    [/tr]
    [tr]
        [td]Technical Notes[/td]
        [td]Poor performance (even in the main menu), many crashes (details above)[/td]
    [/tr]
[/table]
developer_response: The referenced issue of performance and stability should now be fixed

author: {'steamid': '76561198137632334', 'num_games_owned': 125, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 556, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 436, 'last_played': 1599585678}
review:
As much as I wanted to like this game due to past games Artix Entertainment (AE) have published, and created, I simply cannot recommend it, or at least on the PC. 

First of are the bugs. There are just TOO much of them.  It has made the game unplayable at times, but at least, in the design notes, says that the team is working on them.  The load times are also sometimes quite long., especially when moving from map-to-map The graphics may look pretty on mobile platforms, but on a computer, not as so.  Combat is nearly non-existent, and has no challenge what-so-ever. The only thing to currently do in lower levels is grind (Could be okay if you actually enjoy this kind of stuff, where unfortunately, I do not).  Craft items have a timer on them, spanning from a few hours to as long as 3 DAYS (IRL) to craft. 

What is good about it is that it does not demand much, computer-wise, and that it seems to be expanding and expanding with each update, which come some-what regularly. Also, the developers are really passionate and awesome people (just look at their Facebook and Twitter accounts!) and makes me wish that I could meet them either in-game or in real life.

Could be good for mobile, but not too much for PC.
developer_response: Hi there! Thank you so much for your feedback! The devs are constantly working on fixing and improving issues and releasing updates/patches almost weekly. The devs are working on lessening 'the grind,' quests, class skills, more classes, PVP, etc. We also have a Game Plan posted here that is updated every Monday - https://aq3d.com/game-plan/. If you are ever in our neighborhood, let us know! We love meeting our players. ^_^

author: {'steamid': '76561198063633680', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 19, 'playtime_forever': 445, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 445, 'last_played': 1547856072}
review:
I thought I'd written a review when I bought and finished the game months ago, and I'm shocked that I hadn't..
I've not played a lot of Point & Click games, and those that I have, weren't anything like this.

Since it's been so long, I'll just give a short and sweet version: [b]This game is f#@king awesome.[/b]

And I'll be honest, I absolutely suck at the kinds of puzzles and half the problem solving that was in this. I needed a guide. But just as honest, I don't care that I did. I'm glad I did. The story, theme, setting, just the entire tone of this had me dying for more. Several months later, writing this, remembering the best scenes, I STILL want more. I want a series of novels. I want a mini-series. I'll even take a movie. Hell, this game felt almost like all of that somehow as it was. I still get chills thinking about it.
The voice acting, characters, settings, all fantastic. Favorite side-character was definitely Ever Faithful Leobuilt. Spooky and fascinating, full of a lot of information. Best creepy robotic voice I have ever heard, and I love it. I wish I had a text-to-speech reader that sounded like him.

I'll say that this game is incredibly depressing, bittersweet, and and a bit nihilistic in a couple ways if you're someone looking for hope for the future. Even The Good Ending of this game still had me contemplating how long anything might keep existing. But... there was so many unanswered aspects of the world lore, I can't do much but keep wondering.

My only negatives are probably that some of the puzzles were impossible without a guide, and that, as other reviews have written, it seems to raise more questions about the world than it answers. And I guess I'm... sort of okay with that. Although, I'd rather read a series of novels set through the history of the world to learn more.

Goddamn, I love this game. I'm going to have to replay it again soon. lol
developer_response:
Thanks so much for taking the time to write such a kind review, especially after such a lapse of time.

I'm also a huge fan of the delivery of EFL -- Steven Poulton voiced the character, and other than mispronouncing "adept" (for which I tease him endlessly -- he gave it the adjective's pronunciation rather than the noun's), it's absolutely perfect.

In terms of your request for more, we did do a free spin-off story that you might enjoy: http://primordia-game.com/fallen.html

Thanks again for the kind words!

author: {'steamid': '76561198021820604', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 2443, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2443, 'last_played': 1432236216}
review:
Disappointing, I know this is an indie project but when you sell it as the successor to Dungeon Keeper you hope for a bit more. The graphics are serviceable but lack some of the edge and charm of the original. The balance is super patchy - some levels feel too easy some levels hard in maddening ways. One example being a later level where you can chew throw two foes quickly only to find the third has an infinitely spawning group of high level forces, workers and mana - even with half of their base conquered!  

It feels like a competent update but the magic isn't there and the frustrations push it over to a no for me. Really I was looking for more than an update to the old game. Playing this after Keeper RL and having seen the trailers for Dungeon 2 also push me to think they really could have done more.
developer_response:
Hi Silverslide,

I'm not sure when you last played but we've made huge sweeping improvements since your review in 2015. We released the game in an unfortunate state in April 2015 but never stopped updating it. With over 80 updates since then, 7 major updates containing tonnes of new features it's an entirely different game.

We'd love to know what you think of the game and the new stuff, here are some features we've added since release:

- Map Editor & Workshop Support with full scripting to create custom campaigns
- Overhauled Main Campaign
- Four Expansions with dozens of new features each. Two of these are completely free for you!
- New Game Modes
- Improvements across the board to the core game.
- Aesthetic Improvements
- Vastly improved framerate

Looking forward to hearing what you think,

Cian

author: {'steamid': '76561198046650446', 'num_games_owned': 269, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 1430, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 275, 'last_played': 1684102037}
review:
AdventureQuest 3D(aq3d) is created by the same development team that made AQworlds(aqw).

So, it really isn't a surprise when the class system in aq3d mirrors that of aqw. For those of you who haven't played aqw before, aqw is a web browser mmo game that has no class lock, the same as aq3d. As long as you possess the class armor, equipping it gives you access to all skills of that particular class. No class lock and instant access to all skills to 3 different classes?(mage, warrior,rogue).

Sounds good in theory right?It looks like a ton of variety until you look at the classes. Each class has 5 usable buttons. The issue with this is that 1 of these buttons is your regular attack and another is your buff, which leaves you with 3 buttons to button-mash. Not a whole lot to work with, and very demotivating when you realize that these skills aren't going to increase even as you level up, nor is it going to grow in potency as you level. You start off with the same 5 buttons from the moment you equip your class armor to the end, because Artix Entertainment(the company behind aq3d) knows how best to have fun; by removing skill trees and removing player choice.

Combat. Battling with monsters is an unimaginative, boring, repetitive grindfest. Monsters have no weaknesses, discernible attack patterns, or special attack mechanics that you have to look out for, something that good mmos always have. Aq3d monsters are essentially simple auto-attack creeps with differing hp values, which makes gameplay so simple that even a 3-year-old wouldn't have trouble with it. Coupled with the barebone skills system, aq3d's brain-dead combat system is perfect for its target audience; brain-dead aqw fangirls.

Graphics. To be frank aq3d's graphics pale in comparison to many mmos that have been ported over to the mobile platform. The majority of people who actually think aq3d's graphics are good have never or rarely played mmorpg games, or are aqw players who are stuck so long in the 2d web browser world(of aqw) that 3d is a huge upgrade for them. It's like a blind man seeing the sun for the first time; everything is beautiful.

Equipment customization is largely cosmetic. None of the equipment has any special effects or set bonuses you see in mmorpgs, nor does it have any slots which you could socket with gems. Aq3d equipment provides the same kind of stats in mmorpgs( attack, crit, evasion, armor etc), but does nothing more. Itemization is a bland, horrible experience that you would wish on your worse enemies.

To sum up, aq3d is an archaic, repetitive,player choice-neglecting game that might have worked if this was the 20th century. Unfortunately with the advances in technology, aq3d pales in comparison to any half-decent mmo game out there. Gameplay is stale, simple, brain-dead and its design is catered to the converted; namely aqw fangirls.
developer_response:
Hello! Thank you so much for your review. AQ3D is inspired by our original games AdventureQuest and DragonFable and is very different from AQWorlds. We have always wanted to create a 3D game and have been working on AQ3D is some format since 2012. With the change in technology (including Flash discontinuing support in 2020), we have had to create games that are mobile and cross platform. The headway we make with AQ3D, which is our first cross platform game, will help us create cross platform versions of our 2D games. Creating a 3D game has definitely been a challenge, due to being an indie gaming studio with a small staff, we are very small fishes in a HUGE pond compared to the other game studios with many, many more resources and staff that we have, so we do our best to make a fun and enjoyable game for everyone!

The devs are constantly working on fixing and improving issues and releasing updates/patches almost weekly. We also have a Game Plan posted here that is updated every Monday - https://aq3d.com/game-plan/. Classes are very different in AQ3D than AQWorlds and will not have enhancements, but will have ranking. The devs will also be reworking on lessening 'the grind.' We appreciate your feedback and hope you will check the game out again later on when it has been released and has much more content and features.

author: {'steamid': '76561198063909151', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 27904, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 1102, 'playtime_at_review': 6694, 'last_played': 1711958136}
review:
I enjoy building and management games, and I love SciFi, so Planetbase is a lot of fun for me. I bought it on sale and it was less that the price of a movie and some popcorn/soda (I prefer the big stadium theatres) and it has easily been more entertaining for the money than just a movie. The game is a blanancing act of ensuring various resources/needs are appropriately distributed and an error in that ration and knock the colony off balance and kill everyone. I'm enjoying how the difficulty progresses and the order of priorities gets ever more important.

If you were a fan of games like SimCity, the old versions that were actually fun, then you'll probably enjoy Planetbase.

https://www.youtube.com/playlist?list=PLG3A_wf4mt-hCggR1fxGKk8V4gjLjKJ4b

author: {'steamid': '76561198805239685', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 73, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 47, 'last_played': 1701400462}

author: {'steamid': '76561198016003941', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 221, 'playtime_forever': 2744, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 476, 'last_played': 1674646301}
review:
I've had this game since early access and have been patient with it as much as I can but after 40+hours I can safely say this game is just a chore. I've tried many times to get through it all but once again I just feel like I'm pushing myself to get through something I'm just not enjoying. In fact, I'm moaning constantly as I play it...the further I get, the worse it gets....

I've never gotten past the second chapter as the game always manages to exhaust me and bore me. It just goes on and on with plain, boring level after level. The enemies start off pointless and then out of nowhere the difficulty spikes right up making all action sequences annoying and zero fun...

The level design is just bizarre and messy. Very ugly and no fun navigating them. A lot of them are just so bespoke and odd I wonder how they passed testing...

Enemies/AI are just a pain in the ass. Most fights are spent sat at a door way killing off anything that tries to walk in. Walking into big rooms with a lot of enemies is just suicide as your guns never do the job and enemies take way more ammo to kill than they should. Having big enemies tank your damage whilst a flying thing shoots acid at you alongside a tribe of fast moving plebs either shooting a pistol or a shotgun or even just trying to get up close and melee you is way too much and overwhelming to enjoy. 

Special enemies suck in almost every way. They take far too long to kill...

Random events at the end of a battle sequence suck in almost every way too. Some of them are bat shit crazy!!!

Performance is still bad with most busy areas dropping from 60fps down to 40fps or even 30fps. 

Guns are OK but the mechanics mean experimenting and building a good load out is just never gonna happen. 

Spent a lot of time thinking "What the hell is going on??!" or "Where am I meant to go?!?"

The game, as a whole, just feels like a big old mess and whilst it can be fun for a few hours...extended game sessions just feel like work. 

A shame...it has potential to be something cool...buy in a sale and keep your expectations low
developer_response: Glad you enjoyed the game!  We're working on performance right now.

author: {'steamid': '76561198811435048', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 3012, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1387, 'last_played': 1709644414}

author: {'steamid': '76561197992858177', 'num_games_owned': 465, 'num_reviews': 14, 'playtime_forever': 2962, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 565, 'last_played': 1655718784}
review: I originaly gave War For The Overworld a bad review for game breaking bugs, crashes and extreme lag, however after After Playing the game again recently i have had none of these issues. I'm happy to say the developers have fixed all of the issues i have had with this game.
developer_response:
Hi King of the Isopods,

I'm not sure when you last played but we've made huge sweeping improvements since your review in 2015. We released the game in an unfortunate state in April 2015 but never stopped updating it. With over 80 updates since then, 7 major updates containing tonnes of new features it's an entirely different game.

Most importantly the performance and stability of the game has been now greatly improved after thousands of man-hours of development from our two-man code team. 

There is also now the second expansion, the Crucible survival mode, that was free for all! 

If you've not tried the game for a while now might be a great time for you to jump in and see how far we've come since release! We'd love to hear what you think now.

Cheers,
Cian

author: {'steamid': '76561198045556681', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 50, 'playtime_forever': 86, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 79, 'last_played': 1397192899}
review:
Overall, loved the game and it has a better feel than other games have been when they're in their alpha stage.  However, there were a few annoying factors like you can't run diagonally (unless you rotate your camera instead of pressing W D at the same time).  The controls are also a little rough to get used to, but then again, alpha stage.  Good news is, you'll be having so much fun that you'll be learning the controls almost unconsciously.

It's a building game similar to minecraft (because you have to place things, which are in dimensions of blocks) and G-mod (objects on objects to create entities), BUT Space Engineers consists of actually building the blocks. Somewhat of a pain for survival mode, but at least they have creative mode too right?

author: {'steamid': '76561198044948619', 'num_games_owned': 579, 'num_reviews': 15, 'playtime_forever': 78, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 63, 'last_played': 1477873508}
review:
I've been a fan of Artix games since I discovered Battleon back in middle school, so I jumped at the chance to play AQ3D. By all accounts, it's essentially  a 3-D rendering of AdventureQuest Worlds with a slightly different plot. If you're cool with that, great. If not, stick to AQWorlds.

That said, I like this game. The new battle system,while keeping familiar control elements, is enough of a difference to keep you engaged, and the dialogue is par for the course what I've come to expect from this dev, so that was cool.

At the moment, there doesn't seem to  be a party system in place, and there's no option for group/private chat.

I'd reccomend waiting a bit for this one, until it's updated and given some more content, since at the moment it's a tutorial and a string of quests where you're essentially frog hunting.

author: {'steamid': '76561198803603198', 'num_games_owned': 494, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 15, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 15, 'last_played': 1665608545}
review:
Getting a refund as I type this. the game is great on xbox atleast. I played on xbox but ended up selling it so I thought I'd get it on pc during the sale. The game is literally unplayable, I have uninstalled, verified files, lowered settings to rock bottom and nothing. 

The game opens as normal but once I start the opening sequence to play the game it just crashes, not even getting me to the first interaction or gameplay section. 

This isn't an issue with my hardware either, I can run most games at ultra and hit 144fps but with this game on lowest settings? wouldn't even run. Nothing was maxed out either in my pc it just doesn't even run.

TL:DR game unplayable and crashes in first 2 minutes, no fixes to my knowledge.
developer_response:
Hi there!

We’re now looking into the crashing issue, and it’d be a great help if you could send your DxDiag file to info@breathedge.com.

How to get it:

1) Press the Win + R keys to bring up the Run command
2) In the "Run" command box, type in "dxdiag" (without quotes)
3) Press Enter
4) Once the DirectX Diagnostic Tool appears, click on the Save All Information button at the bottom
5) Save the file

Thanks in advance!

author: {'steamid': '76561198008516961', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 26, 'playtime_forever': 877, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 877, 'last_played': 1662349587}
review:
Hasn't been touched in months. I thought about refunding it when i had 3 hours in and now I wish i had.


***Edit*** That was September - it's now January. There have been no updates, no road-map, no nothing. Apparently, "Early Access" is code for, "We need to at least make some of the money we spent on this back without telling anyone we abandoned it"

***Edit #2 - Feb 24, 2024

Thanks for responding, It's been a little over a year and I've read your notes. I haven't played this since Sept 2022, so I hope what has been released is enjoyable. I am glad I was wrong about the game being abandoned, 

 Simply putting release dates with an area and a sentence is not a road-map it's a timeline. That seemed pretty thin to me as did some of the update and patch notes, but I can respect it as a stylistic difference and I certainly don't get to judge that. Fair play, I thought the concept was great and I enjoyed the character creation, skill-trees and the first areas in early access. The first 3 hours were deep, vibrant and pretty good. I remember stopping because it just was very thin after those areas and I didn't characterize your progress the same as you. I followed the patches and updates and it appeared to me to be very thin. However I didn't play it so I could be wrong and I hope I am. I wish steam had a pending review indicator. It's unfair to characterize this as thumbs down now, but I stand by it and what I observed then. 

 I see that the game has been put on sale in co-ordination with another update. I think I'm right about what's going to happen next but I hope to god I'm not. We've seen this before. Reading the patch notes I want to acknowledge and show respect for the work put in, I want to believe this has been a labor of love. You certainly make it sound that way. So if this update and sale is the last gasp of a game that is DOA instead of a road ahead, then I say vaya con dios, good luck and thank you for your hard work. I hope it's the start of something instead of the end. I hope i'm wrong and you find a way to make me eat it. I hope when I check back in six months this game is still being updated and then I will fire it up again and hope.
developer_response:
The last update was released on Dec 6 (new content and major system update). The next update will be released at the end of Jan, as per the road map on the front page, under Early Access:

End of Jan - Heart (the mutant town)
End of Mar - Hydroponics (the Yellow and Red Zones), Mission Control (the lower levels)
End of May - The Armory (level 3), Bridge and the end of chapter 3
End of Jul - Endgame (chapter 4)

Overall, we released 22 updates (not counting hot fixes) since we launched on Early Access.

review: I can't really recommend this game. It's funny sometimes in a tongue-in-cheek kind of way. I feel like all I do is run out of oxygen and fly back to the ship - over and over and over and over. There is no clear path in what I should be doing and the help system is not very useful.
developer_response:
Hey there!

To address your concern about the O2 level - the base level of O2 has been increased to 75 seconds, and on top of that, the game is fully released now - with 3 new chapters, new game mechanics, and tons of things to do. We’d be delighted if you could give it another try!

author: {'steamid': '76561198025472290', 'num_games_owned': 607, 'num_reviews': 135, 'playtime_forever': 12, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 12, 'last_played': 1666996304}
review: Ugh. No thanks. Bad controls — what might be necessary should definitely be changeable for the PC — and dull gameplay. There's some amusing dialogue here and there, but I didn't even make it through a half-hour before I had to uninstall. GW2 is free and ten times better than this .. thing.
developer_response: Thank you for taking the time to check out our game. Our team values player feedback regarding our projects and would love to hear more from you. Our devs work hard to release weekly updates and fix bugs. We have big goals for AQ3D and we would love for you to learn more about them via the News and Game Plan at AQ3D dot com.

author: {'steamid': '76561198080249993', 'num_games_owned': 125, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 444, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 435, 'last_played': 1658740158}
review: Starting game There was a problem authenticating the ownership of this product. แก้ยังไง
developer_response:
Hey there, Dirt Aholic. Sorry to hear you're encountering this! The error about [url=https://support.ubisoft.com/en-GB/Article/000066178]"ownership authentication"[/url] means that the Ubisoft account that is logged in on Ubisoft Connect is not the account where your Steam game, or DLC for the game has been activated. This is not to say that you don't own the game, it is just that the game has been activated on an alternate account. To remedy this, please contact our support teams on any of the following channels:

[url=https://support.ubisoft.com/en-GB/SignIn]Ubisoft Support Portal[/url] 
[url=https://twitter.com/UbisoftSupport]Ubisoft Support Twitter[/url] (Send as private message.)
[url=https://www.facebook.com/UbisoftSupport/]Ubisoft Support Facebook[/url] (Send as private message.) 

They will need to see your [url=https://support.ubisoft.com/en-US/Article/000060565]Steam ID[/url], a screenshot of your [url=https://support.ubisoft.com/en-US/Article/000065542]savegames folder[/url], and a screenshot of your game [url=https://www.ubisoft.com/en-gb/help/article/accessing-the-steam-proof-of-purchase/000061770]proof of purchase[/url]. This will help expedite their assistance!

author: {'steamid': '76561197974031531', 'num_games_owned': 254, 'num_reviews': 16, 'playtime_forever': 1826, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1286, 'last_played': 1564945951}
review:
DO NOT BUY, GAME IS ABANDONED BY DEV!

Cannot recommend.

Negatives:
-Flasks breaking just randomly, and/or on their own
-Positioning Flasks to pour from one into antoher is too finicky
-Pouring is way to unprecise and too fiddly
-Ingredient prices are very over inflated
-"House cleaners" don't even clean out all the garbage (leaving bottels and boxes)
-No mentionable soundtrack, monotonous sounds

Game breakers:
--Missions failing sometimes(often) even if the mixture has all the traits and properties required
--Jumping and bumping around because of random props (also causing flasks to break!)
--Can pour even more liquid into full flasks and loose it that way?! Why?! (see pouring too fiddly)
--Many (like a metric f-ton) spelling mistakes, wrong grammar, wrong interpretation/display of apostrophes (') all over the place
--Too much stuff floating and crawling around to distract you from the game (like dust and cockroaches everywhere, even after having the cleaners do like nothing for their money)
--Continously getting interrupted doing stuff, like carrying a flask, from pop-up messages (Which also mess with your controls resulting in breaking flasks/spilling liquids)

Something Positive:
+The game didn't crash on my PC yet...
+No real graphic issues like clipping or wrong/missing textures
+No stuttering/performance issues for me



When or better IF most of that stuff gets fixed it could be a really fun game!
developer_response: All of these game breakers are in our to-do list. We are close to finishing our latest update and the things you mentioned will be fixed. Thank you for this constructive review!

review:
DO. NOT. GET. THIS. GAME.

This game has a hidden .exe that will pull your personal information, I recently had a paypal transfer attempting to take $1,000 from my account and I found the .exe hidden in the files. PLEASE GET THIS TO THE TOP, NO ONE ELSE NEEDS TO GET ROBBED!
developer_response:
This is not even theoretically possible.

[b]UPD because some people are not convinced:[/b]
How often do you see malware on Steam?
If it was malware, surely it would have been checked and deleted by Valve by now.
Moreover, I have my real name listed as developer and publisher. With a quick google search you can find more info on me and could easily report me to authorities.
Thing is, nobody has done the above yet because this game does not contain any malware.

author: {'steamid': '76561198047747157', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 40, 'playtime_forever': 1635, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 995, 'last_played': 1673153316}
review:
VRChat refugee here! So far the platform loads quicker (when I load a world I'm THERE), has more implemented features that would have had to have been modded into VRChat, more customizable settings, ability to mod AND Devs who interact and listen to input. The Devs are currently flooded with the influx of new players and yet they are still there on their discord answering people's questions and things are actually being fixed and improved actively.

The community is already so much better. Even though all of us new players were causing massive lag I felt welcomed and I was instantly welcomed and helped by older players to learn how to find avatars and worlds or use shortcuts (like you can move your hands a certain way to being up a camera). Chillout also uses the Steam age to make sure kids don't have access to mature content via DLC which is genius. You also have a LOT more options for filtering out what you want to allow or not... for example you can specifically say you don't want to see any flashing from worlds or avatars OR jump scares. 

Game is free with a paid version via DLC for creators that allows for unlimited uploads. Uploading of avatars and worlds is also basically the same but just with a different SDK in Unity which oddly enough offers MORE customization options and seems easier to use at the same time.

I look forward to this community growing!

author: {'steamid': '76561198052567657', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 28, 'playtime_forever': 1124, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1085, 'last_played': 1703570485}
review: Would not recommend at this time.  The game may be improved in the future it is still in early access,  The graphics are awsome.  The initual directions are a joke, when u first start the game you are thrown out of a plane and it states to hit I to deploy parachute, but I doesn't work, neither do any number keys.  Took dying numberous times to figure out it was the F key.  The dietary system is a nightmare also.  Hopefully they have fixed this part, balancing carbs, fat, protein, salt, chlorine, etc is a nightmare.  Who cares, if ur gonna die then eat, doesn't matter what it is.
developer_response: Hello Atigress! We're sorry to see that you've had a disappointing experience with the game. The situation you've had with the parachute and its corresponding input is quite peculiar. If you did not change the inputs before starting the game, then the default input should always be F. Maybe some specific graphic setting you lowered distorted the UI element which tells you to press F that pops up when you become able to open the parachute. This is all speculation currently and we'd love to hear more details about it via https://support.scumgame.com/ if you would be so kind. As for the metabolism, we acknowledge that better explanation of that system is necessary and we're pleased to report that this will be addressed in the upcoming patch, which is why we hope you'll give the game another chance once we get it out.

author: {'steamid': '76561198017107520', 'num_games_owned': 712, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 770, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 770, 'last_played': 1604843793}
review:
I really want to like this game. The concept is really  good, and the availability of different survival items is reasonably well balanced--yes, a bad run can easily leave you without the items you need to survive past the forth (out of six sections), but in general, it's just the right side of encouraging you to be careful with your resources without being frustrating. So that core gamplay is pretty solid. 

However, there are many ways in which game seems to lack polish. Puzzles are randomized, which I like, but it feels like a huge missed opportunity not to have at least a little randomization in the story itself. Sleep triggers the monsters, but what if something else did, and you didn't know at the start of each gameplay what it would be? But no, the monsters and notes you see in each section are set, so once you've seen them once, you know exactly what to expect on the next playthrough. With the exception of a few puzzles, there is no point in reading notes a second time. In addition, there's not a lot of flexibility in the way that you play. Once you've figured out the optimal play style, you pretty much just do that robotically, with perhaps some small adjustments depending on the characters you choose. Taken together, this severely limits the replayability of a game which is meant to be played several times. However, the *fatal* thing for me are the occasional game-breaking bugs, like a building suddenly failing to be warm even though it was warm before and the furnance is lit, or a character who is dead magically being resurrected but not fully functional (a sort of in-game zombie). Bugs push this game over the challenging threshold into not being fun anymore. I got some enjoyment out of this at first, but I can't recommend it.

author: {'steamid': '76561197972758287', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 40, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 22, 'last_played': 1606564113}
review:
So, I like that this game brings more variety to the VR rhythm game genre, and it's overall a decent entry. It's overall well polished and solidly put together, and it has a couple notable improvements over Beat Saber. However, most of the things it's done differently don't actually appeal to me personally. It's clear the developers have a different idea of what they want in a rhythm game than I do.

Broadly, if your primary interest is in fitness, and you want to be moving constantly and hard, but you're not that concerned with extremely challenging gameplay that pushes the limits of your skill and coordination, then PowerBeatsVR may be the game for you.

If you want a game that really pushes your skill and coordination to it's limits, and also tends to get you moving a decent amount, but more as a side effect than a main focus, then Beat Saber will do you better.

In short, I think PowerBeatsVR is a marginally better workout, but Beat Saber is substantially more fun and challenging.

Now, into the details, the things I liked...

- It's pretty. I like the environments and effects. It's nothing ground-breaking or cutting edge, but it definitely looks nice.
- No-loss mode by default. I don't understand why rhythm games insist on booting you out of a level when you're doing poorly. Just let us get a really low score! Doing badly at a skill level you're not good at yet is the best way to get better, and it's kinda demoralizing to have to turn on a special "no loss mode" that doesn't score points to do it.
- Calorie counter. For thus of us who play rhythm games for exercise, this is really cool to have!
- Better-than-average music. It's nothing amazing, but in a world where rhythm games (including Beat Saber) tend to come with a bunch of middling-to-bad EDM, this was refreshing. (Note: Beat Saber now has a number of official DLC music packs from some very good major bands, like Imagine Dragons and Panic at the Disco. But PowerBeatsVR's core music is still better.)
- The hit detection is solid and feels really good. This is something a lot of VR rhythm games struggle with, including the earlier versions of PowerBeatsVR, so kudos to the devs for getting it right.

Now, the things I didn't like...

- By default, the notes come in at a weird arc, making it very hard to judge where you need to put your hands to hit them. I missed a LOT when I started. Thankfully, there's an option to make the notes come in on a straight path, which makes the game MUCH more playable for me! Give the curved paths a try, you might like it, but I'd recommend digging out the straight path option.
- No color matching. You can use either hand to hit any note. This limits the complexity of the arrangements, as it can never make you cross your arms. You'll barely notice at the low levels, but if you're used to playing games like Beat Saber on Expert or above, you'll find their high level arrangements simplistic by comparison. This is the primary source of my complaint that this game does not really challenge your skill and coordination all that hard. Because of this, I was able to drop straight into Expert mode on my second song and do alright. The skill cap just isn't that high.
- Often when you're not hitting notes, it decides to mix it up with a pair of light paths, and you need to hold your hands on the paths. I found these bits honestly really boring. It's not that it's easy, exactly. I missed on them often enough. It just never feels like I'm doing anything awesome or powerful. It doesn't feel like dancing or combat or anything, and barely even feels attached to the beat. I'm just kind vaguely waving my hands in front of me for these bits. I'd almost rather they had me doing nothing.
- Some notes require you hit them a lot harder than others to be considered a "hit". This creates the awkward dynamic that a lot of the time you TOTALLY hit the note, and it presents the visual of being knocked down, but it doesn't shatter and appears to still count as a miss. While it's great to encourage the player to hit the notes harder, cause it keeps you moving and adds some challenge, it seems like it'd be better if it just did what most other games in the genre have done: Give you a score multiplier based on how hard you hit. Instead, you get a moving threshold on whether it was hard enough to count. Cases where you hit, but not hard enough to count, is kinda hard to read and seems frustrating and unfun.

So, overall it's not a bad game, but it's definitely not the rhythm game I wanted. Your mileage may vary.
developer_response:
Hi Aubrey,

thanks for your feedback. We are sorry that you weren’t satisfied with the experience and would like to do our best to give you an overall positive experience.

As we are already working on some bonus scoring for excessive hit velocity, I guess you would also like to have a bonus scoring for big motions (as we are already tracking those). Is that correct? And would you appreciate a tooltip somewhere mentioning that the required minimum hit velocity increases with the chosen difficulty?

Regarding the color matching: We decided to go without color matching, as we wanted to give the player more freedom and achieve a certain difficulty by implementing a fast-paced mechanic, adding challenging obstacles, and making generous use of the given playspace. We know, that some players would prefer color matching, some don’t. So I guess, we’ll have to gather more feedback.

Regarding the collision detection: We thought that we had achieved a reliable collision detection based on previous players’ feedback. But, you seem to have some issues with it. So, it would be great, if you could give us more information. What VR headset are you using? Did it happen in a specific environment or in a specific situation? Which quality level had you chosen? Every detail can help us.

Thanks a lot,
Team PowerBeatsVR

author: {'steamid': '76561197980131827', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 143, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 143, 'last_played': 1666593494}
review: October 23rd 2022 update seemed to really change things. Walls might as well be built out of cardboard they'll survive about 10 seconds against 5 zombies. Soldier AI ignores any attack commands just stands and faces forward. If you're lucky and they happen to detect a zombie to the side they'll turn about 1 degree a second until eventually facing towards the enemy before firing. Unlikely though they'll have already been killed long before they can turn to the side. I JUST bought this game after waiting for YEARS to grab it once it was farther along in development. Safe to say I regret it.
developer_response: I was aware of this being an experimental issue but I was under the impression it was resolved. You should contact “Dark” on the discord/ add on the steam forums to resolve this relating to unit focus. On the topic of wall balance I will forward this along to our balancing developer . I’m sorry you had such a hard time with the build we will do our best to resolve the issues/feedback you’ve given us

author: {'steamid': '76561198009628116', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 130588, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 117288, 'last_played': 1669350128}
review: BIG, very BIG. Billions of star systems to visit, planets to explore. Very good space combat and planetary vehicle combat modes. lots of different missions to perform and rolls to perform. Steep learning curve as is with all space simulators, finding a mentor while not mandatory is a big help in getting on your feet quickly..Joining a corp is a good way to get the help/education you may need. Loads of friendly players on both sides of the "law".

author: {'steamid': '76561198086059935', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 275882, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 19859, 'last_played': 1702865300}
review:
If you've never flown before or if you're an experience pilot this sim has something for everyone. From basic training missions to get new pilots into the air to very challenging tracks with the ability to create your own in a featured map editor. I've put many hours into DRL Sim, Velocidrone, and Liftoff and based on my real life flight experience and the races I've participated in; DRL Sim is the closest to real life among the 3. It's my go-to recommendation for anyone looking to learn to fly or hone their skills. Not to mention just having the sim allows you to participate in their yearly tryouts to become a DRL pilot if you've got what it takes. The devs are constantly working on new features and the updates are very frequent as well. Multiplayer works good and its easy to get other players into a lobby to have some competitive flights with varying degrees of difficulty on the tracks. 

10/10 would recommend.

author: {'steamid': '76561197997689670', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 18, 'playtime_forever': 68020, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 28690, 'last_played': 1702144205}
review:
After a few hundred hours played I can safely say that I do NOT recommend this game. Because the ONLY focus Gaijin have is how they can milk you of money. Every balance patch, how the market works etc. have the soul purpose of earning money. 

They don't care about balance or gameplay, everyone knows what they need to do to improve the game and what issues there is. Still they focus on messing with the market to limit the ability to earn in-game money and making crazy pay to win weapons instead.

TL;DR Gaijin is making their best to make Crossout into a pay to win game. It's not really there yet, but in a few more patches it will be.
developer_response:
Hello.
All parts that affect to the battle can be obtain in-game ways: as the rewards for leveling up or you can buy them on the in-game market. So you don't need to spend any real money to buy a weapon, a cabin and so on.

author: {'steamid': '76561198076448600', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 666, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 423, 'last_played': 1533055615}
review:
I do enjoy this game, but I do feel the AI is quite bad;

- The biologists don't prioritise themselves for food, therefore they die and food isnt produced.
- People don't do work below them when theres a need
- Traders feel overpriced

My main issue is with the people not doing work below them when there is a need. Engineers wont convert ore to metal, and will just exist, consuming resources whilst waiting for metal to magically appear.
developer_response:
Hello there, thank you for your feedback, 
 
We are always listening to the community and fixing any issues in the game. 
 
We would suggest that you play the tutorial as it explains all the major mechanics in the game. If you've already done so, maybe you can have a look at some of the YouTube [url=https://www.youtube.com/results?search_query=planetbase]let's plays[/url] as they will take you step by step on how to build a viable base.
 
We assure you it is possible, and not even that hard, to progress in Planetbase, as you can see by the numbers of people getting the game's [url=http://steamcommunity.com/stats/403190/achievements]achievements[/url], but it has some tricky mechanics that might take some time getting used to. 
 
Kind Regards. 
Martiño.

author: {'steamid': '76561198336491867', 'num_games_owned': 79, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 5492, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 4394, 'last_played': 1652454611}
review:
This game is interesting, cool, and fun! There's very few things you have to pay for, and the things you do have to don't pay-lock you from the experience! There are a few problems and glitches, but they don't detract from the experience! There's humor that's both funny and interesting. The story is absolutely awesome and (I need to find a new word) interesting! The game controls and gameplay is really fun! I've been playing AQ3D since 2016, and I plan to continue playing long into the future!

TL;DR: Adventure Quest 3D is a fun, interesting, humorous, and over all great game that I have and would recommend to others!

author: {'steamid': '76561198373917671', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 28, 'playtime_forever': 3843, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 78, 'last_played': 1651874216}
review:
UPDATED:

It's a top down, mecha combat game. I want to love it, but I just can't.
Great concept, bad implementation.

Poor grammar runs rampant within the game. Whether it is the tutorial instructions, description of items, even in the achievements.

Speaking of the tutorial, it's Broken. It will get to a certain point and then just stop, never to return again. I even tried it on another account with the same result. Although, unlike other reviews, I find that I can still play the game as normal despite it not working properly.

Controls are a bit clunky, as is the GUI.

Combat runs a bit slow, yet you can be instantly killed. In fact, you can be dead before you can even start playing, due to someone camping the spawn point, which you can barely even tell from the map. As a whole, the game is very unbalance and very much geared toward P2W & veterans players that have grinded it out (higher lvls equal better armor & damage).

The mechs themselves and the options available to customize them all look interesting, but the grind to get and build most of them are seemingly far beyond a casual gamer. And I certainly can't recommend anyone spending actual money on this in its current state. -Fortunately you can still collect a lot thru daily tasks and free loot crates provided by them; including mechs.

The game only has 2 (3 now) scenario modes. Team deathmatch and a 'king of the hill' type of base capture battle played on perhaps 4 different maps.  -Recently added a Capture the Flag mode (though no instructions are provided for new players to know what the goal is).

All this said, I will still continue to play this more as it does scratch that mecha itch that just isn't available elsewhere, despite the game's issues, namely because it is free.

And while playing for the Achievements is good, if a large grind, I have found that unfortunately even the some of the achievements are broken. Whether they popping literally every login after completing, or just never increasing.

author: {'steamid': '76561197990735150', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 138, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 138, 'last_played': 1556402175}
review:
Our party called it quits after we ran into a mindnumbing feverdream quest series with this psychopath NPC Reed.

"There are wolves right next to me - kill 20 wolves"
"A wolf ate my shovel - kill the wolf!"
"Wolves scare me - kill 20 wolves!"
"Flying eyes ate my shovel - kill 20 of them"
"Plant some nuts."
"Wolves scare me - kill 20 wolves"
"Talk to that rock face"
"You see those wolves - kill like.. 8 of them"
"Plant some flowers"
"Touch some roots"
"Those flying eyes look like wolves - kill 20 of them.. and some wolves!"
"Find a grave"
"I don't like wolves - kill 5 flying eyes"
"Find water"
"Water ate my wolves - kill 20 shovels"

This is hell. This is what hell feels like.
developer_response:
Hello. We are sorry you are having issues with some of our early and more repetitive quests. The devs are looking for ways to improve some of these earlier quests to make them less repetitive. A lot of them are specifically created to be easy for lower level players to help them level up quicker. 

The devs are constantly working on fixing and improving issues and releasing updates/patches almost weekly. This has been a constant balance as an indie game company with a small staff. Please check out the Game Plan and Design Notes for updates - https://aq3d.com/news/ & https://aq3d.com/game-plan/.

review: I've waited around 1-2 years waiting for this game to come out to the point of following their progress on Discord and following them on the Activity feed on Steam. developer_response: Thank you for playing Bakery Simulator. It is so good to hear that you've loved it. Have a great time relaxing and baking. Cheers. Gaming Factory Team.

author: {'steamid': '76561198175324822', 'num_games_owned': 548, 'num_reviews': 95, 'playtime_forever': 606, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 606, 'last_played': 1583769826}
review:
There is a lot of problems with this baby. Micromanaging all the ships all the time gets dry pretty fast. And the plot seems to assume you've visited every planet in every sector but also limits your jumps with fuel so you really gotta fandangle the holy shit out of it do to that otherwise you get a mess of things happening that you've not actually seen.

Ultimately, not a fan at all.
developer_response:
Hi!
I assume, that micromanagement in battles is the matter of taste. May be it’s not your type of game)))

What about plot, initially the game was conceived as roguelite. We tried to fill the game with events, none of which would be key, but should complement the overall picture. I sincerely wanted the player to be motivated by interest, and not the desire to win, as it was in old games. It’s up to you to decide, how well we did it)

Anyway, thank you for trying our game and for your feedback!

review:
Design flaw: Tutorial is on by default. You have to go into the menus and select to turn the tutorial off, otherwise it will continue to repeat the tutorial endlessly. Thank you daddyhughes111 on YouTube for putting that together!

That's how far I've gotten.

I'd rather have not had to choose recommend yes/no yet. 

I got swayed into choosing yes because of the genius move of adding a peripheral blinding option during acceleration. I turn this up to 100% and I feel no motion sickness! W͟o͟n͟d͟e͟r͟f͟u͟l. More developers should learn to lower the maximum absolute value of the derivative of player camera velocity and rotation, 
or do exactly what this game does and blind peripheral vision during acceleration and during change of rate of rotation.

author: {'steamid': '76561197995707737', 'num_games_owned': 328, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 343, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 343, 'last_played': 1549497334}
review:
I found some of Initiate 2's puzzles are a bit challenging but definitely solvable if you give it some extra thought and thoroughly search your surroundings. With one exception, the last riddle was improperly worded -- had to look in the discussion forums for clarification.  The eerie atmosphere is great. The item sharing system and character swap make the game interesting. The focus of the game really are the puzzles, as the story is forgettable.

As for some negatives: I had an issue with the mouse sensitivity not saving correctly in the UI. Once saved, if you pick up an item for inspection, the sensitivity reverts to high. Really annoying, had to resort to using my mouse software to override the default sensitivity in-game. Also, there is no control mapping screen. A few of the puzzles require you to equip a certain item that you can't equip through the inventory screen but rather from a key bind. I spent a good half hour stumped before figuring it out.

All in all, the game was still enjoyable. I look forward to more Initiate games.

author: {'steamid': '76561197970540118', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 11513, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 11513, 'last_played': 1550380999}
review:
I loved the game and the creations in it.
I will not support a company that splits the community and added blocks to the game that only paid users can use under the name of cosmetic. They added a new cockpit that only people with the paid cosmetics can use making your ship paid to win and unusable by every single person that does not have the cosmetic pack.
This is not an open and inclusive group any more and I will likely never buy a Keen game again.
developer_response:
Hi NightRed,

Thank you for writing this review.

We really appreciate your feedback.

We are continuing to release free features for Space Engineers via updates, (Customizable LCD Screens, Replay Tool, Steam Badges. Steam Backgrounds, etc.) and optional paid DLC (the Decorative Pack), which is designed to not split our community. For more information please see Marek Rosa's blog: https://blog.marekrosa.org/2019/04/space-engineers-customizable-lcd.html

We are also continuing to optimize Space Engineers and fix numerous bugs in the game.

If you are experiencing any issues, please message us via our support site: https://support.keenswh.com/spaceengineers/general and we'll be happy to assist you.

Kind regards,

Keen Software House

author: {'steamid': '76561198011484341', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 1334, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1030, 'last_played': 1599537642}
review:
It was fun for a few play throughs, but there's just not enough you can do in the game. The AI could definitely use some improvement, maybe some more manual control would improve the experience. As the game stands it just takes too long to get anything done, and once you've surmounted the initial challenge of survival there's not much to do but build some pointless monuments. Maybe some extra story or a feeling of a meaningful and interactive economic connection to the rest of civilization would make the game more interesting to play.

It does look nice.
developer_response:
Hi there,

Thank you for your feedback, we always read users reviews and take them in account to improve our game.

Although you can build most small structures at the beginning, the metagame changes quite a lot later on: you will have to optimize your base for a larger amount of colonists, build bigger domes, deal with intruders and tend to radio transmissions among other things.

Also once you master the first planet you can try out the more advanced ones, as they have different starting condtions, weather patterns, disasters and higher difficulty over all, especially the Storm one.

Additionally we've also recently added the new Challenges, which are tests that let you approach the game in a different way.

Overall the game is designed for about 20-30 hours of gameplay, which taking in account it's $20 price tag should hopefully be reasonable value for money.

Regards.
Martiño.

author: {'steamid': '76561197982051089', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 896, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 895, 'last_played': 1664492255}
review: This game is a really intresting idea.  While I have seen games kind of like it, nothing is really even the same type of game that I have played personally.  My experience on this topic is vast.  Just because the developer came up with a great idea doesn't always mean the execution wont fall short.  Thankfully, even in early access, this is not the case.  This game was playable and entertaining, even though it is / was buggy a long time ago, and the developer consistantly does a great job smashing bugs and addressing gameplay issues.  Celestial Command caters to a specific type of gamer.  It requires some micro management for sure.  I would suggest watching gameplay videos (recent as possible since EA).  If you think you will like it from watching gameplay, I promise you will.  I don't think this game is for everyone, but it's one of my favorite games right now.  The pricetag is tiny.  Being Early Access and from a small developer I wouldn't want to pay $50 for it, but it's worth at least $25 and it seems to never be that high.  Kudos to the dev for not being greedy.  I really hope you try this game because its quite amazing.  Also, if you haven't played in a while, take a look.  I have seen lots of good progress recently.
developer_response:
Thanks you very much for review! We glad you like the game! : )
We will make it even better in the future.

author: {'steamid': '76561198076030071', 'num_games_owned': 249, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 47, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 47, 'last_played': 1710743754}
review:
This should not be a Early Access Game!

to put it simple the amount of bugs i ran into made this game unplayable, 1 infected (a crawler) somehow took out a helicopter! and my whole squad of delta force trained soldiers. The bugs i encountered are clipping, hitboxes not responding, infected unites being able to take out helicopters, soldier no matter the type doing no damage and more!

this game needs MAJOR work done to make it playable, I'm still going to keep it on my wish list for when it launches in full and will re try it but until then i requested a refund.
developer_response:
The Crawler was likely an LT or it was targeted by a Anti Air unit that you couldn't see out of LOS

Could you go into detail on the exact type of clipping you ran into?

Hitboxes not responding in what manner?

Infected unites being able to take out helicopters: Doesn't sound like a bug? Im not sure what occurred here they do have anti air abilities 

In the case of doing no damage you need to keep in mind certain weapons don't hurt certain enemy types because of their armor or will do hardly any damage. Upgrade/Swap out weapons at the barracks to build counter units against  says Juggernauts or Levi's

author: {'steamid': '76561198150645686', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 76, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 11, 'last_played': 1698277135}
review:
Here's a game I never even got to play and this is why:

Bought the game on sale but it doesn't even come with product key which you have to buy directly from the devs (Frontier) and redeem on their launcher.

Steam doesn't tell you this unless you check your order history and specifically expand the full product title to show "Elite Dangerous (non-key)" And since I bought the game during the winter sale and only just decided to try it now, I'm way past the refund deadline. Even if I could refund it, its still pretty much an underhanded cash-grab scam by the devs bc the product key is sold separately without any notice.

Frontier's account creation was also a really stupid experience. had to enter an email validation code for every other detail i updated and eventually gave up, but launcher wouldn't close unless I finished account creation first so I also had to force close the launcher through Task Manager.
developer_response:
Hi CMDR,

I'm not sure what's occurred here - we've not used product keys/Steam keys for about 18 months now. If you purchase on Steam there's no reason to ever head to the Frontier Store for any reason. Is it possible you purchased from a third party vendor who didn't provide the redemption instructions?

In any event, if you send us a support ticket we can get you set up: https://support.frontier.co.uk/topic.php

Regards,

CMDR Delta
Frontier Support Team

author: {'steamid': '76561198064989401', 'num_games_owned': 606, 'num_reviews': 124, 'playtime_forever': 1203, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1203, 'last_played': 1622898246}
review: It isn't Dungeon Keeper. It has some of the charm, but lacks... something That said, it's an entertaining game. The humour is dry, dark and delivered well by a great narrator. My only real complaint is the lack of choice offered in the campaign modes. The main campaign very much forces you to rush. It isn't possible to take your time and build up the "perfect" dungeon as almost every level throws timed events at you. Heart of Gold goes too far in the other direction; the levels give you so much time to build and mess around that there's never any sense of challenge. I feel a middle ground would've made the game much more enjoyable.

author: {'steamid': '76561197973038031', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 123, 'playtime_forever': 1335, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 404, 'last_played': 1669638340}
review:
Horrible stupid UI. The dumbest in any game I've ever played. Even something as simple as removing units from groupings requires you to drag it down several times in the grouping screen and even then it's 50/50 if it works. There's also a bug that obnoxiously shows the "System Power" icon which then blocks most of your view of your units and buildings, good luck navigating with a blocked view and buggy AI.

PATHFINDING. It's not there. Choppers will hug buildings. Units will forget orders. Vehicles ordered to dock and resupply will run in circles. 

Wonky building placement. Debris and structures can't be cleared but a forest worth of trees and a small nations worth of cars are easily removed via landscaping tool. Also can't select MULTIPLE buildings, something so basic in RTS games. 

Devs are killjoys. Decided to make game harder for the sake of it being harder. Gotta play the game the way they want it, never yours. Added turret cap when the AI pathfinding is a horrible mess. Good luck trying to get your drunk units into the fight. Also posted paragraphs of mental gymnastic to justify their decisions. You can't limit player choices when your damn AI doesn't function, that's why everyone was turret creeping. Lost so many chokepoints because the AI couldn't find it's way around a garbage can. The map also has a ton of wide open spaces which are impossible to defend with the limited turrets and unit cap. You'll be forced to speedrun the game instead of planning expansion. 

The Main menu is a horrible mess of ADs that Zuckerberg would be proud of. There's links for the devs youtube and other pages. Why not post your Instagram while were at it. Might have had an epilepsy looking where to start the game. It's like a tile of social media apps.

Could've been something great but even the UI is a disaster, basic RTS QOL and features aren't even there, AI constantly lost. Can't even fix the main menu. I want to love this game but every single flaw chips at your patience. 

$5 game at best.
