author: {'steamid': '76561198042891788', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 16, 'playtime_forever': 466, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 310, 'last_played': 1625307556}
review:
I left the below review a year or two ago.  There was an update recently, that was touted as a super-big-deal, so thought I'd give it another try.  Unfortunately I'm experiencing the same issues.  For example, it says to place a town centre, but to be careful where to place it as it can't be moved later.  IT DOES NOT GIVE ANY OTHER INFORMATION ABOUT WHERE ARE GOOD PLACES AND BAD PLACES!  It give you a quest to build a manor.  It gives you the ability to choose a bunch of cool things to the manor like towers and chimneys and flags.  So of course I added those.  Only to find a few hours later that the manor cannot finish being built as those things require resources that I don't have and can't trade for.  Do they expect me to start this game again after several hours with a resigned, 'Oh well, never mind, I learned something?'  And then do the same thing for another two hours until I hit ANOTHER snag and have to restart it AGAIN?  We'll I'm not bloomin' doing that I can tell you!  Even trading is incredibly non-intuitive.  When they say, 'Sell all above this value,' do they mean sell-number-of-resources-above-this-value, or sell-each-resource-if-you-can-sell-it-for-more-than-this-value?  Later I got a quest to sell berries to the king.  I had the requisite number of berries.  But the dumb game never told me HOW to sell them/complete that quest.  Not even in the help thing about quests or trading.  So yeah.  Still incredibly frustrated and still feeling like it's a waste of time.  Some of the interface things look a little nicer.  But it's like staying at a hotel that have been thoughtful enough to leave a mint on your pillow, but you find the bed unmade and the shower dirty.  Note to developers: I will only change this review if you change the game dramatically so it's actually user-friendly.  It tells you what to do, (options when various paths work, disables actions that will make it impossible to progress in the game - for example it should not allow me to add things to my manor design that will make the building physically impossible to finish - and hence the manor mission physically impossible to finish, and hence impossible to unlock any other buildings and quests...) this should be right down to the 'left click here because [X], not there because [Y.]  It should walk you through the game with parts of the screen flashing to show you where you need to look and click (it told me to go to the Trading Panel, but it took me a long frustrating time to find the thing!)  It should explain what you're doing and how various actions will help or hinder you later in the game.  Still same review as below - too difficult to know what to do or to know what you're doing well or badly.  I've played sims and resource-based games for ages.  This is in the top 1% of frustrating games I've played.  Read my original review below.  It still stands.

Not enough information to be able to play the game.  Every time I want to perform even the simplest of actions, I basically need to go and read a few pages of information off the internet.  Which is not fun.  No intuitive.  You don't know whether your actions were good or bad.  You don't know how to make certain things in the game work.  You don't know what's going well or badly at any given time.  The in-game help is woefully inadequate.  It's basically a remake of the Setters game that came out like 20 years ago, except it's less attractive-looking, and far less easy to understand.  Waste of money.
developer_response:
Hi Golan Trevise,

Thank you for taking the time to leave a review. Your feedback is very welcome!

The current UI is a placeholder for the new one that we are currently working on. We plan to release a complete UI overhaul next year that will go some way to improving your game experience. 

We also plan many improvements to the User Experience (UX) including a much improved help menu along with many features that will help to explain and guide you through the game mechanics.

There is still much more to come and we will release an updated roadmap early next year which will take us to the full release.

Hopefully with all the planned improvements and additions to gameplay, we will be able to earn a positive review in time.

Thanks again
Ash

author: {'steamid': '76561198073531214', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 16, 'playtime_forever': 99, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 99, 'last_played': 1685634257}
review:
I had high hopes for Timberborn, but I'm disappointed. The mechanics and overall design feel uninspired and repetitive. There is a noticeable absence of depth and complexity that would have made the game more enjoyable. Instead, it has shallow gameplay possibilities (game doesn't even have map seeds), leaving little room for strategic decision making.

-Difficulty curve is an absolute mess
-Lack of a well-structured progression system
-Absence of essential sound effects
-Lacks substance in terms of replayability
-Fails to provide a sense of accomplishment or meaningful achievements
-Visuals, which lack detail and fail to captivate.
-UI design lacks clarity

If devs want the game to improve they should take inspiration from games like oxygen not included.

review:
Besides a few minor bugs (dough rounds disappearing into walls sometimes, the roller getting stuck and not moving) and ones others have mentioned, I do believe this game is worth getting, especially on a sale. There's something calming about making batches of bread-based items. I did learn my lesson on taking on the 70 croissant mission before unlocking the roller though...never again...

The only downside is the amount of recipes, I think. I wish there were other things to make, or even DLC, but I understand devs wanting to move on from a game. Plus I've also played 38 hours as of this review so that probably doesn't help!

author: {'steamid': '76561197996461304', 'num_games_owned': 683, 'num_reviews': 40, 'playtime_forever': 44, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 44, 'last_played': 1614524065}
review:
This game is so close to being amazing, it just needs some tweaks. I found it would sometimes stutter when the rest of the game runs beautifully. Also, there's no apparent tutorial. The voice will tell you roughly what your goals are, but I had to google where to find or even what most of the items were. It's a sucky feeling when you're only 10 minutes in and you're already struggling.

Also, weapon durability is the absolute pits.
developer_response:
Hey there!

Thanks for the feedback. There certainly were balance issues, and we’ve taken measures towards creating a better experience. The in-game tools have received a durability buff (Scrapper 35>50, many others 15>20), and fixed a number of bugs as well. There’s more info in our recent blog post here: https://store.steampowered.com/news/app/738520/view/3022451561583513184

The dynamics of survival in space should be more enjoyable now. Let us know what you think by sending a message to info@breathedge.com or visit our discord channel: https://discord.com/invite/eyURQXG.

author: {'steamid': '76561198006686203', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 74, 'playtime_forever': 155, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 155, 'last_played': 1564154149}
review:
too restrictive. this is much more of a "one method is the correct solution" puzzle game rather than a fun experiment of making something work, then tinkering to make it more efficient. i was really excited through the tutorial and by the second level it became pretty clear that this was not a game that allowed for multiple solutions. there are very tight restrictions on every facet of your kitchen that keep you from even trying out a setup as a proof of concept before trimming it down to meet the passing requirements. the levels should be basic pass requirements with additional bonuses or achievements for each element like using minimal power, or keeping your kitchen under so many parts, etc. 
the UI is actual garbage. 3/4 of your time is spent repetitiously selecting 3 or more drop down boxes per item to make several items do the same thing. clunky and not intuitive at all.
so far its been more frustrating trying to figure out the exact setup the level designer had in mind than an enjoyable experiment of trying to create a solution and improve it. i was excited about it, enjoyed the prospect that lay before me during the tutorials and was immediately bored, annoyed and frustrated. did not leave me looking forward to the difficulty "ramping up quickly" either
developer_response:
Hey Jimmtron,

Appreciate you taking the time to share your thoughts with us on Automachef, sorry to hear it's currently more negative than positive for you.

Your feedback has been collated and will be shared with the team, especially your part around the UI.

In regards to the solutions, as you progress to larger kitchens you'll hopefully discover the various solutions for each challenge.

Thanks again for your time.

Best,

author: {'steamid': '76561198000352554', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 30, 'playtime_forever': 53, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 53, 'last_played': 1480533321}
review:
This game show me, how you refund a game in steam.

Despite beeing quite charming in art style, sounds are porly made, no control over ship at all, no tutorial at all (steam community guide after 2 years of development ony??) GUI is not consistent in functionalities. Please dont support this game developer. After 2 years of active development no progress has been made in core functionalities.
developer_response:
Excuse me, but most of your statements is incorrect.
Let's look.
>> sounds are porly madeCreation of nice sounds for space game with such dynamic environment and camera - quite a complex task. It requires some time and will be improved later.
>> no control over ship at all
No control at all? :) You may control any modules of the ship. Setup any hotkey for any function. Setup resources connections, location of the modules, shield radius etc.
You have more control over your ship than in most others similar space games.

>> no tutorial at all (steam community guide after 2 years of development ony??)
Yes, this is very complex and unique game which requires a lot of research. Not a casual clone of existed game which can be made for a few weeks and which does not adds any new features after base game .
Celestial Command in constant development and adds a lot new feature which was not available before. Also we constantly improve existed features.
This is Early Access of Alpha version, so everything changes quite often. Any kind of interactive tutorial will be outdated very fast.
We will add tutorial at Beta stage.
At current stage it will be just waste of time.

>> GUI is not consistent in functionalities.
On the contrary. Any action have its button on the GUI. In additional, any button have its tool-tip with detail description of this button.
In our opinion, it is great. Personally, we are do not likes GUI in most games, because its interface provides very low amount of control elements and often without any tool-tips.
Sometimes, GUI can be a complex, but it related only to overall complexity of the game.

>> After 2 years of active development no progress has been made in core functionalities.
On the contrary. Very rare game have some much changes during 2 years of development as Celestial Command.
Just look at out first Greenlight trailer:
https://youtu.be/ONdIjvBFgsk
Also two anniversary posts:
1.
http://steamcommunity.com/gid/103582791436739024/announcements/detail/710835733884410740

2.
http://steamcommunity.com/games/CelestialCommand/announcements/detail/115201797087397375

The game changed almost completely. Added 3D graphics, planets, trading, quests, new modules and a lot more. And now we are working on even bigger changes and improvements.

author: {'steamid': '76561197984130992', 'num_games_owned': 176, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 315, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 20, 'playtime_at_review': 315, 'last_played': 1711887327}
review:
No matter how cool the game is...it crashes all the time. The crash log in the documentation is empty. There's just nothing in it. I've now done everything I could find to help with DIY and it just doesn't work. I also think it's cheeky that there's no fix from the developer. It's not an isolated case that it doesn't work.
There is no patch, there is no solution, there is no help for the problem.

If anyone has an idea or solution to the problem. I urgently ask for help
developer_response:
Hey there Syron2k! Crashing problems are super frustrating and I'm sorry to hear that you're running into this issue so often. I'd really like to look into this further and see if I can help by limiting how frequently this happens for you. These troubleshooting steps and workarounds help with most technical issues and will rule out as much as possible in advance. Note that if one works to stop this crash from continuing, you won't need to do the rest:

- Install Ubisoft Connect and The Crew 2 on the same drive as your OS
- [url=https://ubi.li/CrAsJ]Verify the game files[/url]
- End unnecessary background processes via Task Manager
- Unplug non-essential peripherals (additional monitors, VR equipment, controllers, etc.)
- Clear the [url=https://ubi.li/TMoYl]Steam cache[/url] and the [url=https://ubi.li/plsfw]Ubisoft Connect cache[/url]
- Perform an [url=https://support.microsoft.com/en-us/topic/use-the-system-file-checker-tool-to-repair-missing-or-corrupted-system-files-79aa86cb-ca52-166a-92a3-966e85d4094e]SFC Scan[/url] on your system (if the scan detects any errors, you may want to repeat this step multiple times until the results are clear)
- Clean reinstall the [url=https://docs.microsoft.com/en-US/cpp/windows/latest-supported-vc-redist?view=msvc-170]C++ Redistributables[/url]
- Some Nvidia players saw an improvement after [url=https://www.nvidia.com/Download/Find.aspx]rolling back their driver version[/url]
- [url=https://ubi.li/e4DRO]Everything listed in this FAQ article[/url]

Once the listed steps have been completed successfully, if you STILL encounter this crash, we'd like it if you could open a new support case and provide us with your system files for a closer look. If you don't mind, please [url=https://www.ubisoft.com/en-us/help/contact]login to our website[/url] and open your support case, be sure to list all of the steps and workarounds we tried, then attach your [url=https://www.ubisoft.com/en-us/help/connectivity-and-performance/article/generating-system-reports-to-help-troubleshooting/000061449]Msinfo and Dxdiag files[/url] in advance to save time. Our support team will receive everything and then contact you to proceed. Thank you!

author: {'steamid': '76561198054631888', 'num_games_owned': 262, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 1929, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1231, 'last_played': 1676186286}
review:
I really do not understand the point of games like this and banished. They are lazy and not well thought out. Instead of an abundance of content, they simply create a balancing act between the few pieces of the game that exist. Instead of creating a balanced game, they throw the pieces at the player and tell you to balance it. The only way this game creates any amount of fun is by forcing you to keep balancing, keep adding more colonists, and just keep building up.  

Gets old real fast
developer_response:
Hi there,

Thank you for your feedback.

We've added many features to the game since this review was written, like the new Storm Planet, new structures, techs and a lot more.

Maybe you would consider getting the latest version and playing the game again.

Regards.
Martino.

author: {'steamid': '76561197995690603', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 1094, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1013, 'last_played': 1531032419}
review:
For those wanting a nostalgia kick of the original series - this'll fill your craving.

For those who didn't play the originals, first of all I'm sorry for your loss, this is a great entry into the series considering when you go back to the old games now without nostalgia goggles it's actually kinda rough around the edges.
developer_response:
Hi faultyk,

I'm not sure when you last played but we've made huge sweeping improvements since your review in 2015. We released the game in an unfortunate state in April 2015 but never stopped updating it. With over 80 updates since then, 7 major updates containing tonnes of new features it's an entirely different game.

Most importantly the stability and performance of the game has been now greatly improved after thousands of man-hours of development in out two-man code team spent patching it up. 

As an early access supporter, you even have the first expansion for free, and the second expansion was free for everyone! 

If you've not tried the game for a while now might be a great time for you to jump in and see how far we've come since release! We'd love to hear what you think now.

Cheers,
Cian

author: {'steamid': '76561198396607380', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 25, 'playtime_forever': 68, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 68, 'last_played': 1629763600}
review:
-Online Match Making doesn't work for me or for some friends I was planning to play with. Co-op multiplayer worked but then what's the point? Online match making with at least 8-12 teams is a must for this kind of game. I see potential for a fun multiplayer experience. 
-The levels look decently attractive but the ball models will turn audiences away.  The ball models look like they were made with an elementary school age level in mind. Having a wider audience is good but people might think you are targeting children. A way around this could be making the ball models look super comically weird instead of slightly weird. The bomb model is cool. 
-I can't recommend this to friends yet but I'm excited to see what happens.
developer_response: Hey there, we just pushed an update to online multiplayer that should make matchmaking more stable. Please give it a try and tell us if you're experiencing any more issues!

author: {'steamid': '76561198045042033', 'num_games_owned': 694, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 394, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 255, 'last_played': 1624904044}
review:
This game is awesome but the bugs in it makes me rage, i [b] rarely [/b] write reviews but just to show how frustrated i am, The housing system the residential paint dose not work at all, only 2 houses have been built and 8 serfs total from a total of 60 newcomers , after 2 hours of game play and 2 churches and a ton of Markets and Wells, The AI wont build houses and i am stuck with 8 serfs ...and yes it was saying the desirability was high, still no new houses established. this is the second time that this happened to me once 2 years ago and now, please fix this issue.... this is frustrating. 

EDIT : on my second playthrow the issues have been fixed now the upgrading newcomers tap is showing "it wasn't showing before" don't know why .. also the housing issue is fixed also on my second playthrow ... looks like my first one is just cursed or something, Anyway the game as i said is Awesome need some minor bug fixes that is all
developer_response:
Hi Midst_Thieves,

Thank you for leaving a review. 

It sounds like you have not been promoting your newcomers to serf status. Newcomers do not require housing so will not build houses. Once promoted to serf they will then require a house and will start building. There is an early quest that guides you through this process.

You will need a lord's manor with a great hall function assigned. Once you have this you get the chance to promote villagers at the start of every month. 

If you are using mods there could be a mod that interferes with this.

Cheers
Ash

author: {'steamid': '76561198150798690', 'num_games_owned': 192, 'num_reviews': 16, 'playtime_forever': 3789, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1361, 'last_played': 1655051100}
review:
The original release of AdventureQuest and then AdventureQuest: Worlds touched me as a child and taught me so much about playing games online and in part motivated me to learn more about computers. Now, being 19 in a couple months time, I can't find the words that make me love this new release so much.

I originally picked up the game when it first dropped into open beta and grinded up to level 17, just a bit away from the old max level of 20, killing dragons and working my nuts off to try and get a shiny gold cape which I'm still grinding dungeons for now... One thing that didn't quite get me back then was the humour, my god there are so many hidden jokes and pop culture references that I completely missed when the game first dropped.

In all, if you played any basic MMO as a young kid then you probably came across Artix Entertainment before and this game continues with its never ending charm in ways that you really should experience yourself.

author: {'steamid': '76561198097166495', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 734, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 734, 'last_played': 1705873115}
review: walking sim with no loot also toxic community
developer_response: Hi 2017 FORD FUSION SPORT! We're sorry to see that you were disappointed with the game.  SCUM is envisioned to be a hardcore survival experience that relies heavily on realism, meaning that you will not be able to find loot easily - especially some more valuable stuff such as firearms, explosives or car parts. It is also, entirely possible that someone managed to loot those locations right before you came there. We understand that some players do not find this entertaining, which is why we've enabled private servers where certain settings (such as loot spawns) can be modified to cater to the specific preferences of players. The same can be said with regards to the community. We are certain that there are certain admins and servers that would be a better fit for you. All that being said, we hope you'll consider giving the game another chance.

author: {'steamid': '76561198079134182', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 517, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 517, 'last_played': 1385484593}

author: {'steamid': '76561198069686580', 'num_games_owned': 492, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 575297, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 9469, 'playtime_at_review': 54132, 'last_played': 1712945627}
review:
Original at 900h into the game:
I'm definitely not a critic and maybe I don't have the greatest experience in writing reviews, but what I do know is that I've put in one or two hours into this game and I still don't get bored! First of all it should be clear that noone should expect anything truly groundbreaking. There are different heroes and guardians and each one has its own little special features. Be it a tank that can also strengthen its group and taunt the enemies or a druid that can give the whole group a "Heal over time"; effect and support it. Or maybe you prefer a mage who conjures the image of a dragon for a few seconds, which then fights for him? Furthermore, the game is constantly getting new updates, which add new content, fix bugs, change the animation style, etc. ! Finally, the only point I find really difficult to say: The game encourages you to buy advantages in the ingame shop. However, to be fair, if you don't want to fight for the first place on the leaderboards, you can get through the game relaxed without ingame shopping and never really have the feeling that "You MUST buy something in the shop now or you won't get anywhere! ( I look in your direction Metin2 :D )

Edit: I may or may not have gotten a few more hours in... Game in constantly improving and even more fun then when i originally wrote this review. Many new features, heroes and ways to improve without feeling the need to get into the ingame shop.

author: {'steamid': '76561198087645710', 'num_games_owned': 275, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 125, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 125, 'last_played': 1443776631}
review: This game is awful, things like no maps and forced first person perspective. I really, really wanted to get into it and I even had gone into it with a group of friends. The combat system seems dull and the graphics really aren't very good. There's no guides I couldn't even figure out the basics of building up a character, it seems like there's just random skills that are randomly leveled up and you have a maximum number of skills so things like being good at armorcrafting reduce your combat effectiveness. The last time someone tried something like this was SWG, but SWG was way, way, way more intuitive about the costs and what benefits of various playstyles. Maybe it's just too open? Maybe I've been spoonfed by other games since forever and only like the idea of an open world MMO? But either way this was an awful experience and if I had paid money for it I'd want it back.

author: {'steamid': '76561197983105124', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 116, 'playtime_forever': 27904, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 11148, 'last_played': 1611546394}
review:
New review:

They have abandoned VR, which, I'll admit, is disappointing, but I would still play without it, if there was a solid game here still. The real travesty is a loss of vision. FD just don't seem to "get" why people play their game. They refuse to implement long asked for features and quality of life updates. Instead they put effort into a poorly thought out expansion that didn't even deliver the features most wanted for an "on foot expansion" (interiors of ships, VR, etc). I don't really see any of this being remedied in the next couple years. So with a heavy heart, I have to give up on this game. 

In 2017-2019 the game hit it's peak for me. But today there isn't enough here to be good, and what is here is tedious and sloppy.


Old Review:

I love this game. It's grandios, epic, humungous. It may be grindy, but it's fun. As a VR experience, it's incredible. You're there, in your cockpit, a pilot of the stars, just doing anything to make a buck and buy new stuff. Exploration, combat, trading, lore. It's all here and done so well.

Sure, there are obvious improvements that can easily make this game AAA, and it can be frustrating for the developers to not see how obvious they are. I can only hope in time it's realized, the developers are active and have future plans, even years after release. 

The community is great, but it's hard to be a part of that community without going outside the game. You forget you're playing online for your first 10-20 hours sometimes. But, if you go to Discord and Reddit, there is a thriving community of people to play and talk with that are just as into this game as you are.

The developers have tried to help with my connection issues, I took my issues to twitter and service tickets, and they seem to think the problem lies with me, but I play tons of games online, and have never experienced issues like I did in this game. So, they did try, but ultimately I still get connection issues pulling missions and doing other things in station. I even set my gaming rig in DMZ to make sure it wasn't a port issue and it remained. I changed to google DNS, same issue. But I've never really experienced gameplay lag. Dogfights are as smooth as butter. I know how to troubleshoot network issues. My network and internet are fine.
developer_response:
Hey Extremophile Elite,

I'm sorry to hear that you are having trouble connecting to Elite Dangerous. Our recent updates should have fixed some of the most common causes, but we are still looking into all other reports and more updates are on the way.

In this case please do check out the help page here: https://support.frontier.co.uk/kb/faq.php?id=78

If that doesn't help please do contact us from the top of that page as we would love to help get this working for you. :-)

Cheers!

CMDR Normandy
Frontier Developments Customer Support Team

developer_response: Hey zethphoton! I apologize if you've been having connection troubles in The Crew 2. I'd advise completing our [url=https://support.ubi.com/en-US/faqs/000035320/Connectivity-Issues-in-The-Crew-2-On-PC-TC2/]connectivity guide[/url] in full. This will ensure the connection between our online services and yours is completely optimized, which will help to lessen any disconnects you may experience. However, if the steps in that guide do not help, please contact our team at support.ubi.com. Thank you!

author: {'steamid': '76561198079625287', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 4876, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 4419, 'last_played': 1584443959}
review: Crap...
developer_response:
Hi FpsDog,

I'm not sure when you last played but we've made huge sweeping improvements since your review in 2017. We released the game in an unfortunate state in April 2015 but never stopped updating it. With over 80 updates since then, 7 major updates containing tonnes of new features it's an entirely different game.

We'd love to know what you think of the game and the new stuff, here are some features we've added since release:

- Map Editor & Workshop Support with full scripting to create custom campaigns
- Overhauled Main Campaign
- Four Expansions with dozens of new features each. One of these is completely free for you!
- New Game Modes
- Improvements across the board to the core game.
- Aesthetic Improvements
- Vastly improved framerate
- Entirely new Skirmish AI

Looking forward to hearing what you think,

Cian

author: {'steamid': '76561199111041246', 'num_games_owned': 13, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 729, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 225, 'last_played': 1661677338}
review: this is a really good game graphics are amazing and even the details

author: {'steamid': '76561198970857856', 'num_games_owned': 135, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 1548, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 695, 'last_played': 1655196256}
review:
EDIT: i have since 100%'d this game and i still love it dearly, but i will not be changing my review until the issues i had are addressed. restarting and playing through the whole game again because of bad rng was something *I* was willing to do, but not something i would expect of everyone playing this game, and as such my review will stay negative until the issues are fixed.

i love this game and i recommend you to play it if you're a fan of charming worlds or boss rush games, it does these very well and it's a very fun adventure game.

what i DONT recommend is for you to 100% this game. ever.
spoilers ahead so read with caution.
popocity is so terribly designed and is the killer if your first 100% run, no matter WHAT. you will HAVE to 100% this game twice because of the event involving reaching 10,000 credits. when you reach popocity it's already around 8,000, and will tick up over time so even if you do nothing it will eventually reach 10,000. why is this an issue? simple, many events can ONLY be completed BEFORE it reaches 10,000 and (unlike most events) CANNOT be completed after you beat breevis. the worst example is the kneft invasion, which is where i lost my run. 5.5 hours in and i have literally done EVERYTHING ELSE up to this point, all i had to do was a couple of missions i knew could be completed after breevis, the fried kneft happiness point, and the kneft invasion. i had totally forgotten the kneft invasion was a thing and spent so long trying to get the bad kneft from fishing (nothing but good fish hooks, by the way) that the city reached 10,000. so before i went to fight breevis i figured i would take care of the kneft invasion. but for SOME REASON the kneft invasion GOES AWAY WHEN YOU REACH 9,999. not after breevis, which is what would make sense, but RIGHT when the city locks up. so if you take too long doing the mandatory events for 100% you are PERMANENTLY LOCKED OUT OF 100%ING THE GAME AND MUST RESTART. not to mention, i was playing on INSANE MODE. so if i want to get back to where i was, i would have to replay 2/3rds of the game all over again and make sure i did ABSOLUTELY EVERYTHING on a TIMER to make sure that i didn't miss anything and would have to repeat it all over again. 100%ing this game is terribly designed and ruined all good graces i had for this insanely charming and fun game. if you play this game, for the love of god do not 100% it.
developer_response:
Sorry to hear you had such a bad time 100%ing it. However, you should be able to fight the kneft infestation after you've reached the sinkhole. You just can't do it during the Popo City event you described, because all credit counters are locked. Once they're re-enabled you're good to go. 

There are some events in the game that you can skip or miss, but none of them should affect your ability to 100% the game.

author: {'steamid': '76561197995186207', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 490345, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 490345, 'last_played': 1638411717}
review:
(8k hours played) Constantly changing garbage game.  The game has been out for 3 years yet is still in 'Early Access' IF YOU TAKE MONEY FROM PEOPLE THROUGH PACKS, THEN IT'S IN RELEASE. Not early access, they devs hid behind early access tag, so when they screw it up, they can say "Its only in early access"
The devs will rip whole system out and rework them, add new ones, break them, add new currencies (It's is a 'free' game) trash it. Now you've got the same currency for two different systems, but can only level one. Artwork gets updated when ever they feel like it and make every look like a short bus weirdo. 
They added tanks, with dramatic difficulty spikes (unless you pay money)
They added PvP because they can't create content. Of course it's Pay to win, that's how the whales will show how much   money they spent.
Community is toxic, if you are in a guild and take a week off, you're kicked. If you are not in a a guild, forget it, you will take weeks to level. I spent $1.00 in the game and that was too much. It a nice time waster up until about level 1,600. After that $$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$ or lots and lots of time (like 5+ years of 16 hrs/day playing)
developer_response: we are sorry that you had this experience with the guild. That is due to that guild's policy however, the developers are not responsible for this. After offering a gameplay of 8000 hours for free, don't you think it would be nice to support us with your rating? As you said you spend 1$ and you have been playing since 2019. Let us count on your FaintKarma, players like you can make the difference so that we can grow our community!

author: {'steamid': '76561198043814385', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 14, 'playtime_forever': 982, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 218, 'last_played': 1696817638}
review:
i felt id revise my review as i was a little quick to comment last time

ive played this game periodically on mobile and on steam for a few years

i think the game could be really fun and interesting to play if it werent for the fact that everyone is pretty much the exact same aside from cosmetics

what i would do to make the game more attractive for myself would be to add some kind of talent system or specializations to each class to allow for one to build there own version of each class. I think its boring when you level up and there is nothing interesting or new going on besides being able to wear new gear.

also i think it would be cool to be able to have your own custom class which takes from each of the main class trees or whatever something interesting like that to allow someone to feel like they are really playing there own character that they made.

character building is fun and also id add some big bosses with interesting mechanics and some sort of huge battleground pvp with good rewards.
i mainly play games like this to build characters and this game doesnt really give me much to work with in terms of building. thanks for the read
developer_response:
Hello. Thank you for checking out of our game! There are many things to do in our game. There are multiple areas/maps to explore, hundreds and hundreds of quests, dungeons to battle through, other players to group up with and play up, 1v1 duels, etc. We suggest exploring the world more as 3.8 hours really isn't enough time to see what the game has to offer! 

The devs are constantly working on fixing and improving issues and releasing updates/patches weekly, which is a challenge as an indie game studio. Please check out the Game Plan and Design Notes - https://aq3d.com/news/ & https://aq3d.com/game-plan/. Thank you!

author: {'steamid': '76561198017048581', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 15, 'playtime_forever': 25, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 25, 'last_played': 1672330910}
review:
Bought it on sale, I didn't expect much and still I was disappointed.

*First of all, the English translation is REALLY bad, and that breaks immersion very early on the story.
*The plot is shallow to say the least. Gameplay feels clunky and the interaction with the environment is not intuitive.
*The puzzles are pretty random, with no good reasoning behind them, so solving them is not rewarding, just relieveing. 
*Ambientation is poor. Game really needs some better sound effects and appropiate music to build tension.
*The "monster" is badly designed and not even close to being scary.
*The dungeon, which is supposed to be the spookiest place, had a pointless QR Code on a wall (which doesn't seem to work) and a picture OF THE DEVELOPERS with the text "it's just a prank bro ;)" after a long corridor. I think that's immature and unacceptable in the horror/suspense genre, and just breaks immersion (even more than the broken English).

I don't want to be unfair with this game since it was most likely developed by one or two developers with low to no budget, but I wouldn't buy it again. It wasn't fun, it wasn't interesting, wasn't scary or immersive. I played 20 minutes and got bored, with no will to finish it even though I knew it would only take 20 minutes or so more.

There's totally free games which are amazing, with hundreds of hours of fun gameplay. Why would anyone pay for 45 minutes of mediocre gameplay? Even if it's 50 cents, it's not worth it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198003444684', 'num_games_owned': 556, 'num_reviews': 30, 'playtime_forever': 13, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 13, 'last_played': 1539235088}
review: Crashes each and every time you try to run it, and the devs don't give a shit.
developer_response: Unreal crashes are isolated to a small number of people and 100% of the time they are related to hardware and drivers. Our hardware survey showed that 15% of our players are trying to run DD on machines below 8GB of RAM and with insufficient video cards. I'm not sure if that is you, but if it is, that will cause the Unreal crash. The other cause is not having DirectX 11 and out of date video card drivers. I hope this helps. It has fixed the issue for some of our other users. Long story short though, that is an Unreal Engine issue that all UE games have (including Fortnite). It is not a result of our team or us not caring. Just wanted to clear that up for you.

author: {'steamid': '76561198335309910', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 1172, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 219, 'last_played': 1583634390}

author: {'steamid': '76561197970508116', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 24, 'playtime_forever': 77, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 6, 'last_played': 1450030827}
review:
I'm torn, I love the idea and feel, but it just needs more content or structured options, ie something to actually "do" other than fly endlessly though empty space from station to station.  I really want to like it, but it's just a simple endless grind, combat is few and far between, and there's no making sense of the background "story" as there really isn't one.

Controls are nice, flying is fun and feels right.  It's a great framework, just needs filling in now.

Hopefully that will come in the future.  I was a beta backer and just got a Steam key, hence the no play time.

review: Would recommend it only for people that like to stand still in vr
developer_response: Hello, the game was designed to be a sit-down game. When in space, an astronaut is moving using his thrusters, not muscles, so sitting down had more sense for us. It's also user-friendly for people with many disabilities - we didn't want to exclude players from experiencing the game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198027442761', 'num_games_owned': 125, 'num_reviews': 21, 'playtime_forever': 35, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 35, 'last_played': 1685199093}
review:
I find the UI unintuitive to use. You can't escape out of selections, you can't escape to the main menu. Signals cannot be selected after placement. Signal placement is unintuitive. I have only a single train and it keeps getting stuck all the time because signals cannot be placed in a bi-directional way. A tutorial should present itself on how to use these systems. It didn't.

Asking for a refund.
developer_response:
Thanks a lot for your feedback and sorry for inconveniences.

For bi-directional signals, just click once more at the same spot (clicking on existing signal switches one/bi directional). Also there is an option in settings for what should be default on first click (if one or bi directional signals).

I am working hard on content and intuitivness, but I admit there is always something need to be improve.

author: {'steamid': '76561198024088242', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 17519, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 17517, 'last_played': 1623033760}
review: I've played a fair bit of Odyssey now and I can saw it is a complete waste of time and full of bugs.  Nothing says a waste like loading up with some missions to only find that the planets those missions are on are not there!  Then there is the nice bug when fighting with scavengers you get attacked by the security system that does nothing to the scavengers.  The fines will also rack up when you fail a mission because the planet isn't there or you are blatantly attacked for no reason.   Don't get me started on other things like the SRV and how it now responds or how the auto landing now works but you can't turn it off unless you shut off the module.  This list can go on and on, do yourself a favor and hold onto your money until this thing gets fixed!
developer_response:

I'm sorry to hear you're having trouble with the game.

Do submit a ticket via https://customersupport.frontier.co.uk/hc/en-us and the team can assist.

review:
THIS GAME IS BULLSHIT. Grandma is not a real physical object, there is no fun to be had.  I was hoping the grandma could get hit by car or cause any kind of effect on surroundings.  The only fun I had was trying to push every item out of my apartment or escape the matrix that this game traps you inside of.  There is nothing you can do besides throw at coins. author: {'steamid': '76561198084842382', 'num_games_owned': 164, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 6537, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1460, 'last_played': 1706239162}
review: Before going into this, I'd just like to say that I've never played the "Dungeon Keeper" games that inspired this one, so I'm not wearing the rose tinted glasses of nostalgia.  That being said, I think this may be one of the most fun games I've ever played.  While there is a bit of a steep difficulty curve (I'm looking at you, level 7), and the campaign seems a bit short, It is still an enjoyable experience.  The deep, varied, and strategic gameplay, combined with a strong visual asthetic and a dark sense of humor, make this game feel fresh and enjoyable, even on repeated playthroughs.  The devs still seem to be active, so we can (hopefully) expect more content in the future.  The online multiplayer and Workshop support should help tide us over until then.  Plus, there is a sandbox mode where you can create and grow a dungeon with virtually no limits, and then test it against waves of invaders.  I've speant an embarassing amount of time in this mode.  It's sort of like a combination of a fish tank and your father's train set, but with more evil.  This game is a good expereince on its own, but it will really appeal to fans of the original dungeon keeper.  It's basically what the third game would have been if EA (Electronic Anus) hadn't turned it into a terrible "pay-to-win" phone game.  Dig out tunnels, build rooms, attract monsters, contruct defences, fight enemies.  Heck, they even got the guy who did voiceovers in the original to come back.  Anyway, it's a good game that's worth your time and money.

author: {'steamid': '76561198137934248', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 25, 'playtime_forever': 177, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 130, 'last_played': 1703273276}
review:
i tried to get into adventure quest 3d, i really did. my main gripe with this game is that there is nothing that keeps me coming back. ffxiv has an incredible story and rewarding progression which kept me hooked, wow had fun combat and a huge universe to "comfily" level through, but aq3d? even dragonfable is better (shoutout to all my df vets tomix fan till the day i die) AND ITS GOT TWO PEOPLE WORKING ON IT LOL

every now and then i launch this game (usually when im high) to see if it got better and it didnt. joshstrifehayes made an incredible video on this game and why it doesnt stick its landing. just fyi rn my character is stuck in that i cant find voltaire since i got TPd to battleon, but THERE IS NO MAP. as in i cant see where the quest is. im not an idiot i know i can look it up but even zone maps have so little effort put in them it frankly makes me not want to spend time on this game

the transition to 3d robbed aq3d of all the stylistic charm aq, df and mq have. looking at a mechquest character sprite i can instantly tell its from mechquest, but aq3d stylistically evokes nothing in me

just wait for the updated aqw
developer_response: Hey there, thank you so much for taking the time to share your honest thoughts with our team. We are sorry to hear that you did not enjoy AQ3D, but we really do appreciate you being truthful about what you didn't enjoy with our team. Thanks so much for taking the time to leave us a review today. We hope that next time you come back to AQ3D, you will enjoy it more than you did this time. Again, thanks for reaching out and letting us know how you feel. We are also glad you are looking forward to AQW: Infinity. You can learn more about that project at AQ2D dot com. Thanks.

author: {'steamid': '76561198038613113', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 16, 'playtime_forever': 316, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 316, 'last_played': 1549276093}
review:
A decent enough early access title. Definitely far from feature complete, but the base game is very playable and mostly bug free. That being said I would say that this game is not worth the money that is being asked for it at this time. There is no challenge whatsoever as you cannot fail. Your citizens don't die for any reason as far as I can tell. You can starve them. Leave them without water. Whatever. They will leave if they become too unhappy for too long though. 

If you want a good medieval style city building game go play Banished. Because all this game did was remind me of how good Banished is and that I should go log another 50 hours into it.

review:
First, Let me get something straight. I think this game is great. It has a lot of potential. i loved the main story. Bunch of side quests to do. However, i think the combat system is a bit lacking. Not once did I feel any challenge while fighting. Also, I think the crafting could expanded a bit to reflect the level progression. Some professions you will end up "spamming" a craft just to get enough level to proceed to the next tier of crafting.
All in all, i would not recommend the game right now if you plan investing more than 20 hours but definitely keep an eye for when they release more content
developer_response:
Hey, we are aware of the issues with lack of difficulty and it's something that will definitely be improved before 1.0 release. We are working on improving our balance tools and will be soon doing complete rebalance of progression curve, both for combat and professions.

Hope you will give the game another chance once the balance and difficulty are fixed.

author: {'steamid': '76561198158465560', 'num_games_owned': 72, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 97869, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 1928, 'playtime_at_review': 60248, 'last_played': 1712365432}
review:
edit 2/29/24 : FIXXX THE ZOMBIE HORDE . i killed zombie with a bow but it keeps calling horde ? are you kidding me . what is that? that is an issue from 2 months ago. can we get that fixed atleast please.

Edit: i've been playing this game for almost 2k hours. its not that frustrating anymore . bugs do exist stutters are still there. but atleast its playable now to the point you can enjoy the game. I cannot recommend the game yet. you might quit when playing at the  moment. hopefully it gets changed upon the time they start doing fixing the game after full release

_________________________________________________________________
I was so hyped to play the new horde update. 
but it failed. it doesn't make any sense. if u see one zombie, even if u kill it , it doesn't stop the scream to call horde,
those 5-6 puppets that will be summoned. it can do another scream. it doesn't really stop. 

I understood that eventually the puppets can get in the doors. BUT they can flawlessly jump from WINDOWS !! ? WHAT !!?
What zombie movie have they watched that made zombies like a god damn smooth criminal. Zombies crawl in windows not jump. your character will need to vault in the windows its like 2 seconds. but the zombie  can just jump for 1 sec. HAHAHAHAHAHAHA my brain exploded. I have never seen a zombie movie with a zombie that can jump kick like a ninja in a window HAHAHAHAHAHAHAHAHAHAHAHA
developer_response: Hi Grim! We're sorry to see that the new update disappointed you. The idea behind this update for the puppets was to create a greater challenge and further enhance the moment-to-moment gameplay. We acknowledge that some of their functioning might not be as satisfying for all players, but we wanted to increase their threat, especially with their entry into buildings. The agility of puppets is also something that is specific to the lore of the game, meaning that they are not monstrous, decaying creatures like in other media, but retain virtually the same functioning as the living because of the BCU's controlled by TEC1. Also, the other reason this was introduced is because the threat of puppets was easily mitigated by entering buildings and now this is not an option as hey can open doors and enter through windows. Regardless, the game's in Early access and we're gathering feedback from our players on these matters and we'll be making necessary tweaks if the need arises. That being said, we hope you'll give the game another chance, at least once we fully release the game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198101362683', 'num_games_owned': 344, 'num_reviews': 20, 'playtime_forever': 181, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 181, 'last_played': 1659562314}
review:
It's a cute idea, and I like it, but the execution is so buggy and lacking in content that I can't recommend it to someone trying to spend wisely. :( The controls still show incorrectly, and I randomly glitch out of the map and have to restart a lot, and that hampers my ability to enjoy the game. Additionally, there's not much to do and it gets old quickly. "More difficult" translates to "more robbers" and nothing else, and there's not much interest for me in continuing as the levels go on.

Needs some serious dev love that it's not getting for me to be able to recommend it, but I can tell it's a smaller team, so I do still want to iterate how good of an idea it is and how much it would be improved by a team that can maintain it post-release
developer_response:
Hey Ashterisk, we're sorry you weren't satisfied with your experience with Roombo. It was a small experimental game for our team, so we weren't able to put in as much polish and content as we'd like with its limited budget. 

However, you might want to check out the follow-up we made in 2022, JUSTICE SUCKS, which takes the core concept and takes it much further, with a lot more content and polish! https://store.steampowered.com/app/856890/JUSTICE_SUCKS_Tactical_Vacuum_Action/

author: {'steamid': '76561198119834610', 'num_games_owned': 859, 'num_reviews': 140, 'playtime_forever': 59, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 59, 'last_played': 1592858499}
review:
[h1] <-- Review written for [url=https://store.steampowered.com/curator/35180752/] 3 Point Play [/url] --> [/h1]

I like these kind of games, I really do. You know, there's a buncha games in which you can be Adam Jensen, but very few ones in which you can actually be his sidekick, his support: Pritchard. 
For those who don't know, Adam Jensen is the main character on Deus Ex: HR and Deus Ex: MD, a former swat agent turned into a cyborg dude who works like sort of a hired gun, and Pritchard, on the other hand, is a hacker.

If you explore in the first level on Deus Ex: HR, and you have a high-enough hacking skill, and/or one of those unlocker thingies, you could access Pritchard's computer, and there's an email, with a rejected idea for a TV Show, in which, the main the main character would be a hacker. The reason for the rejection, is that people don't really feel identified with the "hacker" and would rather prefeer a rugger, ex-cop turned bodyguard or something like that.
So, this game is basically Pritchard's TV show turned into a game, you won't be working in the front-lines, but actually, behind the screen, giving intel, hacking stuff, and commanding your squad across a series of missions, in which imagination is key, pretty much like it would be in a real case scenario were this things happen in real life.

Whilst I haven't really got immersed into the story at all, I thought the gameplay was intuitive and fresh, and pretty fun. At least for the hour or so I've played. But pretty much like the fictional producers in Deus Ex: HR world, I wonder, what's the core demographic for this particular game? Do people really feel identified with the idea of a hacker, hiding in the shadows, giving orders and support behind a screen?
That troubles me a bit. People whom I'd believe could feel identified here, would maybe be actual hackers, but the game doesn't really feature a complex simulation of hacking nor anything like that, it's actually more like a series of minigames. So, I don't know. 

I guess your best bet would be to pick it up, and see if it is for you.

author: {'steamid': '76561198032536288', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 99, 'playtime_forever': 35391, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 55, 'last_played': 1705051837}
review:
While I have changed my mind on the game I want to leave my original feelings to stand as well as they still hold a lot of water.

Tried to play, oh have to sign up and link steam account to another service... sigh...

That done I tried to play... demo only... linking the account did not inform them that I had in fact purchased the game... sigh time to enter my billing info so they will let me redeem the CD keys from steam... already over 15 minutes in and still havn't gotten past the "launcher" much less into the game.

OK game boots up, resolution and graphics auto detect and fail to set themselfs correctly... ok into the menu to fix that as well.

Ah we are finally at the game tutorial!  controls are a bit odd, oh but the option to put them the way I like them is available, perfect!

20min. into the tutorial, almost an hour from when I first tried booting the game, and i realize: this game isn't for me.  I didn't enjoy a single part of the experience except the visuals, once i got the settings sorted are quite nice.  can't realy comment on if the game play is good because the controls and game play were just too... I don't know not right.  I was frustrated right out of the gate just trying to get the ship to just go where I told it.  then the first training drone... that was even more frustrating.  

maybe this is just not a game for me, and thats fair but i can't say I reccomend it at all.

[Update]

I have changed my mind about the game, when I originally tried playing, I had been using the keyboard and mouse at my desktop.  and my original review covers my feelings on that.  However after getting a VR headset I gave the game a second try, first with an x-box game pad and found that I had no problems with the controls.  After borrowing a HOTAS controller I have fallen in love with the game.  With or without VR the game is a GEM as long as you are not using the mouse and keyboard!
developer_response:
Hi CMDR,

Sorry to hear you've not had a great time with the game so far. I just wanted to mention that we haven't provided Steam keys for almost 18 months, that's a legacy method of registering access so if you've got a copy of the game with Steam keys (either an old purchase or a third-party vendor) it can be tricky to get set up.

If you do have any questions or require any kind of assistance please don't hesitate to send us a support ticket: https://support.frontier.co.uk/topic.php

Regards,

CMDR Delta
Frontier Support Team

author: {'steamid': '76561198040783895', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 17, 'playtime_forever': 634, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 625, 'last_played': 1573530842}
review:
PATHWAY strives to be an Indiana Jones pixel-roguelike-tactics-adventure game, and the first few hours are exactly this. But the majority of your time will be tedious, boring, and lackluster.

Pros: 
1. First few adventures are fun, fast and exciting
2. Gorgeous pixel art, beautiful locales, awesome score
3. Excellent cast of characters
4. Adequately channels some of that Indiana Jones goodness

Cons:
1. Shallow management mechanics; not enough character customization
2. Combat becomes tedious and slow
3. Exploration can be too linear and random
4. Not enough story to tie everything together


Check out my full review here!

https://youtu.be/LG3NImIKRpw
developer_response:
Hi Barunnen,

we spent the last six months improving our game. 

Now that we‘ve finished our update 1.1 I can tell you that we have added 18 new special character actions, thereby completely reworking the skilltrees to enhance character custumization and overall progression. We now have three different combat modes and many new combat arenas. There also is an option to speed up enemy movement...

In addition to that, we have created many new story events and added regional flavor events because we felt that the storytelling aspect of the game just needed more substance. 

We‘d be very interested to hear from you if our latest additions made an overall change to Pathway!

author: {'steamid': '76561198221538324', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 10569, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 10569, 'last_played': 1672495323}
review: I really wanted to love this game. Was my favorite game on C64, played it on Amiga 500. And this? Looks great, but feels empty and bureaucratic. Example: fined and killed at station for not leaving station in given time. Left with penalty that I wanted to pay - and after not being able to pay the fine in 3 stations killed again by security forces for 1000 in-game credits ( I had 26 million credits on balance).  Even at nazi Germany they had mock trials, here its just stupidity. I am still waiting for decent space simulation with stories I can relate to.
developer_response:
Hey CMDR,

To pay the fine, you will need to visit a station with Interstellar factor contact available.

author: {'steamid': '76561197960668693', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 351, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 351, 'last_played': 1601245438}
review:
This game is boring and broken.

First, the boring. Making money is trivially easy. Buy some ships, make some routes, set the buy/sell orders to "standard", and it's done. Things will be purchased and sold and you will make money without any intervention.

The tutorials are slow. Our narrator is a fine voice actor, but is trying way too hard to sound like a pirate and jabbers on for far too long. Many parts of the narration are unskippable. The game play is locked to 0.5x or 1x, which means you literally have to watch your ships slowly make their way across the sea over the span of a few minutes. The main tutorial takes over 2 hours.

The campaign isn't much better. You have to play Spain first. Spain wants you to trade items, ferry people, and build production. The town economies are a mess, but you aren't allowed to fix things until you appease them; in the mean time, they insist on producing things they don't need, or failing to produce things they need and could be producing. The campaign wants you to make a lot of buildings; far more than you actually need, producing far more than you could reasonably sell. They also want you to ferry 1000 people from the home town to other towns, but you can't automate this, so you have to babysit your ship as you move people to towns that don't need them. I was swimming in cash, had almost no control of any production (because I didn't spend my time individually shipping goods in short supply to each town to appease them), and I was literally just waiting for time to pass to complete the objectives. Yawn.

Now for the broken. So many things are either awkward or just completely broken. Almost everything is done through various dialogs, including interactions with the towns. Placing buildings requires zooming in, which is a bit of a hassle but at least makes sense. But buying ships and assigning them to convoys? Why does this require zooming in to the town and selecting various buildings instead of using a dialog like all the other trading/organizing? You use the same button to interact with a town as you do to order your ships to sail, so I regularly found myself sending my ship away instead of interacting with the town. The ships themselves often got lost behind the nameplates of the towns; I had to zoom in all the way to just see them. The mouse can be used to zoom in/out and rotate (who needs rotate?), but you have to use keyboard to pan the view: no click-and-drag like most games. Placing buildings would regularly cause existing buildings to be destroyed without warning, refunding the money for the land but losing all the trade items you just spent minutes delivering.

If you really want to play this like a tycoon game, good luck. You get some summary charts, but those won't help you to diagnose things. Routes and convoys will also give summary statistics, but there are no breakdowns to figure out which parts of the journey are working and which aren't. You can't see which towns require what or what your typical buy/sell prices are. You can't easily track or manage your town reputations. Heck, you can't even check what towns need while you are modifying a route! If the point of making a route is to get items to/from places, wouldn't you want to know what they have/need?

The "filling level" seems to be arbitrary. Some places had zero consumption but we below the optimal filling level even with hundreds of items in stock. Other times goods with small consumption would be "full" after having only a few days worth in stock, even if those goods weren't produced locally. There is no way to tell how much demand there is for something. You could easily find yourself buying a hundred of an item only to find that most places were "full" after receiving only a few of them.

For a game whose main focus is trading, trading is boring, confusing, and monotonous. There was no strategy and no risk. It was less engaging than playing Drug Wars. Buy some stuff, sell some stuff, automate it because it's boring, have more money than God, and now what?

Sure, you could be a "pirate" and make military ships, but for what? To sit and watch a counter tick down while you siege a town? Just so you can have another place to build more useless buildings? Or get into a fight and play a mini turn based tactics game whose biggest challenge is "try to line up two shots"?

And normally graphics don't matter, but seriously, the graphics look they came straight from the early 2000s, right down to the low-res prerendered intro cutscene, the pixelated portraits for characters, and the incomprehensible mess that is the town hexes, where you can't even tell what they are without selecting each one (not even a hover-over!).

This is one of the most disappointing games I have played. I picked it up because several Let's Players I enjoy are currently playing it (paid, sponsored) and they seemed to be enjoying it, but they sure earned their sponsorship, because this game is a lot more fun when someone else is playing it for you.
developer_response:
Thank you for your detailed feedback.

Regarding the difficulty: Have you tried using higher difficulty settings in free play?
Especially with regional resources changed from „even distribution“ to „Regional distribution“ and trade routes from „with automation“ to „without automation“ make the game far more challenging and fun for experienced players. By default, the game settings are suited for beginners.

Please rest assured that the other topics you’ve raised will be discussed and taken into consideration for further improvements to the game.

Just like in previous games like "Railway Empire", we plan to work with the community for improvements and long-term support.

Please feel free to head on over to the official Port Royale 4 Community Hub to share your feedback and ideas.
https://steamcommunity.com/app/1024650/discussions/

Thank you in advance.
We hope that with your feedback we can improve the game further and that you will enjoy Port Royale 4 more.

-cheers

author: {'steamid': '76561198016538831', 'num_games_owned': 372, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 574, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 443, 'last_played': 1485361896}
review:
Pro tip for oculus users: Launch through Steam VR interface. (Top right VR icon in steam.)

Got VR?  Want to go on exciting missions as a space fighter pilot?  Want to immerse yourself in a fantastically rendered, battle hardened universe, where you are a member of a topflight squad?  Then this game is for you!  

This may be indie, but the immersion and the gameplay are top notch!  Works great with my H.O.T.A.S  and I got totally lost in the CDF Database, looking through all the ships and space stations.  Clearly a lot of thought and love has gone into the lore and backstory for this game.  

The dev is approachable and is open to feedback and suggestions from the community.  I’m having fun with the game and eagerly awaiting updates - I can see myself losing many hours in the CDF universe as it moves towards a full release title.

Be warned Pilot!  Combat is challenging! o7

author: {'steamid': '76561199378093128', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 82, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 82, 'last_played': 1703408637}
review:
As another reviewer put it, "the devs care about the game, but not about the players."

This game does not have anything that even passingly resembles a meaningful tutorial. I felt like I was being actively punished for just trying this game, and I regret purchasing it.
developer_response: Hi Chadodoxy! We're sorry to see that you were disappointed with the game. We acknowledge that the mechanics of the game could be better explained and that a dedicated tutorial would be more than beneficial - especially for new players. SCUM is still in Early access and we still have a lot of features, QoL improvements and content additions on the way before we fully release the game. We advise that you try to acquaint yourself with the game's mechanics by accessing the MANUAL submenu when you press TAB while in game. We acknowledge that the game may have a learning curve that is on the steeper side, but we'll make sure to address that as we'll be fully releasing the game and we hope that you'll give the game another chance once we'll get there.

author: {'steamid': '76561197965960078', 'num_games_owned': 1231, 'num_reviews': 40, 'playtime_forever': 293, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 272, 'last_played': 1583598524}
review:
I love the feel of stomping around in a giant mech. I also appreciate the throwback to the old Syndicate games with how the maps are laid out.

The campaign structure is a (long) series of missions and I would have liked a more linear and cohesive experience. In fact you don't really ever have to read the briefings or debriefings between missions. 

Controls could do with a bit of tweaking as well, the game picked up my x-box one controller just fine and will roll with it, but having to control both distance and direction with the right stick makes for an unpleasant experience. I would have liked for the game to turn on autoaim for distance, and had the crosshairs locked at a specific distance when using a controller instead.

Using the mouse for aiming works perfectly, but movement with the keyboard can get tedious, as you often have to walk diagonally.

Thankfully, almost all of these issues can to a certain extent be fixed in the settings. If aiming with a controller is hard, you can either alter the sensitivity, or lower the game's speed to give you more time. 

If having to press W and D at the same time to move diagonally gets tedious for you, change the settings so that W moves you diagonally (either left OR right).

So the solutions are all there if you have the time and inclination to experiment until you find what fits you like a glove.

In short: I really recommend it!

Watch full review:
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=8b_NZFcdXRU

author: {'steamid': '76561198027980111', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 4010, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2332, 'last_played': 1666043163}
review:
Timberborn has a wonderful gameplay loop that will challenge you to creatively design a solution to a lack of a vital resource to your beavers. When a draught is expected, you must rush to prepare. Is everything in place? Do we have enough food? How full are the water barrels?! And if the draught is longer than we were expecting, how many of your beavers might die? The first time you lose a colony after meticulously planning out a lot of complexities kind of hurts.

The game currently has two factions of beavers, each with their own quirks and tools to tackle problems. I switched to the Iron Teeth beavers as soon as I unlocked them while still very new to the game and at first I found their lack of an irrigation tower technology for farming inland (away from your river) confusing and frustrating. I suddenly realized I needed to channel my own personal inner beaver and that is when the beauty of this game reveals itself.

Dams! Levees! Floodgates! By shaping the riverbanks, rocks, and creating frameworks of bridges and passageways, I could carry water anywhere if I was clever enough to get the logistics correct. Building aqueducts by placing levees as walls down the middle of my territory, or exploding new channels along ground with the beaver's dynamite tool to provide a more natural pathway for a stream, I am now a master of conducting water where I want.

This game, though fresh into early access has a fair amount of depth out the door. If you have a joy for games involving resource management, logistics, a pinch of that RTS genre feeling (though you can pause this one) then this game is a must buy. Games like Factorio, Dyson Sphere Program, and Satisfactory are my personal favorite kinds of games, so if you are also from that crowd, you should be adding this to your cart immediately. Yeah, it isn't about making a factory, but that same itch that those games scratch is one hundred percent baked into this game. 

Would I buy this on sale? Yes.
Would I buy this at full price? Yes. 

I put 500+ hours into Dyson Sphere Program and it came out about 8 months ago. I think my next 500 hours are all going entirely into Timberborn.

author: {'steamid': '76561199034417923', 'num_games_owned': 63, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 316, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 287, 'last_played': 1681676469}
review: the controller problem makes this game absolutely unplayable
developer_response: Hey there! Apologies for the difficulties you are having with using a controller in The Crew 2. If you are using a steering wheel for the game, I would review if the model used is a [url=https://ubi.li/fz3ST]Supported steering wheel for the Crew 2[/url]. This will also include supported gamepads for the game. However, if you are using one of the supported peripherals, this kind of issue is generally caused by other USB devices being plugged in. If you have other USB devices plugged into your PC, try only using your mouse, keyboard, and joystick plugged in and reboot your PC. I would also recommend checking for any driver updates for the controller you use to ensure you have the latest installed. If the issue persists, check to see if the controller works without plugging the keyboard and mouse. Please keep us posted on [url= https://ubi.li/c0aBB]this site[/url] if you continue to run into any further issues after trying this out. We'd be happy to continue looking over this with you. Thank you so much!

author: {'steamid': '76561197978552772', 'num_games_owned': 278, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 30, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 30, 'last_played': 1615049002}
review:
First of all, it might be fun if you are not to much into volleyball and the concept is also nice and there ara nice animation when the ball hits the net.

I know it is still early access but there are too many things I dont like about the game:
[list]
[*]You [b]cannot use both hands/arms[/b] for playing like you would in real volleyball for setting (the ball will fly anywhere except for where you want it to)
[*]If you just let the ball hit your hand it bounces back really far, if you hit it hard, it is not much faster.
[*]You cannot go close to the net, you will stay about 1m away from it but the bots of your team often set the ball so that you would have to hit the ball directly over the net.
[*]Joistick movement is really slow
[*]No description on how to jump (it is pulling both triggers)
[*]No description what the settings do
[*]Jumping is just teleporting you into the air for 2s
[*]While jumping you can still move 
[*]Almost no Valleyball rules
[/list]
developer_response:
Thank you for the feedback! I reassure you that what you're saying is being read and carefully considered.

We have a community of players that are very active on Discord (many of them play volleyball IRL). Their feedback guides the development of the game. If you would be interested to join us and bounce ideas you're more than welcome: 🙂 https://discord.gg/CMVGFtbU

Two hands/arms: There's a specific feature that detects when the player brings the hands and arms together and modifies the physics model to better represent the intent of the player. It's not perfect, and we have seen that for some body types and VR setups this isn't detected properly. Going forward we'll adjust this to make sure it works better for people.

Ball goes far/short: By default, aim assist is enabled to make it possible for players of every skill level to play. The ball will be clamped to the play area so they you can't shoot it outside. If you are experiencing this with aim assist disabled, then it would be interesting to discuss it more.

Cannot go close to the net: Before players could go to the other side of the net. We talked with the players what we should accept. We decided that we should not be able to cross over, and we then keep the play area on "your side of the net" so you should be able to step forward to the net physically on your play area. If you can't, we can tweak they to let you move further.

Slow joystick movement: We have discussed this in Discord and decided that the movement should be faster. 

No settings descriptions: We have added more and more settings so players can tweak the experience to their liking. I agree with you that descriptions would be good!

Jumping is just teleporting: Some players have suggested that the jump should be a smooth animation up and down. Would that work for you, or do you have something else in mind?

Movement while jumping: in the beginning you couldn't move when jumping but players felt too constrained by that so we made it possible to move while jumping. Would you like an option to turn that off?

Volleyball rules: The fundamental volleyball rules are in place but there are a few things that we could add, for sure.

Thank you for the feedback, once again. I'd love to hear more so feel free to join us on Discord, or write a post here, or send an email to support@neuston.io

Have a great day! 🙂
