author: {'steamid': '76561197971111112', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 150, 'playtime_forever': 381, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 182, 'last_played': 1564725578}
review:
tl;dr needs more time in the oven, this is a game of pure exponentional unrecoverable attrition.  If you aren't setup and know what you're doing from the start, gonna have a bad time.  Don't level up right?  Gonna have a bad time.  No way to undo mistakes and just snowballs down.

I really want to like this game.  I find a lot of mechanics cool but more frustrating.  The way the game plays out is a prime example, you feel helpless when the team has the ball.  Advanced tactics seem to allude you, IE moving to players at once.  Shootouts are just RNG.  I find myself having the most success letting the AI do the matches, so actually watching the matches is really...boring after the third time.

The 'x-com' element is really just boils down to how can i make a shot in 3 moves.  If you have an ai opponent that is just smashing you on one saide there aint shit you can do about it until the half.  Any moves you want to make for a defender means you aren't movign the ball up and the same AI will just steal and shoot in the same move.  Boiler player 3 moves per side doesn't cut it.  Maybe 1 move each.  I think the dev's have watched a few matches but don't realize every action on the pitch has a reaction on both ends.  Offsides really isn't a thing.  fouls are just RNG, no slider to effect your chances on how aggressive you want your players.  

the way you level up your 'coaches' with fame is the same way you're leveling players...which is drip fed at a slow pace.  you can get 'maybe' 2-10 fame per match and every upgrade is n+2.  Meaning whatever upgrade, from whatever coach, is going to need 2 more than the last.  By an hour in, each upgrade was 50 fame and I was getting maybe 4 fame?  To upgrade a player its either 2 seasons of play or...200 fame.  At this point I was over my head and nothing I could do but lose.  I ended up leveling up my players, but then when they were retiring the players i could buy were woefully crap.  So I made it to the first league (3->2->1), then had to drop down to the second cause i had to rebuild.  But because I wasn't getting good replacements well I was still losing.  I find myself either woefully underpowered or smashing everything.  

It doesnt make sense that you use fame instead of money to pretty much level up everything.  EPL is known for throwing money at any problem but this is pretty much a no-op.  The jumps in spending are insane.  10k -> 100k -> 370k.  The most I got from a match is maybe 22k.  Most players cost 200-500k.

gameplay loop seems to be simulate all the matches, and inbetween make minor adjustements on injury or training.  End of season buy your new team then hope it was enough carry over.  if not, well you'll relegated to a league you smash so you build up your $$ (not fame) again.  

to the devs, who gives a fuck about face engine when you don't even see your players on the pitch.  I didn't even realize that one of my star players had a mowhawk until I had to renew the contract.  You're exponential costs for upgrades is absured.  Make coaches like players where you hire/fire them.  Remove the fame system and make everything money.  If you want to keep fame, then do it in building your arena more.  Use it to attract fans.  Why can't I build buildings?  Where is the training camp.  Where is the locker room.  Where is the coaches meeting room.  There is absolutely no reason for me to keep a player at age 34 when he retires in a year when I can ax him for a 6 figure payout most times.  When a player retires with the team, that's fame.  When Thierry Henry retired he got a statue.  When Ian Wright retired there were documentaries.  When a player retires here, he's just deleted.  Fame in real life is built by the player sticking with the club and it's ignored.

I really want to like this game.  I will come back to this but for now it's not enough.  Even the demo isn't enough. It gets you from league 3 to 2 which is just a cakewalk.  I won the league by simulating every match and made 2 changes to player positions at the start.
developer_response:
It's a pity that your first experience with the game wasn't good. However, I hope, you will change your mind later when you master the game. 

I want only make few notes which might show you that the game is not what it seemed.

1) Football Tactics gives you the easier way to manage your club than Football Manager. But it is not a casual game in the meaning of easy wins, easy promotion etc. Football Tactics is a football world which lives by itself. And you as a manager have different ways to develop your club.

You can try for the fast promoting from league to league, but it has the consequences. You can slowly build the foundation of your club, but it's slow. You can develop through the transfer or through the Youth Academy. You can be a footballers' farm (train weak players and sell them for big money) etc.

Sure, you have to know how the game works to make better decisions. Mastering the game is part of having fun.

2) The Amateur league is simple and has no tactics. But winning in the higher leagues requires tactical approach: using skills, previewing the opponent and finding his weak spots to counter them. Every match needs a preparation. 

Coach's notes describe the tactical elements, but I'll leave there few important notes about skills:
- train skills for your players
- learn how skills work and use them a lot because they give +1 actions for your team if performed successfully _against an opponent_
- in the first turn after kick off the skills are not available because players have to concentrate

Watching is a good mode when you know what are you doing when you prepared your team for the match. Also, if you have players with the skills, watching how AI plays with your team might help you to understand how to play better. We taught our AI how to better use different tactical possibilities.

3) Again, read the coach's notes, they explain many important things. For example, fouls are not just random. They depend on the direction of the tackle. They depend on what action or skill do you use to tackle (Sliding tackle is more probably end in foul than usual Tackle). There are many other things to take into account regarding tackles and bookings. Also, there are offsides.

4) If you don't like the RNG, start a new campaign and select "Less random" option. It makes the results more dependent on the players' attributes. The matches become more predictable. 

5) Amount of fame depends on the league you play, on the goal difference, on the opponent's power. It's hard to earn fame, but it's the same in real life as well. Also, as FT is not a casual game which allows for easy and unfair progression, upgrading the trainers is not granted. The better you play, the more possibilities you have to improve your club. As FT is a strategy, you have different ways to develop. You can put all the fame in the Forwards' Trainer, or put it in the Transfers assistant, or make all trainers average. Your choices make the club develop differently.

6) You can make money not only by selling tickets to matches. There are sponsors, for example. Select less risky conditions (like money for every match) to earn at least something. Also, you can sell your best players. It's a very good way to earn money in the real life as well. Especially for the lower league clubs. 

7) One of the important steps in the gameplay loop is preparing to the next opponent. Without it, you just blindly send your players to the match with hopes for the victory. However, the game gives many "tools" to counter the opponents' formations. Put your forwards against the weaker defenders. Learn how different skills work, and use players with the skills in the places, where these skills are most effective. Make a good defense. 

Simulating the matches is a good way of playing only if you know what is happening in the match. When you master the mechanics, when you know how the skills work, how to position your players, you will be able to predict how the match will go. Simulating matches is the same as watching matches. AI makes the same things but you spend less time. So when watching matches end as you planned, you can start simulating them. And so your preparation for every match matters a lot.

Without understanding how to outsmart opponents tactically, simulating matches is a roulette which is not fun.

8) We are still working on the updates. And soon (around 1 month) we will release a huge update which will make the game even deeper and much much more tactical. 

You can play a beta version of the update. It is still rough on the corners but main new features work. Also, the beta has a footballpedia which explains game mechanics in details.

http://steamcommunity.com/games/375530/announcements/detail/1451703867052346225

- - - - -
Hope, you will give the game another chance. We know that the game did not explain its depth well. That's why we have many negative reviews from the players who played 3-5 hours, and many positive reviews from those, who played 20-200 hours. We will improve the tutorials in the next update. Meanwhile, I'm open to help and answer the questions. FT is our dream game, we have a lot of fun playing it, many players have a lot of fun playing it. And it would be a pity if someone dropped the game not having a chance to understand how fun it is.

author: {'steamid': '76561198058289756', 'num_games_owned': 120, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 18715, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 18632, 'last_played': 1619666275}
review: It's ok for what it is. this is designed to be a game played in small chunks. Riding the bus? Play a little bit, take a break at the gym? Play a little bit. On lunch from work? Play a little bit. You can max the game out in 2-3 weeks max playing it like a big box MMO. Don't play it thinking it's a big box MMO, it's not The game has more cosmetic items then it needs to have. cosmetic armor and weapons are EVERYWHERE. if the devs spent as time working on story content and quest develop as they did on cosmetics, the game would be way farther ahead. A lot of the classes need fixed. Some classes self nerf. for example, the necro class has a skill that has 8 seconds of armor break and 8 seconds of DoT. when they skill lvls to 2, the dot stays at 8 seconds, but the armor break reduces to 4 seconds. their wiki says it is an 8s skill though. character hit boxes are massive. area of effect attacks from monsters can be seen on the ground, unless they're standing in water or carpet, and you're supposed to move out of them. so you do, or think you do. you run behind a monster with a pie effect charging, it hits you. run out of a circle pbaoe, it hits you. everything hits you. some monster charge skills charge way to fast, and you dont have time to move, example is second stage lich fight, and that's a 1 shot hit. some boss battles they changed from 5 man, to solo. example of this is in ashfall. some people have not completed that story line because the dragon boss, though once 5man, is now solo. you're stuck on a small platform, against a boss that has 1 shot hits, 1 shot hits that cover the entire small platform you're standing on, and regains health, and it's a 2 stage fight. you have to stand in it's right armpit and hope it dont hit you with the platform attack. the fight is also bugged. move farther back then half of the platform, were there is a little boulder sticking up, the fight resets, and you do it all over again and hope you dont mess up. parkour is EVERYWHERE, and this is a mostly mobile game. main game content is locked behind parkour, try jumping that to get through main game on a phone. in a new dungeon they added in bastion called the aquifer, they added in an option at the very start of the parkour section for mobile players to build a bridge instead of just fixing the dungeon, they just put a patch on a deflating tire. there are bugs everywhere, glitches and the like. don't spend money on the game, it's not worth it. they give you the dragon guardian class and a title, but with everything going on, fitting the bill is jut not a good idea. this game has been out for several years now, and it's still spinning it's wheels. if you're looking for an MMO, go with Wow, FFO, or GW2, something that's solid already, has long lasting content, and has a focus, AQ3D has none of this.
developer_response:
Thank you so much for your feedback! AQ3D was created with the intention of being a casual and fun game you play with your friends. You can get to max level (which was just raised to 33 and will be going to 35 shortly) in a few weeks if you do play constantly, but there are still tons to do in the game such as playing through all of the stories, quests, dungeons, boss challenges, you can do dailies, join a guild, 1v1 duels, etc. Cosmetics are just for fun and really easy and fast to make, so the devs can focus on working on content and game features. 

A monster can still hit you if you are in range or in the same map - you would need to kill it or leave that map. The are specific parts of the game that are quite challenging that you are supposed to battle through with a group of other players and that are not intended to be played solo. There are some challenges that are meant to be played solo, as they are supposed to be challenge. It seems you are having trouble with this, we suggest to keep trying or ask friends for tips how they beat it! 

The devs just added more parkour and a work around for mobile players. They are also working on improving and tweaking mobile controls. We aren't sure what bugs you are referring to, please make sure you are reporting them via artix.com/devs as devs can't fix bugs they aren't aware of and that weren't reported. New content is always tested by the tester team, but sometimes there are bugs they don't catch or that they just don't see on their end yet. This is why we have a bug report system and a bug team who checks reports daily and escalates bugs to get fixed. 

AQ3D is free to play, players do not have to pay anything to play the game, progress in the game or earn and purchase awesome gear. The Guardian upgrades are a one time fee that gives you multiple rewards and bonuses (not just a class and a title) for helping to support the game and is completely optional to purchase.

Artix Entertainment is an indie game studio - comparing us to huge Triple A games such as World of Warcraft, Guilds Wars 2 and Final Fantasy online is quite an honor. Many of the devs play these games and are inspired by them! AQ3D is definitely more 'bite size' compared to them, but we have quite grand plans for the future! These games have also been out for many years and do not have weekly releases like we do. The devs work very hard to fix issues, update the game and release new content weekly. They post regularly via the Design Notes and update the Game Plan via AQ3D.com every time there are game updates.

author: {'steamid': '76561198329838364', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 16263, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 4413, 'last_played': 1709264031}
review:
If you like flight sims, space, and economics/political war on a grander scale than you ever imagined then you'll like this game. It's not perfect, there are bugs and flaws but overall it is more fun than I've had in a game in a long time. 

I highly recommend using a joystick/throttle setup to get the most out of the game. The learning curve is steep, and there's a lot to bear in mind but that's part of what makes it a good sim. If you want to explore the galaxy, you can. If you want to hunt pirates, you can. if you want to be a space trucker guess what... you can. 

can't recommend it highly enough for those patient enough to get through the curve and like a peaceful gaming experience interspersed with fun dogfight combat. 

NOTE: very self guided game, no real objectives and your hand is not held. Join a faction like Simbad to get help with early game setups. 

o7 see you out there CMDRs!

author: {'steamid': '76561198030784015', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 11196, 'playtime_forever': 412, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 412, 'last_played': 1691861249}
review:
Ground Pounders is a somewhat uncertain attempt to make a hex grid turn based strategy game combined with a deckbuilder... and this lack of clear vision from the developer permeates all aspects of the game.  As a cardgame, this makes a poor turn based strategy game... and as a turn based strategy game, this is a terrible deckbuilder.  We really have the worst of both worlds here.  The game is set in the lacklustre and uninteresting "Sword of the Stars" universe, which you'll be passingly familiar with as the developers shove this into every single game bundle and discount they can manage, either to try scrape a few more cents out of a franchise on life support, or just in the hopes that someone buying a game bundle will see one of their games and then suddenly everything will "Go viral".  Spoiler:  Nothing went viral. 

The technical implementation is really weak here, I'll get into the specifics later in this review, but the point is that the depth of the game is lost on the majority of gamers who are understandably turned away from the almost browser-esque graphics.   If you did invest time in the game, which I certainly don't recommend, you'll still be disappointed.  Unfortunately, most piles of rubbish on Steam aren't hiding a pot of gold underneath their ugly veneers, and this is no exception. 

One of the big problems here is in terms of the general design and the way it was designed to look and feel like a boardgame, instead of a PC game.  There's two aspects of any game.  The mechanics of the game, and the interface that the players have with that mechanic. Poker, for example, is about randomly generated hands that players get, and the interface is the randomly drawn paper cards.  If you keep the random hand, but remove the physical cards, the game still works, but it's streamlined, more pure.  That's video gaming.  The best video games put the players directly against the core game mechanic.  We don't love games because of their interfaces, we love them for their mechanics.  The less that the interface gets in the way, the better.  So here, we have a boardgame/cardgame, and the focus of the developers has clearly been to keep, and emulate the annoying physical interface, without bothering to improve on the mechanics or put the players closer to them.  As a result of this hamfisted decision, the game is clunky and annoying to play compared to games that were designed from scratch to be PC games.

From a technical perspective, the game doesn't meet basic minimum requirements that most PC gamers expect as standard.

The game features mostly static, barely animated 2D images, the kind of thing you expect to see in browser/flash games.  While the artwork itself, while mediocre, might be considered passable, the visual presentation here is negligible, it might as well be a slideshow or a Youtube video.  Pac-Man, Space Invaders and Asteroids had more advanced animation and visuals going on than this game does.

The developers didn't design the game for modern gaming PCs, as such the display resolution caps out at around 1440p, there's no support for the state-of-the-art 4K or higher resolutions.  The game simply won't look right on modern gaming displays due to this failure on the part of the developers.

The controls can't be customised, which will be an annoyance for many, but it can also render the game unplayable for differently-abled gamers, or gamers using AZERTY or other international keyboard layouts.  

These technical defects push this game below acceptable standards for any modern PC game.

You don't have to take my word about how bad the game is, we can measure the interest in a game by how much people bothered to play it.  Ground Pounders has achievements, and they show us a very clear picture that the game absolutely failed to capture any interest from gamers.  The most commonly and easily attained achievement is for completing the tutorial (and you can't really play the game properly without doing that), but less than 9 percent of players bothered to get that far before uninstalling the game.  That's a tiny, tiny proportion of gamers who even bothered with this.  Ouch.

Reviewing SteamDB to check how popular this game was with players reveals a surprise... there's a very healthy spike in player counts for the game.  But this isn't consistent with the achievement stats, that show less than 9 percent of players bothered playing the game for any reasonable amount of time.  How is it possible for this game to have so many concurrent players who weren't even playing the game?  Trading cards.  Players will use card idling software to collect the cards and sell them, but this won't trigger any achievements in-game.  That tells us people only really bought this game for trading cards, and that's a damning indictment of the woeful quality.  A closer look at the numbers shows the game just has a couple of players every week running up the game and idling it for cards, then deleting it.  We must ask how it benefits gamers for there to be so many games like this, with no merit as a serious game, that only generate sales from people idling and selling the trading cards.

Ground Pounders has the utterly unrealistic price of around $5 USD, it's not worth it given the defects and shortcomings with the product, especially considering the sheer number of completely free, much higher quality games on Steam.  If you are looking for a good hex grid turn based strategy, the go-to is Hearts of Iron, try that.

author: {'steamid': '76561198268833891', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 4028, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1532, 'last_played': 1699875701}
review: stupid games! cannot login and tell me to check connection. BUT my connection is totally fine!!!!
developer_response:
Hey FannnTzy! I'm sorry that you've been unable to log in and have been told that your connection isn't working properly! If you are receiving a "Connection Lost" kind of error in Ubisoft Connect, I suggest first disabling any LAN adapter, unused or virtual adapters as these could be affecting your PC's connection in general. To do this, please follow along with [url=https://support.ubisoft.com/en-us/Article/000060572]this guide's steps[/url]!

Additionally, some players have found that disabling "Hamachi network interface" has resolved the issue as well (if you have it installed). You can do this by:
1. Right click on "My Computer".  Select "Manage".
2. Click on "Services and Applications" and then on "Services".
3. Inside the services screen, scroll down to "LogMeIn Hamachi 2.0 Tunneling Engine"
4. Double click on it.  Then change the "Startup Type" to "Manual".  Click okay.

If, after trying these steps, you are still having trouble connect, please reach out to our technical team on support.ubi.com so that they can help out more!

author: {'steamid': '76561198026390874', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 646, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 149, 'last_played': 1530909910}
review:
First, it's a text-based game.  There are great illustrations, but the game play is all about reading and responding.

Second, a single play-through of the game is relatively short; maybe an hour or two.  

Third, it's gay.  The main character is gay.  The relationships are gay.  The whole approach is gay.  It's just as advertised.

If you're okay with all three of the above, it's absolutely a great game.  The dialogue is witty and frequently laugh out loud funny.  The situations and choices range from realistic, to absurdly bizarre, to "why doesn't this ever happen to me?"   One of the major strengths of the game is its branching in seemingly insignificant dialogue choices.   Deciding to wear a hat can change your entire life.  After a number of playthroughs, I'm still being surprised by the variety of outcomes possible and that some of the paths are more poignant than "happy".  Occasionally, stepping through dialague that you've already been through to get to another choice can be a little long, but that's a minor nit and the payoff has usually been well worth it.  The game as delivered used censored illustrations of some of the encounter screens, but I consider this a NSFW game in any case with partial nudity and some written dialogue displayed in large text on the screen.  For personal use, the uncensored screens are a fun update noted in the forums.


Overall, I found it engaging, fun, and worth well more than the $15.

The game is your basic tower defense with several different settings to choose from. Defeat wave after wave after wave of Orcs, the occasional Ogre and Dragon by shooting them with arrows. Shoot enough, get some gold, get a better bow, add some spells to your arrows, shoot some more.

author: {'steamid': '76561197985817956', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 436, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 436, 'last_played': 1661461203}
review:
Like a lot of people have said, if you want to play this game, get it on sale cause its really more a collection of what can be done in vr like a "show case" but generally its all pointless and mostly only in the starting area of the game.
You can play fetch with the dog and feed him, but its kinda pointless, you can feed the horse too, but again its pointless.
Smelting iron nuggets into iron ingots its a nice touch, but then you can't do anything with the ingots, so again its pointless and so it goes on, so many cool ideas in a game but none of them really have any point, the talking in the game is a nice touch as well, but for me it hardly ever worked so again just made it pointless!...can you see the pattern here? lol

But with all that aside its a nice tech demo, or at least it was when it was released back in 2020, if this is the kinda game you're looking for the get wabberjack and download a mod-pack for skyrim VR so much better and bigger.

Its a real shame though that the developers/game creators don't seem top have produced anything else, if they took all the aspects of this game and put them into a full sized, open world RPG like skyrim and if you had a point to being able to do the things in this game, like set up a camp and cook the raw meet you've gathered while hunting to heal yourself and ,maybe give you a "well feed" buff, have the dog as a companion that travels with you and you can feed it to heal it and the same with the horse, create a proper crafting system so those iron nuggets you turn into iron ingots could then be made into blades or arrow heads or axe heads and you could make your own weapons then I think you would have a very good game and possibly even a skyrim beater for those that don't or can't mod!!

It is a really fun game at first, but once you get to space and mine a bit there is nothing, and i mean NOTHING else to do.
save your money and get something else, come back late 19' and check to see if there is any added content. But for now dont waste your time or money on a game that has no midgame or endgame content
developer_response:
Hi Wright1331,

Thank you for writing this review.

Space Engineers is a complex game, which was designed to give players a lot of freedom.

When it comes to single-player, there several Survival scenarios to choose from, a Creative mode where players have the choice to build nearly anything they can imagine and there are also an extensive amount of mods available for game.

Additionally, Space Engineers has a thriving multiplayer community, where people come up with a wide range of scenarios.

We're currently focused on polishing existing features and optimizing multiplayer  in Space Engineers. However, once this is completed, we will have more resources available to reevaluate Survival. There will also be additional features added to the game in the long-term future; this includes new blocks as well.

Kind regards,

Keen Software House

author: {'steamid': '76561198006244511', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 35, 'playtime_forever': 31, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 27, 'last_played': 1509536669}
review:
TLDR: Frustrating Controls 

Im in the tutorial and im so frustrated by the controls, it just makes no sense.

I am supposed to pick up an item from the ground by standing still on an item but holding the sprint button (which is just contradictory), and press C to add it to my inventory for some reason, while my inventory opens with W. In the inventory you have to press CTRL to switch items per example. The tutorial then asks to place a crate, but items are automatically thrown away when you release the button, so you have to hold the button or the item will be thrown. To place the crate on the ground, you have to throw it upwards, which is a strange solution but alright. Then I get a weapon and I am supposed to attack with it by sprinting and jumping at the same time (???) It just all feels so wrong, the hotkeys chosen, the way they need to be executed, so much feels wrong, im sorry. I rather watch someone play it than play it myself. 

Also why does the 30seconds intro play every time ?
Edit: You can close the intro with pressing "X"

@Devs, you really need to rework this control system, its a total mess and breaks all conventions of what people know about controlling a platformer. Its strange, complicated, unintuitive and makes me want to stop the game before ending the tutorial. Keys are somewhat rebindable but these are mostly that can not be fixed by changing keys.

Towerclimb does simple things wrong that Mario did right 20 years ago. 

Let me know when/if it is reworked and im changing the review no problem, but I currently can't have fun with it.
developer_response:
There's so much misinformation in this review.

You've only played 30 minutes, barely enough time to even scratch the surface of this game or it's controls, or why they were made this way.

You claim that you can't jump off the wall "like in super meat boy". If you played this game longer than 30 minutes you'd have easily figured out this can be done with jump potions/aura. Comparing this game's controls to simple twitch platformers like meat boy is like asking why a roguelike isn't as simple as pacman. It's simply an invalid comparison. There's much more that can be done in this game. Here's a quote from someone with 500+ hours playtime: 

"People have complained that the controls are very inconvenient and don't make very much sense. Trust me, they do, and you'll get the hang of it with some practice." 

Play, and you'll see that the controls make sense once you understand the game and it's nuances. There's a lot of subtle things you can do. This game is very strategic, complex, and vast. Do not expect to be good at the game in 30 minutes.

You claim throwing the crate upwards is the only way to place it on the ground. You can simply hold down and drop it. Since the tutorial didn't tell you this word for word, you thought you could only place it by throwing it straight up.

You claim the intro plays every time. You can skip it by pressing jump.

You claim switching items with CTRL isn't explained, when it VERY CLEARLY is.

You simply got frustrated at a game you didn't play, and a control scheme you didn't immediately understand, and left a negative review full of misformation, based on controls you don't understand. There's a reason many people say this game is among their all time favorites; just read any reviews with actual playtime.

If you get frustrated by learning a unique control scheme then this game might be too much for you. Complete the game, then come back and say the controls don't make sense. You won't if you get that far.

author: {'steamid': '76561198193023628', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 1786, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1290, 'last_played': 1702141077}
review: You run wherever you want, do whatever you want, and just have fun, a real old school mmorpg. And the humor is a bit Monty Python-esque, which is a big plus for me.

author: {'steamid': '76561198000307077', 'num_games_owned': 835, 'num_reviews': 24, 'playtime_forever': 82, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 82, 'last_played': 1692299392}
review: For 0'79 it's a pretty cool minivania, though it definitely lacks a lot of polish. I faced a lot of bugs and an achievement won't pop up, and I would be pretty mad if I paid 5 bucks, as it seems this game did a while ago, but for its price I can't say I wasn't entertained. A pity it seems like it won't receive more support, because if this was polished, refined and expanded we could have a pretty cool metroid-like in our hands.

author: {'steamid': '76561198049618980', 'num_games_owned': 489, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 74, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 38, 'last_played': 1556992962}
review:
Too early to judge. At the time of this review it has only a PvE mode that is basically just fighting over and over again with increased enemy health (and damage I think), the AI stays the same. Open world and PvP to be added.
- Gameplay is kinda nice, there's a lot to be improved, but its in a good place. 
- Every 10 levels you unlock a new character and weapon. 
- There are a few maps, half of them a bit unoptimized. 
- Low poly graphics, some would say its shit, some would say its the game's charm. 
- A few graphics settings, like resolution, bloom, shadows, postprocessing, but if you look into appdata files you can mess with a few other things. 
- No control settings, you gotta put up with the game's default controls. They're not the worst, but I would like to set them to something more comfortable for me.
- The most annoying thing for me is the huge "Delete save game" button, that is inconveniently placed below start and there is no confirmation after you click it, so you might end up starting all over again.
- It's cheap!
Overall I like it. Sure, it has a lot of room for improvement, but if the devs are willing to do so I think the game will turn out to be great.
developer_response:
Thanks for the feedback.
- The confirm delete button will be added.
- In the near future, I will add a change in management settings.

author: {'steamid': '76561198030843226', 'num_games_owned': 152, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 488, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 437, 'last_played': 1492498405}
review:
Fantastic game! The world was torn yet alluring. The characters were well written and diverse. The story was enticing as you started to uncover the mysteries of what seemed to be a meaningless theft. Some puzzles took very very very long for me, but were absolutely rewarding once completed. 

Overall, fantastic world and fun puzzles. Would play again!!

author: {'steamid': '76561198065508767', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 45, 'playtime_forever': 277, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 129, 'last_played': 1602033252}
review: The entire game has a very low-budget and tacky feel to it, with things like scrolling not always working and off-screen tooltip/UI incredibly common. The graphics aren't absolutely terrible, but they're ugly enough. It's also not possible to cancel ships that are being built without clicking the sell button, which of course makes you lose money. Most importantly, it's incredibly easy to be a victim of your own success and oversupply a port, which is why the AI uses single-use rockets like 75% of the time, and then barely manages to turn a profit. I don't mind a bit of micromanagement, but this game requires a lot of clicking and scrolling in a low-quality interface to even be playable, and even then it's still not that fun. Ultimately, this game is basically an unfinished game that presents itself as one (and thus it probably shouldn't have left Early Access), with the devs apparently responsive and helpful and happy to tell you about things that you won't be able to figure out (which I expect to be quite a bit), yet not willing to actually complete the product. Some of the other reviewers like this system, but I personally cannot conceive recommending this any time soon unless you expect your games to come with a support system and have that fact reflected in the price; after all, I prefer playing a finished game in the first place.

author: {'steamid': '76561198018008942', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 414, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 409, 'last_played': 1701628532}
review: I was enjoying the game until the the "Destroy all 5 Structures"scenario it starts out with 2 Mark I ogres and 2 Mark III and with in a few turns F*&^^^% more ogres - so there is no way to finish this scenario. Yes did you try with a different group of army types - I have not played the same scenario over and over again. Very disappointing ;-(
developer_response:
Hey there Iklindt - sorry to hear about the difficulty you've had with this Campaign level!

It's definitely possible as I've spoken with several users who have completed the Nightfall campaign. It's worth experimenting with different forces, or if you don't want to grind (completely understandable!) then it might be worth checking out some playthroughs on YouTube. Mearrin69 has a great set of Let's Plays from the whole campaign, [url=https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=COt4MdPCcng]maybe worth checking these out?[/url] He goes about it slightly differently from me, I went for an all-GEV force for the extra manoeuvrability and movement stage.

Thanks for the feedback, and let us know if you manage to beat it!

author: {'steamid': '76561197981111953', 'num_games_owned': 18312, 'num_reviews': 359, 'playtime_forever': 229, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 119, 'last_played': 1574860225}
review:
UPDATE (nov. 27. 2019): The dev made a completely new version. The game is still short, but the graphics are fantastic. You need to play it.


UPDATE (dec. 21. 2018)  The dev. updated the game and it is much more playable now. Still many situations where the car can get stuck, but you learn this positions and can avoid it next time. I have to say, i had lots of fun now, playing the game, finding the right way. So i recommend  it now for a buy. But keep in mind, it is still buggy and the english voice is hard to understand. But the gameplay is something fresh and nice. I hope the dev. will fix the remaining problems, but he is on the right way.

New gameplay video (sorry for the bad quality):

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=weD6DQAVdUw


Outdated first review:

I really can not say much about this game. You are driving a car in a foggy night on a field of planks between rocks. But every time i move a few metres the car stucks on anything which is near. Then, it needs a level reload. Two times, i could pass the rocks, both times i got stuck shortly later. This could be a fun game if this would not happen, but right now, it is unplayable.

UPDATE: After many, many tries, i could finish the first level. After that, the game is playable. Still many situations where the car got stuck, but doable after a few tries. So i was able to finish the game. If the game would work and had a story, both things, that the dev is working on right now, it would be a nice little game. So, if you see, that there is an update, that fixes this problems, consider a buy, until then, only the hardcore gamer can try it.


Gameplay video:

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=KCYICd11xhk
developer_response:
Sorry for the inconvenience, this bug is fixed in update 1.2, which due to a computer crash can not come out now, you can see about it here: https://vk.com/road_homeward?w=wall-172186550_2
To work around this error, you can press: back and left, and then forward and right, and the car will leave.

author: {'steamid': '76561197960830998', 'num_games_owned': 926, 'num_reviews': 264, 'playtime_forever': 545, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 503, 'last_played': 1607627241}
review:
This is a solid point and click adventure, with a distinctive style of its own.

Pros:
Excellent story
Really well produced world, lots of back story and consistent theme.
Puzzles are well balanced, they can be tricky, but always fair.

Cons:
Some of the lines, are funny, but become a bit overused for my liking (like smeg in Red Dwarf we have a lot of B'soding).
Resolution on modern systems is a bit of a problem, I had to read community guides to get it looking half decent on my Surface Book.
Because of the above, I couldnt use my pen as a pointer, which I value.

This game deserves a higher rating than I'm giving it , I enjoyed it and can "feel" the effort and quality of work put in. Something just didn't quite click - like it has done with other modern point and clicks I've played. (Kathy Rain for example)

7/10 - would ask B'sodding Crispin for help again.
developer_response: Thanks for the review -- I think those are fair pros and cons, and I can see how, given the usability cons, you would come away mixed. It's frustrating that despite our best efforts, we can't really push Primordia's underlying engine to be able to work well on modern machines. We've mitigated some of the issues, and I think our next game will mitigate most of them, but it's not as smooth an experience as it could be.

author: {'steamid': '76561198049683798', 'num_games_owned': 324, 'num_reviews': 145, 'playtime_forever': 96, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 40, 'last_played': 1677169099}
review:
So the game itself is great, You can train in the gym fight in the ring and pvp.
I am using a samsung odyssey wmr headset and on launch day the only way i could play the game was with the warped vision bug in the unreal engin, but thanks to the devs all that is fixed now 


So after the 1.1 hotfix it still was not working with my headset but after a very quick email response from the dev team it is an easy fix to cure the vision problems and i can now recomend this game to everyone.

here are the steps to fix.

Open a Run window by simultaneously pressing the "Windows" and "R" keys on your keyboard.
Type "%localappdata%" and press "Enter" or click "OK".
Navigate through the following pathway: Creed
Delete this folder, then relaunch Creed: Rise to Glory.
developer_response:
Hey Kain,

We just released [url=https://steamcommunity.com/games/804490/announcements/detail/2619297772121439127] Hotfix 1.1[/url] which contains a quick fix to address performance incompatibilities with WMR headsets. Please contact us at support@survios.com if you're still having problems with your WMR headset!

author: {'steamid': '76561199073617469', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 7501, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2119, 'last_played': 1632511529}
review:
AM I THE ONLY ONE whos game started to function poorly after the new update. the game shows blacksmith iron production facilities BUT NO IRON ORE EXTRACTOR NOR i found any ANY PLACE WHERE I COULD FIND PRECIOUS METAL. 

PLEASE HELP....................................................
developer_response:
Hi siddhantgupta123456

Thank you for leaving a review. Any questions you have are better asked on the [url=https://steamcommunity.com/app/690830/discussions/0/]forums[/url] or our [url=https://discord.gg/foundation]Discord[/url] server as the review section is limited to the support we can give.

To try and answer your issue. As per the details in the [url=https://steamcommunity.com/games/690830/announcements/detail/2591209246719491239]announcement[/url] Iron now needs to be prospected for as part of the new discoverable mineral deposits. Once a deposit is within range of your territory you can send the bailiff off to prospect the deposits. Currently all minerals can be found on a map so it is likely you haven't reached all deposits.
You can see the deposits if you switch on the minerals layer in the layers menu bottom left.

Once prospected you can then click on the mineral deposit to build a quarry.

We hope that helps but if you have further questions please create a thread in the forums or ask in our Discord server.

Cheers
Ash

author: {'steamid': '76561199002805377', 'num_games_owned': 36, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 1117, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1115, 'last_played': 1645935118}

author: {'steamid': '76561197968212106', 'num_games_owned': 507, 'num_reviews': 44, 'playtime_forever': 1839, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1113, 'last_played': 1631100421}
review: Used to have a highly negative review here about the state of the game at release in 2015. In 2021 September I can very thoroughly say that things have turned a complete 180 degrees and the game is legitimately the equal of or better than DK1 and DK2.
developer_response:
Hi Milord,

I'm not sure when you last played but we've made huge sweeping improvements since your review in 2015. We released the game in an unfortunate state in April 2015 but never stopped updating it. With over 80 updates since then, 7 major updates containing tonnes of new features it's an entirely different game.

We'd love to know what you think of the game and the new stuff, here are some features we've added since release:

- Map Editor & Workshop Support with full scripting to create custom campaigns
- Overhauled Main Campaign
- Four Expansions with dozens of new features each. Two of these are completely free for you!
- New Game Modes
- Improvements across the board to the core game.
- Aesthetic Improvements
- Vastly improved framerate

Looking forward to hearing what you think,

Cian

author: {'steamid': '76561198808985044', 'num_games_owned': 35, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 1103, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 339, 'last_played': 1653164822}
review: AQ 3D was the most greatest thing that ever came into existence when I was a potato playing the normal AQ and AQ Worlds, and when I finally played it, i was overjoyed to see something that was a massive part of my childhood turn into something even bigger than i imagined. Although i wasn't really around when most of the great stuff happened in AQ Worlds, i had excellent fun doing the events where there was famous artists in it (They Might Be Giants, Voltaire, etc.) and I kinda hope that Adventure Quest 3D becomes a mixture of both AQ and AQ 3D since i believe that it'll gain more attention if it were...expanded and awesome. Artix, if you can see this, you're doing an awesome job and keep up the excellent work! Cheers from a potato in Nevada!

author: {'steamid': '76561198038893206', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 593, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 593, 'last_played': 1511377497}

I've recommended it to others even when they had never played a point and click game before, knowing that Primordia would capture them immediately. Give it a try, you won't regret it.

review: This game is like the old dungeon keepers, but with only two forms of strategy. The only hope for the keeper is to attack or keep monsters around the heart by flagging the heart. Fortified walls can be broken through very easily (just by simply digging), and the AI constantly bum rushes the player. Also, most of the levels already have a pre-made dungeon for you. The game just throws you in and expects you to know what to do. Overall, this is a poor spiritual successor for the old dungeon keepers. Stay away from this game.

Hi TrueSgt Monkey,

I'm not sure when you last played but we've made huge sweeping improvements since your review in 2015. We released the game in an unfortunate state in April 2015 but never stopped updating it. author: {'steamid': '76561198041856540', 'num_games_owned': 919, 'num_reviews': 275, 'playtime_forever': 475, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 475, 'last_played': 1530614250}
review:
An adorable space-themed tamagotchi game. Highly recommended!

Info for achievement hunters: The last few achievements are bit grindy, you need to semi-idle for at least 5-6 hours to get all of them.
developer_response: Thank you so much for supporting our game, it does mean a lot to us. I just wanted to let you know that we recently updated the game and we tweaked here and there to make the game a tad less grindy. Biggest achievement tweak: sleep, which was the one that showed would take players the longest to get.

author: {'steamid': '76561198225351096', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 318, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 318, 'last_played': 1598478160}
review:
Needs a lot of polishing. UI needs an update. Buttons are too far apart. There are no hotkeys. Add custom scaling to UI because 1x is too small, 1.5x is too much. Some icons don't convey meaning too well. Needed to get real close to the monitor to understand them, this issue lays within the UI elements being too small. Plus I'd rather have a more modern UI. The current one feels, well, not modern.

These things can be fixed. What I think won't be fixed is the housing system. The game lets you select the residential area where your peasants/citizens can build however they like. Which is an issue. It is supposed to be "natural" but it is more "chaotic". They just build the most random way. Which does not look good most of the time.

Some warehouses and granaries hold mats to be sold both on your markets and trading. You need to build quite a lot of them in order to get many mats stacked up. It would have been much better if you could upgrade them at least once, for the sake of visual because at that point your citizens have stone buildings and these are still wooden and look barebones and for the quality of life reasons.

I could honestly go on and on about these things. I am a bit pessimistic about the future of this game because most of the problems lay withing the foundation of the game. I am not sure how willing the devs are about going back and fixing stuff.

I would only but this game on sale to burn 5-6 hours. At least as it stands now.
developer_response:
Hi Quxera,

Thank you for taking the time to write a review. 

We though you might like to know that the UI, it is undergoing a complete overhaul right now that will include many improvements to the UX. You can check out some teaser images of the current work in progress in the recent Devlog [url=https://steamcommunity.com/games/690830/announcements/detail/2745461157458184840]here[/url] as well as more in the recent article from [b][url=https://www.rockpapershotgun.com/2020/08/14/foundations-updates-and-new-ui-will-make-it-the-city-builder-to-beat/]Rock Paper Shotgun[/url][/b]

Housing is currently still work in progress and will be improved as we further develop the game and we will be taking a look at the warehouse and trading system again in the future.

Thanks again and we hope you enjoy the further development of the game

Cheers
Ash

author: {'steamid': '76561198305415380', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 1049, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 515, 'last_played': 1699750298}
review: Latest patch has made the game unplayable by virtue of simple resource glitch, cannot progress past building granary...impossible to get planks
developer_response:
Hi Lester,

Thank you for taking the time to leave a review. 

The granary requires 15 wood and 5 stone to build. It does not require planks. Perhaps you have added a mod that changes those resource requirements?
Incidentally the sawmill to create planks also only requires wood (20) and stone (10).

If you would like help with the issue then please send in your save file to support@polymorph.games and we will be able to advise further.

Cheers
Ash

author: {'steamid': '76561198202469215', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 3071, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 230, 'last_played': 1677453738}
review:
granted, at the time of this review this game has only been available for 4 hours (of which i have ~4 hours of play) First of all I must say "THANK YOU!!!" this game scratches an itch i've had for 18 years ever since I found out no matter what i did i could not get another certain game with the word tychoon in it to play on windows XP or later. Over all It is a very nice start to a game but, as it is brand new (on early access) it has a few glarring issues: 
1) I could not get it to load a larger map... it just sat at the loading screen for about 10 minutes before i gave up and alt-ctrl-del it. but the quick start did work fine
2) some graphical issues when playing on a rig with dual monitors.
3) a few quality of life things that would make the game a lot easier to play well at(being able to have a list of all your depots/loading points/bus stations. being able to search the industries, roads being funky about connecting to eachother(I could go on...)
4) The AI is kinda stupid (as i mentioned i was playing on the quick start version) I took over the AI company and found out only about 25% of their routes were profitable(and about 10% went nowhere... ie a truck picked up cargo, and the route was set up so there was no where for it to be delivered)

And, well, there are other things to gripe about. All that being said, provided updates and development continues, If your like me having spent $100s of dollars looking for a substitute for that particular game from the 90's also with the word tychoon in it, this is damned near the best i've ever found (and one of the cheapest.)

author: {'steamid': '76561198108987808', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 1032, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1032, 'last_played': 1440575419}
review:
A great concept let down by a multitude of game breaking bugs. Expect to have to look through the forums for bug fixes and edit your save game to be able to get though the game in its current state.

Oh, and don't forget to keep a backup of your save, since the game can corrupt that also.

Game should have been released as an early access title, way too many issues to iron out.
developer_response:
Hi IceCreamKimi,

I wanted to apologise that you ran into some of the bugs surrounding Hacknet at launch. 

We're a very small team, and while our internal testing was solid, we had unexpected issues come out as the game hit a wide number of systems. 

We have just released a blog that explains our priority right now, number one being the save game issue. It would be great if you could check it out here: http://steamcommunity.com/games/365450/announcements/detail/132083641497684826

Also, I'd love to just chat and apologise for the issues you had. Please contact me on community AT surpriseattackgames DOT com, or add me on Steam.

Thanks again! 
Steve - Community Manager

author: {'steamid': '76561198054248784', 'num_games_owned': 112, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 585, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 576, 'last_played': 1485987200}
review:
Okay so, I honestly despise point and click games and really, any game that isn't 3D and or, open world. But I must say, Primordia is truly an amazing game. This game is beautiful, flawless, atmospheric and well fucking worth the $10 out of your bank.

Give. The. Developers. Your. Fucking. Money. NOW.

author: {'steamid': '76561197996404287', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 14, 'playtime_forever': 202, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 202, 'last_played': 1614480897}
review:
Maybe I will return when my frustration subsides. Yes, this is like subnautica in a lot of ways, but much, much, much more tedious.  I haven't gotten far, admittedly, but I don't feel like I want to. Here are some reasons:

1. Oxygen is much more punishing than in Subnautica. You can get a better tank, but it doesn't help much. You can craft consumable oxygen pots, but they don't last long. You can create oxygen stations that have a finite amount of oxygen that will refill you, and then you can refill those with disposable oxygen generators. Sounds ok at first, but...

2. Item durability is horrendous. You can't repair for cheap, so each item breaks down completely, needing a new one. So you need to get more materials to make the most basic of tools, to then make oxygen less of a problem. Problem is, oxygen again depletes quickly. So you will find yourself running in circles more than moving forward, replacing things to get you to further areas to collect things to replace things, etc. Which brings me to the next issue...

3. Many resources look the same. Ice and glass? Look the same, and you will have to be drunk to find glass, so your vision is blurry. Yea, alcohol heats you up and glass is in an icy area. While trying to get it you are also fighting oxygen as it is quite a ways away (see above again regarding the oxygen issue). 

4. Knowing what to get, and where to get it is not really even hinted at for the most part. Which means you will have to explore every nook and cranny, which again causes you to fight the oxygen mechanic. 

The game, and maybe it is just the first couple hours, is so tedious that it made me not want to continue. And I've played some tedious games. There is humor in the game, but it really isn't enough to make you want to continue.
developer_response:
Hey there!

Thanks for the feedback. There certainly were balance issues, and we’ve taken measures towards creating a better experience. The in-game tools have received a durability buff (Scrapper 35>50, many others 15>20), and fixed a number of bugs as well. There’s more info in our recent blog post here: https://store.steampowered.com/news/app/738520/view/3022451561583513184

The dynamics of survival in space should be more enjoyable now. Let us know what you think by sending a message to info@breathedge.com or visit our discord channel: https://discord.com/invite/eyURQXG.

author: {'steamid': '76561198332891237', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 4392, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1460, 'last_played': 1693947640}
review:
Playing solo Survival...I'm not recommending. Excessive grind is becoming more and more of a problem with crafting and survival games, especially late-game. SE starts out with a grind for resources early on, which only becomes more excessive as you progress. To build even simple items, because of the huge number ingredients involved and the small personal storage available, means constantly running back and forth to your fabricator to grab more and more items. 
All of this is coupled with basically zero instructions or tutorials, and things that don't work as it appears they should. A number of hours spent with this game have been troubleshooting things that just aren't working, then going to online forums to find fixes that other players have found. That's the sign of a broken game. Please fix this game, don't expect the players to find workarounds for all of the errors.
developer_response:
Hi, Grimsmiley.

We appreciate the time you took to write this review.

It is our belief that by incorporating your and other community feedback, we will make Space Engineers an even better game.

Please feel free to submit any feedback you may have forgotten or think of in the future here: https://support.keenswh.com/spaceengineers and we can also help you address bugs via this website.

Cheers,

Keen Software House

author: {'steamid': '76561199011218869', 'num_games_owned': 208, 'num_reviews': 29, 'playtime_forever': 10076, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3052, 'last_played': 1686280911}
review:
Game was fine now it crashes every time I try to use my second screen, also caused a BSOD on a brand new machine. You give me frowny face I give thumbs down.

Edit: They have fixed the BSOD issue but the game still gets a thumbs down from me. The game has zero replayability and flying and powerboat racing is clunky. If you can get the game for 10 bucks like I did it's probably ok lol.
developer_response:
Hello Juh Bruh! I'm terribly sorry to hear that The Crew 2 is crashing constantly for you. I completely understand how frustrating this is to encounter so frequently, and I truly apologize for the impact this has had on your gaming experience! With that being said, please first try [url=https://support.steampowered.com/kb_article.php?ref=2037-QEUH-3335]verifying the game's files[/url] in Steam. This will ensure everything required for the game is installed correctly and will also replace any missing or corrupted game files that may have popped up. Once that has been done, I'd check for Windows updates and ensure that your drivers are completely updated. These updates can be easily overlooked, but make quite the difference in-game! I would then recommend going through the rest of our [url=https://support.ubi.com/en-US/Faqs/000025947/Basic-PC-Troubleshooting]technical PC troubleshooting guide[/url]. 

If none of these suggestions help, please contact our team at support.ubi.com for more specialized assistance. From there, they will investigate this further with you and help to find a solution. Thank you!

developer_response:
Hi Lyro Raines! I'm so sorry to hear The Crew 2 has been crashing so frequently for you. I can certainly understand how frustrating this would be. I'd like to look into this more with you. To get the ball rolling, it's recommended to check over our [url=https://support.ubisoft.com/en-us/Article/000061047]general troubleshooting steps[/url] as these can resolve many assorted performance issues, and also improve PC optimization. Sometimes background applications can cause conflicts with games, so it would be worthwhile to [url=https://support.ubisoft.com/en-US/Article/000063761]disable them[/url] in order to determine if one could be causing an issue.  Finally, [url=https://support.steampowered.com/kb_article.php?ref=2037-QEUH-3335]verifying your game files[/url] can help stabilize the game as Steam will replace any missing or broken files.

Should none of these suggestions improve your situation, please do not hesitate to reach out to our Support teams on any of the following channels! Also, let them know what troubleshooting you have tried, and provide your [url=https://support.ubisoft.com/en-US/Article/000061449/Submit-Dxdiag-and-Msinfo/]system files[/url] to expedite their assistance. 
[url=https://www.ubisoft.com/en-gb/help/contact#en-GB]Support Portal[/url]

Before sending any system files on social media, provide your username in DMs and wait until they request the files. :)
[url=https://twitter.com/UbisoftSupport]Support Twitter[/url]
[url=https://www.facebook.com/UbisoftSupport]Support Facebook[/url]

author: {'steamid': '76561198158047753', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 18356, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 5927, 'last_played': 1478426162}
review:
Dev attitude towards their game and their customers have turned out to be very disappointing...

Don't expect this game's development to continue, they call this a finished product, intended for only about 30 hours of play.

Limited 'domes' to construct, and other limitations make what could have been a very challenging space colony building game, into a game that leaves me wanting more challenge and possibilities that are, very sadly, never going to come.

Such a shame... I had been waiting a long time for something like this, but with such a short time for playability, and small building area, I just ended up disappointed.

My money would have been better spent elsewhere.

-- Smoov
developer_response:
Hi there,

Thank you for your feedback.

We've added many features to the game since this review was written, like the new Storm Planet, new structures, techs and a lot more.

Maybe you would consider getting the latest version and playing the game again.

Regards.
Martino.

developer_response:
Hi there,

Sorry about this trouble!

We recently found out that some players with AMD cards are having an issue very similar to what you're describing. 

Would it be possible for you to check if you also have an AMD card and if any of these processes are running when you start up Game Dev Tycoon? 

AMD Gaming Evolved
Raptr
Plays.TV

Seems like some game titles are incompatible with these programs, which may crash to desktop or simply fail to launch.

Hope this helps and thanks for taking the time to write to us!

author: {'steamid': '76561197993403849', 'num_games_owned': 287, 'num_reviews': 16, 'playtime_forever': 313, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 313, 'last_played': 1451457407}
review:
a very solid point and click adventure that doesnt hold your hand, but also at least gives you Crispin so you arent ever lost on the way.

the music ranges from desolate to haunting and gives a full sense of a dying world and sounds like its from shortly after the 16bit era.

the visuals are very unique and asymmetrical. bringing the beauty of a more organic design to it's cast of robotic wonders.

and the cast themselves are very animated, and unique. they all gives a very distinct feeling. some come across as zealotus misionaries, others as military wardware given life, and theres even a bit of robotic love thrown in there to blur the line between emotion and robotics.

very happy with this game.

author: {'steamid': '76561197985699323', 'num_games_owned': 819, 'num_reviews': 41, 'playtime_forever': 340, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 340, 'last_played': 1516956084}
review:
I bought this game in the early access period when it was only out for a few weeks because the concept was right up my alley, and it looked promising. Unfortunatelly the game never really added much more and only fixed issues however complex those might have been to fix or not I will not judge but I will judge the content after my return since it's release.

First of I only have 5 hours in the game because there just isn't a whole lot to do if you follow the right order in what to build first it's simple even with the random events, 4 possible as far as I know 3 of those are natural causes which are al neutralizable in the end and never crippled me personally the only one which kept being annoying was the armed thugs just landing and entering.

I will list the pros and cons next:

+ Base building
+ Simple mechanics
+ Good Graphics

- Too Simple
- Still quite buggy
- Clearly not finished (even if the devs claim it is)
- No real goal to work for
- Interface

------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Here I will explain some of the points for those that care to read about them.

The pros first then,
+Base building, for me any game with base building is a good game on average so that is just a preference.
+Simple Mechanics, the games mechanics are easy to understand and don't really require explanation imo.
+Good Graphics, the game looks good.

-Too Simple, now here I feel the game loses most points for me because these parts feel lazy. You cannot rotate buildings and yes I can hear others say "but the buildings are round" but at the start your airlock building is not and the ground collision model seems to be a hexagon rather the circle which is especially noticable when building near hills so yes it is important for those that want a tight look. There are no other building options to make the base look clean such as align to grid for example. 

 You can also unlock tech upgrades via trading and once aquired you might want to get rid of the slightly smaller but clearly obsolete versions but to do that you need to breakdown half your base in some instances, they should have allowed you to remove anything you want but that that other part becomes unpowered or unaccessable until it is reconnected or w/e. Units would not work on a schedule to relieve one another which could often cause systems to go offline for a while before another would take over the duties (think anti asteroid lasers).

If you think Japan loves standing in line to wait for something then I got to tell you the colonists here love it more, I added several airlocks on one massive storage node to help with congestion but they would still take one because "shortest routing programming" (also why can only 1 go in an airlock clearly big enough for 3 at a time or make a double airlock to make that go faster because that part killed a lot of my population often)

- Still quite buggy, Often AI will walk outise without a pressure suit and not using an airlock no they just plop through the walls and at one point a lot of the people and robots would refuse to move things around for no reason visable to the player. sometimes there where other random bugs but those where rare and not as game breaking.

- No real goal, Other then building a succesful base there is no real goal given or explained so currently when you have a fully functional base the game it's plan is to have to colonize another planet and repeat what you just did with no real variation. Why is there no little vid that shows a slideshow of images and text showing proud colonists and text congratulating you on pushing the boundries for the whole of mankind or something in such a style?

- Interface, Everything consists of vague icons and everything is under a menu so eventhough there can be a crisis you have to go through 3 menus to hit red alert which is just super silly... why would I have guards and stations if they cannot decide that themselfs or at least have 3 colored dots in the top or bottom of my screen? It's never good to have things in too many menus is just makes it feel clunky and causes unnecessary slowdowns in gameplay.

Because of all this and even having enjoyed the time I played I cannot recommend the game as it just is not finished (NO ITS NOT).  Get the game when its like 5 euros or w/e your regional equivalent is because if they don't want to make a game that is 100% then they don't deserve 100% of the price.

I hope this helps ya nerds out there, peace.
developer_response:
Hello,

Thank you for your feedback.

We would just like to clarify that Planetbase was never early access.

Martino.

author: {'steamid': '76561198917269269', 'num_games_owned': 20, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 542, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 263, 'last_played': 1672004992}
review: cant play it more then 3 minutes with out it crashing on my pc
developer_response: Thanks for sharing your review, johnnylfrazier4! I surely hope that I can help you with getting the game to launch properly. Since it's unclear of whether the game is crashing at launch or while in-game, I'll try and give two scenarios! If you're finding that the game crashes at startup, please go ahead and make sure you have the game and the Ubisoft Connect PC launcher installed to the same internal hard drive ( C: Drive being the best option)! If you're all good on that front, go ahead and complete [url=https://support.ubi.com/en-us/faqs/000025947]these PC troubleshooting steps[/url] and [url=https://support.steampowered.com/kb_article.php?ref=2037-QEUH-3335]verify your game files[/url] before trying to launch again. If you're finding that this happens in-game, it could be that you needed to update your drivers ( which the PC troubleshooting link can help with ) or you may be having an issue with not having enough available RAM to maintain the game ( which [url=https://support.ubi.com/en-GB/Faqs/000025721/Disabling-Background-Application/]disabling background applications[/url] can help with that! If you continue to have issues, however, please feel free to [url=support.ubi.com/Cases/New]create a support ticket[/url] for additional support and we'll see you through it! :)

author: {'steamid': '76561198024704964', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 172, 'playtime_forever': 189, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 19, 'last_played': 1443074359}
review:
The game is just black for me, I'll keep this review negative until it's fixed.


EDIT: I'm using the stock (but not the open source ones) AMD drivers for Ubuntu 15.04, but they were recently updated specially for Ubuntu 15.04, so there might be some issues there.

EDIT2: I tried all kinds of different drivres, but none of them works. The open source ones, different versions of fglrx, nothing. I know this is a common issue with the Unity engine and probably AMD cards. I'm going to get a Nvidia card soon and will try if the issue is fixed then.
developer_response: Hey there! Just a heads up that our Linux system requirements are Ubuntu 14.04 with the stock ATI drivers for Radeon cards. While alternative distributions and drivers are currently unsupported, we'll be sure to add Kubuntu and alternative driver distributions to the list to test for our next update.

author: {'steamid': '76561197977122919', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 25, 'playtime_forever': 5430, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 5430, 'last_played': 1616021510}
review:
This is a game that has become worse and worse with time. In the beginning it was a fun vehicle shooter where you could build whatever ride you felt like, for the most part. Sure have always been able to buy better stuff faster but that has with time become more and more important. Today you pretty much have to do that because you are teamed up with and against people that have so much better weapons that you do. Forget about the power score, that doesn't mean much. This is pay to win on steroids. You're queueing a small car with shotguns or machine guns and are teamed up against railguns that are what tier 3-4 or something. Ludicrous. 

So you can get better and buy better parts right? Yes but it takes literally ages. And during that time you will be steamrolled into the dirt over and over. Just not fun.

In it's base form there is a good game. Fun, nice physics and destruction models but it's all destroyed because of pay to win, bad matchmaking and grinding. Such a shame.

Edit after dev response:
Yeah, all those points are addressed in my review. 

Yes you can obtain the parts without spending real money. But that takes ages and during that time you are steamrolled by people with better parts all the time. Not fun.

Matchmaking, yes, that sounds good and all but the advantage of having better weapons is greater than having less durability. People are making glass cannons and are very effective doing it. So power score doesn't mean much as I said. It would have been wiser having matchmaking in tiers instead of by power score so you don't get steamrolled by people with better parts.

Sorry, not convinced at all.

Oh and I guess I missed mentioning that paying for the vehicles that you can buy with real money are very expensive. Pretty much all of them cost as much as a full game on the PC.

If this game had been somewhat fair I would have kept coming back to it. This time was probably the last.
developer_response:
Hello!
All parts that affect to the battle can be obtain in-game ways: as the rewards for leveling up or you can buy them on the in-game market. So you don't need to spend any real money to get a weapon, a cabin and so on.
Speaking about matchmaking system: it based on Power Score of your and other players vehicles. That means if enemy has weapon with higher Power Score then he has less durability. You can find a key to each enemy.

author: {'steamid': '76561199054693669', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 19603, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 7803, 'last_played': 1702687756}
review: If you're looking for a free MMORPG adventure game, look no further than this. This game balances adventure, great story lines, and humor incredibly well. The story is quite well done, very captivating, and the graphics are quite nice, and gentle on your computer. Works even if you're playing on a potato computer. Though the game is targeted towards kids, I appreciate that it's also adult/teen friendly, and allows for a lot of freedom in the chat. I've played far too many games with chat restrictions. Hacking/cheating is pretty limited, at least from my own experience, and makes for a more enjoyable experience. The gameplay is simple and straight forward, doesn't take much in regards to brain power, though there are some quests that do require logic and riddle solving. Can be a little repetitive at times, but they're always coming out with new content and quests/adventures, so it keeps you coming back. Pretty limited in the pay-to-play aspect, you could easily get away with never paying a dime in game (though the option is available if you're impatient like me). Daily payed for currency, though not given in large quantities, makes it nice for the players that can't pay for in game content, as it allows them to still be able to save up for some of those items. Overall, I would definitely recommend this game. Honestly the laced in humor in the dialogue was a strong selling point for me.
developer_response: Hey there, we are so happy to hear that you're enjoying AQ3D so much! Our team is so stoked to hear that you've put 132 hours into our game- thank you so much for being a part of our in-game community! We appreciate your review and suggestions, too. Our team is working hard to make AQ3D fun for all players, so we really appreciate you sharing your thoughts with us about the quests and writing. We are also so happy to hear that you're enjoying the dialogue and humor-- our team works hard to create captivating stories for our audience and we are beyond excited that you've enjoyed what you've seen so far! Thanks again for taking the time to write to us and share your opinions with our team-- you made our day! Battle On!
