author: {'steamid': '76561197960878241', 'num_games_owned': 335, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 30, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 30, 'last_played': 1558705138}
review:
The game itself promise to be fun - I really enjoyed the hour of game play I had.

However, it installs a so called 'updater / launcher' from Gaijin.net which 

* does transfer continuously P2P data - that does not only retrieve data but also contains information about my PC that seems to be far more than just CPU / GPU & Co. I haven't had the time to investigate here deeper, but found names of several files (.docx, .xlsx and more) that definitely do not belong to the game or information I would like to see transferred without my knowledge and approval. 

* has no uninstaller - and does not clean uninstall when installing the game itself (neither via Steam nor from 'programs and features'

* is not GDPR / BDSG (the latter relevant in Germany) compliant for a number of reasons.

Hence I do NOT recommend the game due to the manufacturers behavior regarding my privacy.

I did also send my findings to German Data Protection Authorities - and due to the malicious behavior of the Gaijin tool itself, also to German BSI. I also filed the case against Steam - since Steam does obviously support this type of business practices.

Since this Gaijin behavior is the same for WarThunder and other products, I can only urge others to follow my example and make a short notice to their authorities to end such things - see EA some years ago, we - the games - can make the producers of such game change. And it is not as if the game is for free, paying with your data - not the PC data but as it looks like, way more, isn't for free at all.

Last and least - and that's the flabbergast news - since my firewall stopped the P2P traffic instantly, the updater obviously is able to handle data transfer via standard HTTP.

Note:
* Still, the data transfer takes place here as well - insecure.

As said, NO recommendation due to the fact that the game (or its components), seem to compromise your computers. So consider it twice before you install it.
developer_response:
Hello! I would like to address the concerns you have raised in your review. As Gaijin works on the territory of EU, all our data handling is compliant to the requirements set by European laws and regulations, including GDPR and BDSG. Our company diligently sets and updates policies regarding the safe handling of user data, as described in our Privacy Policy https://crossout.net/en/support/privacypolicy/#/ , and if there are any additional questions – we welcome them.
In the Privacy Policy  https://crossout.net/en/support/privacypolicy/#/ we describe all the data we get from players to ensure the correct running of the game: «2.2.3. Details about your device (such as operating system, browser type and language, manufacturer, model, screen resolution, and interface language);»
Aside from this a player can send their game data to the tech support.  The launcher provides a tool to create a set of relevant data consisting of dxdiag, driverquery, tasklist, ipconfig and launcher/ game logs to make the interactions with the tech support easier if some issue arises, but it doesn’t send any data, it merely assembles a data package which the player can send to the tech support if he or she wishes to do so. The tool operates only with the game-relevant data and cannot and doesn’t touch anything else stored on your computer.
If you do not wish to use Crossout, once you uninstall it no data will be collected from your device, of course.  While uninstalling, Steam runs the launcher to delete the game. Then Steam deletes the launcher.  Log files might remain in case the player decides to reinstall the game, as is the case for many other games – it’s the industry standard practice, but you can delete them manually, then no traces will remain.
Speaking of the double nature of the download protocols usage: P2P is faster, so it’s a primary source, but it it is not available, the launcher falls back to downloading from content delivery network servers, it’s a rather standard practice for games, and it doesn’t endanger the data security.
Thank you for the feedback, I hope I alleviated the concerns you have voiced. Have a good day!

author: {'steamid': '76561198028405336', 'num_games_owned': 177, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 1022, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 846, 'last_played': 1675305144}

author: {'steamid': '76561198025477286', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 67, 'playtime_forever': 3535, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2114, 'last_played': 1711008565}
review:
I would not recommend the game in the current state. I do not know if developers are going to fix what I consider shortcomings, and if they are not, then I'm not recommending the game altogether.

When you start a new game for the first time you are presented with 3 difficulty choices. Two of them are locked at this stage, so you only can choose the easiest. (Very minor gripe: why the heck to give a choice when there is no choice?)

When you are playing the game there are 10 "milestones", certain conditions during the game that are used to measure your progress. They could be "reach 500 power" or "reach 100 colonists" or sopmething else. In my first and only game (that took 17 hours across three sessions) I got 9/10. The last one "reach 300 colonists" was not possible for me to achieve because I ran out of space for colony buildings, and here is my problem number 1.

When you start a new game, you "choose" a pinpoint on the planet where you land. The interface for choosing it is abysmal	. You cannot rotate the planet with keyboard and you cannot zoom in or out. Mouse speed when rotating is about of a dying snail. I honestly cannot understand why they included this game element, it's awkward and pointless. In zoomed out state you do not see what landscape is like so you are just choosing at random. And here is where the real problem starts. I happened to land in a relatively small area surrounded by mountains from 3 sides, and the 4th side was the edge of the map (which is also bizarre, because I mean they just allowed me to rotate the freaking planet, I know that it's a sphere and I know that it does not have an edge). When I started the game I did not realize that there would not be enough space for me to fully develop, and that the game gives you a zilch ways of crossing the mountains. The "edge" is also not obvious. At a certain point you can no longer build in that direction, no line in the sand, perfectly level surface, it just does not let you place a building as if you are trying to place it on to  another building or on a mountain. Frustrated, you are trying again and again, until you realize that you are not supposed to build on the other side of an invisible wall. Anyway, after 17 hours of play it is a surprise that you cannot actually finish the level.

That was problem number 1. Note, that the game is probably meant to be open ended, so I'm not sure if it would properly "finish" even if I got 10/10. So how they say, the pleasure is the journey, not the destination. (Edit: the game does not have a win condition. You have a hard limit of 200 buildings and 500 colonists)

Here is problem number 2. Some sim games give you an info panels about your minions (in this case colonists) and this one is no different. What is different from some of the games I played before, is that the info panel usually have a button to find the minion or to follow it. Not in this game. You click a colonist, you look at the panel and when you are done this colonist already wondered away and with a big base you cannot find her any longer, because she looks exactly like anyone else. By the way if the person departs (visitor) the info panel does not reflect this and displays the last known data. Now, you might be thinking, but do you actually *need* to look at the colonist information? I'll be honest with you I wondered the same. You see, I'd be happy if the game was built so that this information is of no use and can be totally hidden. I'd also be happy if it was there and easy to use. But currently if you'd like to investigate why your colonists are dying for no obvious reason you really can't. First of all, "a colonist has died" notification when clicked does NOT show you the colonists or her info pane. It just jumps somewhere on the map. Presumably, this is the place where the colonist died. There is no body or any indication of what happened though. So you reload a recent save if you were lucky to have one, and you are trying to find that person that is going to die. But since the game does not have a colonists list, or colonists search, you cannot really find this person, no way. If by some crazy accident you managed to find her and select her and look at her info panel... well I did not manage that.

Here is problem number 3. As game flows you get event notifications in the bottom left corner. You left click to follow them, you right click to dismiss them. If you are not fast enough they are gone. If these where landing permissions and you missed it, well sucks to be you, you just lost these coins you otherwise could have earned, better luck next time. If there was two similar events about different objects the game group them up and excludes any specific information. So if two building were completed or two people died, you won't be informed what these building where or what theses people died from. Why is there no log, that one could browse at leisure? Btw, sometimes but not always, even if just *one* person dies the game does not tell you why. "Well he died. Whatever."

So the above sums up to the following. I wish I did not need the log, I wish I did not need to track individual colonists, but I do. And here is why. When my colony was developed with about 100 colonists and 30 bots, I had all my production lines up. I did not have absence of any particular resource. In particular, there was enough food. Still a colonists died "from starvation". Then another one, then another. Soon there was enough dead that there was not enough people to for the hydroponics, so the food supply plummeted and everyone died because now there was really no food. This happens, and the game gives you no way to find out what went wrong. You are simply left in the dark. This leads me on to...

Problem number 4. This game does not support any corrective actions. If you ran out of an important resource (any important resource) there is no way to recover. (If you have plenty of other resources and lucky timing a trader flies by you might be able to salvage the situation, but from my about a dozen reloads it did not happen once). The only thing you can do is to reload your previous save and make sure that this resource does not run out. I'm not sure, maybe it's a genre staple? If it is I do not like it, I feel that there should be an in-game way to correct a mistake without the need to reload.

Problem number 5. There seems to be a limited number of save slots and the saves are called save1, save2 and save3. I'm serious, that's what they are called and you cannot change these. (I understand that this is probably so that they can port to a mobile device easily, but it's just an explanation, not a good excuse)

Problem number 6. So remember I told you that there is no way to find out what happened when something goes wrong? Well what the game wants you to do is to use built in resource graphs to figure out what dynamic led up to the current situation. The only problem is that there are bazillion of different resources and a single graphs screen. You have an icon per resource that you switch on an off to show the line on the graph or not. This is so bloody inconvenient. Because they did not have enough colours, half of the colours are the same so you cannot tell on the graph one line from another, and there is no legend. Also certain types of resources mean something to some people like me in combinations. So for example I want often to see raw ore and metal produced from it. And then I want to see starch and bioplastic produced from it, and also vegetables, because they same as start come out from the hydroponic pods. And in order to switch from one view from another I need to unclick all the old resources one by one and then click all the new ones one by one, what a nuisance!

This game could be good. Currently it is not. The worst thing, that most of the problems are only noticeable only when you are well in the game, and not immediately.
developer_response:
Hello there! We noticed this review is quite old, and the game has been updated quite a bit since you wrote it.
We'd appreciate it if you'd try the latest version (1.0.7), to see if the improvements make you change your mind about Planetbase.
We've made AI improvements, gameplay tweaks, fixed many issues and added some new features too.

Thank you!

author: {'steamid': '76561198165366657', 'num_games_owned': 230, 'num_reviews': 14, 'playtime_forever': 5540, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 5540, 'last_played': 1567732836}
review:
The game used to be enjoyable, but it seems to get worse every update. While the devs are adding more to the game there is an unbalanced quantity over quality situation going on. Imo there should be a lesser frequency of updates to reduce development stress and most of the mechanics should be rebuilt from the ground up. The net code has always been a topic of debate and from what it looks like it was never remade, just added onto. I say this because the game itself ran better and had a stable multiplayer connection before the planet update. I would even say the planet system should be remade entirely, since there's no water system in the game at all. Not to mention the Mobs were handled poorly. Its very unlikely that these issues will be solved in the future.

TL;DR: There are many issues with the game that are more than likely never going to be fixed. There are better options if you want to play a multiplayer space sandbox game.
developer_response:
Hi BigGucciBerry,

Thank you for writing this review.

We are continuing to release free updates with new features, bug fixes and optimizations for the game. We're also selling optional DLC, which is designed to not split our community.

For more information, please see Marek Rosa's blog: 
https://blog.marekrosa.org/2019/08/space-engineers-economy-update.html

Please also message us via: https://support.keenswh.com/spaceengineers/general
if you're experiencing any issues and we'll be happy to help you.

Kind regards,

Keen Software House

author: {'steamid': '76561198077226873', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 749, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 603, 'last_played': 1515173400}
review:
*This game was gifted to me*

What a gem of a game. 

I have a soft spot in my heart for dystopian/post-apocalyptic/cyberpunk/steampunk settings and stories so this game quickly became a favorite of mine. Great writing with quirky humor, fun characters, and a memorable world all made the experience thought provoking and enjoyable.

I appreciate that the puzzles, while challenging at times, weren't overly difficult so they didn't bring the game to a screeching halt or distract from the story. 

There are a few choices to be made in the game as well as a variety of endings depending on aforementioned choices so this game does have replay value. Not that I needed another excuse to complete various playthroughs, but it was interesting to see the various endings and where certain characters could end up. 

Crispin is too awesome to be my sidekick, but hey, I'm not complaining. 

That's all folks. Another great point and click adventure game well worth your time.

author: {'steamid': '76561198058813678', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 29, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 25, 'last_played': 1590985292}
review: This is a really misleading game: it is NOT a simulation of Modern Operations, but just modern air and naval operations. The land side is purely there as it relates to air and naval basically targets and SAMs. You might giggle at this, and think this is modern operations, but, if you are interested in buying this game, believing that it is a JOINT simulation, then steer well clear. Land combat is hardly portrayed at all. A very disappointing waste of money.
developer_response:
Hello,

We are really sorry about your disappointment in the game. We believe the dev team has been quite forward in detailing both the strengths and weaknesses of CMO in the land combat domain, as one of the pre-release dev diaries was dedicated to this domain: https://www.warfaresims.com/?p=4982

As you can see, that article goes into considerable depth into the improvements over CMANO, the new abilities as well as the limitations that still prevent the game from being compared to land-centric titles.

If you choose to stay with the game notwithstanding your negative initial impression, we welcome your feedback on the specific items that can be improved on ground ops, as well as any other improvement on both the simulation and game-playing experience, on the dedicated suggestions poll on the MG forum: https://www.matrixgames.com/forums/tm.asp?m=4709794 . We want this leg of joint ops to be improved in its modelling as much as you do, so there is a good chance that your priorities on this will match ours.

If OTOH you have decided to put the game away (or refund it) because of the current limitations, we are again sorry for your disappointment and do hope that you keep an eye out for the next major iteration in the Command lineage, which is more than likely to feature even more improvements in this aspect.

Thank you!

author: {'steamid': '76561198089477182', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 20, 'playtime_forever': 613, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 613, 'last_played': 1703716581}
review: Spend hours building your character up just to have some screamer spawn 20 of his buddies and ruin your day. After 4 attempts and same thing happened I do not recommend a game that basically s@#$s you right when it is starting to get somewhere.
developer_response: Hi wolfgar7474! We're sorry to see that you were disappointed with the game. We acknowledge that there were certain issues with the hordes spawning and therefore made tweaks to this system which should make the hordes spawn further away from the player. Also, we buffed the amount of damage melee weapons do to puppets which should give our players a better fighting chance in the early game. We also understand that further tweaks will possibly be necessary, which is why your feedback is important to us and why the game is still in Early access. We're still balancing things out and we're confident that by the full 1.0 release, we'll have something that is truly enjoyable for our players. While you've had a negative experience now, we hope you'll give us another chance eventually once we get there.

author: {'steamid': '76561198085995031', 'num_games_owned': 7977, 'num_reviews': 45, 'playtime_forever': 48, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 48, 'last_played': 1435843835}
review:
good morning jesus! good morning sinners! what bundle key has the almighty blessed me with today?  oooh a color game!  this one used to be called colorblind, but black people found that offensive so now it is called colortone. let us go ahead and give it a try. how bad can it be when jesus is my co-pilot.

to start, as soon as you get into the first level, a screen with simple control directions pops up. you read it for about 10 seconds and then you want it to go away so you can start, it does say 'press h to quit'. this is the best advice an evil sinner dev can give. don't stop at pressing the 'h' key. turn off your computer, go outside, or just do anything short of suicide(that is a sin and the devil gets your soul) to avoid playing this. it turned out that after 30 seconds of anger i realized that the evil sinner dev meant to say 'press h to continue'. i must advise against that however.

visually, it looks like a game that requires 3-d glasses to play.  if i play this for more than 20 minutes, i will projectile vomit all over my pc. no worries there though, because the game is so short that nobody will ever play for that long. 

anyway, you have to take a ball and change it to the right color. there is a box with blue color and a box with red color etc. you need to put your ball into the right color or combination of colors to progress.  sounds easy enough, right? 2 weeks out of your mother's womb you knew that yellow and blue made green. it is never that easy, of course.

lets say you want to make green. you put your ball into the blue color square thing on the floor, and all is good. now you need to put it into the yellow square. here is where the game goes completely to shit.  you have about half a second of your colorball turning green like you want it. if you don't move with lightning fast speed, the ball is going to stay in the yellow for too long and turn to yellow. i did that first stupid colorball probably 10 times before i managed to get it to stay green. this is the mechanic that the entire game is centered around, and it is all kinds of fucked up.

the final nail in the old body of christ for me was when i got to level 3 or 4. i went to carry one of the colorballs, but it was so big that it literally blocked 95% of the screen. i can't play if i can't see. you can't tell me this was tested and someone just decided it was fine that nobody could see what they were doing. occasionally, the giant colorbll morphed into a giant colordonut so i could see through the middle, but i don't think that was intentional.

http://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=473698606  

so thats it. i'm never playing again. somehow i made it through half of the game anyway. it is not exactly bursting with content. 

lets all try something here before we go.  get a blue bible and a yellow bible. smash them together to make a green bible. now go throw it in the trash. that is where this game belongs. at least i would give you steam trading cards and a 'you threw away the bible you are going to hell' achievement.

god bless amen
developer_response:
Hello, 

1) I changed to "press H to continue".
2) It's a visual effect. I have it reduced. Hopefully no more vomiting.
3) Many people have made a video about the game, a lot of game tester, and the problems are only from you. I do not know what the problem is. Can you make a video?
4) You can use the mouse wheel. Described at the beginning in the window that you could not close.

Thank you,
Kirill

author: {'steamid': '76561198074787094', 'num_games_owned': 199, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 25, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 19, 'last_played': 1427386306}
review: There has been nothing revolutionary about this game, there is no cover system, no 'this tank shell has such low accuracy that it surely won't hit a soldier, eh?" Turns out, all tank shells are both HE and AT at the same time and they are OP. There is no strategy options like go backwards or run forwards, not even a crouch and crawl. I have not tried any mods yet but the gameplay already does not look promising. This game deserves a re-make. The concepts need work since there is no structured research, tiering, weaponry selection... There is nothing that can even level up at all. This game is a lie, it and it's promises. Do not buy this game as they are scamming people of a great game they made in your mind to entice you to click that button... To everyone else, what fun is there in playing a level field game with the occasional bridge just for bad balancing, no depth gameplay and a really unoptimised game for what should be a very few number of sprites.

author: {'steamid': '76561198841500452', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 164775, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 164775, 'last_played': 1702802754}
review:
I've been playing this game for a few years now, since about 0.2 if I remember right.  I've seen things come and go, and although I realise it's Early Access the development of side content rather than addressing some of the basic mechanics has been problematic at times.  I was very excited to have cars come, then more types of vehicles, then they got removed, and only 2 types of very bugged car were available.  There have been a number of fun additions, like new points of interest, but some of them (like the nuclear plant) have me disappointed.  I'm also an avid S.T.A.L.K.E.R. fan and it honestly seems like they were wanting to wrap that into the ever-creeping scope of the game.  And it destroyed one of my favorite corners of the map, I loved having a base up by the now-gone campground.
I've still kept playing, even with not being interested in the new bunker mutants or the broken fishing process.  However, with the 0.95 release I am finally out.  It has been uninstalled, and I have left the island.  I was here for a survival game and what was, in its original dynamic (and from what I could tell, intent) a survival game with zombies mixed in until real NPC interaction could happen in future updates.  In its dynamic now it appears to be headed more for a zombie game with some survival around them.  Walking through the forest I have a puppet appear 8 feet in front of me, and so I fight it.  Another one hears it, screams for backup, and within 15 seconds I'm dead.  Respawn, and it drops me right North of the nuclear plant, which is toxic without gear.
Speaking of gear, I did buy supporter packs 1 and 2 when they came out but there now seems to be many DLC packs for a game that is still in progress.  Given the cool features that have been introduced then taken away I'm not keen on spending more money on something that might get deleted at some point.
I'm sure there are many who love this game, and if you do, fill your boots.  As for me, I'm finally off the island.
developer_response:
Hello there OP. Thank you for taking the time to write this review and reaching out to us. 
We realize you've been playing for a long time and you've seen a lot of changes come to SCUM. 
Those changes were made with the best intentions and in keeping with our ultimate goal -> to make the 1.0 release the best it can be. 
With a team of only 55 people, making a game this ambitious means that sometimes some features have to take a back seat in order to finish up the high-priority ones. 
But, now that we're past 0.95 we will focus on adding some very important features along with polishing the game, so it will be in the best possible state when it releases with 1.0. 

This game was always planned as a survival game with Zombie (puppets) NPC's. 
And yes, the horde system drastically changes the way you play and we understand that it takes people some time to get used to ti. 
But also, this could be your opportunity for a fresh start, try a different tactic with the puppets. 

Having said all that, once we're in the polishing phase, that's when we'll revisit every single feature and do what we can to make them work even better.
We're sorry to hear you'll be leaving the Island, hopefully you'll revisit the game and perhaps change your mind. 
Have a great day!

author: {'steamid': '76561197991730530', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 14, 'playtime_forever': 79, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 79, 'last_played': 1636333867}
review:
The help menu is worthless. You can't search "tools" or even "resources" to find out what is and how to get a tool. The game quest wants me to promote a villager to a serf - I have tons of serfs already - and I cannot do that, there is no drop down. It wants me to assign a room in the lord manner, but I don't know what rooms it is talking about (cause there are none!)

This game is just abysmal at teaching you how to play it. I do not recommend.
developer_response:
Hello and thank you for taking the time to leave a review.

Feedback like yours help us improve the game everyday during Early Access.

We noticed the search bar hasn't doing its job properly, so that is being fixed already.

Some building parts can be assigned a function by opening the building panel and finding the dropdown in the parts list.

Once a Great Hall has been assigned to your Lord Manor, you will get the opportunity to promote villagers at the start of each month.

The implementation of in-depth tutorialization is planned for full release and we will keep improving the content of the Help menu until then.

Hope that helps!

author: {'steamid': '76561197998285816', 'num_games_owned': 843, 'num_reviews': 16, 'playtime_forever': 10914, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 10730, 'last_played': 1548497693}
review:
Fun Game, but like with all Russian companies, you get shit support. There is a certain hacker on there that the community knows by name. If you mention getting hacked in chat, the only question anybody will ask you is if it was that guy who hacked who. He somehow obtained thousands of players login information on the game and goes and sells everything you own and transfers the money to his account basically. You can send all the screenshots and proof you want to Gaijin. They do not care, they tell you the account is solely your responsibility and they will offer no assistance or punishment to this hacker. 

Do not support this shit Russian company who supports and endorses hackers.
developer_response:
Thank you for the feedback! We do not condone hacking and consistently take all measures we can against it and ban the accounts involved. 
However we strongly recommend against giving out your data on pages or sites which are unsafe, clicking on dubious links promising free coins etc. and downloading dodgy add-ons. We have security features in place on our websites which help protect you, but  players have to be careful with their personal data outside of those. Again, we recommend players to activate 2-step authentication where possible and we suggest that you use different passwords for different sites and accounts. Please be sure to contact our technical support if something happened with your account and we'll provide assistance if possible.

author: {'steamid': '76561198018210252', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 41, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 5, 'last_played': 1567539340}
review:
Why am I supposed to do math by moving the cursor with arrow keys when I have numbers on my physical keyboard? Who the heck thought this is a good idea? Ok, I understand no mouse support, but at least let me write answers from the keyboard. I'm willing to find out the story and all, but not by getting angry for having to move the cursor with arrow keys for a simple math minigame. Not to say that after I write the answer, I also have to press the virtual Enter key with (you guessed) going with arrow keys there! Please change this and I will consider buying this again, I'm requesting a refund for now.

Edit: I did read the dev response saying it's supposed to represent the stress of that time, but let's be honest, a math game like this ain't going to do anything rather than annoy people. Change the minigame to something that's both stressful and interesting for the player to continue the game. It's ridiculous.
developer_response:
It is a pity that the game left you with an unpleasant experience. I understand your position and understand why you left a negative review.
Nevertheless, I am forced to note that the mini-game is exactly the way we intended it to express our idea through gameplay mechanics. And so we will not change the minigame. Although we will think about changing its complexity a bit.
Hope for understanding. Best wishes.

author: {'steamid': '76561198007683294', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 94, 'playtime_forever': 6319, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 4286, 'last_played': 1517888638}

author: {'steamid': '76561198081103893', 'num_games_owned': 445, 'num_reviews': 82, 'playtime_forever': 304, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 237, 'last_played': 1630597996}
review:
Game is ALL about the movement.  If you get sick easy I guess don't play but you should know better honestly at this point.  You expect to spin around in space with NO problems no amount of computer code is gonna prevent that.  There are fisheye options you can turn on.

For the rest the best experience is turn all that crap off and learn the simulation movement style.  Once you get it down it's great.  Blows me away though the reviews.  Got the gogogogo generation dumbfounded how they have to TAKE TIME TO LEARN THE CONTROLS!!!!  As in YOU have to learn how to play the game before you are good at it.  OMG!  Whodda thunk it?  Typical.  It's a fun ride and it does exactly what it says on the tin.  Read the description.  It doesn't advertise an amazing tale.  You must get to safety in space.  

IMO best way played as mentioned by others is to sit in a chair (with armrests preferably).  I like to use the controls like you are sitting in an EVA chair.  Don't know exact name but I remember seeing them being used by the shuttle astronauts before.  Just a chair with control joysticks and thruster packs.

I love it.  Really immersive and looks great.
developer_response:
Glad you had a great time! Thanks for appreciating our attention to detail. We had great fun trying to simulate the zero-g movement :)

Just for curiosity - what hardware you've been using?

author: {'steamid': '76561198134517146', 'num_games_owned': 86, 'num_reviews': 18, 'playtime_forever': 251, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 227, 'last_played': 1505256695}
review:
This might really be the end of Artix Entertainment.
Why make this ugly looking 3D Game? AQW had an enormous fan base, they had good 2D artists and they got a lot of money mostly because of appearance items. AQW was good but outdated, they just had to spice the mechanics a bit. Perhaps making a turn based game like Wakfu/Dofus would be the best solution. 

But no. Let's make an amateur 3D modeled game focused for mobile users. Eveyone's gonna love that idea!
Artix Entertainment, WHAT WHERE YOU THINKING?
developer_response: Thank you so much for your review! The devs are constantly working on fixing and improving issues and releasing updates/patches almost weekly. This has been a constant balance as an indie game company with a small staff. We have had to grow and evolve over these last few years since the Tech Demo which has been a big learning experience! We also have a Game Plan posted here that is updated every Monday - https://aq3d.com/game-plan/. We very much appreciate your feedback!

author: {'steamid': '76561198029769999', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 761, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 698, 'last_played': 1596187979}
review:
The game is good has a nice concept and the skill mechanics and cancels seem good variety in PVP BUT one thing bothers me a lot and its the martial arts and basic attack mechanic with the guarding and parrying.
That mechanic is RNG based as of now because in the practice room when testing to see if you can counter the martial arts it appears that once you even see the beginning of the martial arts animation there is NO frame that you can parry/counter the attack once you see it.
developer_response: Thank you for you review! Every patch we make sure the combat is balanced enough so that no RNG elements are too influential. The combat of the game might be challenging at first, but will also become very rewarding once you reach a certain level. Hope you become a skilled fighter and have tons of fun in Hunter's Arena!

author: {'steamid': '76561197972886954', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 45967, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 17670, 'last_played': 1671542769}
review: I've never been huge into ship-based games, but Elite has really changed that for me. The first month was challenging getting used to the controls and gameplay, but after that initial hurdle it's been awesome. I really like the more technical aspect (you have lots of options for ships and ship parts (modules), tons you can do with controls, etc.), the detail is amazing (from the detail of the ships and stations to seeing how detailed they make your arrival at a planet or ring), it's obvious the creator loves science, it's obvious the developers love the game and add cool little pieces of lore to it (from the political to the newly-discovered alien), and it's awesome being able to use add-ons like HCS Voice Packs that let you control your ship with your voice (including hearing responses by William Shatner, Brent Spiner, etc.). This is absolutely one of my all-time favorite games and I can't suggest it enough. It's not for everyone, but if you like things a little more technical and you're fine with slightly less in-game direction (but still have a bunch of options for stuff to do) then you'll enjoy it. Check it out!

author: {'steamid': '76561198256952735', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 3277, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3276, 'last_played': 1699247083}
review: I tried to like this game but it just seems tedious.  The game balance is kinda wonky.  Because it works on the points for your parts, its pretty common to find players with overpowered weapons basically slumming in the early ranks for easy kills.  Its painfully slow to get any progress in the game, so despite putting in more hours than I have spent to complete other games there isn't much feeling for accomplishment.
developer_response: Hello! Matching in Crossout is based on several factors, one of which is the car's powerscore, sum total of all its parts powerscores. The beginners are matched with bots first to get used to the game, then matched with other beginners for awhile. If one of those beginners vields a higher level weapon, obtained from the ingame market, at the low powerscore levels (where the beginners with light weapons play and are matched) it means the vehicle is very fragile. The majority of the powerscore went into the weapon, which means the bare chassis and cabin are unprotected and very prone to damage, so it balances the superior weapon out.

author: {'steamid': '76561198044161322', 'num_games_owned': 325, 'num_reviews': 248, 'playtime_forever': 367, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 367, 'last_played': 1653976125}
review:
I went into this hoping to love it. Unfortunately, while some aspects are great, there are [i]serious[/i] flaws that bring this game down in a massive way.

Pros:
- interesting lore
- very cool visuals and aesthetic

Cons:
- enemy design is sorely lacking, almost every enemy is a variation of one particular type
- the first section before you get to the open world is a bit too large in my opinion and starts feeling repetitive
- awkward and unresponsive controls sometimes, especially in fights. Your movement feels clunky and slow and your character will just not dodge at all sometimes despite spamming the dodge button. The platforming also sometimes suffers from this
- boss fight hitboxes are all over the place
- UI is weird, mixing up quick use items like health with keys and collectibles. Makes it hard to find what you need
- the game, while aesthetically interesting, is pretty low poly. As a result it's baffling how bad the performance gets in the open world
- platforming feels weird. The game encourages you to be creative and explore by giving you secret items early on, but later there are invisible walls everywhere. Making it somewhere really difficult only to be met with an invisible wall sucks. Either let us have freedom or not, and if you need to block something off, at least make it make sense with the level design
- there are forced perspective sections, where the camera shifts to be looking directly to the side of your character and you are locked into a 2D plane for that section. Words cannot adequately express just how much I [i]hate and despise[/i] these sections. In a souls-like game full of atmosphere, where there are cool visuals everywhere, let alone being aware of enemy placement and frequent insta-death falls, how [i]dare[/i] the designers restrict your motion and field of view? Honestly I was ready to put down the game after encountering this for the very first time. Devs: [b]never do this again[/b]!
- the game just does not respect your time at all. From infrequent checkpoints forcing you to run back to where you died (often, given the frequent platforming sections and awkward controls), to long load screens, to making you go back to the starting area to level up, to the quite frankly ridiculously long animations for backstabs and enemies getting back up, everything seems designed to waste your time

It's a real shame as the world would be interesting to explore, but I just can't make myself sit through the slog that would be the rest of the game. Pass on this one.

author: {'steamid': '76561198058481342', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 842, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 237, 'last_played': 1580547615}

2 years (almost three) and I've never heard of this game until Pewdiepie played it. Saw it was free and gave it a shot. Holy crap, it's fun. Like Mad Max meets Call of Duty meets Twisted Metal. The initial tutorial is a bit long, but once you start unlocking stuff on the map you realize just how big this game actually is. It's more than just "deathmatch." I've been recommending it to all my friends. Get it, try it. Why not?

Update:
Devs, please allow for group games to scale to the lowest level player automatically. Having to have a specific player add everyone just to join a game together is obnoxious. And why do we all have to be level 10 to make a custom game??

author: {'steamid': '76561197981245174', 'num_games_owned': 287, 'num_reviews': 34, 'playtime_forever': 423, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 36, 'last_played': 1497625363}
review: Hope you make it better.
developer_response:
Thank you for your feedback.  As a solo dev who relies a lot on feedback, I offer you a free early access copy of SATS - Small Arms Training simulator - so you can give more feedback prior to public release.  

This game is motion controller only and we do not expect the controls problems some have stated.  This game is designed for touch/vive and I would love to personally welcome you as the sole creator of my 4 published games to have a stab at the SATS - DLC - for free well in advance of public distribution to aid in QA and bug testing. As A solo developer who went it alone with failed crowd funding I would appreciate what feedback you have to offer.   This game is down to VR controller usage.  I will PM you personally over the coming days to see if you have the right equipment and to offer you a unique- pre-release beta test.

Thanks for playing,

Shaun Williams  (AKA MAG studios) as an incoming friend request.

author: {'steamid': '76561198325639608', 'num_games_owned': 137, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 968, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 231, 'last_played': 1598735686}
review:
I really got hooked on the construction mechanics, i would definetly play for hours building ships if there were more materials and color options for said materials. A few comments on the construction though, i would really like more available visibility while making designs (360° vision). Most of the UI needs fixing (better construction inventory, texts that fit), but i indeed liked where the game is going and the potential it has. I would love to help in the translation if you are planing to doing it also in spanish. counter or markers for needed sails or weight balance would be great. For now, I'll keep designing ships till i get the perfect one. Good luck and keep on the good work... 

Bugs: 180° rotation displaces ship if there isn´t any steering wheel on.
ship gets stuck between certain strecthes of land.
tesxt doest fit in the screen for guides and sailing ui (quest, trade, etc.)
developer_response: Greetings, many thanks for the detailed review. I hope you manage to build a really grand ship. Yes, I am really interested in translations into various languages, especially Spanish (becouse the sailing era is impossible to imagine without Spanish). I hope that can count on your help :)

author: {'steamid': '76561198064392148', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 231, 'playtime_forever': 1050, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 592, 'last_played': 1620495976}
review:
Another gem that proves that a great story is what makes a great game and not some high quality graphics.

Through the quest of Horatio and his sidekick Crispin to recover their power core, discover a world where humanity destroyed itself and where sentient machines with very human-like behaviours seem to follow the same path than their original creator.

A self-reflection and metaphor of our own society in a sci-fi world that could very well be one of our possible futures.

A must play game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198030792746', 'num_games_owned': 105, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 32, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 32, 'last_played': 1580425287}
review: The game itself seems like it could be fun with the right controllers, but I would not recommend getting this game if all you have are knuckles controllers. The game is not optimized for them at all and it is hard to use them. For one, grabbing weapons and objects is very unintuitive with the knuckles controllers, and it requires you to maintain a force grip the whole time you are holding the object unless you use the sticky pickup mode, which makes putting down the objects annoying. This pales in comparison to the bigger issue which is the movement. For some reason, there is no way to use the joystick for walking, and you can only use it for teleporting. which is incredibly difficult to use in combat and makes using two handed weapons almost impossible. If you want to walk normally, you are forced to use the small scroll wheel touchpad which makes moving sideways impossible, and along with this if you accidentally press a little too hard on the touchpad while you are trying to move it will open the teleport movement. I was only able to play the first mission before I had to quit because I got so annoyed by accidentally dropping my weapon every minute or so and having to wait ~3 seconds for it to respawn on my back so I could use it again, and constantly having to sit and wait for the enemies to come attack me because I couldn't move towards them easily.

author: {'steamid': '76561197972318014', 'num_games_owned': 541, 'num_reviews': 199, 'playtime_forever': 249, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 249, 'last_played': 1542959019}
review:
It was a great game at the start and would recommend to anyone that enjoyed Dungeons and hated the sequels, but I do not recommend as there are impossible achievements to get when original they could be and since the timers got messed with without adjusting the amount of time allowed I can not let this oversight go.

After reading what the developer has written in a couple places it is clear they have no respect for others time and like wasting it.  I had such high hopes again as I was looking forward to what seemed to be a better dungeons game and got instead was a group of developers that are too uncreative to come up with something inspiring and worth achieving or lazy to copy what has workered for others in what could be forgiven as been there done that.  DO not waste your money on this turd of a game.

I have decided that the AI is hte issue overall with this game.  The workers and other units are just not controllable enough even on a micro management level.  They will do whatever the hell they want be dammed what I want.  Path cutoffs for works, nah ill walk right on through and continue what I want.  Fighters go to the flag as that seems to be the only general way to get them from your base to theirs nah I want to explore over here instead.  Trying to get information on this game is extremely taxxing and just not worth it.  Oh you messed up with the room layout, how do I change lair to barracks, well that took forever for apparent reaosn.  The list goes on.  At best this is a game that should have been thought out more on paper as it has no real cohesiveness yet.
developer_response:
Hi Shield,

I'm sorry to hear that you've had difficulty with the game, in particular, the timed achievements.

As far as we are aware all the timed achievements should be completely possible in the current version of the game and it is simply not true that we have not updated the timers in accordance with the changes we've made to game balance, we regularly adjust these to ensure they're up to our standards, for example we revised quite a few in [url=https://wftogame.com/2-0-1-release-notes/]Patch 2.0.1[/url]. Some of these achievements are meant to be a challenge but should be entirely doable, if you believe that any achievement is unachievable then please let us know and we'll investigate to see if they need further adjustments.

We're always eager to take feedback and happy to be challenged by our community, we have a strong relationship that we intend to maintain for many years to come. If there are genuine concerns rest assured we will listen.

If you let me know via support@brightrockgames.com which level you are struggling with or open a thread in the [url=https://steamcommunity.com/app/230190/discussions/]discussions board[/url] either we or the community should be able to assist and provide hints or tips.

Hope we can help,

Lee

author: {'steamid': '76561198011581319', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 31, 'playtime_forever': 757, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 676, 'last_played': 1670082938}
review:
Absolutely recommend this classic point-and-click adventure game. The artwork both conveys the beautiful landscapes and mournful losses experienced by the characters in this a post-humanity wasteland environment.  Multiple options for dealing with puzzles are a lot of fun to discover on repeat playthoughs. Also the voice work/ambient soundscape is truly the best in the genre and is in my personal Top 3 Adventure game soundtracks to listen to at home (along with Technobaylon)!!  

As a long time fan of the creators at Wormwood Studios (and their collaborations with Wadjet Eye Games) I realized that with the Switch release of Primordia -- I should take the opportunity to leave a written review for the game on Steam. Give Primordia a try on your platform of choice, it comes with my highest recommendation!
developer_response: Thank you so much!

author: {'steamid': '76561198030840424', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 26, 'playtime_forever': 563, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 106, 'last_played': 1706489585}
review:
Ths is the true spritual successor to the Dungeon Keeper series -- all the way down to the same voice actor for the announcer!   

However, the system requirements are so high (or perhaps it's a lack of optimization for mid-range systems?) that the game becomes unplayable on larger maps.  

I *VERY* much want to play this game four dozens -- perhaps hundreds -- of hours, but can't even continue the campaign without a substantial system upgrade to bring it into the stable 20-30FPS range.   It's 5-10FPS on large maps for me right now.  Maybe next year?

So in summary:  If you have a high-end system, PLAY THIS GAME!  It's like DK3 would/should have been... lots of new toys, traps, and depth.
developer_response:
Hi Inteselygoodtime,

I'm sorry to hear that you're struggling to get the game at a playable framerate. We're constantly looking to improve the game's performance and are still working on finding places we can optimise further.

Hopefully we'll be able to get you in sooner rather than later without the need to make a huge investment in a new rig. We wouldn't want  to leave you out in the cold :)

In the meantime you can try adjusting the graphics settings in the options menu to see if it yields any positive gains.

Cheers,

Lee

author: {'steamid': '76561198004903022', 'num_games_owned': 299, 'num_reviews': 52, 'playtime_forever': 59255, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 59255, 'last_played': 1665768504}
review:
I haven't played this game in a few months now. So I suppose I should move on and leave a review as a post mortem. 
Up front I'll say that I stopped playing because I'm just done with the game. There was no shocking change that made me quit. I've just had enough.

I'm not sure what makes a good idler and a bad one, to be honest. Reading other people's reviews it's hard to grasp what other people want out of these things. So I'll just have to detail what the game does and you'll have to decide if that's good or bad.

So the first thing I think should be covered is "is this an idler or a clicker?" I would say this is an idler because the only component that benefits from clicking (your familiar's DPS) becomes incredibly useless after a few hours of playing. It sort of helps when you rebirth and are level 1 again, but not by enough to matter. And it doesn't help at all with progression.

The next point is how attentive you need to be. There are only a couple things you need to pay attention to: when you hit a wall and want to go back a few stages to leave your guys to grind. And timer missions. The shortest timer mission is ~20 minutes (with upgrades). These are those missions you see in phone games where you just click "start" and then once the timer completes you turn in the quest. So that means you, at most, are checking the game every 20 minutes. There's also some daily quests you have to fiddle around to complete each day. Those take about 30 minutes to do, I think? I've seen some people say this game requires too much attention. I don't think so. I find this to be a good amount. The most interaction you get is when you try to push progression by spending levels and using consumables. By the time I was level 80 or so, I only did this every couple days. Eventually once a week. Maybe I was being lazy, but it didn't seem like pushing was always an option. You have to idle for long periods of time, as the genre goes.

The social aspect of the game is super easy. You have guilds and fellowships (which are like secondary mini-guilds that require no effort) but both can be joined using search tools. These don't take any effort on your part, unless you find some kind of weird hardcore guild (not sure how people manage to be hardcore here but they always exist). They both provide huge bonuses so you'd be a fool not to join them. There's a guild activity where you farm a crystal, but this takes mere seconds out of your day. Just about the least commitment needed to be "fully active" I've ever seen in a game, so I think it's nice.

Other than that, we have... STUFF. Lots of superfluous menus and bonuses and things to click on. It may look overwhelming in the screenshots, but they are introduced very slowly. Each thing doesn't take much to manage, and can be safely ignored for long periods of time. It adds a kind of management to the game, albeit a very casual and "idler" version of it. A lot of it is redundant, quite frankly, but it provides the illusion of depth. The most notable side content is the tank battles. The tank battles are pretty stupid. And kinda feel like a huge waste of time. But it's more bonuses so you do them. Again, they only take a few minutes out of your day (this is where a lot of that "daily quest 30 minutes" I mentioned earlier comes from).

In conclusion, I think this is a pretty good idler. Maybe my favorite so far? A lot of numbers and increasing them. The right amount of auto-play vs management. For example, I couldn't get into that AFK Arena because you have to click on every level to go to a new one. That's probably the most important part. The idle combat just keeps going and going without having to do a bunch of menu-ing. Checking once every 20+ minutes is good. Checking every minute is bad. That's where my head is at.

EDIT: I forgot to mention monetization. I actually wanted to give the game money since I was playing it so much. But I never did because none of the things you can buy seem necessary... or even worthwhile. So I guess that's a good thing. Although this may change in the future (or already has), you never know with f2p games.
developer_response:
thank you very much for this review. I want to say here that its one of the best and most helpful reviews i have ever seen as a developer. You highlight the good things but most importantly the weaknesses of the game. The things that we need to work on to make it better.
Thanks again!

author: {'steamid': '76561198047421784', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 958, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 747, 'last_played': 1587083882}
review:
Disgusting rubberbanding makes the game so un-enjoyable. Race perfectly and the ai will be right behind you the entire time even if your vehicle is 50 points faster. Of course it's the same the other way around as well, you can eat shit in a ditch and be right behind the leader of the race 10 seconds later because they basically slow down to a crawl if you fall behind, which is incredible because as soon as you pull ahead of them by 5-6 seconds the ai can start to take perfect turns going twice as fast as you like the car is on rails instead of tires. Even worse is the fact that the game punishes you for using your breaks. It's legitimately faster to ride the side rail of a corner and hold the boost than to bother to slow down and take a proper turn.

PSA: I'm honestly super surprised I actually have to explain this here but to everyone commenting about the problem being connection or cpu or w/e else, rubberbanding ai is not a term for lagging. Rubber band AI refers to a feature of artificial intelligence found in racing titles that is designed to prevent players from getting too far ahead of computer-controlled opponents. 

Edit: I'm making a sidenote for all the people who are real grumpy about the bad reviews, the base of the game itself is nice. It feels great to freeroam around the map. The physics could have used a bit more tuning but aside from that the cars control as you would expect from a good arcade racer. The problem lies beyond that in the ai. The oponents can decide to hit warpspeed to catch up to you whenever they damn well please. It's not as obvious in disciplines like hypercar racing and the F1 syle discipline, but street races are absolutely atrocious to play. I honestly believe if Ubi went back and fixed some of their problems the game could be great, but as it is, it feels like a big mess. Also, always online game and no PvP for another 5-6 months is a pathetic joke.

author: {'steamid': '76561198061380544', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 2308, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2302, 'last_played': 1512666878}
review:
When this game first came out it looked interesting even though there was not much content and most things in game were not usable so I waited. Then they added some more content, but in the form of DLC that you need to purchase.  This game is so not worth it and to make the people that got in at the start purchase content that should be part of the game is greedy and stupid.
The game it self is repetative and slow.  AI pilots always fly the same way, always take the same actions. Graphics look better on the steam page then in-game.  Still bugs that cause you to crash and  loose everything.
BUT HEY THEY HAVE DLC YOU CAN BUY!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!
developer_response:
Hello Yibaroane,

I have to agree and disagree with your statement about content and DLC. Every DLC was community wish since release (most of them was suggested post release). With every DLC we've upgraded vanilla version with same content. 

About your bugs that crashes and lose your progress. Feel free to send contact us via support mail: customersupport@starpointgemini.com

Stay frosty

author: {'steamid': '76561197969945509', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 87, 'playtime_forever': 394, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 394, 'last_played': 1441463384}
review:
So, I gotta say the devs really care about the game. Just see the low below :)




Old review:
Like Dungeon Keeper 2. Just a bad version of it.
The game is still buggy as hell. Worst of all is the cursor, you just never know where exactly it is pointing. That is especially frustrating when trying to place prisoners in the torture chamber.

Edit 29.07.:

Hi, Lee

First of all, cool that you guys took the effort of replying here. Never saw a dev do that before!
I looked into what you told me and you're right. There is a light beam, I just never realized as it is very hard for me to see. So there is no real problem and sorry for claiming there would be one!

The bug happened in the introductory level for the prisons (2nd level of the red circle to the right in campaign mode I think). I enlarged the captured prison and later tried to move prisoners from the second one (with the lvl10 bard) to another, which resulted in the new prisoner being killed. The same happened for me when I picked up the lvl10 bard and dropped him in the same prison again. All the other prisoners ganked up on the new guy and killed him for good. 
As I never did this in later levels, I tried that as well and it doesn't appear to be a problem there, so I don't know if that was a special problem or not.
developer_response:
Hi Volvox Globator,

Sorry to hear that you're disappointed with the game.

The hand always points towards the tip of the index finger or pickaxe. The exception to this is when dropping units or objects. If you are holding something in your hand then a small purple godbeam will be placed in the world to indicate where the unit will drop.

Having played around with it a little I think we can make some improvements for patch 1.2 there, generally the unit in your hand is hiding the beam a little too much making it difficult to see where it will land.

While I was in game I also tested the bug you reported that moving a prisoner from one room to another will cause other prisoners to kill him but I wasn't able to replicate. Did you do anything particular with these prisoners or was there anything special about them?

I'll try to check back here tomorrow to see if you've responded if not can you post up a [url=https://forum.subterraneangames.com/threads/please-read-how-to-report-a-bug.4689/]bug report[/url] on our forums and we'll do our best to fix it.

Cheers,

Lee

author: {'steamid': '76561197971064261', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 54, 'playtime_forever': 164, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 164, 'last_played': 1567645085}
review:
I thought I would like it, but I didn't.

The main gripe, survival mode has only 50 seconds of air, so you are constantly doing 20 sec travel out 10 second do things, 20 seconds back... over, and over, and over again.  It gets old fast.

But if you switch to story mode, it becomes boring.

I might try playing it again later... but right now I regret purchasing it.
developer_response:
Hey there!

Good news - the base O2 level has been increased to 75 seconds (meaning you can have 125 seconds with the first oxygen tank upgrade), and continue to monitor reviews more actively and tune it to make sure a good experience. The game is now fully released with 3 more chapters and the game finale, there is so much new stuff. We really hope you could give Breathedge one more try!

author: {'steamid': '76561198014795790', 'num_games_owned': 2096, 'num_reviews': 32, 'playtime_forever': 443, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 443, 'last_played': 1476937038}

author: {'steamid': '76561198011843901', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 44, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 44, 'last_played': 1441163095}
review:
Pros:

Has some cool idea that I had really wanted to check out.
Guild run territories
housing
a lot of freedome
varied skills

Cons:

Gameplay feels sluggish and dated
Total pay-to-win
Skills cannot be increased past 60 on a free account
sub based
Many areas are over-camped by higher level players killing off new characters (with what I read in chat)
Older Graphics

Overall, I wouldn't recommend the game until the sub-based premium is dropped and they adopt a GW2 style payment method. 

Increase in area size for the tutorial zones would help alleviate the horde of players swinging like freaks at the same 2 pigs. 

Finally the graphics could be overlooked but the game still feels sluggish.

So it has potential but the starter zone was full of people killing the same 2-3 pigs that actually spawned. After mentioning in "help chat" that i wasn't sure i was keen on the pay-to-win model, i get lagged out. Check the forums to find i've been IP banned. So that was neat.

author: {'steamid': '76561198008089245', 'num_games_owned': 368, 'num_reviews': 26, 'playtime_forever': 2251, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 795, 'last_played': 1678048179}
review:
Its improved a lot since beta.
Its good practice and has some fun courses.
I'd recommend it to anyone who is interesting in mini quad racing.


Negatives (these things are being worked on but this is what I see right now):
-Very Few possibilities for customization.  ( Ok, its because a physics update meant that  experimental data has to be re-gathered, but thats how it stands right now ).

-A lot of courses (at least the indoor ones, and multi-gp) are really hard, and feel closterphobic.  There are some easy and mediums but really most are labeled appropriately as 'hard'.  
I'd recommend a beginner fly the easy and mediums at
-Gates of Hell
-Airport
-Miami

-The course markers can be misleading.  This is the most annoying thing ever.  Theres the actual visible checkpoints and then theres these invisible ones that you can miss.  The tracks can be complicated and the green diamond often looks like it wants you to go here, but actually it wants you there (ok turning off lens distortion to fix this).  Also on some of the smaller tracks the red line that highlights the intended course can show you the completely wrong direction of some parts of the course path are close together.
developer_response:
Hi Tytugg!!

Thank you so very much for your feedback! We really appreciate it! 

I'd like to address a few of your concerns, and say that they are very valid concerns, and we have fixes in place for all of them. 

-"The few possible customization's": This is due to our most recent huge physics update that we did. We had to pull all the parts from the drones because we have to capture ALL new bench test date to reflect the new physics. Unfortunately this process takes a very long time. Here's a clip of what it takes to get those parts in the sim: https://youtu.be/hm4EQfMQShY ... So with every update going forward we will be adding more and more of those parts along with brand new ones!!

The hard courses: Yes there are a lot of challenging courses, we are in the process of currently making more beginner friendly courses, however there are a number of easier course built by the community that could help you in the meantime, but more will be coming in little by little!! 

As for the bug with the green diamond check points, there is a known issue with them if you have the "Lens Distortion" feature turned on in your settings. Can you check your settings in the option menu to see if you have it turned on, if so, try turning it off and see if that resolves the issue you are encountering. We're working on a fix for it, but it requires an entire overhaul of the checkpoint system to fix this. I'm sorry about that, its a tricky one.

As for the red line... the courses that our community makes or we make through the map editor will have an issue with the red line when dealing with multiple tracks, so yes you are correct that there's an issue for sure.. lol.. but the official DRL tracks shouldn't have any issues with the line, because we create that differently then the way the redline is made through the editor, so a fix for that will be in the future as well. I know its a pain.. trust me.. it bothers us when were playing as well... So for that.. I'm sorry...But please send me a message on any specific tracks that have issue with the red line or checkpoints so we can get them fixed. I've sent you a request. 

So with all that said, again.. Thank you so very much for the feedback. We have fixes in the process for all the concerns you've brought up. I just wanted to take the time to let you know, so that you are aware that your money spent on our sim, is certainly going towards making this the best sim on the market. 


Also join our Discord Server: its very active with a lot of community members, info, tips and tricks, help related stuff, live stream links etc etc. https://discord.gg/b9RZ5yZ

Thank you again so much! Cat wait to fly with you!  

KaNoodle
Tony

author: {'steamid': '76561198114672385', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 29581, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 29497, 'last_played': 1710633159}
review:
WILL YOU QUIT ADDING DLC CHARACTER SKINS TO THIS UNFINISHED GAME IT DOESN'T NEED THEM RIGHT NOW!!!

author: {'steamid': '76561198350173653', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 46, 'playtime_forever': 715, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 715, 'last_played': 1680711399}
review:
Papers, Please, but in 3D. 

Checking papers and looking for contraband is fun, but of course it gets monotonous eventually, dont expect game loop to evolve much, you just have to check more papers, more conditions applied... You can upgrade your stuff/officers, but not really much yourself.

Other missions can be a nice break from checking papers loop, but driving and shooting is very basic, not much of a challenge or fun.

You can choose between 2 sides, sadly your choices have 0 impact on gameplay, only on game ending, so you dont feel like you picked a side. Also you do those choices outside of customs. It would be cool if I could help rebels on border by letting assassins in, letting them smuggle weapons/people etc.

author: {'steamid': '76561197964197713', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 17, 'playtime_forever': 419, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 390, 'last_played': 1544560024}
review:
I am really enjoying MOST of the game.  The story has been great and the combat is lots of fun.  

That being said the crashes and error in the game have taken the fun out of the game for me.  The first cutscene consistently crashed to desktop.  To fix this I had to verify my steam files. ( quite a few people have has this problem, so I hope if youre reading this it has helped you)
Everytime I open my inventory or my character menu there is a 60% chance my game will freeze.  So i have had to save everytime i want to look at a weapon or level up.  
Alt tabbing also slows the game down or freezes it.  
Tree hugger (an ability for a character) also has a chance to completely freeze the game

I am not alone with these bugs ( have been active in the forums trying to get things sorted out) and I cant reccommend this game in the state it is in now.  Plus the fact that the opening credits are unskippable so everytime I crash to desktop I have to resee the companies that rushed this out.

I really want to enjoy it and play more, but i am going to wait for a few more patches before I continue.

author: {'steamid': '76561199579729744', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 259, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 259, 'last_played': 1705375998}
review: great if you want hardcore survival, not so much if you're looking to build with a group. tried playing coop, so difficult to get together we just kept dying trying to reach each other
developer_response: Hi Peanutshell! We're sorry to see that the game did not live up to your expectations. SCUM is indeed a hardcore survival game and that is something that we are definitely leaning towards, which is why you just can't port to one another once you join an official server as that could be used as an exploit. That is why, once you join a server with your teammates, you should all open the map using the 'M' key and assess where all of you are and determine the middle point between each of you. There is also an option to play on private servers where the admins would be willing to port you to one another - you just need to find one that has this practice. Hope this provides some clarification and that you will consider giving the game another chance.

author: {'steamid': '76561198044067986', 'num_games_owned': 755, 'num_reviews': 158, 'playtime_forever': 1046, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 350, 'last_played': 1634277394}
review:
Just don't ask too much from this game.

It's a little budget mmorpg with simple graphics but really cool humor and solid gameplay.
The quests are kill this, fetch that, activate things but it's okay because the gameplay is really good and the npcs are really funny.

The cut scenes are really well made and the dialogue "shot-counter shot" style cinematics remind me of old good time of games like Skies of Arcadia on Dreamcast (a lot of gesticulation by the characters, no voice over, loud music).

It seems there is a lot of collectibles (weapons, armor sets, cosmetics) and  most of them are not reserved to payed players.

The only annoying thing are the musics. They're well-crafted but they're basically 30 seconds loops. And don't try to cut them unless you like total silence, since there are no ambient sounds (a part footsteps and fighting sounds).

I really enjoy this game. I played today because I was tired by waiting queues in New World and because it's quick to install (123mg), but I realize I will probably play Adventure Quest 3D this night rather Amazon's blockbuster.

PS : the dev answer was because I experienced heavy stutterings in town the first time I played. Nothing of that sort happened today.
developer_response: Hello! We are sorry you are having this issue - it seems like a connection issue of some kind. Please read our troubleshooting options here - https://support.artix.com/hc/en-us/articles/115001580572. You can also contact Artix Support via artix.com/contact. Thank you!

author: {'steamid': '76561197987438662', 'num_games_owned': 598, 'num_reviews': 28, 'playtime_forever': 156, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 156, 'last_played': 1649679261}
review:
My first experience with this game was not great

Option menu is extremely unreliable, settings will save at random and can even change themselves after loading into a match.

You start out with a minibird and a handful of troops. The chopper is extremely clunky, soldiers will only fire at things from their side which would be fine except turning the chopper to the correct side for your troops to fire from it is a difficult and sometimes tedious problem.

The pathing is absolutely horrendous especially in chokepoints, the final straw for me was when I tried to have a squad of 8 soldiers pass over a bridge, they would not follow the formation I set and kept walking back and forth, not following my directions. It's almost as if the bridge completely broke their pathing.

Honestly there is so much wrong with the game, I can see the potential but unless they get to polishing and bugfixing this game is going nowhere.
developer_response:
We've made vast improvements in 1.1.15 . if you've switched between experimental and public build it can cause issues so I would recommend reinstalling the game/verifying. But our team has made considerable strides in this regard I hope you'll give the game another look!

The Interface was also redone with a collaboration with our community on Discord. Do let us know of the new layout 

We've also improved units responsiveness overall  & the Options screen was improved and expanded so give users more control over the games performance

Formations were also tweaked do let me know what you think of the new changes!
