author: {'steamid': '76561198075336912', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 13061, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2793, 'last_played': 1683388769}
review:
Just updating the review to recommended after being away from it for a while the Devs have continued to work on it which is great to see. Still needs some work but has alot of content and is becoming a beautiful game, my previous review should be below I think. (not sure how the reviews work as this is the only one I have reviewed so far)

---------------

I think this is my first review, I feel it is warranted to discuss some thoughts for those considering purchasing this game.
Firstly I love this genre of game, big fan of banished (450 hrs played) and feel this game will be the next step up from that

Overall I wish I could mark my recommendation as neutral with potential - Have marked as Not Recommended at the moment largely based on the pricing for this stage of an Alpha product however the Devs seem to be motivated in updating it regularly and does have alot of early game enjoyment and stability.

Positives:
- Gridless building is great, the freedom to place buildings almost anywhere gives it a natural look and feel.
- Natural sprawl, (not for everyone from the videos I have watched) I like that towns people build their houses in their own way (within your set zone) and create their own paths/roads making each gameplay unique
- Dev humor, if you look close you can see parts of the developers personalities come through with the kooky cartoony characters and little puns/jokes but not overdone to take the shine off the overall feel of the game
- Early Gameplay, has been fleshed out very well, the buildings and features work well to encourage further gameplay
- Art Style, to me this is an appealing artstyle, soft on the eye and allows enough color and creativity to make your city truly yours without ruining the settler/medievil style.
-  The Devs are updating the game on a regular basis

Negatives:
- Expense, for an  alpha with a long way to go I took a gamble on paying what I rarely pay for a fully produced game, the first couple of hours I was happy but once the mid/late game lack of content and bugs arose I would have refunded if I could. (keeping in mind I am a poor family man :P )
- Mid/late Gameplay - after the first couple of hours it is obvious that the game is not complete, there are buildings and resources with little or no purpose as yet and functionality of those buildings is lacking and leaves you void of progression in any way other than to continue to expand the existing services. For an Alpha I don't mind a lack of polish such as names of units being "male2538" and general bugs but when I hit a lack of progression speaks a bit about flow design and how it appears to be a bit rushed out at this stage. In saying that I can see where they are going with it and just hope it continues.
- You are a game tester paying a premium price
- No real tutorial, if you are not use to games like Banished then you could get lost quickly 

In Summery:
This has SO much potential to be a brilliant city builder if the devs can follow through with what they have started. If you love the genre and happy to watch the game develop over time and hope that it reaches its true potential for it's premium price then this is a good purchase for you. I recommend holding off on your purchase until the development has progressed, though without funding it may not progress, Catch 22. If it were half the price or you have the extra cash to splurge (unlike me :( )I would say absolutely give it a go.

Happy Building :)
developer_response:
Hi Bear,

Thanks for the honest and open review! As a small Indie team, all feedback is very important to us.

We are in heavy development whilst in Early Access and there is much more content, gameplay and challenge to come. We hope as we release more content and refine the game we will be able to earn a positive review.

As you have probably seen there is a help menu (?) and initial quests that guide you through the early game but we recognise the need for a tutorial in the future.

Thanks again for the great feedback!
Cheers
Ash

author: {'steamid': '76561198102269834', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 58, 'playtime_forever': 720, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 240, 'last_played': 1635226005}

developer_response:
Hey Maelstrom! Sorry to hear you're encountering this! The error about "ownership authentication," means that the Ubisoft account that is logged in on Ubisoft Connect is not the account where your Steam game, or DLC for the game has been activated. This is not to say that you don't own the game, it is just that the game has been activated on an alternate account. To remedy this, please contact our support teams on any of the following channels:

[url=https://support.ubisoft.com/en-GB/SignIn]Support Portal[/url] 
[url=https://twitter.com/UbisoftSupport]Support Twitter[/url] (Send as private message.)
[url=https://www.facebook.com/UbisoftSupport/]Support Facebook[/url] (Send as private message.) 

They will need to see your [url=https://support.ubisoft.com/en-US/Article/000060565]Steam ID[/url], a screenshot of your [url=https://support.ubisoft.com/en-US/Article/000065542]savegames folder[/url], and a screenshot of your ANNO 2205 [url=https://www.ubisoft.com/en-gb/help/article/accessing-the-steam-proof-of-purchase/000061770]proof of purchase[/url]. This will help expedite their assistance!

Alternatively, if you're experiencing any other launching issue like crashing on the splash screen, or silent closes, please go through these [url=https://support.ubisoft.com/en-us/Article/000061047]basic troubleshooting steps[/url] so that we can rule out any typical crashing causes. I also recommend [url=https://support.steampowered.com/kb_article.php?ref=2037-QEUH-3335]verifying your game files[/url] as this will help Steam repair any corrupt files, or replace missing ones. Please try these steps out before contacting Support.

author: {'steamid': '76561198006308681', 'num_games_owned': 796, 'num_reviews': 33, 'playtime_forever': 286, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 56, 'last_played': 1706300487}
review:
It's a neat little sim and I like the idea in building a network of buildings. It's similar to Surviving Mars but without the large dome management and the management is much more straightforward.

However, my biggest issues with the game have to do with the colonist/robot AI. The AI has great difficulty handling a large amount of tasks in the early game and multi-tasking is troublesome. While you can prioritize structures to build first, building individual components within rooms with prioritization is not possible. I would also suggest that the AI follow prioritization by needs of the colonists. For example, if the colonists are all getting very tired and sleepy, that they prioritize building bunks over the other less essential structures. In addition, I would recommend starting the game with more colonists to give some more wiggle room in the early game building process. If your engineer dies for whatever reason (such as natural meteor disaster or power grid failure) and the building bots go into very poor condition, it's very easy to hit a state where the game is guaranteed to be a failure.

Lastly, this is a small thing but the amount of techs and milestones is a bit on the lean side of things. Most of the milestones are very easily achievable in the short term.

It's an okay game but it does have some issues that could be improved on.

author: {'steamid': '76561197998363460', 'num_games_owned': 242, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 2060, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2060, 'last_played': 1493426182}
review:
I don’t write many reviews, but I felt I should for this game. First off I really enjoyed this game and I think if you enjoyed DK1 and 2 then you will probably enjoy this game too. I played through both the main campaign and heart of gold, and I would recommend both to anyone who enjoys this type of strategy game.  

A lot of reviews recently seem to be complaining about this being all about clicks per second (CPS) because they feel they are rushed and they are unbale to beat the levels. One reviewer claimed its basically impossible to beat some levels without going to YouTube and watching tutorials. I completely disagree. 

Admittedly, there are a few levels that were very hard the first couple times I tried them, but I think it’s a bit silly to buy a game and assume it is not going to challenge you. if it was not a challenge, then what’s the point? I play RTS games very slowly and methodically, building up my base and my units until I can overpower the enemy. You will notice, this is exactly the opposite of what a lot of the reviews are claiming you have to do in order to beat levels.

There are a couple levels that did force me to play faster than I normally do, but again, that is part of the fun. Otherwise it would just be the same thing over and over. I had to replay these levels a couple of times before I came up with a strategy that worked, and it felt rewarding once I had figured it out! 

A couple of tips for players if you need some help:

1 - in the gameplay options menu, there is a game speed slider. on levels I was having difficulty with, I moved the slider down to 50% so that I had more time to plan things out and build up my rooms. some levels I played almost entirely this way. I would hop in and out of that menu a couple times in a map usually to adjust the speed of the game.

2 - You can most definitely funnel enemies. if you are having trouble figuring out the way to funnel enemies, there’s a sandbox map you can play in the campaigns that allow you infinite money and time to build up a dungeon and allow you to call waves of enemies when you are ready which will allow you to test out defense setups. I was able to make a kill room that would handle a full wave of level 10 enemies by itself. I used this setup a number of times during the campaign, so it’s not like it requires infinite resources to do.

3 - Like most games like this, as long as you give the enemies a way to get into your base that is not too far away from where they naturally want to enter, they will take the route you give them instead of cutting a path of their own. A point to be made here though is that some defenses (the blade flower and the rampart for example) do not allow minions or enemies to walk through them. So, that would count as a blocked path, which means that the enemies might decide to cut their own path instead of taking the one you gave them. Doors and whatnot are fine since the enemies will understand that they need to attack them.

Comments to the devs (if they are listening :)
As I mentioned above, I played around with the speed setting a lot. I think a more fluid way to adjust game speed would be nice. like simply using the + and - keys to adjust the speed on the fly. 

Another thing I would have loved to have is the ability to pause the game and look around. basically, just stop time and let me move my camera around and interact with the props. The ability to mark areas for mining and marking out defenses/constructs would also be great to do while paused, though I could see how this might be "over powered."

author: {'steamid': '76561198350170057', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 32, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 11, 'last_played': 1644521487}
review:
Unplayable, just unplayable.

And the worst about it is that the game look really crazy! But I just can't play even against AI.
developer_response:
Hello,

Sorry for the lag.
We made a post about it. If you could read it and tell us where you are located (in case it's to far from brazil and asia) that way we know which servers are missing exactly.

author: {'steamid': '76561198125588356', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 3400, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3317, 'last_played': 1696662675}
review: THIS GAME IS GARBAGE. I thought this was more of a C&C type base-building game...it's not. It's a straight up tower defense game that cost me TWENTY DOLLARS when I wouldn't play it if it was on Kongrigate for free. NO SAVES. NONE. You have to play each level to the end, or start again from the beginning...which you should get used to, since the slightest mistake means you have to start over or lose the perk you get for perfectly finishing the level.
developer_response:
Thank you for your review. 
Seeing that you have put roughly 55 hours into this game means you've been entertained for about 36 cent per hour which is quite a good ratio in my opinion.
I'm sorry to hear you thought it would be more of an RTS. It is a tactical base defense game (like advertised). A mixture between RTS and tower defense, build your base and defend it. It's much more complex than a regular tower defense game and also brings much more tactics into it. The game has been developed by my wife and myself over 4 years and we tried to put as much content into it as possible.

 - Story campaign mode with voice acting (English + German) and three different difficulty levels
 - Skirmish mode with two game play options and procedural wave generation
 - Map editor with steam workshop integration
 - Twitch mode
 - Complete soundtrack

and all packed in unique, atmospheric graphics oh and it is localized in 9 different languages too!
I'm pretty sure none of the free games on Kongregate has the same amount of content with such a high production value. All the hard work can't come for free, we have bills to pay. And because of the fact that you've played the game for this long means that somehow the game had to be good for you. 
Anyway, maybe I could change your mind. And maybe or hopefully you will see games from a different perspective in the future. 
Kind regards, 
Marc

author: {'steamid': '76561198159667034', 'num_games_owned': 193, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 2155, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1742, 'last_played': 1581293686}
review: Adventure Quest 3D, the nostalgia and memories this game brings back! I have been playing adventure quest since the begining and have the membership on basically every one of Artix Entertainment games that i have played. Being developed by the original developers of the original Adventure Quest, i know that this game will be a success. For an early access game this game has alot of content, Adventure Quest is a little repetetive but simple, not like other games where you have to grind for days for craft items and then wait more days just to finish crafting said items. Adventure Quest 3D has simplicity but is also challenging enough to keep players engaged, some quests are repeteive but the rewards in the end are worth it! Repetetive at tmes it can be but theres alot of variety for an early access game. The events are fun, Story is hilarious, i still dont understand whats going on other than theres bad guys and that they must be defeated to save the world. If you havent tried this game i recomend that you do and if you have played the other games and want to try a new concept, i definitly recomend this game. Plus you can basically play anywhere, im not near a computer but ill log in on my phone or tablet to help you! The cross platform feautre really is amazing! Thats my review! Ill see you around! Battleon!!!!=D

IF YOU HAVE WMR, STAY AWAY FROM THIS ONE!
After you exit the game the first time, (when you launch it again) your displays are switched (your left eye sees what the right should see and the right eye sees what the left should see). 
After finding a post that this is a bug caused by ingame SS, I did manage (while using 1 eye) to reset the settings and start the game normally but after 3-4 times restarting the game, this does not work either. Now I am left with a game that cannot be played using both my eyes...
You can only use the 'move your hands by your side' locomotion that is far from perfect in a game like this.
Steam SS does not work! (I have no idea why) 

So.... imo this is triple A garbage!

P.S: I have tried to delete that folder, reinstall the game and edit that value (that was 100.000000 to 100.0000) but nothing helped. I did not find any way to make the game playable again. Now it always starts with the eyes switched.

developer_response:
Hey orbelosdul,

Apologies for this double-vision issue you're experiencing with your WMR headset

Could you try the following workaround and see if this helps your issue:
[b]Note:[/b] we do not officially support WMR headsets for [i]Creed: Rise to Glory™[/i]
[list]
    [*]Open a Run window by simultaneously pressing the "Windows" and "R" keys on your keyboard.
    [*]Type "%localappdata%" and press "Enter" or click "OK".
    [*]Navigate through the following pathway: Creed > Saved > Config > WindowsNoEditor
    [*]Open up the GameUserSettings.ini file.
    [*]In the notepad, check what number is displayed next to the "sg.ResolutionQuality".
    [*]If the number is higher than [b]100.0000[/b], change it to [b]100.0000[/b] then save the file.
    [*]Launch Creed and see if the issue persists.
[/list]

author: {'steamid': '76561198002413545', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 14, 'playtime_forever': 1441, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1441, 'last_played': 1496057333}
review:
[h1]Unbalanced RNG and rampant unfairness ruin a very promising game.[/h1]

Put about 20 hours into Football Tactics so far, I'm about ~40% done achievement wise and played through 5 seasons so far.

The game is very promising, there is a glimmer of what could be a very good tactics game, unfortunately, it's a pretty shitty football game. The AI is very binary, and with the RNG dice rolls and the way the AI gets players makes the game inherently unfair. For example;

My last game the opposing team had a Goalkeeper with ~90 defence and one Striker with ~65 Accuracy. The rest of their team was awful and did not impact on the team at all. As my Strikers are ~40-50 Accuracy and my Goalkeeper is ~50 defence, no matter how I attacked it was impossible to score, no matter how their team attacked it was impossible for them not to score. Result, 6-0 loss.

This is further exasperated by the AI. The AI knows that the Striker will score every shot. This means every turn for the AI consists of 2 passes to that striker, and a shot from max range that will always score. That's right, their League 3 Striker scored [b]6 50yard screamers in one match.[/b]


Add to this a lack of crossing or headers, defenders moving one square only (no wing backs in this game...) there are no actual football tactics in this football game. Nearly every match relies on using your best passer to play down the middle to your best striker, score. Reset, do the same again.

I've seen matches where both myself and the AI can score in 3 moves from kick off, lots of 6-6 or 7-7 draws etc. in this game.

The way the RNG works can also lead to massive swings. Whatever the stat is for your player is the max they can roll. So if you have a defender with 25 defence they will roll a D25 for every action, if the Striker has 50 Accuracy they will roll a D50. The Striker is almost guaranteed to win every dice roll.

The skill system is obtuse and doesn't always seem to trigger, a lack of defensive options (Pressing and ending the turn seemingly has zero affect on the AI), AI bonuses leading to whichever 3 teams were relegated nearly always winning the league by huge margins and a lack of management simulation, I really can't recommend the game. The training and sim systems are particularly bad, with players being sold/bought on a whim without needing to go to a team, you can't choose what to train your players in (skills are randomly allocated) and a lack of any real management beyond buying some one shot upgrades for bonus exp.

To finish up fully, I could see myself needing to grind for 20-25 seasons slowly leveling up players. [b]It's often better to deliberately lose games and finish fourth for several seasons than get promotion to a new league.[/b] Every draw and loss has a chance to lose you fans and reduce your income on a weekly basis.

Avoid unless they make significant changes.
developer_response:
It's always hard to know that someone doesn't like your game. But everyone can have its own opinion and taste. So no problem with that.

However, from your review, I see that one important part of the game wasn't clear for you. And it hugely affected your experience. 

This feature is Skills. 

When you master using them, when you start developing your team to get the maximum from the skills, you will see the tactical depth of Football Tactics. Pass+Pass+Kick is tactics for an Amateur League. To win the stronger opponents with higher stats, you have to use skills smartly.

We know that currently, it is explained not very well in the game. So I will write there few important notes:
- the skills are not available after kick off
- the skills give +1 bonus action after performed successfully _against an opponent_

So there aren't bugs in which the skills do not trigger. It's just the cases we haven't explained well.

Other than that, there are few additional notes.

1) You might feel that we intentionally affect RNG to be unfair for the players. But it's not true. There aren't any reason for us to do that. 

2) We wanted Football Tactics to simulate the random nature of the football when even stronger footballers just play badly the whole match. The RNG simulates it. But if you don't like it, start a new campaign and select an option "Less random". With this option, the effect of the RNG will be decreased significantly. 

3) No matter whether you play with this option or not, when you master using skills and building your team with needed skills, you will see that on the big scale RNG doesn't affect your results much. As in real football - if your team is strong, and the tactics is smart - some random losses won't stop you.

4) We are working on the next huge update which will add headers, crosses and other football elements to the game. The game will be much deeper http://steamcommunity.com/games/375530/announcements/detail/590375319499622407

Hope you will win Premier league with very skilled team and change your opinion about our game

Keen Software House

author: {'steamid': '76561198056765622', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 14733, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2560, 'last_played': 1669387664}
review: After five years, the devs fixed a lot of bugs and brought the game to a place that I can reccomend it. But the first four years were still frustrating at times, and I'm over it. If you've never tried this game, it can be fun, and it if you like D&D inspired games then this is for you.
developer_response:
Hi I'mNotYourBro,

I'm sorry to hear that you're disappointed with the game and the range and breadth of issues you've faced with it. I can completely understand your frustrations and we're always happy to try and help where we can, we believe in offering support as quickly, diligently and comprehensively as possible and as you know we have responded to your three bug reports [url=http://brightrockgames.userecho.com/topics/2758-invoking-a-potion-locks-up-ui/]here[/url], [url=http://brightrockgames.userecho.com/topics/2756-invisible-stuck-beast-cant-find-food-or-lair-and-produces-errors/]here[/url] and [url=http://brightrockgames.userecho.com/topics/2757-mouse-delay-on-menus-and-throughout-game/]here[/url]. It's of great regret that we weren't able to assist you in your issues and one remains under investigation for future balancing but I hope you'll agree that at the very least we spent the time to discuss at length with you the issues and investigated what we could with the information provided, we would very much still like to know your system specs so we can see if we have a similar PC for future testing particularly to discover if indeed the AI is falling over for some units on a certain kind of rig.

We completely recognise how disappointed you were in your purchase and as mentioned previously although we cannot personally issue refunds on Steam purchases we would be more than happy for you to request a refund from Steam support with our blessing. We do know it is possible to have a game refunded even if it is beyond the 2-hour cutoff and we hope that our advocacy in this matter would allow Steam customer service some leeway in processing it.

There were a few important points I wanted to address here for the benefit of other customers. Firstly that we take all feedback and complaints very seriously, we have set up extensive support structures and ways for our customers to contact us directly and we review and respond to all feedback as soon as we can. We always take whatever steps are within our ability in order to resolve issues and in most cases the majority of reported issues and bugs will be addressed in as timely manner as we can manage.

It is known that Coherent UI causes issues on some systems, mostly when systems do not reach the minimum or recommended requirements and in the rare exception even when they do. Sometimes when the UI appears laggy it is simply because the Coherent UI process is being starved of system resources whether this is CPU, GPU or RAM, in most cases though it's often limited by the CPU or GPU. This is a result of a number of factors but primarily the sheer complexity of the dungeon itself. Few games go to the lengths that WFTO does especially without using a custom engine with all units running their own autonomous AI and acting in accordance with behaviours. Deformable terrain causes complex pathfinding problems and the number of units can easily overwhelm a lesser specced CPU.

We are in the process of researching a move to a more modern version of this middleware and hope that the performance improvements could benefit some of the lower specced rigs amongst our customers as well as resolve some of the remaining issues without requiring some common workarounds with incompatible systems. There's no timeline for this yet but we're hoping that if we can get it in then it will be in the next major patch for WFTO. As for the future, we're confident that we will be deploying a more bespoke solution for future games.

Naturally, we're always looking for optimisations of our own and have some planned to go in both in the near future and in the longer term for the next major patch and we'll be scouring our code for improvements that we can make. However, we do believe that a minimum G3D score of 1500 (a score easily beaten by even most modern low-end cards and doubled for sub $100) is the absolute minimum required to run the game. Though the recommended score of 3000 should easily be attainable with cards that nearly double it available at retail for less than $140. We also recommend at least a well-specced CPU and 8GB of RAM. 

Most of the issues you covered in this review were also the ones we looked at for your bug reports though to cover a few more things. You can easily pay minions by using the Gild spells as well as dropping gold directly onto them, you can also move gold to vaults where you need it. Though I think there is some solid feedback that is worth looking into which is how units determine where to get their gold from. Currently they will locate the closest vault with gold which makes sense but we might be able to make them draw from the tiles rather than the gold piles themselves so provided a vault has gold they will be able to draw the gold if they can reach a single tile in that vault, another alternative that is under consideration is allow the gold vortex to work both ways so it can be used to pay minions from your gold reserves. Workers will always try to place gold in the closest vault, to reduce travel time so you'll find that some vaults may never be filled unless they have a local gold source. However, rituals like Avarice will fill vaults at random.

With regards to the pause feature, this is not exactly true though I know what you are referencing. The issues in question are with allowing the player to take actions while the game is paused as opposed to pausing the game itself, there are twofold issues here. Firstly there is no way to provide user feedback and it can have unintended consequences for the gameplay. If a player "queues" actions while paused then they will see no immediate feedback to their action as they would if the game was running, likewise queueing actions such as a slap could have serious unintended consequences, further to that its just not in the design intent to allow players to pause the game in this way. As with most coding, there's rarely an insurmountable issue but this particular one has some roadblocks that would require a lot of work for the limited gains. However, I can definitely see the value in having a pause state where you can look around and review your units so I'll see what we can do.

The cultists not returning to work is likely caused by a lack of research being required. If you have researched enough sins to unlock everything then further research will not be undertaken. They will instead look to train up or perform other tasks.

Again I'm truly sorry that the game did not match your expectations and left you feeling disappointed. If nothing else we're always willing to take feedback on board and address concerns, complaints and issues where we can and with each patch we know that the game gets better and better.

Sorry once more and I understand your decision to not support us as a developer in the future.

Take care,

Lee

Hi I'mNotYourBro,

I'm not sure when you last played but we've made huge sweeping improvements since your review in 2017. We released the game in an unfortunate state in April 2015 but never stopped updating it. With over 80 updates since then, 7 major updates containing tonnes of new features it's an entirely different game.

Most importantly the performance and stability of the game has been now greatly improved after huge amounts of development from our two-man code team. 

There is also now the second expansion, the Crucible survival mode, that was free for all! 

If you've not tried the game for a while now might be a great time for you to jump in and see how far we've come since release! We'd love to hear what you think now.

Cheers,
Cian

author: {'steamid': '76561198035600404', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 1627, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1467, 'last_played': 1585693383}
review:
[b] Bueller.......Bueller....[/b]

[b] The Good: [/b]  Fun characters with lots of personality.  I have almost cried from some of the things the duck says.  Voice acting is very good.  The graphics are nice and the maps are interesting.  

[b] The Meh?: [/b]  I don't mind playing the entire game from a stealth mode perspective, however, if you do mind this, I would steer away from this game as it is mandatory in order to survive.  The rewards are dicey, and until you reach the end of the game where you've completed everything, you don't have enough gear, trade goods for upgrades, or skills.  This makes it very challenging.

[b] The Bad (and in my humble opinion this is the crux of it): [/b]  This game may be fun to play, but it is very short, and really not replayable for the price ($35 US).  The blatant "we will not have a presence on the Steam forums" statement from Funcom is outrageous.

It is very sad when the Dev's, Publishers, and the Community Managers (who both work for the publisher), have a whopping total of 4 posts, none of which address any of the feedback, bugs, or general questions that the Steam community has posed.  Two of the posts were the typical set up, and two were concerning glitches and instructions for receiving the deluxe editions at the release of the game.  The Bearded Ladies are a Swedish game consulting group listed as the Dev's which is whom you would normally be conversing with.  They have been absent on the forums and discussion boards.  Funcom, a Norwegian game developer and the listed Publisher has been around for 25 years with titles like The Secret World, The Longest Journey, and most recently Conan Exiles (which they really really care about).  

I would rather give my money to an indie dev, that understands the various gaming communities, is working on the best title they can produce, and will be interactive, and/or, have a community manager (which can be a game fan that communicates with them) to address the community at large.  Bottom line-don't release a title on a platform you are not going to actively be part of and support.

Just my 1.5 cents.

[b] EDIT: [b]

[b] FUNCOM [b] Response to your comments concerning my review.  You guys have been in this industry for 25 years and should know better!  Having someone as a true community representative should've been completed prior to releasing the game.  Note that as of today you have yet to respond to a SINGLE one of the 806 (and counting) general discussion, questions, bugs, and comments posted.
 
As for the Stalker Trials, thank you, but I'm not a fan of competition based play so this is not for me, but I'm sure there are people that already own the game that will enjoy this addition.  As for myself, I'm looking for additional content in the form of exploration, story line, and further character development that is single player like the base of the game.
developer_response:
Hey!

We're trying to improve community-wise, aiming to increase our presence through all our active communication channels and hiring new talent to help us in that regard. 
We've actively gathered feedback from our community which were concerned about the replayability of Mutant Year Zero (as you point out in your review). Because of that, we just released the Stalker Trials to address that concern. You can give it a go and let us know what you think of it!

author: {'steamid': '76561198406592125', 'num_games_owned': 183, 'num_reviews': 30, 'playtime_forever': 126880, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 59458, 'last_played': 1707064984}
review:
(Re-re-review of my old review)
Let me start with this: I left this game around early 2020; that is, I stopped following its updates, stopped playing on a next to day to day bases, and overall left communities I had been part of since 2017; (maybe 2016, honestly I can’t recall) this was my main game in those periods (as you can see by the hours tell), I left though because I found more dissolution between the community and the dev’s; and me feeling that the dev’s felt that they prioritised new content over fixing or fleshing out pre-existing content. Overall that previous review was more of a frustration as a long-time player, and hence why I left the game retroactively, giving it a bad review,
But what’s changed? Now? Why positive? Well as of 27/07/22, I found myself moving out from home and into my own flat, and long short I had no internet for 2 weeks, and my go to games (Sea of Thieves, halo MP, Age of Empires 2) these days all require internet; I found myself stuck for entertainment, that’s when I realised, I had Space Engineers installed still. So, for those 2 weeks I found myself playing it and quite enjoying it; bringing back a passion for it even, made me remember why I wanted to have this game, ever since I saw the yogscast play it, and even the reason why I wanted to get into PC gaming in the first place… 
Its because of this game, it’s fun, put simply, they have nailed that no doubt, and the slogan about creativity and exploration does stay true! 
A lot has changed (or at least from what I remember) from when I last played it, in vanilla, as someone in the past who use to use a lot of mods to flesh out the game, playing it in vanilla (as I had no workshop items because no internet) made me realised how much the game has evolved and how much vanilla has changed, even fleshed out, I had a lot of my old Blueprints on old USB thumb drives, and I’m finding myself spawning them in, half or mostly missing, and trying to refit them into a vanilla style, and to say I had fun, it was like playing with Lego, but in space! I find myself wanting to play more of it. (Though there are 1 or 2 mods I still wish I had…. Larger ramps and seats mainly) 
The dev’s have done amazing things to the game, and I can appreciate that a lot; I still have gripes with the DLC (being someone who thinks that its content that shouldn’t be charged for), I cant say with the community side or developer relationships to the community, but overall I recommend it.
developer_response:
Hello Shallows, 

Please let me respond on behalf of Keen Software House. 

First of all, thank you for your feedback. We are trying our best to address all comments and concerns from our players, especially from those who spent significant amount of time playing our games. 

The performance issues are currently being worked on. It's always a challenge with such dynamic and open world we have in Space Engineers. We optimize one thing, fix it, or add new feature and it always opens a door to new use cases, new limits and new stress levels for the game. Then we must optimize again and look at all options. Space Engineers multiplayer is currently our priority and I can say that we have reached nice improvements in its performance. As we moved towards having the major releases only, we can spend all of our time on major updates and we hope that it’ll bring significant improvements and changes to our game. 

You can find many more details and information in our CEO's blog about the SE state of development: 
http://blog.marekrosa.org/2018/03/space-engineers-state-of-development_13.html

Here is also the link to the latest interview that Marek had with CaptainJack: 
http://blog.marekrosa.org/2018/03/space-engineers-answering-community.html

Again, thank you for your feedback. We hope that future changes will bring the improvements you expect.

author: {'steamid': '76561197994604546', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 55, 'playtime_forever': 6318, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 9, 'last_played': 1686578838}
review:
A message to someone thinking to purchase this game or DLC.

Dont do it. Developer doesent care about players. You will lose your money and time on pointless things. 

Like 1.5 hour battle when you almost board enemy shp and then servers are down for mainteance and game just closes.

Or when you crawling upwind and some guy on ships with same square sails moving 5 times faster than you chases you,sinks your ships and leaves just because!

Or funny battles near friendly ports where defenses wont protect you.

The whole idea of game when wind constantly blows on your ship nose is broken. I spend my mone and time and i dont want just sit and wait for wind change.

And this funny unskippable battle at game start when you die and got to start again was made purely for steam 2 hours anti refund rule. You just cant start the game,see mechanics etc. you need to spend 1 hour on first mission.

I repeat. dont pay money to people developing games of this quality.
developer_response:
[b]1st problem:[/b] [u]Maintenance on game servers prevents a player from playing the game.[/u]

Every online multiplayer game requires server maintenance time to keep servers healthy, for example Eve online requires daily maintenance time. Naval Action is no exception. The warning about server maintenance is sent in advance every day to all players on servers.

[b]2nd problem:[/b] [u]Port defenses are not protecting friendly players.[/u]

In battles port defenses (fortifications) fire at enemies of the nation the port belongs to, and only in a PVP (player versus player) scenario. Port defenses do not fire at enemy NPC to prevent abuse of this mechanic from low level players, e.g. luring a large fleet into fortifications on a basic cutter.

[b]3rd problem:[/b] [u]Wind constantly blows on your ship nose.[/u]

In the game the wind constantly changes according to weather conditions, it is never static.

[b]4th problem:[/b] [u]unskippable intro battle.[/u]

Many games have unskippable intro missions, to name a few: Half-Life and The Witcher series. The purpose of the mission is to show the beauty of ship combat right from the start and show player the ropes of basic combat.

author: {'steamid': '76561198023384477', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 5062, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 5062, 'last_played': 1517033214}
review:
What a waste of potential. I was under the (potentially incorrect) impression that this game would continue to be developed. Seeing that it's released now tells me that they either gave up or decided it was time to cash out. Regardless, as pointed out by others, the combat is lackluster at best, and the interface is not very well designed, to put it kindly.

The sailing, fishing, and a handful of other minor features are nice, but remain underdeveloped. There was immense potential here, from ship combat to battling monsters at sea, a dueling system to reputation with pirate sects. None of that will come about, apparently.

All this is as of full release is a sailing simulator, and while that's somewhat decent (compass, sextant, other tools help make sailing feel involved, not to mention that you have to be your own cartographer), there isn't enough there to justify the price.

What a saddening waste of so much potential.
developer_response:
Hello! 

First, thank you for your feedback and taking the time to write out what you liked and didn't like about the game. I did want to let you know that we will be continuing support of the game even after the full release with bug fixes, balances, and other changes. Feedback like this is important in helping us understand what we did right and what we did wrong. 

I also wanted to assure you that we didn't release in order just to cash out or anything like that. We are a really small team (only 3 members) and we've been working on Salt for around 4 years. And while we loved the idea of content like ship combat, monsters in the sea, etc., we knew that would be a massive undertaking and we just didn't have the team size or resources to do it. I wish we did as I agree that type of content would be great! Instead we focused our efforts on quests, loot, exploration and discovery, and multiplayer and tried to add as much content in that regard as possible. 

We will be continuing to improve as much as we can and taking feedback like this into account in the future. 

Thanks again for taking the time to let us know your thoughts!

The tutorial isn’t great to get started. The best thing is to give some time to developers to fix current problems and then give it try.

author: {'steamid': '76561198126673006', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 12359, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1347, 'last_played': 1703736579}
review: Great game so far! The models are beautiful and the atmosphere feels very realistic. Has quite a bit of bugs and an incomplete UI, but that's expected from an early dev game. Dev's should look into better scaling into the late game and also make it easier to know what modifier means what. This game has amazing potential and I can't wait to see what the devs do with it!

author: {'steamid': '76561197989989921', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 68, 'playtime_forever': 619, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 491, 'last_played': 1600741177}
review:
It's been almost 2 years since this game was released on steam as early access and yet it's still riddled with obvious game breaking bugs.  I've played the game for a few hours recently after setting it aside for over a year, and I've met the prerequisites to promote newcomers to serfs 3 (now 4) times, all on different saves.  I know this for certain because I surfed on numerous forums and even the foundationgametips website to see if anyone else was having similar problems.  
What I also found surprising is that you can still easily soft lock your game if you construct required future quest buildings before they even appear on the quest.  This was an issue when the game was released, and is rather shocking to see when the devs are still adding features into the game when issues like this are still prominent in the game's systems.  It shouldn't take a slight deviation in build order to break your quest, nor should promoting serfs seem so convoluted.

Devs, please fix your quest system and the bugs that are still in your game.  You've built a pretty interesting system, but it's rather annoying that I can't even experience it past the initial stages.
developer_response:
Hi Humpiestranger, 
The residential zoning tool is unlocked when your villagers reach serf status. This will occur when you meet their initial needs of water (well) and food (berries). Berries must be sold by assigning them to a slot in a marketplace.
Although you can click the help(?) button on the bottom menu to get some basic information. The help menu will be improved during and updated to reflect the many changes during development.

author: {'steamid': '76561198826766279', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 43718, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 11528, 'last_played': 1710757101}

author: {'steamid': '76561198038046971', 'num_games_owned': 285, 'num_reviews': 24, 'playtime_forever': 27, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 27, 'last_played': 1620076484}
review:
This game seems like it has some real potential. The graphics are nice, building your own vehicles is fun and thorough, destroying cars feels satisfying, and the controls aren't bad at all.
So it's a shame I have to say that if you want a good car build/battle game, you should look elsewhere. 

Yes, the battles feel satisfying, but that's only when you're matched up with players that have vehicles similar in strength to yours; you could just as easily get matched with people who shilled out some cash to buy packs full of powerful parts and weapons that can demolish your rusty pick-up truck faster than you can say "Where did my guns just go!?".
Yes, the building is fun, after you slog through a number of games with the most basic parts while a tutorial tries to teach you stuff you can learn yourself after just a couple of games and rewards you with almost nothing, grind for a few hundred hours to slowly build the parts for your car, all the while being smashed to bits in seconds by players with far better cars... or you could just pay cash for the aforementioned packs of gear to annihilate anyone else without all that effort.
Yes, the controls are nice, but that doesn't matter once someone blows off two of your wheels/jets and suddenly you're about as agile as a crippled turtle with all the same power.
If you're anything like me, and you're sick of seeing games filled with so many microtransactions you'd need to lock up your wallet if you had a toddler around, then find another game.
developer_response:
Hello.
All parts that affect to the battle can be obtain in-game ways: as the rewards for leveling up or you can buy them on the in-game market. So you don't need to spend any real money to get a weapon, a cabin and so on.

author: {'steamid': '76561198072902807', 'num_games_owned': 378, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 118, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 92, 'last_played': 1488320543}
review:
Graphics aside, ROM Extraction is nothing more than another wave based shooter, and an unfinished and feature-lacking one at that. An orb-throwing gimmick produces a less than exciting gameplay loop of "toss grenade (for lack of a better word), slow down time, shoot grenade" which got old after two or three playthroughs. Oh, and there's an arbitrary time limit of 3 MINUTES per round you play, meaning you can't even play without interruption even if you're playing well. With such a lacking amount of content, the price of admission is ludicrous especially when so many other titles do it much better.

Check out my full review HERE: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=eqk5jp3uqFI
developer_response:
Thanks for offering your honest opinion of ROM. 

Launching with only the first base level of the game was risky on our part, but we really wanted to get it into the hands of players and get them into the world we're building ASAP. While it may be short, quick rounds, we know that players can get hooked into besting themselves and once multi-player comes out, it will be a completely different competitive landscape for us.

We're currently working hard on bringing out our first round of free content to players and we can't wait to share more details with everyone!

We hope you'll want to come back and play again once our new content is out and if not, we still appreciate you offering your feedback to us. We can't improve unless we know what the complaints are.

review:
Cannot recommend at this time. Tutorial highlights some severe issues

1) Dwarven miners will mine * 1 * piece of ore, (they have 6 inventory slots) then place on the rails.

1a) Once placing the ore, they will not return to mining.

2) Built the initial mining operation per the tutorial, rock / ore would simply sit there with no movement.

I think these are simple fixes, since WC got this right 23 years ago, this should be a no-brainer.

author: {'steamid': '76561197972483399', 'num_games_owned': 1027, 'num_reviews': 144, 'playtime_forever': 755, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 739, 'last_played': 1442400484}
review: If you like point-and-click adventure games, this is an AWESOME title. The atmosphere and storytelling in this game are REALLY, really good -- injecting new life into old themes (post-apoc, robot rules/society, etc.) and it has quality voice acting that really helps immersion. I truly cared about the characters in this game and there not only were multiple endings, but in many ways more than one way to solve a problem -- which is rare in games like this. I am generally NOT a fan of Point/Click adventures, but I HAPPILY made an exception to play this one. I was sad to finish it, because it meant parting ways with the world of this game, that I so enjoyed. Where many games disappoint, this unravels mysteries worth knowing... and endings worth seeking. <3 Recommended.

author: {'steamid': '76561198056614196', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 26318, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 5407, 'last_played': 1708454879}
review: Crew 2 random freezing (Not responding) during gameplay...............................and continue stil  no fix ....
developer_response:
Hi Amigo! We are sorry to hear TC2 is freezing for you. Please make sure TC2, Uplay and Steam are all installed on the same HDD. If they are, we recommend installing them on the same drive as your OS. We also have [url=https://support.ubi.com/en-gb/Faqs/000035324/Improving-game-performance-TC2/]this performance FAQ[/url] available. Additionally, we recommend [url=https://support.ubi.com/en-GB/Faqs/000025721/Disabling-Background-Application/]disabling background applications[/url] and [url=https://support.ubi.com/en-GB/Faqs/000025662/Run-applications-with-administrator-rights/]running Uplay and the game as an Admin[/url]
on your PC.

If none of these steps helped, please submit your [url=https://support.ubi.com/en-US/Faqs/Details/kA030000000emSbCAI?name=how-to-submit-dxdiag-and-msinfo-files]MSINFO and dxdiag files[/url] on a ticket. Be sure to list what steps you've already tried as well on your ticket. Once you've done that, please reply back with your ticket number so we may follow up with you. Thanks!

author: {'steamid': '76561197960437408', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 84478, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 60959, 'last_played': 1706998497}
review:
I have been playing this game since the original was released in 1998. It is the gold standard of RPGs, and although many mechanics are indeed dated, it is still a classic. I can't recommend enough for folks looking for an old school RPG to play Baldur's Gate, which essentially resurrected the RPG genre from the grave for PC gaming. 

From the atmosphere, to the no-bars-held difficulty, to the riveting story and power progression, you can't go wrong here.

author: {'steamid': '76561198422199704', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 431, 'playtime_forever': 47, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 47, 'last_played': 1642989223}
review: Has potential, the mechanism of the games are done pretty right, but the "color choosing" and lighting of the game done utterly wrong. Like most VR players have experienced before, flashy and bright coloring isn't a pleasant design for VR even when they do look cool and futuristic, especially if we are using the game as a workout machine... this game won't last an hour before your eyes start watering... and some of the blur effects can even make you nauseating (motion sickness aware!)

author: {'steamid': '76561197996186863', 'num_games_owned': 216, 'num_reviews': 82, 'playtime_forever': 4394, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1378, 'last_played': 1581181043}
review:
This game used to have vehicles, but they were broken, so now there are no more vehicles.  Problem solved!

It used to have stealth mechanics, but they were completely based on character stats and had nothing to do with moving carefully or hiding in cover; ergo, broken, so now there is no more stealth.  Problem solved!

Overall the game suffers from a bad case of "Made with Unity" (i.e. expect to get less than half the FPS here that you would normally get playing Skyrim at max graphics) and an even worse case of "Made in Russia."  Despite all the talk of improving customization, your character choices are sleazy looking white male or sleazy looking white female, as is literally [i]every[/i] other character in the game regardless of their faction.  If you're ever wondering which equipment to buy or equip just grab whatever looks the most Russian because for some [i]strange[/i] reason it will miraculously outperform everything else in the game, every time.

Most of the real problem, however, is that it's trying too hard to be "Mount & Blade + Guns" as opposed to, say, a FPS version of Jagged Alliance 2.  Look, M&B works because it's got swordsmen on foot, archers, horses, mounted archers, lancers, spearmen, formation tactics, and several [i]diverse[/i] factions based on different real world cultures.  And while every battle starts off at a distance (just like here), there is enough terrain variance to make terrain actually mean something.  Those horse archers that kicked butt in the open desert turn out to be nearly helpless when trying to defend a castle wall and conversely Nord Huskarls don't last long against horsemen in the open.

In F:GW, however, there is only one troop type (i.e. white dude with a gun), one terrain type (low woodland hills) and urban combat may as well not even exist because the AI (both yours and the enemy) aren't capable of using any of its cover - not that there's really much to begin with.  City fights are just like every other fight except that you wait longer for the AI to figure out how to get out of town before your snipers blow them all away as they mindlessly rush towards you like always.

In other words, it turns out that the M&B medieval model simply [b]does not work[/b] with modern weapons and/or tactics.  Sorry, but it just doesn't.  Again, I think they'd have been better off trying to steal ideas from Jagged Alliance 2 and turning that into a FPS-type game instead.  Y'know, [i]actual[/i] urban warfare and tactics that are more than just saying "move cautious" or "charge?"

Now I know they've been working hard on this and they've been really scrambling to squash all the bugs (there's a reason why Unity is free, guys - 'cuz it sucks) and I'm not trying to say that they don't know what they're doing or that they don't care.  They are putting forth a lot of effort and it is moving along just fine - but I just feel like it's moving in the wrong direction, and sadly I think that they're already too far along to change course.

It's sad because I liked the game a lot more when it first came out.  It wasn't until much later that I realized that the real problem wasn't the bugs or glitches but something in the very foundations.  No matter how hard you try you still just end up with the same thing every time - a battle between two forces on a summertime hillside that always goes to whoever has the most sniper rifles with "Made in Russia" stamped on them, whilst you, the player, sits there with binoculars hoping to actually spot an enemy at some point before the battle ends.

After about two or three of these non-events in a row I just want to go back and see if I can lure those damn Khergit horse archers into patch of thick forest and then see how they like it when their horses get stuck on the trees and my Rhodok spearmen end up surrounding them in a box formation... or maybe find out of if it's easier to capture San Mona from the east side at night using nothing but suppressed weapons, knives and lots of camo paint.  Here... I just feel like I'm watching an RTS game play against itself while I'm stuck in some kind of glitched observer mode that makes it look like I'm playing, too, even though I'm not.  Not really, at least.  I'm just watching a map from behind a rock, like always, and hoping that I brought more sniper rifles than the other guys... like always.  Wake me when it's over.
developer_response:
Vehicles are canceled because of the modding, not because they needed more work.

Stealth mechanics are just not added back yet, same as more content. Because we were remaking the game like from the most beginning in order to add modding support and some features.

All characters are white because of the game lore, as it is about the Eastern Europe. Everything happening in the same country, so of course different factions does not influence how people look like except clothes. "The most Russian looking" weapons are not the best ones, and we are still working on the weapons balancing in total.

WE ARE NOT TRYING TO BE  "Mount & Blade + Guns" , it's just the closest description of the game which people found. 

AI still wip.

Unity isn't free.

Hi, and thanks for your review!

The game is fully released now (with 3 new chapters full of gameplay and a lot of polishing). We’ve made changes to game balance - now the base level of oxygen is at 75 seconds, some tools have more durability, some items are easier to build, and much more. 

We want to make sure the balance is right now. We would be happy if you could try Breathedge again and let us know how it goes. Let us know your thoughts by sending us a message to info@breathedge.com or visit our discord channel: https://discord.com/invite/eyURQXG and let us know what you think! 

Thank you once again.

author: {'steamid': '76561198140195173', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 22, 'playtime_forever': 2930, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1877, 'last_played': 1708730189}
review:
This was a lovely game and had suuuuuch potential. However, I just read a comment made by the developer it is no longer supported. I have not made it to the final bakery without several bugs. My last one was the bowls despawned and no matter whether I skipped a day or not they won't come back. I can only start a new game. 

Save your money it is too buggy to be a final product.

Addendum: 
So, I wanted to come back to this, because it is one of my favorite games I think I have crashed 10 times, It sometimes doesn't send all the orders and although I am at the final bakery it resets me back to the first one and I can't do anything. May have to restart again. The idea for the game is great. I honestly hope someone picks this up and fixes it. But right now it is at the save your money stage, even a sale, unless you are determined to play this, is not good enough.
developer_response:
As the publisher of the game we want to apologize you. Also we created a devlog with solutions to the most common issues.
You can read this devlog here: https://store.steampowered.com/news/app/1031120/view/3356885688288912108. We can't do anything more without the developers on the board. :( Thank you for your opinion. we appreciate all kinds of feedback.

author: {'steamid': '76561198035449835', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 2359, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2359, 'last_played': 1700177344}
review:
Colony Ship is one of those unique games that only surface once in a decade and it scratches a very specific itch.

Are you tired endless loot that is immediately surpassed by something else? Then this game is for you, revel in delight as you get a chance to rummage through ruins, finding artifacts that actually matter.

The environments are beautiful and I'd describe them as smooth.

The storytelling makes me think of System Shock 2 and Deus Ex, the way it managed to pull you in with abandoned PDAs and such.

This can be a hard game, but there's always an easier way around an obstacle, which I appreciate. You can also do a full pacifist run. Overall, I found it delightfully challenging.

Nothing beats finally setting foot on the bridge... and seeing what's out there.

Summarized: Game of the year for me.

author: {'steamid': '76561198000871950', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 205, 'playtime_forever': 69, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 69, 'last_played': 1675358955}
review:
This game has some potential but for something so simple there are a lot of issues. The combat is alright but nothing to write home about. Some of the movement feels a bit floaty at times. Enemies aren't terribly well balanced. It feels like at any given moment I can either be ripping and tearing through enemies with ease or getting spit roasted out of nowhere. Enemies keep respawning like it's a wave shooter which feels weird in a game like this. 

The worst of it is the technical issues. Settings revert randomly. Lots of hitching, going from 60 FPS to 2 and back again at random. Anything that spawns a lot of particle effects kills the framerate for a second or two. This is not Early Access and issues like that should have been obvious enough to be corrected before shipping it to Steam. 

I may pick this later on but for now it's a pass for me. It's too buggy/janky to put up with for a game that is so simple and that isn't really offering a unique experience to justify that.

author: {'steamid': '76561198041575021', 'num_games_owned': 636, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 529, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 529, 'last_played': 1387717585}
review:
I bought this game out of blue, just from curiosity and nostalgy for the old games. So I expected absolutely nothing from it... And had found a beautiful jewel, proudly shining through the pixels of sepia-colored design. 

I don't want to talk about the plot - you should walk through the whole story by yourself, to feel & understand the world and its inhabitants, to see the whole story from your point of view and to decide, what will happen at the end. I will just say that if you're looking for a game with not-so-simple story, with ability to choose how to solve difficult situation, with an almost alive (figuratively, of course) characters - this game is what you are looking for.

P.S. If you're scared off by the drawing style - believe me, I's bringing absolutely unique feelings about this game. It's totally charming and I couldn't imagine this game any other way.

author: {'steamid': '76561197967904424', 'num_games_owned': 161, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 30856, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 29946, 'last_played': 1692698159}
review:
Had great fun when the game came out and won awards for best early access in it's genre. 
Sailed the seas with my friends, under the flag of my own Nation - Denmark. 
We battled the Swedish, British and French in many wars. 

We sailed for numerous hours, set our course over night via compass and then went to sleep, only to wake up and go back to sailing. Whether it were for fishing in distant regions, or sailing in force to attack the enemy in the mist of the morning sun. 

Nationwide battles for strategic harbors/ports. Well coordinated, everyone working together, with each their role to play. 
Nations had famous crafters/builders/PvP'ers and of course pirates!! 

Now.. the game is free to play, with game devs who has done nothing but sink this once great ship of a game. 
Ships are now set at a price, "OVERPRICED" where as you could craft/farm for them before. 
The game was realistic too, now there are runes and all sorts of "unrealistic" elements shoved in there to try and help all of the mistakes done before, and all the stuff that didn't get done. 

I put roughly 500 hours into this game, went hard to be someone in my nation and put my mark on the map in the pvp world. 
I would have had many more were it not for the current state the game is in, an end result of a very long run of nothingness and incompetence from the dev team. 

Sad. This game once had so much potential. 

Im out.

author: {'steamid': '76561198066574810', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 48, 'playtime_forever': 198, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 167, 'last_played': 1667127117}
review:
Overall fun game, only real complaints are that the troops are robots (as in they only look forwards and won't react to zombies approaching them from the side even if they are visible on occasion).

It also seems that the zombies adapt at a horrifying rate, by the time I was able to secure the smaller side and wall it off they had most of the remaining island, this led to several new zombie variants that were hard to kill and killed a lot harder.

My main peeve is that the "zombie towers of death" where the new zombies spawn from pop up unrealistically quick, as in I'll see 30ish zombies run to a spot and then a tower pops up almost immediately. I could possible understand if they took biomass from a capture point with a pop count but not in the middle of the trees.
developer_response:
So as for the robots aspect they have very limited line of sight that used a more realistic model of what they can see. They actually hear and see within the world which is why its important you use formations and consider breaking bigger units into sub groups to do security and guard your weak-points . Also spacebar slomo is your best friend for this!


The infected do adapt and change as you play mutating as the game progresses to create newer infected. You can combat this by using creeping artillery barrages and  using the special abilities of units to lock down positions. The heavy and Sniper are invaluable for taking control of zones mid-late game.

Its not recommended to attack during Hordes but instead do so doing times of calm. Utilize silencers and hit and run tactics the game also has a stealth system so you can actively drag infected into ambushes if you so wish. Your outnumbered at almost all times.Use Engineers to build turrets and other safety defense to help you and provide you early detection for a breaches along your secured zones

author: {'steamid': '76561198015162915', 'num_games_owned': 587, 'num_reviews': 44, 'playtime_forever': 5834, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 5236, 'last_played': 1599712390}
review:
Playing since the game came out on September 2016. Theres no doubt that this game has the most ridiculous prices you ever saw in a f2p game!

Not only that, the game favors p2w and people who spent money have a huge advantage over others.

You dont have the possibility to get certain cards which only are obtainable if you spent money, BIG MONEY!

There are top10 guilds where people spent thousands of dollars just to be on top! These people literally pay the devs salaries and keep the game alive..cos hey,..who's supid enough to pay 400 bucks for one card!?

If you think these things will change, lower prices, no enormous gap between f2p and p2w i can assure you, those greedy devs wont change a thing. They showed us over the past months how greedy they are and they dont really listen to the community.

Edit:
[strike]They said a few weeks ago they going to make the rewards fairer and dont nerf them like they did with the latest update a few days ago. Prev. you could get legendary stones from challenges and brawls in the arena. Now the only chance you could get those are Rumbles which are every 3 weeks.
Meanwhile, the same players who are always on top of those brawls and challenges are getting their mythic stones - where you also had the chance to earlier before the update in lower ranks to get 10 stones. Now gone, too.
There are tons of threads and a petition regarding this issue and people start to boykott their move![/strike]

Edit: They giving back the leg stones to challenges and brawls.

author: {'steamid': '76561198007848800', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 29, 'playtime_forever': 1819, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 354, 'last_played': 1579142667}
review:
They have fixed the problem! And they responded quickly in less then one day. I now definitely reccomend this game, its great exercise, the mechanics are good, and the Rocky/Creed theme is awesome. Good job guys and this shows that if developers actually listen, good things happen. Thanks Survios_CS!

what I said before, of which all is fixed and they listened! "
I own a ton of VR games through steam and I use them with my WMR Samsung headset with extreme ease. This is the first game in which I am caused to see double and you have to close one eye if you want to not have double vision. Very dissapointing that WMR support is not there, and I am familiar with the Unreal Engine, and its not hard to fix that issue. So if you are using a WMR VR setup don't buy this, you won't be able to see anything correctly. If the devs fix this I'll reconsider, but as of now I am very dissapointed."
developer_response:
Hey maxsalhab,

We just released [url=https://steamcommunity.com/games/804490/announcements/detail/2619297772121439127] Hotfix 1.1[/url] which contains a quick fix to address performance incompatibilities with WMR headsets. 

If you're still having issues after the hotfix, could you try deleting the Creed localappdata folder then relaunch the game?
Steps to do so:
[list]
    [*]Open a Run window by simultaneously pressing the "Windows" and "R" keys on your keyboard.
    [*]Type "%localappdata%" and press "Enter" or click "OK".
    [*]Locate the "Creed" folder.
    [*]Delete this folder, then relaunch Creed: Rise to Glory.
[/list]
Please contact us at support@survios.com if you're still having problems with your WMR headset!

author: {'steamid': '76561198040573815', 'num_games_owned': 1311, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 2812, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2399, 'last_played': 1668497631}
review:
I love the art style, the overall design, worldbuilding, and level design. Many areas simply blew me away, visually.

However, the combat is incredibly basic and the enemy variety is almost nonexistent. The exploration, while visually interesting, did not feel very rewarding from a gameplay perspective; usually a small essence item (currency) or more weapon upgrade materials (you will quickly have more than you want/need).

I wouldn't mind seeing a sequel (especially if the art team has more ideas up their sleeves) but any attempt at combat needs some serious work. For me, it single-handedly dragged down an otherwise amazing - if unpolished and slightly janky - experience.

Also crashed twice, once during a boss fight (rip souls) and once during an ending sequence.

author: {'steamid': '76561198149206745', 'num_games_owned': 186, 'num_reviews': 82, 'playtime_forever': 272, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 36, 'last_played': 1485172351}
review:
[h1] Wasn’t sure what to expect, but this game is awesome! [/h1]

[u] DISCLAIMER! [/u] 
I got a Steam Key from the developer. 
HOWEVER, I got it for Beta Testing purposes. I am Beta-testing the Mac version. I will also be naming some cons. I'm not biased ;)

But, since I tried it out on my gaming PC, I thought I might as well leave a review.

[b] On with the review! [/b]


First of all, the pros. 

[b] Pros: [/b]
[list]
	[*]Good graphics! Because it’s made in Unreal4, that’s to be expected. 
	[*]Voice acting is surprisingly good ^-^
	[*]Quite a few different ships (6 in total)
	[*]Cool sound effects
        [*]Easy to install! Worked on DK2 very well. 
        [*]Works well with the Steam Controller.
        [*]Each ship is super different. They each have a different HUD, speeds, and sometimes different weapons. 
        [*]Stealth mode is awesome! You can't see through your windows, but use a black and orange monitor to navigate! And the sounds it make add to the atmosphere! 
[/list]

[b] Mediocre: [/b]
[list]
	[*]Between loading screens, you have the default, endless, white void of the Steam VR set up. Not a real problem, but worth mentioning. This is a problem with SteamVR, not the game.
[/list]

[b] Cons: [/b]
[list]
        [*][strike]The crosshair is off centre. This might just be because of my set-up, but I’m not too sure.[/strike]
	[*]Sometimes there is a bit of doublevision. Might just be because I am using a DK2.
        [*]Some of the ships don't have the Stealth/Scout/Fighting/Flying modes. This might just be because of the type of ship, but it is something I noticed. Makes the Scout/Combat Fighter a bit less interesting.
        [*]Crazy fast AI Pilots!
[/list]

(Update: Aiming is fine. By moving my head down a little, the laser aligned with the crosshair. Hence why I removed that from the cons)

[u] Note to the devs! [/u]
The minumum requirements might be able to go down a little, as my GTX970 handelled it easily on highest graphics. But that might require further testing to find out if it can indeed be lowered. 



Anyway, I do recommend it. 
Right now it’s a  7/10. 
With the cons fixed I’ll up it to an 8/10 or a 9/10.
developer_response:
Thank you for your feedback.  As a solo dev who relies a lot on feedback, I offer you a free early access copy of SATS - Small Arms Training simulator - so you can give more feedback prior to public release.  

This game is motion controller only and we do not expect the controls problems some have stated.  This game is designed for touch/vive and I would love to personally welcome you as the sole creator of my 4 published games to have a stab at the SATS - DLC - for free well in advance of public distribution to aid in QA and bug testing. As A solo developer who went it alone with failed crowd funding I would appreciate what feedback you have to offer.   This game is down to VR controller usage.  I will PM you personally over the coming days to see if you have the right equipment and to offer you a unique- pre-release beta test.

Thanks for playing,

Shaun Williams  (AKA MAG studios) as an incoming friend request.

author: {'steamid': '76561197965934721', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 18, 'playtime_forever': 99, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 29, 'last_played': 1497063069}
review:
Pros:
Good art style
Graphics and lighting look great
Nice selection of weapons

Cons:
Random audio clipping
Zombies don't make noise when they walk, so you can't hear where they are coming from
No controller vibration with weapons
Can't choose what level to play on
No multiplayer

My biggest complaint about the game is that if you choose endless mode, you have to start from the very beginning and play through some of the less interesting areas before you get to the fun stuff. Why not let us choose which level to play on? From what I saw the zombies always spawn in the exact same order/location. 

Overall the game feels unfinished but I'm going to hold onto it hoping that it gets improved upon.

author: {'steamid': '76561198236162972', 'num_games_owned': 1254, 'num_reviews': 92, 'playtime_forever': 835, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 14, 'last_played': 1696103514}

I'm sorry to hear you are having troubles running The Crew 2. It's important to first make sure that the PC you plan to play the game on meets [url=https://support.ubi.com/en-US/Faqs/000035169/System-requirements-for-the-The-Crew-2-TC2]minimum requirements[/url].

If it does then I recommend [url=https://support.ubi.com/en-gb/faqs/000025721/Disabling-Background-Application/]disabling background applications[/url] and then [url=https://support.steampowered.com/kb_article.php?ref=2037-QEUH-3335]verifying your game files[/url]. Try to launch the game.

If you have continued issues please perform the remaining steps in our PC crashing [url=https://support.ubi.com/en-us/faqs/000025947]FAQ[/url] while keeping those apps disabled.

review: Very fun so far, there are heroes for everyone. Combat needs some refining, price tag for EA is fairly high, I could see this as a super popular FTP, hard to consider $20 fair price but with a better tutorial and expanding on the UI, adding some better alerts to what different things are on the map, would help ease that $20 price tag further down the road. Worth playing and paying for now, with small lag issues about 1-2 hours from launch, considering other games that are $20, I'd say probably wait for a sale or until more content is dropped to be worth $20. Other wise, great game, would recommend on sale, just not $20.

author: {'steamid': '76561198140801438', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 87, 'playtime_forever': 516, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 516, 'last_played': 1643820917}
review: This game is a masterpiece. Amazing story and lore coupled with stimulating gameplay characterized by clever puzzles that manage to be tricky while being perfectly logical at the same time add up to a wonderfully immersive gaming experience. I literally squealed in awe several times while playing it. Audible squeals, at that. The dialogue and in-game text is fantastically written and contains some deep philosophical elements, and while the overall tone is serious, there is a good deal of humour thrown in there, too, mostly thanks to your witty little floating sidekick. The game is full of interesting characters that are fully voice-acted, and the VAs all did a solid job. The graphics are old-school and pixely, but serve their purpose without fault and are charming in their own way. Lastly, the game not only has multiple endings, but also multiple paths you can take towards getting to one, judging from the achievements that I've yet to unlock. Some of these paths I didn't even think were possible while playing the game! This is by far the best point & click adventure game I've ever played, and I've played more than 20 games of the genre. In fact, I would consider it one of my favourite games ever of any genre, simply because of all the 'OMG' moments I experienced while playing it.
developer_response:
What a wonderful review to read! Grateful for your kind words. 

You might enjoy our follow on game Strangeland—it’s different but shares many of the qualities you mentioned in your review.
