author: {'steamid': '76561198045826063', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 42, 'playtime_forever': 124, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 60, 'last_played': 1678056670}
review:
This game features many different aspects:

[b]Survival:[/b] An aspect of the game includes feeding you and your fellow stalkers by rationing portions of food off.

[b]Crafting:[/b] To build your base and survive, you follow an easy to follow UI to cook up food and other medicine.

[b]Management:[/b] You are tasked with assigning jobs to your teammates during the mission loadout to help accomplish more over the course of the game.

[b]Building Sim:[/b] Using material you find, you build different components inside your Refugee base. 

[b]Shooter:[/b] You can't hipfire, and only shoot once by holding down right mouse, then pressing left. It is only ADS shooting.

[b]Exploration:[/b] The areas are small, and while you are free to explore what you want, radiation hot zones railroad an experience for you to play though. You can however choose what mission to do when, whenever you want.

[b]Music:[/b] Great, really on the right path for what is expected in this survival game. 

[b]Voice Acting:[/b] Only in Russian, that isn't the problem the problem is the quality of it, there doesn't seem to be tension during the dialogue parts, and sounds like people reading a script. 

[b]Dialogue:[/b] Branching, maybe? The multiple roads all seem to end at the same outcome.

[b]Movement:[/b] It felt very chunky

[b]Optimization:[/b] Running the game on low settings, i maxed out at 7fps in a majority of parts, making the game unplayable, despite meeting all the system requirements above minimum.

--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

[b]Edit for Developer Response 17 Oct:[/b]
@Legileg I ran it on Low Settings on the following hardware:
GPU: ASUS GeForce GTX 970 STRIX
CPU: Intel Core i5-4460 Haswell Quad-Core 3.2
Ram: 24GB (2x8GB | 2x4GB) DDR3 SDRAM DDR3 1600
where the minimum requirements were
GPU: Geforce GTX 760 / GTX 1050
CPU: Intel Core i5-2500K CPU
Memory: 8 GB RAM

I was unable to complete the Moscow Eye mission to due to frame dropping down to 7 during the majority of exploration. The lowest I dropped was during the Moscow Eye mission, inside the room with the projector, and the area around it, where they dropped to the point where the game was unplayable (5fps). I tried to exit the area, but the chugging continued to follow me. Even during the CNPP initial raid, i was getting around 10fps-15fps. I managed to get above 90fps inside the refuge map area and while inside the "portal dimension" 

When i mentioned the movement felt chunky, I meant that when I move the mouse, the player tends to float with momentum, it feels that the turning follows behind the mouse itself and is slightly delayed when not aiming down sights and not a 1:1 movement ratio.

My second biggest issue was the fact you can't hipfire, which felt like a nitpicky problem, especially in tense situations, when i had a shadow after me, It killed the atmosphere having to stop, aim, then as the creature attacked me, continue to aim then fire. A tense atmosphere would have been kept if  i was able to hipfire while backing up without aiming down sights with a major accuracy decrease. 

While this game is a unique and hopeful experience, I had to return it because in its current state, and use the money for a different game, due to the fps drop making it unplayable for me. I hope as updates come out that issue will be fixed, and I will purchase and try again.
developer_response: I understand that your biggest problem is movement and optimization, right? What is the specification of your computer and what settings do you play on? Do you have any advice for us on how to improve movement?

author: {'steamid': '76561198119351614', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 38, 'playtime_forever': 372, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 316, 'last_played': 1478912884}
review:

author: {'steamid': '76561197996272522', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 16, 'playtime_forever': 1413, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1310, 'last_played': 1625206178}
review:
EDIT: 2021- 3 years after original review and response from dev.
Decided to give this another whirl 3 years after its been collecting dust in my library.

After that amount of time, I can safely say...

Still save your money for something else.

After starting a new game to give it the best possible chance, the amount of visual glitches that should be easily caught during testing, especially since this supposedly received more polish, tells me that the bare minimum was done. AI glitches started popping up with enemies deciding that 0.5 seconds is the appropriate amount of time to search something breaking near them before giving up.

...and with that, the immersion is broken. Why should I invest more time in a game that was buggy before to see if its less buggy 3 years later to figure out the story? In a post pandemic world, games are a good bit of escapism...but if they start frustrating early on, why invest more energy in them when there are toooooons of other games that do not.


ORIGINAL TEXT 2018:
Unless theres a huge patch fixing the bugs, streamling the quests and story, and fixing the pointless huge but empty maps, this "released" game feels like a half baked beta. Basic concept wise this game should be a smash hit. And yes the "mostly positive" is relying on the prerelease good mojo which is highly deceptive. 

But back to the game...you liked Bioshock right? Liked stealth heavy games that had combat when you really screwed up like Dishonored? Like a visually compelling area where theres actually something sinister going on? Sounds like those elements combined should be pretty awesome right? They would if there had been proper polish on stealth, game mechanics, a map that feels alive rather than sparsely populated, AI that behaves as expected, targetting of items for selection in the world as expected, and a quest system that is clear.

Case in point I was curious if foodpoisoning was a chance like the tooltip indicated or guarenteed...so I ate spoiled food. First one made me queasy, second made me sick, the third started some sort of "fatal" counter which the specifics were not exactly know how to buy time....and made mention of the 2 items Id need to cure myself in time. One of them sounded like an item that might exist in areas later in the game, it sounded fancy compared to the junk i was picking up...the other was some form of tea....except it didnt give me the recipe. What it did do was give me a quest, not display progress on it, and not make it apparent that I get the recipe from the quest that was autogenerated while I was puking. I barely managed to get things together in time with maybe 5% health left.

I then later recieved the recipe again randomly after a cutscene....and commented on it like it was the first time I had recieved it.

Its small things like this that are all too common. Good idea for game, bad execution.

TL;DR:
Is the game playable? Yes
Is it fun with all these issues? No
Is it worth the price of a AAA game right now? Absolutely not


Addendum: Continued to play further in. Just got progressively less engaging and interesting. Bugs (with perks and quests) and AI issues can be summed up as huge things on the agenda. Can the game be salvaged? Yes, to passable. Can this game be made into an awesome game? Conceptually yes...it could. But the time to do that was during the years in development....not at release. Large companies can handle a botched release of a game and pull out all the stops including re-releasing it. Compulsion Games? Not so much. 

I really try to find positives no matter how much negativity about one aspect of a game gets. I really do. And I really wish they fix this to be the game that was imagined. But as it stands [currently], I find minimal value in We Happy Few. It had cool lofty ideas and just cannot deliver. Save your money for somethine else.
developer_response:
Hey, thank you for the feedback and for giving the game a try. 

We have released 4 patches since the game launched and are currently working on another one. Most of the issue you've mentioned have been fixed and further work is still being done to continue to polish the game.

We fully understand the frustration of encountering those issues. Now that most of them have been fixed we hope you'll give the game another try :)

Cheers,

author: {'steamid': '76561198133377366', 'num_games_owned': 205, 'num_reviews': 25, 'playtime_forever': 34, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 34, 'last_played': 1681605449}
review:
This sucks that I have to give this, this review because there is some genuine passion to tell history with this game that is very cool. However I ran into issues in my half hour of playing.

* Every other time I click, it tabs me out. I messed around with the settings, cleared my apps so it was only the game and this just kept continuing. I died 3 times in the first mission because of this and I almost called it quits there.

* The Morse Code segment is where you have to translate a message in 4 minutes. This...just wasn't fun. I didn't feel like some intelligence officer racing against time like intended...it felt like a quiz you'd have in a class.

* There are long moments where simply nothing is happening. A good quarter of my playtime so far has just been going to objectives and looking at my phone. 

I hope the game improves - and it genuinely looks like it will - but for right now I need to refund. Hopefully this review ages horribly.
developer_response: Hello TheTestyDuck, we have updated the game with release of our patch 1.1. Significant changes have been implemented. If you want, try it out again. Thank you.

PS: We toned down the buzzer, it shouldn't be nearly as obnoxious now.

author: {'steamid': '76561198315173516', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 180, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 180, 'last_played': 1477845351}
review:
Before this review starts to fade away and you have to click "read more", I'll just state it simply that this game probably isn't ready for most people, especially those unfamiliar to the series. It has a lot of potential, however, so if you like simple MMOs, you might want to go claim a nice name or something. I also note that I have never played any prior AdventureQuest games but have played multiple MMORPGs. As of this review, my character was level 5.

AdventureQuest 3D is a very basic MMORPG. I can't stress that out enough right now. From character creation to combat, most features are very barren and unnoteworthy as of the current version. Limitation is a word that comes to mind, and it is probably due to the game itself only being at its beta stage. Customization has few options, and there are only three (or four, if including the paid-for class) classes the player has to choose from, all of which are primarily DPS-based. 

Honestly, I believe that the combat is what really gets to me in this game. It's boring, and when put together with the general MMORPG aspect of grinding being required, gets very grating. There just doesn't appear to be much challenge. All classes have four moves and a quick autoattack, and most opponents are quickly taken down with them. Teamwork is nearly nonexistant, being basically just slaying monsters together by coincidence with little communcation. There are so many people online, and it is a shame that there isn't any encouraging to work together early on. As far as I am aware, there is not even a party system-- but I could be wrong. Strategy, unfortunately, doesn't seem to be a highlight as of now.

Maps are small and host a few number of unique mobs. Prepare to slay the same monsters 30 times each... with your same 4 moves... maybe with one random person who happens to be nearby. While crafting does prove to be an incentive (making a cardboard crown made me very happy), it is undeniable that it gets repetitive. There's a lack of a feeling of reward that some other games manage to capture, probably because of the grind beginning so early on. The size of the maps only add on to this feeling of repitition: there's little to see, other than the unfriendly neighborhood mobs. I like their designs, really, but after seeing the same faces over and over, that sense of wonder becomes exhausted.

Despite this, the game does have character. I enjoy the cutscenes and the personalities of the many NPCs, which seem highly self aware. It's funny! Descriptions for items often have humorous jokes in them. 

Still, I just don't think that it has enough to keep me playing for long.

However, as said before, the game is in its beta stage. Wandering around the central town, there are plenty of unopened shops for honestly interesting features to come, like pets and housing. The creators of the game, from what I can tell, do want to hear feedback, which is a good sign. And perhaps if you're more willing than I am to play around, you could help improve the game with your own suggestions. It has potential--- but right now, AdventureQuest 3D just feels too bare-bones for me.

So, if you really want to try this game, go ahead. I don't think most players will become heavily invested in it like with other games, but it's worth a brief try, if maybe for a few minutes. And who knows what the future holds for this game- it's probably good things!
developer_response: Hello! Thank you for your review and we apologize it was missed! We are going back through some older reviews so we can gather more feedback. The game has grown a lot in the last year or so and the devs are constantly working on fixing and improving issues and releasing updates/patches almost weekly.  This has been a constant balance as an indie game company with a small staff. We also have a Game Plan posted here that is updated every Monday - https://aq3d.com/game-plan/. We appreciate your valued feedback and hope you will check the game out again in the future!

author: {'steamid': '76561198310948870', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 25986, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 39, 'playtime_at_review': 11488, 'last_played': 1711461568}
review:
I went into this game thinking that I would pick it up, play it for an hour or two then drop it.
191.5 hours later, I really was mistaken, but let's get to the point.
Pros
1. Stellar Graphics that still hold up.
2. Practically endless galaxy to explore.
3. Immersive lore and factions, which are completely optional to do.
4. Wide range of ships and customization for said ships.
5. Combat is entirely dependent on pilot skill and for the most part, not the weaponry used.
Cons
1. Steep learning curve.
2. Mind numbing travel time.
3. Not enough ways to make decent money.

Overall, 9/10 game.
If you're looking for a space flight simulator for a relatively cheap price and don't mind the learning curve, absolutely pick this game up.

author: {'steamid': '76561198004316083', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 1500, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1493, 'last_played': 1660822905}
review:
This game will forever be in my list of favourite games. 
The story, the art, the voice acting, the WORLD and all of it so genuine. Even though all those aspects arn't speical to gaming, all these strengths would not be so powerful in any other medium. You live in this world, and it's just the right amount of familiar and so foreign. At least for me. 

If I ever stop recommending this game it will be too soon.

author: {'steamid': '76561198254452562', 'num_games_owned': 42, 'num_reviews': 31, 'playtime_forever': 1583, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1371, 'last_played': 1684499715}
review:
I bought this game because I love the Rhem series. 

Knut's work is easily recognizable in a lot of the environment and puzzles. There are also some fun non-Knut-like contributions to be spotted in both the environment and the game-play (e.g. little monsters, scary sounds in the cemetery).

Lisssn is a lot smaller than a typical Rhem game. Also, a map of the entire game is included from the very start. The puzzles can be divided into logical, item collecting, and musical. There is no story.

The idea for this game is great : learning something about music. The music puzzles were great fun, and took me back to evenings spent at the music school as a child. I think that for me, if the game would have focused even more on music/sound/rhythm/history, I would have liked it even better.  

The only negative : I have spent over 20 hours in the game, but I haven't finished it; 2 cards are missing from my inventory.
I will definitely replay this game in the future (once I have forgotten most of the puzzles).
developer_response: you know, the locations of the cards are indicated in the map!

author: {'steamid': '76561197984141426', 'num_games_owned': 334, 'num_reviews': 70, 'playtime_forever': 66784, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 40911, 'last_played': 1704555836}
review:
Game is a good long grind.  I enjoyed it because i enjoy long boring grinds - most people do not.  There is very little meaningful action - so I'm not sure why so many screenshots on the steam page are action focused.  There is VERY LITTLE action, just repeating for those in the back.

The game is mostly about exploring procedurally genereated systems and planets.  This leads to a MOSTLY stale and boring experiance - as opposed to handcrafted worlds.  It's a tad more boring/uninteresting compared to no mans sky, because it tries to be a bit more grounded in realisim - thus less variation.  

Anyway, despite being boring, if you like a good grind, this is the game for you.  I'm not negatively reviwing a game for being grindy, but I am going to drive that point home, it's grindy, thats it.  lol

author: {'steamid': '76561197970107455', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 302, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 302, 'last_played': 1577129562}

author: {'steamid': '76561198068198008', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 4968, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2786, 'last_played': 1672428138}
review:
I'm not much of a hardcore gamer (see my profile) and really only got into RPGs for the first time playing Divinity 2 with my husband. But I fell in love with CRPGs because of that and decided to give one of the classics a shot.... Well, I tried and failed to get into it probably 5 or 6 times. I would start up the tutorial and flounder for an hour and get frustrated and quit. Because frankly even this enhanced edition feels very foreign to someone who first played CRPGs in the context of a modern 3d game.

But I kept hearing about how great Baldur's Gate is and so I kept trying and finally after my sixth attempt and after reading some guides online I jumped into the game and I've now been playing for nearly 50 hours. I love it. The writing is so good. I feel like I'm playing through a high fantasy novel. Combat is very complicated from my perspective but I read guides about how important magic protections and buffs are and once I started using those liberally it became very tractable on a normal difficulty. I plan on playing through all of the expansions and the second game using my character. I LOVE how it all transfers and I get to go from a weak level 1 nobody to a level 20 demigod over the course of however many hundreds of hours the game will last. 10/10 Glad I was persistent.

author: {'steamid': '76561197988701024', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 16, 'playtime_forever': 7555, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 5126, 'last_played': 1497050833}
review:
Elite: Dangerous will be transformed in a year’s time. But they’ll have a huge job bringing personality and humanity to their universe. You know how in the Pixar film Cars, there are buildings and cities and roads, but no humans? Well, imagine that, but with fewer cars and the cars don’t talk, and the cars look sad, and it’s always dark. That’s how lonely Elite: Dangerous feels at the moment.

But it’s beautiful, and the very simple joy of flying through it can’t be denied, and should probably be experienced by everybody. And the game’s sound design alone needs to be held up as an industry standard to any other developers hoping to lasso a player’s consciousness like a big sexy audio cowboy. It’s the best sounding game that has ever been.

Elite: Dangerous is a beautiful arcade experience, plugged into an empty galaxy, one so big and bold that it might trick you into thinking there’s more to see and do than there really is. You’ll probably love it anyway.

author: {'steamid': '76561197994926197', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 77, 'playtime_forever': 3484, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3484, 'last_played': 1566078535}
review:
I got about 60 hours out of this game, and mostly enjoyed it. Think I only made it half-way through the campaign, but frustration was starting to edge out the enjoyment. While I don't regret buying this, I don't think i'd recommend it to someone else.

It has been compared to Big Pharma, but although it looks similar they're quite different. Automachef is much more of a puzzle game, and the tight victory conditions on each stage makes it feel like there's only one viable solution to each level. Big Pharma on the other hand is more about business management and gives you more freedom to make decisions about what you want to make and how to do it.
developer_response:
Hey Robotzo,

Thanks for playing Automachef and spending such a sizeable amount of time with the game!

Sorry to hear that overall you felt the experience negative. What would you like to see in the game to make it a positive?

Thanks,

review: My favourite point and click adventure game. Played it when it came out and been under it's spell ever since. The world, the voice acting, the aesthetics, the melancholic world with a search for a deeper meaning, multiple endings and questions that will leave you puzzled for years, makes this game unforgettable. Recently replayed it with my kids and they loved it too. If you like the point and click genre or games with great story, this is definitely for you.

author: {'steamid': '76561198119813451', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 3007, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 469, 'last_played': 1621734762}
review: Excellent game! I had issues at first with citizens getting stuck in sockets, but that was my own fault for not paying attention to the green arrows on the buildings. Dev response below helped me get that fixed, so thank you for that! Highly recommend the game!!
developer_response:
Hi Savetti,

If you are getting the message that a transporter is stuck going to socket # then it means you have blocked either a warehouse or granary socket. These are the 4 storage slots. Each slot has a green arrow that can be seen when placing or clicking on the building.

You need to make sure these green arrows/slots are not blocked and are accessible.

I would be happy to help further and take a look at screenshots or even any savegames to give any further advice or help.

You can reach me on our official Discord server [url=https://discord.gg/Foundation]here[/url]. 

Cheers
Ash

author: {'steamid': '76561198028029393', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 42, 'playtime_forever': 1229, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 744, 'last_played': 1530931760}
review:
Not recommended at its current state. The game is too buggy and feels like an alpha build, with plenty of text that should be used for debugging purposes but has no meaning to the player. Also a huge memory leak issue makes the game unplayable if you play for too long.

The game itself is exactly like Dungeon Keeper, which is good since the official Dungeon Keeper became complete crap on mobile.
I had lots of fun playing, and will change the review if the bugs are fixed.
developer_response:
Hi KillerM,

I'm not sure when you last played but we've made huge sweeping improvements since your review in 2015. We released the game in an unfortunate state in April 2015 but never stopped updating it. With over 80 updates since then, 7 major updates containing tonnes of new features it's an entirely different game.

Most importantly the stability and performance of the game has been now greatly improved after thousands of man-hours of development in out two-man code team spent patching it up. 

As an early access supporter, you even have the first expansion for free, and the second expansion was free for everyone! 

If you've not tried the game for a while now might be a great time for you to jump in and see how far we've come since release! We'd love to hear what you think now.

Cheers,
Cian

author: {'steamid': '76561197999128028', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 23, 'playtime_forever': 117424, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 43098, 'last_played': 1623315867}
review:
Nearing 1k hours I am still fully engaged in both the lore, gameplay, combat and all the community based happenings. 

The community in this game is just fantastic, likeminded individuals are always around if you look for them and join their ranks via 3rd party tools like inara & discord.

VR support is absolutely fantastic, and it's the best experience currently out there by a long shot.

Elite has become part of my life, and has the potential to ruin it ;)

author: {'steamid': '76561198010824743', 'num_games_owned': 7494, 'num_reviews': 316, 'playtime_forever': 278, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 278, 'last_played': 1429203869}
review:
One of the greatest point and click adventures ever created.

Dont get irretated by the pixel artstyle. This game has a fantastic story, a great synchronisation and the artstyle is really art and not an excuse for missing high resolution.

author: {'steamid': '76561197970944492', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 155114, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 126997, 'last_played': 1623094080}
review:
Casually playing this game now for 2000+ hours. I played the original ELITE when it 1st came out on the AMSTRAD 464!
It's a unique, iconic game with a rich history. It's a bit of a grind but you can play Solo, private group or in PVP open. 
This game doesn't hold your hands but there are beginners areas where you can train and hone your skills.
The community, apart from the occasional griefer is very helpful and there are massive amounts of tutorials, support websites out there that can help, assist, plan and even entertain when playing Elite Dangerous.
See you out there in the void. O7 CMDR

author: {'steamid': '76561198063206887', 'num_games_owned': 126, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 438, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 438, 'last_played': 1616560562}
review:
I recently revisited this game after a year or so of not not playing it. No reason to revisit it or start from where I left off, but it was damn well a good choice to!

The story line is HIGHLY immersive and had me wanting more and more with every puzzle solved. After every puzzle I felt closer to the truth and understanding of who I was. I was so enthralled in this quest that upon completion of this game; I felt a void. This void was not because the game lacked completion but rather that I wanted more. I could play an endless amount without getting bored, as I could expect the puzzles to progressively get harder and harder, always challenging me.

For those who haven't yet played: you should TRULY consider this game. The dialogue, story, artwork, animations, and more will surely captivate you.
developer_response: What a wonderful review! I’m so glad you enjoyed the game and grateful you took the time to share your kind words.

author: {'steamid': '76561198002831171', 'num_games_owned': 267, 'num_reviews': 18, 'playtime_forever': 4769, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 56, 'playtime_at_review': 4223, 'last_played': 1712785465}
review: As much as i want to like this game, the devs just have no clear direction on what they want to do.  the most needed thing at the moment is bug fixing, and they utterly neglect it in favor of constantly adding new things instead of fixing whats already implemented which has resulted in a mostly unplayable mess that will either crash, lagg out, or you will end up with patient zero stuck on an electric fence, unable to be killed untill you research shredder rounds, which for some insane reason, now costs 3500 DNA points, which means you will be in for one hell of a grind to unlock them.  its just not worth it at the moment.   if the devs ever actually figure out what they want to do with the game, it could be good, but for now, avoid it and save your money for something else.
developer_response:
We are working on bug fixing and QOL changes extensively in Experimental. We have been pushing to improve overall performance/balance and maintain our roadmap seen here. 
https://www.notion.so/cepheusprotocol/Cepheus-Protocol-31f1b25ce00148d6844825f4a0c0bc08

Patient Zero getting stuck on your fences should have been resolved and if your running into i i would recommend you contact us on Discord/Steam so we can get your save file and see the exacts. For Chelsey to be 3500 DNA you must be playing on experimental. Experimental is not for official full play as we are testing a lot of things on there at any given time.  

Shreader round are NOT 3500 on the stock game and will be patched to a much lower number next experimental build.....  We are testing on experimental with our community to find the right number. 

Roadmap Info
https://www.notion.so/cepheusprotocol/Cepheus-Protocol-31f1b25ce00148d6844825f4a0c0bc08

author: {'steamid': '76561198083111331', 'num_games_owned': 190, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 436, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 49, 'last_played': 1565765080}
review:
[h1] Если не сохраняет игровой профиль и не запускает режим "Завоевание Европы"\
If it does not save the game profile and does not start the "Conquest of Europe" [/h1]


Господа, спокойной... Все работает. 
Заходите в  [u] Steam\SteamApps\common\Cossacks II Napoleonic Wars[ /u] и создаете там папку [b] "save" [/b] ( без кавычек с маленькой буквы ). 
[u] Заходите в свойства вновь созданной папки и убираете галочку "только для чтения". [/u]
И Вуаля - все работает.
Проверено на Win 7. 


Gentlemen, calm ... Everything works.
Go to [u] Steam \ SteamApps \ common \ Cossacks II Napoleonic Wars [/ u] and create the folder [b] "save" [/ b] there (without quotation marks with a small letter).
[u] Go to the properties of the newly created folder and uncheck the "read-only" box. [/ u]
And Voila - everything works.
Tested on Win 7.

author: {'steamid': '76561197987694568', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 66, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 17, 'last_played': 1579100192}
review:
First of all..slicing evil robots bears? Yes! Thoroughly enjoying the 'no fail' aspect of it, it helps lean it twords more than just a game, in the sense that unlike in other games when you're exercising and having fun then all of a sudden you fail... Well you can't reset the exercise/fun you've done/had, you did it, so why can't you just keep going? Though I suppose an option to set it would probably make some happy. 
Also it seems [to me anyways] to require a little more precision and thought about where you need to be, the other game [which I'm sure this one has been compared to] has let me get away with some things I know I messed up. Secondly.. not having to wait for maps, or broken mods to get fixed so we can have fun.. Heck yes! I'm really excited to see how this game progresses.
developer_response: Hi, thank you for your feedback! We will do our best to make our game even better. Please join our Discord to chat with us directly via the link on the game's main page.

author: {'steamid': '76561198039971295', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 6061, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1491, 'last_played': 1711114150}
review:
I'm having a lot of fun playing this, its got RPG & sim elements combined, FPS shooting thrown in and some base expanding. you have to manage your border post as the commander there and hire guards. buy new vehicles, upgrade your outpost & living areas then also upgrade you existing personal etc. you get attacked by groups at times or when transporting prisoners or confiscated contraband which is actually quite fun. you earn money & promotions through doing your normal work tasks, transporting contraband confiscated at the check point to the police station, prisoners  can also can be transported to the prison which all create revenue for you. There are also side quests and story quests which involve choices that impact the game, also action & stealth quests which are quite cool. you can also do side hustles trading or be corrupt and sell contraband if you like.

Have not had any bugs yet in 24 hrs of playing & the game does have a decent story going with cool quests.
pros - good solid game with no bugs
          lots to do and keep you entertained
          FPS combat inst bad reminds of stalker.
Cons - not really bad cons tbh
           Graphics are fair not horrible at all, on par with garage sim perhaps a bit better.
           No save function the game auto saves only at the end of the day when you go to sleep or you can 
           restart the day

Games worth the money, if i had to make a suggestion it would be allowing to save so if you need to quit the game you don't lose progress if you haven't finished the day yet. 
Perhaps slow the day duration a bit or let us have an option to slow it a touch, its not bad just would be nice to have an option to do that on the days you want to do more. hope this helps everyone :)
developer_response: Hey Ghost, thanks for your review :) We appreciate such detailed feedback. We will be making various adjustments in the future updates.

author: {'steamid': '76561198317033717', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 1626, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1616, 'last_played': 1668960666}
review:
It's great fun, until it's not. Like at all. Spent A few hours in a save (multiple times) and randomly everyone is dying of starvation even with food literally everywhere. Dunno if it was a bug, but going from over 150 Colonists to fewer than 60 in about a minute was frustrating. 

TL;DR - Wait until there are fewer bugs.
developer_response:
Hello there, thanks for your feedback,

In Planetbase the AI follows some simple rules, that (hopefully) should be easy to understand: the first tend to their needs: food, drink sleep, morale, then they do work, if they can (all the components, resources are there etc...)

The idea behind the game is that once you understand their behaviour you should be able to indirectly manipulate them, to do what you want, just like you would do in real life if you were managing a bunch of people.

We understand that this kind of gameplay is not to everyone's liking, and some people would prefer more micromanagement, but we wanted to try something a bit different in terms of gameplay for this game.

Kind Regards.
Martiño.

author: {'steamid': '76561198077581724', 'num_games_owned': 102, 'num_reviews': 24, 'playtime_forever': 1695, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1695, 'last_played': 1547932682}
review: no matter what we were doin with my frind , no matter how many times we started over again, because something got bugged,this game is impossible to enjoy, trying to play this game is like hitting  wall with your head, can't fkin connect big cubes to small ones, or otherwise,you must use stupid method ,messing with pistons. Small reactors won't work no matter what and no matter how we were placing them and others little things which destroy gameplay. This game is so many years in development, 0 innovations. Nothing made me say 'wow this game has so many possibilites', because no it has not. developer_response:
Hello, burzum.

Thanks a lot for posting this review. We truly believe that the feedback we receive from our fantastic community helps us make Space Engineers a better experience for everyone.

We are continuing to update the game, fix bugs, add new features, as well improve existing aspects of the game, which will hopefully make Space Engineers the best game it can before it's released from Early Access.

We invite any additional thoughts, comments, suggestions etc. here: https://support.keenswh.com/spaceengineers

Cheers,

Keen Software House

author: {'steamid': '76561197999390811', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 227, 'playtime_forever': 2955, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1536, 'last_played': 1587554657}
review: They have you write a review after the tutorial. That's garbage.
developer_response:
We work hard to make the game as fun and as deep as possible. We hoped that it's not a big deal if we ask to write a review. Once you click the button, the message disappears forever. So you don't actually have to write.

Still, I believe it's not fair that instead of reviewing the game in which we put all our soul, you don't recommend the game just because we ask to write a review.

Anyway, I hope you had fun playing the game. If not, make sure you use the skills of your players. The skills are crucial if you want to win even stronger opponents. Also, using crosses and wingers help as well. 

Have fun!

author: {'steamid': '76561198393991847', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 1673, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 18, 'last_played': 1558290555}
review: In the old simulator, you can select the controller type. In this version is not possible and for this reason, the controller does not work properly (tgy i6)
developer_response:
Hi thomas.bridi,

I'm sorry you're having an issue with your transmitter. The Turnigy i6 is a supported and confirmed transmitter for the sim, so let me see if I can't help get you going.

To start, from the main screen go to Settings, then Add+Remove Controller. Then select your transmitter's profile and delete it. Then quit the sim, and start it up again. Then try to recalibrate your transmitter following the instructions found at this link:

https://drlracingsimulator.zendesk.com/hc/en-us/articles/115001150792-FlySky-Turnigy-i6-AFHDS-6CH

When the sim asks if you want to calibrate the switches, skip that, and complete your setup normally.

Run the sim and let me know the results, please. You can respond here, or if you're still having issues, send me an email here: joey@thedroneracingleague.com

Thanks for your patience.

author: {'steamid': '76561198268811503', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 13662, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 10983, 'last_played': 1707812105}
review:
SCUM stands as a paragon in the realm of survival games, distinguished by its unparalleled realism and meticulous attention to detail. It offers an immersive experience that transports players into a world that, while fantastical, feels incredibly tangible and lifelike. Since its inception, the game has undergone a remarkable evolution, marked by substantial enhancements that have only amplified its appeal. As a strategic alternative to third-person tactical shooters, SCUM presents a compelling proposition.

As a dedicated player, I’m eagerly awaiting the upcoming updates, which promise the addition of AI/NPCs into the game world. This new feature is set to enrich the dynamics of both single-player and multiplayer modes, adding another layer to the already engaging gameplay. I highly recommend keeping an eye on SCUM’s future developments.

I strongly encourage you to consider supporting SCUM by purchasing the DLC. The value it offers far exceeds the initial investment, providing a substantial return in terms of the quality and quantity of content. The development team is highly responsive to player feedback, consistently implementing improvements and frequently releasing updates. Your support not only enhances your own gaming experience but also contributes to the ongoing development and refinement of this exceptional game.

review: I really don't understand how this game is a "Very Positive" rating in its current state. I'm probably left out of the loop but I cannot get this game to work. My first time opening the game it crashed and that should've been an obvious omen but I insisted on giving this game a chance. I've uninstalled, installed on SSD, verified files, etc and etc and still cannot get this game to run for 5 minutes. I understand this is an early access game and I really wanted to give this game a try because the features looked like there was plenty to offer but that doesn't matter if we can't get the game to functions properly to even get a chance. I hope the game eventually gets to the point where it's working, not just smoothly, just playable and I might give it a another chance but for now, very disappointing. .

author: {'steamid': '76561197963119802', 'num_games_owned': 541, 'num_reviews': 54, 'playtime_forever': 7302, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3219, 'last_played': 1508925925}
review:
We started this game the day it was released into Steam, I put over 120 hours into this game and it was wonderful, I myself was having a blast playing as Canada in a simple 22 man game, which we made it to Day 6 and then.. their support for the Steam game seemed to have dropped, as they let hundreds of players games just disappear, no word no support, they have a Steam Promotion going right now..

Come join us on Steam, you will get free currency!! <-- This is a complete trap, considering they just delete the servers whenever they want, and all your gold and time go with it, no word no nothing. Just donate again right?

We waited all day Tuseday October 24th for some simple service from them, yet they gave us nothing and let us sit there unknowing to what happened and why this happened, I am sure many others are in the same exact boat, considering they couldn't even handle a 22-man server, and they offer 100-man servers. 

- Game was amazing when I was able to play it.
- Lots to offer
- Zero Steam Support
- Zero Cares for its population
- No backing for their own Promotions, they lure you in, and burn you out.

I can't recommend games that trap players, specially players who don't have the most time to offer and/or limited resources, as this game requires tons of time, and if their going to just randomly delete your servers, all your time and gold is gone.

Who'd want to recommend, let alone PLAY that?

Goodluck!


EDIT: The servers did come back up, over ten hours later however.. units still moved, resources still ticked away and continued on without us.. I will have to sit this one out for awhile.
developer_response:
Hello Zhuge,

sadly we had an incident yesterday night, which caused some games to be not reachable. We immedietly started to work on a fix and by now all problems should be resolved. 

I can assure you that we don't just delete games. Also for people that don't have time for games that run up to 60 days we have different events that offer games with 4x speed. 

We are sorry that you had a bad experience after you seemed to enjoy the game and maybe you want to give it another try and participate in one of our speed rounds.

author: {'steamid': '76561198026079008', 'num_games_owned': 310, 'num_reviews': 19, 'playtime_forever': 4769, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1378, 'last_played': 1463164569}
review:
I just wanted to try the game out, thinking it looked cool and even though it looked like there were some complaints about the AI(however what game primarly focused on AI doesnt have AI problems?). So I jumped in with very little clue what I was doing, the tutorial covered the very basics of sustaining a base, but nothing else. I thought this would be a problem, but I found with the tool tips and descriptions as well as the liner unlocking of buildings helped. 

My first 4 times playing were straight up failures one failure took me 4 hours of gameplay before everything just went wrong, I probably could have saved it. but I was so frustated I just turned off the air, until there was silence. after a couple tries I don't see how the gameplay would get old quickly, so many things can change the entire pace and direction of the game. the decisions you have to make are meaningful in the present future and very long term. 

some of the things I love,
the graphics,
the random terrian
the minimalist UI
and the AI works under most conditions.

some of the things I don't like/think should be improved
The UI, I apprecaite that there are not tons of menues and screens always on and in my face, but putting everything in one corner. some things I think should be outside of the submenues, like the security setting, when you need to change to yellow or red alert, going to the menu clocking managment options and then clicking secerity and then going to the pop up in the middle of the screen and selection which alert you want to set, feels way slow. 

On the topic of UI I would like to see better statistical information, and predictive information like how much food you need for a civilian a day, and compare that with your storage, and beyond anything that is a convince like that I would really like to see more information about your storage, and people. 

I don't feel like im in charge, but instead I am doing things and they are reacting, and sometimes in a way that I don't like or in certain cases in a way that they kill themselves...

There is no way to force a person to do a thing, if your colony is failing, it is extreemly hard to fix, as without being able to force one or two of your people to do one thing before anything else, they will make small problems worse, during food shortages ive noticed not so hungry people eating while someone is starving and never can walk to the food in time to get any(in that case though they did make it).

the priorty system is meant to fix the above problem, but it does not work all the time, in my expirence it works if everything is running smooth, but if all your people are tierd, hungry, thirsty, sick I have never seen them do what I marked as priority but instead do the least important things, like carry supplies to storage, when I could really use the medic to be making medical supplies in the machine that has all the reqired materials in it and is 70% done. 

I still would say the AI is good, Ive never seen pathing issues or anyone getting stuck, if they are not doing anything there is a reson why, even if its stupid like they are tierd or where hit by an metor. 

The game is fun, every decision matters and I cant count the amount of times where one night the wind did not blow and power went out, keeping the situation under control with your hands behind your back(becuase lack of control) is really fufilling when you succsed.

author: {'steamid': '76561198098035566', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 441, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 63, 'last_played': 1646914570}
review: I just bought this game and its crashing in tutorial and main gameplay ,i have farily decent i5 4th gen intel cpu 4gb ram 2gb nvidia 820m laptop, please fix the bug
developer_response:
Hi,

Please make sure the game runs on the GPU and not the Processor, sometimes it does not get recognized as a game and laptops run it on the CPU.
Also update your Nvidia drivers, old drivers can also cause crashes and fps problems.

If this did not help, please send me your logfile so I can analyze the problem!
Here is explained where you can find it https://strayfawnstudio.com/community/index.php?/topic/651-please-read-this-before-posting/

You can send it to support@strayfawnstudio.com and I'll have a look.

Hope this helps!

Cheers,
Micha

author: {'steamid': '76561198078535004', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 39, 'playtime_forever': 22, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 22, 'last_played': 1617929771}
review:
Game runs poorly. The music often "jams", playing the same 0.5s on loop for ~10-15 seconds like a broken record. Kinda important for a rythm game. I also get multiple freezes while in menus.

developer_response:
Hi XenarTrem,

that’s odd. We haven’t heard of such a behavior before. Are you playing wireless? Could you please send us your hardware specs including your headset as well as your player.log and player-prev.log from “C:\Users<yourusername>\AppData\LocalLow\Five Mind Creations UG (haftungsbeschränkt)\PowerBeatsVR” to support@fivemindcreations.com? We would like to have a look at your issue and see how we can help you.

Thanks!

author: {'steamid': '76561198052452517', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 2907, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2255, 'last_played': 1684767158}
review:
This game is now over 2 years old and the bugs have not been fixed?

I cant finish the last mission due to horenndous lag.

Is there any way to fix this?

I have a GTX970m, i7 processor with 16GB of RAM
developer_response:
Hi Anthonymarc,

We're always looking for ways to improve the performance of the game, however we would expect the majority of players to have no issues with completing the game without serious performance issues.

This could indicate you've run into a very specific issue and we'd like to look into it just to make sure whether there is in fact something very out of place.

If you like you can drop us a line on our [url=http://brightrockgames.userecho.com/forums/1-war-for-the-overworld/]bug tracker[/url]. Be sure to include as many details as you can and please include the core details, output log and ideally a save file as described in [url=http://brightrockgames.userecho.com/topics/118-how-to-submit-a-bug-ticket/]this topic[/url]

Could you also clarify if this Level 13 of the main campaign or level 4 of the DLC you're having issues with?

Cheers,

Lee

author: {'steamid': '76561198286165937', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 31, 'playtime_forever': 551, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 491, 'last_played': 1669578379}
review: what a ride this was. a cool game with awesome art direction and an interesting storyline. it's a short game, but the puzzles will keep you around for a bit depending on your skill. the only gripe i have with this game is the puzzles, more accurately the items. by the end of the game, i had a great amount of items that did absolutely nothing. i understand that there were different endings, and i have no doubt all the items had some sort of use, but you can get items that you needed earlier that cant be used after that time frame. this confuses everything. now, i wont lie, i am admittedly salty that i got the worst endings, but regardless, with multiple endings in a point and click, you should probably make items that wouldve caused different endings (but can't anymore) to be inaccessible. Oh, and another thing, some of these puzzles are really dumb. i had no idea i had to right click on the junk after getting the quest to find glass to look for it, so it was a wild goose chase until i happened to find the solution. two words. T o t a l l y u n i l l u m i n a t i n g .
developer_response: Glad you enjoyed the game despite the flies in the ointment. :)  I appreciate the candor and balance.

author: {'steamid': '76561197970814505', 'num_games_owned': 423, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 378, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 378, 'last_played': 1571761221}
review:
Hi all,

this is a good adventure game worth your while!

Graphics are nice, sound is really good and the handling is just amazing. Drifting 0G or having a satalite dish at your hand really feels like this. Vertigo included!

Also the whole "solutide" alone in space ... with no people ... just your imaginations, a sweet robot and sound files will get you after time!

Story is nice, loved to very important "energy crisis" and what it could mean and well worth a DLC to get Sarah back :D

Only drawback ... it is too short. I needed around 6h ... with some dying and as a streamer who talks a lot. Ofc if you go for all goddies its a bit longer but still ... there is enough space out there to fill more time.

Still worth playing :)

author: {'steamid': '76561198083994389', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 764, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 764, 'last_played': 1669305620}
review: Still waiting for multiplayer Linux (proton) support for after several years.  Poor performance on my older Windows PC.  Can't say much about the game play itself as I could never get into it as a single player game.
developer_response: Hi Garfield[cat]! We're sorry to see that the lack of Linux support has diminished your opinion of the game. What we can tell you is that we currently focused on deliver a bug-free, feature complete and optimized 1.0 version of SCUM, but we manage to hit that - we'll see! As for the older PC's, the game has a minimum and recommended specs that are listed on our Steam page. We do not know how old is the PC on which you tried to run SCUM, but what we know is that you do not need to have a top-tier expensive gaming rig to run our game. That being said, we hope that this does not dissuade you from playing and enjoying SCUM eventually and that you will hopefully find a way to enjoy and play it in a manner satisfactory for you.

author: {'steamid': '76561198048914936', 'num_games_owned': 122, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 5589, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 4405, 'last_played': 1632776534}
review:
The first AE Game i've ever played was Adventure Quest Worlds (2D MMORPG Game) just like some people here in the reviews. This game was my childhood and i loved every second of it, i still play it to this day! I've also played other games like the original Adventure Quest, EpicDuel, HeroSmash, OverSoul and Undead Assault.

 When i first played this game, i thought it was really nice but little things to do, i got a bit inactive on the game once i reached the max level cap at the time when Ashfall Part II released (Level 18). I did get in recently when the game got a few redesigns and it looked awesome, i just logged in today and i was really excited to see so many things to do, i'll be definitely playing this game more now that there's more quests and places to go. Overall its great to see the evolution of AE's games from time to time and a pleasure to be part of the community and see the huge improvements you guys make every single day and a real honor to have your games' as part of my childhood. Hopefully everything works out for you guys here on Steam once AQW for Unity hits!

Now back on topic, i do recommend this game if you're into 3D MMORPG Games, the Staff from Artix Entertainment are real kind and nice human beings and you'll be welcome with open arms to this community, make sure to check out the other games from the AE Team too and give them support if you can!

author: {'steamid': '76561198136421655', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 513, 'playtime_forever': 385, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 385, 'last_played': 1651482893}
review:
[h3]🍿 5min VIDEO REVIEW[/h3]
https://youtu.be/XUGQrXs8h0w

🔵I spent 6+ hours on a BETA pre-release version + my comments are based on that 
[h3]🍿 WATCH UNEDITED GAMEPLAY HERE[/h3]
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=-UJazY-nciQ&list=PLqCcKPhsV5eAhaOCfqBbiErxK5BWY0jm8

[h3]GAMEPLAY [/h3]
🔵Run your own Bakery, order ingredients, agree contracts, Bake & Deliver before Time Runs Out!
🔵Manage finances, resources, upgrades and expansions.
🔵Unlock new equipment, vehicles and recipes by increasing your client relationship.
🔵The game gets progressively more complex and time sensitive.
🔵Roadblocks hinder you when driving.
🔵You do have BOOSTS to help bake things quicker.
🔵Upgrading the premises and the machines really help you to bake a lot more produce.

[h3]POSITIVES [/h3]
✔️Reasonable price.
✔️Challenging.
✔️Looks Great & the food looks good enough to eat.
✔️UI + Interface is excellent.
✔️The game is a LOT OF FUN for all ages and genders.
✔️A nice collection of modules for progression, upgrade and expansion.
✔️Easy to learn, tough to master (especially with the bugs I encountered lol).
✔️This game delivers a wonderful dose of feel good factor.

[h3]NEGATIVES[/h3]
❌BUGS in BETA (pre-release) def did hinder my progress (I still really enjoyed playing)
❌Sometimes clicking and placement is a bit off (minor irritation).
❌Not really a simulator...They could do so much more with this game IMHO.
❌The driving is really basic and underdeveloped, again so much more could be done.

[h3]STAR FEATURES[/h3]
⭐Graphically the game is really pleasing & there are hours of fun to be had in this game.

[h3]RECOMMENDATIONS[/h3]
💡Bit more realism for me....Washing up, items I buy don't vanish each morning etc... Otherwise really fun.

[table][tr]
[td]🔵 POI[/td][td]✔️ Pos[/td][td]❌ Neg[/td][td]💡 Ideas[/td][td]🍿Video[/td][td]⭐ STAR ITEM[/td]
[/tr][/table]
developer_response: Thank you for your honest opinion!

author: {'steamid': '76561199025623040', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 7220, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 6471, 'last_played': 1601518790}
review:
I would not recommend Steam or the Drone Racing League Sim.  RealFlight or any other purchase that you can buy and have on your PC is a much better option than something that relies on the internet to function.  If you don't have a decent understanding of EVERY environment your software will be used in, you do not have any reason to be developing.  I can't fathom how this sh!t ever gets approved.  Had I known this prior to purchasing my money would have gone elsewhere.  I am purchasing software to own it.  Not rent it out when I have a data connection, or only use it in those cases.

Due to KaNoodle's response and support, I have modified the recommendation for the game to a 'Yes'.  

BE AWARE:  You WILL NOT be practicing while without data connection.  That means flights, airports, car rides, stuck in a factory... etc.  are out of the picture and you will need an additional simulator.  I didn't mention in the review that the simulator is a 5 star application because I was too concerned without being able to use it when I have the time.
developer_response:
Hi there!

Im sorry to see you are unhappy with the fact that the sim requires an internet connection. However I can see that you have hundreds of hours enjoying the sim, and the Steam store page states that the sim requires an internet connection. So I'm curious why the change of heart and where this frustration is coming from. We would love to help you troubleshoot any issue you may be having, or even if you'd just like someone to chat with, or even fly with in the sim. We're here for you either way. 

Send me a message, I've sent you a friend request, perhaps we can get to the bottom of your issues and see you with a smile on your face again. 

Thanks so much for your support! Looking forward to flying with ya! 

TK

author: {'steamid': '76561198043366416', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 653, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 400, 'last_played': 1685731069}

We understand how this can be frustrating, especially since it seems to be preventing you from even logging into the game. For troubleshooting, we recommend that you reach out to our devs directly at artix dot com slash contact. Thanks for bringing this to our attention-- we hope to hear from you soon!

author: {'steamid': '76561198967655473', 'num_games_owned': 191, 'num_reviews': 614, 'playtime_forever': 64, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 64, 'last_played': 1691530441}
review:
This game is literally just a generic RPG game that follows every single form of generic possible.

Mediocre music, mediocre gameplay, clunky camera, mediocre graphics (would be considered shit graphics nowadays).
Honestly just a mediocre game all around that takes way too much time to progress significantly. It's not a bad game, I just don't recommend it. There's far better games out there and I would rather invest the limited time I have on other games than this one.
developer_response:
Thank you for your feedback. AdventureQuest 3D is based on our original AdventureQuest game via BattleOn.com that was created in 2002 and also inspired by our first MMO AQWorlds via AQ.com that was created in 2008. The developers work hard to release enjoyable, exciting and funny content, and if that means it is generic, we are okay with that as long as players have fun! All of our in game content, artwork, animation, music, etc are done in house - we have never taken ourselves too seriously and just like created games players can play when they have time that makes them smile. 

If you are having issues with the game, such as with the camera, please make sure to go to the game settings or you can contact Artix Support via artix.com/contact for help. We hope you continue to check out AQ3D and they update the New and Game Plan via AQ3D.com frequently.

author: {'steamid': '76561197992277997', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 37, 'playtime_forever': 425, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 425, 'last_played': 1568055761}
review:
7 hours of multiplayer and half the base simply disappears after a client crashed. Now nobody wants to play the game anymore.
Game makes you fly 34km to a strong signal, and then when you reach it, it just disappears into thin air right in front of your eyes. If you mine a lot, rocks will simply disappear (I was hoping they had just merged, but they didn't), sometimes you come back to a mining site and are unable to pick up rocks anymore because they are no longer registered as objects.

This game is a more refined yet buggy version of Minecraft. You need tons of time to achieve miniscule things, which is not bad per se, but you should be very aware of this when considering playing it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198031058131', 'num_games_owned': 399, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 1500, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1417, 'last_played': 1604371875}
review:
So, tl;dr, game with great potential, which makes it kinda great, but it does have downsides.
Also I wanted to get most of the game's content before writing this, but you have to farm a lot with the little content before getting the rest.
Neon Abyss, is a rogue-lite(Kill stuff, loot stuff and get rekt) but some gameplay decisions are curious.
First, the game handles the rogue-lite stuff pretty well, you don't have to rely much on RNG, you can still get ressources with various tools, all weapons are beyond broken as long as you get items, so git gud and you're good to go.
Then the game replayability is okay, you often see the same room patterns early in the game, but you'll get to see more later on the game by unlocking the game's features.

So yeah, it's pretty fun on that part but...
Enemy variety is pretty low, at least, for the first 20 hours, I think I managed to see something 70% of the enemy pool, but it's often the same thing, small flying melee, big flying melee, flying ranged, flying "minelayer", "slimes", crabs and etc...
They differ a little, but they only get  variants, like, weaker, stronger, has contact damage and etc... But mostly, it's the same enemies.
The issue is not really this, but it's the very same encounters from Level 1 to 9. You don't feel like really progressing.
The enemies are not themed, it feels like the same level over and over, but it gets harder and harder.
Also, everything deals one half of damage, but when you get to the level 5 everything deals 1 full heart of damage including your bombs or evironment, there's nothing with varying damage, like, an elite doing more damage, or something.

Following this, the game is punishing, not like you would expect.
Enemies are spawning instantly, without any visible warning, I mean, they spawn like this, and immediatly attack you, or worse, you'll get an enemy with contact damage spawning ON you. It doesn't feel fair, you get damaged for no reason, and it's just feel frustrating like another enemy who throws grenades while trying to teleport on you without telegraphs. Especially when you try to get a wisdom portal.

The game pace is ... well, I can't tell if it's really bad or not.
What I mean by pace, is how fast you get to see new content, spoiler alert, It's really slow, the game feels short, and the unlockables feels little, you have to defeat 5 bosses to get a single item, and that's only for the first branch, and it gets longer and longer. Yes it does add longetivity to the game, but it doesn't feel that rewarding, because the default item pool and room presets are really small.
Well I guess it's a little bad after all.

And then that depends on the person, but you get overpowered really fast and easily, most items are items that improve your guns and add stats (damage, RoF, Range, Multishot...), so even your starting weapon can be Godlike. Bosses feel like ads, and they are not really impactful, but Hal and Argus, who feels like bosses but are still weak because of itemization.

Despite all of this, I think the game is cool, pretty and colorful, and I will continue the game, BUT I don't recomend it, unless you are patient, because alot of things are frutrating, but if you manage to get past that you'll get well rewarded with an overpowered caracter and a succesful run.

PS: Oh also, we are on pc why do we have simplified keybindings >:c
Give my dodge roll on another key than use !
developer_response:
Hey Mechawoo!

Thanks for taking the time to make a review, sorry you've had a mixed time!

We have dropped the 1.2 content patch which from some of your gripes adds teleportation symbols where teleporting enemies come in, plus when you enter the room it shows you where the monsters spawn.

On our experimental branch where you can test things early, we've also detached the power key from the melee key which should help.

There's lots more improvements, including to boss HP and weapon balance, plus loads of additions like new enemies, boss, rooms and much more in both live and experimental.

The full notes are here: https://steamcommunity.com/games/788100/announcements/detail/2952633082352515389

We hope you give Neon Abyss another chance!

author: {'steamid': '76561197960739818', 'num_games_owned': 721, 'num_reviews': 42, 'playtime_forever': 463, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 463, 'last_played': 1514409487}
review:
A really pleasent game, although it's to be expected from Wadget Eye. Aside from a technical hitch where the game started with a black screen, it played flawlessly.

Although short, the story was well written and really interesting. The puzzles for the most part wern't too odious (although I had to reach for a guide once or twice) and were generally fun and more to the point logical. Some of the puzzles were apparently optional but it doesn't feel like I missed anything and nothing felt like a "sidequest". In addition, your actions do have the odd consequeces and there are several endings available.

Initially I was put off by the whole 640x480 thing that AGS has going and the way it crappily scales up, but all too quickly I was gripped by the art style - that pixel art is glorious.

It would be interesting if further games in this setting are released.

author: {'steamid': '76561199038157176', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 834, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 263, 'last_played': 1606194342}
review:
Not a good MMO overall (on PC), for mobile this is very good and better than most releases.

The aesthetic is very nice, quite dated graphics but because it's cartoonish its charming instead of ugly.

It seems very F2P friendly, nothing seems to be locked behind paywalls except cosmetics. This is a big plus. 

Where it sucks, depth and gameplay. The questing is still generic 'Kill Wolves', 'run over to the tree and 'Click on the tree'. There is literally no other quest type, seriously. No attempts at making puzzles or different experiences, just killing and clicking over and over.

The ability system its very accessible for mobile which is good, but again its terrible for PC. You have 3 skills, 1 'ultimate' and 1 cross skill. Cross skill cooldowns tend to be 30 seconds and the ultimate isn't something you think about other than 'click once its ready' so what this means is you spend 90% of combat pressing the same 3 skills. For classes like Warrior this means whatever is on cooldown.

I see with classes like Rogue they tried to add micromanagement to the barebones skill system. Its a good try but again the 3 skills format is too limited. Once I unlocked the cross skill (which is supposed to be shared? But for some reason looks designed like its only usable for Rogues) which seems in design to essentially be the 4th skill of the class, it felt alot more complete. I feel like even 1 extra skill for every class would have gone a long way to improving the feeling of complexity

As it is it's worth it if you are a mobile gamer, or a PC gamer who plays for casual, mobile style fun - 20 to 30 minutes log in, grind a bit, log out. If you are more invested it's probably worth skipping. There are certainly better choices out there, with more meat to the combat and meat to the questing experience. But try it out yourself and decide.
developer_response: We appreciate your checking out AdventureQuest 3D and for your feedback. The devs are working on updating the game and fixing issues, while also releasing new content, which is a challenge as an indie game studio. They are continuing to improve quests and combat while hand drawing and modeling artwork which is influenced by cartoons/anime and inspired by our original game AdventureQuest at www.Battleon.com. We hope you keep checking AQ3D.com for updates, which includes the Design Notes and the Game Plan. Thank you!

author: {'steamid': '76561197986184047', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 23, 'playtime_forever': 20338, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 15147, 'last_played': 1606014360}
review:
I'm going to review this game based on 3 categories and then I'll address some common complaints people have with the game and what I think about them.

[h1]Graphics[/h1]
The graphics in this game are great, pretty much the kinds of graphics you would expect with a space themed game. Nebulas look amazing, lighting effects are great, stars in the distant are as you would expect them, everything is in the right place graphically. What I enjoyed most was how the lights of suns kind of differed depending on what class they were, so for example if you landed on a planet with a sun that shined a blue light, the planet surface would have a kind of moonlit night feel to it rather than that of a scorching orange sun.

The ships and stations all look great (although there are currently only 3-4 looks for stations, to which they'll hopefully add more). Everything in this game graphically draws you in, it's all very immersive and the HUD does a fantastic job of making you feel like you're an actual spaceship pilot, I can only imagine how much more amazing it is with VR.

What's even better though is that this game runs very very smoothly, with a decent rig you could probably play this at resolutions higher than 1080 with no problems whatsoever. I play it on a GTX750ti and I have 0 issues playing the game on a mix of high and ultra settings, and I get 60 fps no questions asked in space, with drops into the 50s and high 40s on planet surfaces. Keep in mind that planetary surfaces are still being optimized for and apparently in the next patch (2.1 engineers) there are a lot of optimizations on that front to make planet surfaces also run much better.

[h1]Music/Sound[/h1]
The sound in this game is absolutely amazing, the roar of engines in different phases of flight is always very nice to hear. Different sized ships also have different sounds, some having a more meaty sound to portary the amount of power needed to push the giant piece of metal around, while some have a more high pitched hum of something like an F1 car. The sounds once again like the graphics do a fantastic job of immersing you into this world, your ship's computer talks to you to give you warnings and status updates if you turn certain modules on and off, and in the next patch it seems like air traffic control of stations will also be voiced and give you directions into the station, calling you by your ship's call sign. All this does is add even more to the immersion. 

In the music department, what is there is great, it has a kind of "Interstellar" vibe to it and it really matches the game's theme. I only wish there was more music to listen to while you fly around the galaxy. This wasn't too big of an issue to me though as I found myself having spotify on in the background most of the time anyway.

[h1]Gameplay[/h1]
If you ever played any other space sim/rpg game this will be familiar to you. A couple months before I tried this game, I had played "Rebel Galaxy" and this game is somewhat like a bigger more immersive version of that game (atleast for the amount of time that I played it, I'm not making a direct comparison). You start with a small multipurpose ship that's capable of doing almost any task but not very efficiently. It's up to you to start making money and setting goals for yourself, this game [b]DOES NOT HOLD HANDS[/b]. To make money you can explore, trade/spacetruck, or go into combat. 

The [b]exploration[/b] in this game is very enjoyable if you're into space and the idea of exploring a realistically modeled galaxy. What I mean by realistic in this case is that the galaxy is not litered with interesting things, for the most part you'll run into an ordinary yellow/orange sun, with a couple of barren rocky planets orbiting it. However, sometimes you run into some interesting views, maybe you find a super massive gas giant orbiting very close to the sun, maybe you find two suns orbiting one another with a single planet in between, maybe you find a solar system with nothing but 15 suns. The point I'm trying to get across here is, exploration is very fun and interesting if you're into space and astronomy, there's plenty of little bits of information you can find out about each planet. 

You can also find planets or entire systems that no one else has ever been to in the game and have your name branded on it forever, that to me is a pretty cool and I've been following that ever since I got my exploration ship (the Asp Explorer).

[b]Trading[/b] In this game is kind of shallow as of right now. You have two options, you can either do manual trading for yourself, which is to buy cheap one place, travel far away and sell expensive to another station. In terms of manual trading you can also try to smuggle illegal goods or slaves into stations that have a blackmarket, this can be very profitable. Besides that you can get into space trucking, which means you go to a station and check the billboard, they'll usually have some transportation jobs available, some risky and some more safe. This was a good steady rate of income in my experience.

[b]Combat[/b] careers in this game take the form of piracy, bounty hunting or mercenary work. Piracy is just what it sounds like, bounty hunting has you hanging out at pirate hotspots (resource extraction sites) and scanning ships that pass by. If the ship shows up as wanted, you're free to take them out and collect/redeem the bounty at the specific faction's station. Mercenary work is just mercenary work, being hired and killing for money.

[h1]Complaints[/h1]
One of the major complaints I've seen people have about this game is the "mile wide, inch deep" complaint. People complain that the game is shallow and doesn't have much content. I kind of disagree in that regard, I've put 80+ hours into it so far and I'm still not completely burned out on it. This is a galactic sandbox, you kind of have to set your own goals and go about achieving them. With that said, I think people forget that this isn't exactly a finished game in the greater sense, there is still a lot that they are going to add which will hopefully flesh out the game more. 

With that said, it's a life sized galaxy... it's not going to have hand made content sprinkled all over the place. Do you really think there's something to do in every corner of the actual milky way?

Another common complaint is that the game is too grindy. This one I kind of understand but at the same time, it's somewhat of an MMO/RPG, so obviously there is going to be grinding to get the ship that you want. You know what else is grindy? Euro/American truck simulator, and people love that game. I personally found the grind tolerable, because there was always a new ship or module within reach, so the grind always felt like it was towards something. 

[h1]Final Verdict[/h1]
I'm going to recommend this game to anybody that loves the sci-fi space theme, or is into space/exploration/astronomy at all. For the money that you pay for the base game, it's well worth it. The graphics and sound immerse you into this galaxy, and you're free to go whereever you want, there's a sense of discovery in being the first person ever in the game to jump into a new system, and if you're an astronomy nut you'll love the amazing views, screenshot opportunities and information available to you about each system and it's planets. 

However, if you're big on instant gratification  or not really into space exploration do yourself a favor and pass on this game,

review:
Although the game had bugs and has been in beta for many years with no official release date in the horizen this game is extremely fun and immersive.  It does its best to keep the physics real modding makes it that much more enjoyable.  You can push your computer to the max with many mods or pick a few you may enjoy.   

My only hic up in the game is a lack of goal.  I know its a sandbox,  but even MC has a progression to it and I have seen very few mods that push the game in that dirrection.  Maybe I am missing something, I need a sence of purpose and this game does not give that.

I still play the game, because there is nothing better out there yet that has the funcionality this game has.  I would love to learn to mod so I can see what the limits of this engine are and if my ideas are even feasable.
