author: {'steamid': '76561198026362756', 'num_games_owned': 328, 'num_reviews': 70, 'playtime_forever': 928, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 928, 'last_played': 1499286396}
review:
Man is dead, only machines remain.  Primordia is a wonderful adventure game developed by 
Wormwood Studios and published by WEG.  They have the perfect formula.  Great story, great characters, and puzzles that don't drive you to the point of insanity.  That being said, I love puzzle games, and for those of you that want to enjoy the story (and not burn your brain over puzzle solving) can find some wonderful guides to help get you over any obstacles you may encounter.  
What makes WEG games stand out is the little extras they throw in.  In this game, they practically have an entire bible written in.  I love games that have all of this extra information.  It adds that much more to the main storyline, even though it is not mandatory.  
In short... just get the game and play it.  It is not very long, but it is definitely worthy of the WEG name.

author: {'steamid': '76561197999323398', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 45, 'playtime_forever': 6782, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 4460, 'last_played': 1614830441}
review:
Its very fun, but very pay to win. I'm always reluctant to even consider spending money on these kinds of games but the game's economy is totally broken. If you don't want to spend at least 60 bucks, then you are going to have a bad time. pricing options have no intermediate and crafting is generally not worth it.

 The community is the backbone of any primarily multiplayer experience and that's a mixed bag here. The biggest problem aside from the economy is that you run out of things to do and there's no one to do them with.
developer_response:
Hello lilcstrike! 
Crossout is a free to play game - purchasing packs don't guarantee wins, it can save time spent on unlocking a part or obtaining it from the market. The ingame market prices are not dictated by developers, it's purely supply and demand so watching the price fluctuations and seizing good deals can be prfofitable and help to outfit the vehicle without resorting to purchasing packs. Intermediate options for parts and weapons include blue and purple parts - the success in the game depends on the preferred fighting range, a suitable construction for that range and tactics.Speaking of things to do in the game and no one to do that with: aside from missions and raids there are brawls and Adventure mode, for example, which are more suitable for solo players. Although Crossout is really fun when played in a group of friends with shared tactics, mutual help and delegation of tasks to different team members, so joining a clan for that or just playing with acquaintances made in the chat could be an enjoyable experience. 
Thank you for your feedback and have a nice day!

author: {'steamid': '76561198367161298', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 5086, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 4232, 'last_played': 1695007860}

author: {'steamid': '76561197980662054', 'num_games_owned': 228, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 1937, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1783, 'last_played': 1579549746}
review:
I wrote a bad review of this a year back. After coming back to give it another shot I'm going to write a sort-of good one.


Firstly, they've fixed a lot of the issues I had back then (UI issues like the call to arms dot being a tiny thing that was hard to click on, total lack of useful mouseover information, massive glitches)


Secondly as I got further into it I started to appreciate the thought that has gone into it. And particularly the new mechanics that weren't in the original dungeon keeper. A lot of them make sense when considered, like seperating the DK1 horned reaper "strong creature thats hard to keep happy" and DK2 horned reaper "endgame summon monster" into two seperate monsters, the vampire and titans. Or giving a means to assign creatures to the peaceband, so they work instead dropping everything to following the call to arms spell. Smart.


(Tip for anyone coming from DK1 and 2: Dont try to build 5 x 5 rooms immediately like you used to be able to in that game. Theres so many rooms and less space to build them in so its worth planning what you need for the level and starting with a 3x3.


Also I highly ecommend you slow down the game speed, which is a stock option thankfully.)


But it still has one MAJOR issue though, the difficulty curve. You're either storming though the level fairly easily or you're hitting a brick wall (level 4 with its unending waves smacks you out of nowhere after a fairly easy first few levels) it really lacks the twists and surprises that Bullfrog designed levels had. 


Pretty much every level has an infinite gold seam, so once you find that, you dont have to budget anymore. Plus you have the option of gold potions, turning your enemies to gold, a spell that literally just gives you gold for temporarily mana etc. 


Its too many get out of jail free cards. Again in the old bullfrog games they werent afraid to occasionally lock you out of some of your abilities, to force you to change strategy. 


Maintaining a dungeon is really easy since creatures dont fight internally anymore, not even converted hero units. I dont think I ever once had creatures complaining about food even with a 3x3 pig farm feeding a massive dungeon. 

Lava only seems to sort-of burn creatures, and plenty of them just dont care anyway. I got the stone bridge well before "how do I cross this lava" ever even became a problem I'd thought about solving.

DK1 and 2 you could NEVER rebuild earth. So once it was mined you were exposed for good. Here you get a spell to do that easily. 


See where I'm going with this? The game gives you a bunch of abilities, maybe too many abilities, but rarely tests your brain with them. 

The two suddenly-actual-difficult levels where I had to actually think and strategise were the ones I enjoyed the most.

It adds up to a fun DK flavoured novelty, but one without an engaging challenge. If steam had that option I'd give it half a thumbs up.
developer_response:
Thanks for the re-review and really pleased to hear that all our work over the past nearly two years has helped to change your perception of the game.

We're always taking feedback on board and while I can't promise changes we make will please everyone I can at least say we do try to listen to as many people as possible.

Economy in particular is something we've seen mentioned a fair bit recently and it's something we're going to be looking into over the course of 2017. As for difficulty that's a tricky subject you'd be surprised how many players find the game extremely tough!

In general our stats put the curve at being rather well balanced but we recognise it's impossible to please everyone with this, some will always want the game to be harder or easier!

Will take it all on board though and make decisions accordingly. :)

Cheers,

Lee

author: {'steamid': '76561197969287191', 'num_games_owned': 135, 'num_reviews': 37, 'playtime_forever': 14767, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2011, 'last_played': 1581360516}
review:
Awesome fun if you like management games.
Missing a few features still, seems a very young title, no septic for fertilizer makes no sense sort of thing, and no enemy ai attacking the base yet, not sure if its a planned feature but should be.

The game itself though is tricky at first, I killed 100 odd colonists learning and started 10 odd new games doing it, but once you figure the mechanics out its very enjoyable to build a huge base and balance its many different systems.
The graphics are sweet, neat and colorful, the sandstorms need work though, very bland at the moment, you can zoom into all buildings and build things into each building after you have constructed the building itself, it requires you ''deck out'' each room so to speak, or its just an empty room, you can build big bases or small, it doesnt force you to have a huge base you can run a small existance if you like, but the real challenge is in a massive base, it has trade ships, colonist ships, visitor ships, all come and you can interact with the trade ships and buy and sell anything you make, which is great, radio scope, tele scope, radar, etc all work, all the systems inside buildings worked for me, I have experience ZERO bugs with this new release, given I have a very high spec PC, that is still very rare on new games to be so bug free, very impressed at the sole developers efforts so far, if he sticks with it and expands on the game he has here I beleive he will make a pretty penny from this project, overall I give the game a big thumbs up for such an early release, even though the game itself isnt that big yet, it is sound in how it works.  Great geame for the price, which for me was around 10 bucks.

author: {'steamid': '76561197999254689', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 39, 'playtime_forever': 575, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 575, 'last_played': 1485005373}
review:
Looks good and has atmosphere and some feeling of old Dungeon Keeper. I feared it has the same dull graphical style and feel like most modern games (especially games having "fantasy with swords" setting), but its style is ok. It's heavily filled with features too. Announcer is great too.

However campaign is awful. "Tower defence" levels one after another. Why? This is not clash-of-whatever and this is not mobile phone game. Seems that industry is doomed and every RTS is now clash-of-towers. Thanks at least it's not "three-in-a-row" game. So lots of clicking to install "defences" and reinstall broken defences again and again. Many suggest that defences are useless and all I have to is to build large beast den, not tried it. After 7 levels I still not got a chance to really build decent dungeon, not played further. Why all these features if I have absolutely no time to use them and must rush from the start?

So, maybe other game modes or some DLCs are better, I have no idea what should I play instead of campaign.

Also, UI is painful. Cursor changing from arrow to hand and back, hacky minimap conveying almost no information, events feed on the right side of screen looking like my gmail inbox full of unread useless messages.
developer_response:
Hi ungzd,

I'm not sure when you last played but we've made huge sweeping improvements since your review in 2017. We released the game in an unfortunate state in April 2015 but never stopped updating it. With over 80 updates since then, 7 major updates containing tonnes of new features it's an entirely different game.

We'd love to know what you think of the game and the new stuff, here are some features we've added since release:

- Map Editor & Workshop Support with full scripting to create custom campaigns
- Overhauled Main Campaign
- Four Expansions with dozens of new features each. One of these is completely free for you!
- New Game Modes
- Improvements across the board to the core game.
- Aesthetic Improvements
- Vastly improved framerate
- Entirely new Skirmish AI

Looking forward to hearing what you think,

Cian

author: {'steamid': '76561198035697801', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 208, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 208, 'last_played': 1557458023}
review:
Its not the money that's a problem, its the hours that I will never get back. Since when is being an adventurer the same as being a gardener? I made more money chopping down bushes than adventuring. Because the bshes repopulate any time you leave a screen and come back, you could make enough money to buy all the high end gear before ever fighting a monster. 

The game mechanics are horribly simple, press a key to swing. No blocking, no need to time attacks, just keep clicking the mouse. Boring.
developer_response: Since you posted this review, there have been many updates to the game to improve the experience. Including changes to make combat more exciting and balancing currency rewards. And while you can still hack at the respawning bushes to get gold, it would take much, much longer than just playing the game for real. There are also a ton more areas to explore, and quests to complete. Anyway, I encourage you to play again and hope you can enjoy the changes.

author: {'steamid': '76561197984271570', 'num_games_owned': 289, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 701, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 701, 'last_played': 1535751569}
review:
hey wanna let you know cuisine royale is actually malware. it uses a ton of bandwith with the Gaijin launcher.
(The way to remove it because theres no way to ununstall it)
> Hold your windows key and R
> type %appdata% 
> go back one file to your appdata folder
> Click Local > find Gaijin
> Delete and delete from recycling bin
developer_response: Hello, this game does not contain any malware. However, due to our player's feedback, we have made Gaijin.Net agent entirely optional during a Steam installation (now you can decide whether you want to use it, or not). Please note: Gaijin net agent is completely harmless and useful software, and not using it can lead to delays in updates, if Steam updates are switched off/or not efficient. We still recommend using our solution, it is essential to keep your game up-to-date to be able to play!

author: {'steamid': '76561198032636062', 'num_games_owned': 2817, 'num_reviews': 104, 'playtime_forever': 159, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 159, 'last_played': 1477153672}
review:
Personal Rating: 3 of 10

This game is a fine example of what happens when a developer has a huge ambition to create a game but disregard the design and needs from the players point of view; complete disaster.

The game started on a tutorial island and already you can see there are actually plenty of features and contents. The rune mechanic is also fresh as unlocking chests require some kind of puzzle. The weapon system goes so deep there are binded cursed weapons already in the tutorial.

However, this game lacks in presenting these features to the players and interaction between players and the game is kept at minimal. Example, I spent minutes looking for the captain as presented in the hint box but he was just right beside me where I started because hovering my mouse over NPCs does not glow nor have any hint that they can be interact with. The example is just a small insight of how vague the game can be.

If you are a hardcore patient gamer who are really into RPG perhaps this would be nice. I don't know how the story goes but dialogue are voiced over so that is pretty awesome.

Every other things such as graphics, character creation and customization, inventory, minimap, camera controls and etc are mediocre. Nothing to shout about but its there, plain and simple and ready to be utilized.

author: {'steamid': '76561198048161816', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 77, 'playtime_forever': 229, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 224, 'last_played': 1578628611}
review: Go kill  x skeletons x times, turn in quest. Go kill x gargoyles x times, turn in quest. Go kill x skeletons again for x times.  This entire game is fetch and kill x things x times.   Very repetitive and classes are behind a pay wall. It's all just mundane grinding for the 4 hours I did play it.  If you like grinding mundane creatures over and over and over, well this is your game. If you want skills and multiple skill charts and abilities and depth, this is not for you. Maybe on release they will add content that has depth. Right now you are stuck with a set of abilities for each class and it get's boring fast.
developer_response:
We are sorry you do not like the game and appreciate you checking it out in Open Beta. The devs are constantly working on fixing and improving issues and releasing updates/patches almost weekly. This has been a constant balance as an indie game company with a small staff. This includes reworking quests, but there are other ways to complete different things without grinding. There are only a few classes that cost money which are Guardian and some that you can earn in game soon without paying. No one is forced to spend money or use classes that cost money as our game is free to play. 

Please check out the Game Plan and Design Notes for updates - https://aq3d.com/news/ & https://aq3d.com/game-plan/. We hope you check the game again soon once it is officially released and how more content!

author: {'steamid': '76561198917098063', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 594, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 115, 'last_played': 1688616185}
review:
The worst controls I've ever seen. 
I want to love this game but it's unplayable with unresponsive controls that don't make any sense even when they do work.

developer_response: Hi! I'm sorry you were disappointed with the controls and you're right about ladder/rope/edge grabbing - it is far from perfect. I promise quick fix of that :)

review:
Well, fun game. Really nice graphics, and gameplay... for almost everything. some suggestions:
Please add school or library associated to the monastery. Essential for mathematics for siege weapons; and astronomy for navigation and long distance trading with port and luxurious goods (spices and fruits).
Salt was essential for conserving the food on those times, as well as the smoked food.
Military could have a bit more interest challenges, and units (infantry, archers, siege weapons, etc) . Siege a city, attack a port, blockade to a port/city,
Cultural/entertainment the news reader, the speaker, the street clown, theatre, medieval fair with duels ground/horses.
And I got a bit lost with the potential castle...the mechanics of construction.
Please add more scenarios!!

review:
After playing this game for ages I cant help wonder why its gotten good reviews. The AI is shocking, thick as mince, can cause you to lose people due to stupidity. Then there is the blizzards, solar flares and the like. just how STUPID would you have to be to walk out the airlock when a Solar flare is on the go. Oh but its a game mechanic blah blah, pissoff. Why do random people land and attack your colony, reasons??

To many little irritations stop this game from Me recommending it. But hey if you like it and disagree then thats gravy.
developer_response:
Hello there,

Thanks for your feedback.

In the case of disasters you can activate a yellow alert (this requires the control center) and colonists won't leave the base.

Martiño.

author: {'steamid': '76561197984654092', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 49, 'playtime_forever': 239, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 239, 'last_played': 1471131208}
review: My colonists decided they dont like food anymore then stood still (all 67 of them) untill they starved to death......... Apparently pure happiness, a fridge full of food and all the supplies you could ever need just isnt enough for some colonies.....
developer_response:
Hello there, thank you for your feedback, 
 
We are always listening to the community and fixing any issues in the game. 
 
We would suggest that you play the tutorial as it explains all the major mechanics in the game. If you've already done so, maybe you can have a look at some of the YouTube [url=https://www.youtube.com/results?search_query=planetbase]let's plays[/url] as they will take you step by step on how to build a viable base.
 
We assure you it is possible, and not even that hard, to progress in Planetrbase, as you can see by the numbers of people getting the game's [url=http://steamcommunity.com/stats/403190/achievements]achievements[/url], but it has some tricky mechanics that might take some time getting used to. 
 
Kind Regards. 
Martiño.

author: {'steamid': '76561198200718514', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 14, 'playtime_forever': 99, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 31, 'last_played': 1573562649}
review:
Pros: 
Gameplay
Graphics
Sound

Cons:
Inability to use controller on the menus
No Linux support

Overall:
My judgements are based on the free version. Product page was a bit misleading, showing that the only difference between free and paid was maps and acheivements, but the use of single player bots is locked behind a pay wall. 

Either way, as someone who loved the early 2000's shooters (unreal tournament, etc), I find this game is a nice tribute to that era with modern graphics and effects before Call of Duty single-handedly lowered the entire Gaming communities IQs by a large margin.

Would be a nice addition to SteamOS/Linux.
developer_response:
Hi there and thanks for your review.

[quote]Installs extra crap on my PC[/quote]

The setup installs only the game. However, Unreal Engine might install some "missing" run-time components and prerequisites. This is particularly true, if you currently have no other Unreal Engine based games installed.

There are no extra programs, bloatware or other BS installed with Toxikk. Just the game and its prerequisites (if missing).

Thanks and have a great day...

author: {'steamid': '76561198008095222', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 129, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 129, 'last_played': 1542090006}
review:
Tl:Dr; A nice-looking, somewhat humorous, but EXTREMELY SHORT AND EASY GAME.

This ISN'T Subnautica in space, or a beautiful-but-haunting exploration-survival game like Adr1ft. 

What is IS is a game with an extremely small amount of content. Without even trying, you can beat the game in an hour to an hour and a half. And thats it... no replayability due to the lack of content either.

All you do is collect a few resources, make your way to a waypoint, collect a special resource, use it to make an upgraded space suit, then make your way to a second waypoint, and voila, the game is finished. 

Worth it for 5 bucks, not for 13.99
developer_response:
Hi, and thanks for your review!

The game is fully released now (with 3 new chapters full of gameplay and a lot of polishing). We’ve made changes to game balance - now the base level of oxygen is at 75 seconds, some tools have more durability, some items are easier to build, and much more. 

We want to make sure the balance is right now. We would be happy if you could try Breathedge again and let us know how it goes. Let us know your thoughts by sending us a message to info@breathedge.com or visit our discord channel: https://discord.com/invite/eyURQXG and let us know what you think! 

Thank you once again.

author: {'steamid': '76561198871110305', 'num_games_owned': 22, 'num_reviews': 16, 'playtime_forever': 744, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 744, 'last_played': 1692776787}
review:
Space Engineers is a captivating sandbox game that allows players to immerse themselves in the world of engineering, construction, and exploration in the vastness of space. With its emphasis on creativity, engineering, and open-world gameplay, Space Engineers offers a rich and immersive experience that appeals to players interested in building and designing intricate space structures and vehicles.

One of the most compelling features of Space Engineers is its robust and intricate building system, which enables players to construct and customize a variety of space stations, ships, and planetary outposts using a wide array of blocks and components. The game's realistic physics engine adds depth to the construction process, allowing players to design and engineer complex structures that must withstand the challenges of space, including gravity, inertia, and collisions.

The game's open-world sandbox environment encourages players to explore and interact with diverse celestial bodies, including planets, asteroids, and moons. This exploration aspect, coupled with the ability to mine resources and gather materials, allows players to expand their engineering endeavors and establish a foothold in the vastness of the cosmos.

Space Engineers' multiplayer mode enables players to collaborate with others, fostering a sense of teamwork and camaraderie as they work together to conquer the challenges of space exploration and construction. Whether players are engaging in cooperative construction projects or competitive battles, the multiplayer mode enhances the social aspect of the game and provides an engaging and dynamic gameplay experience.

Furthermore, the active modding community contributes to the game's longevity, offering a wealth of user-generated content, including new blocks, components, and gameplay enhancements, which continually enrich the gaming experience and provide players with new and exciting possibilities to explore and create within the game's expansive universe.

In summary, Space Engineers stands as a captivating sandbox game that offers players an immersive and engaging experience in the realm of space exploration and engineering. With its robust building system, open-world sandbox environment, multiplayer support, and active modding community, Space Engineers provides a rich and dynamic gameplay experience that caters to the creativity and curiosity of players interested in space and engineering.

author: {'steamid': '76561198363052422', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 39914, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 6612, 'last_played': 1685521555}
review:
How does one update the game and install the patches?
Very confusing for beginners. Disappointing would like a link to the patches and other items directly with the notifications.
developer_response:
Hi ihillmayr,

The Steam client handles game updates and will automatically update your game to the latest release/patch unless you have changed any Steam settings to prevent this.

Patch notes can be found in the game's library but can also be found in the Steam discussion forums [u][url=https://steamcommunity.com/app/690830/eventcomments/]here[/url][/u].

[strike]If you are looking to play the experimental map generator branch then you can find more details and how to try it out [u][url=https://store.steampowered.com/news/app/690830/view/5650356584426826425]here[/url][/u].

Note: the game will automatically update with the map gen update when we push it live on the main branch.[/strike]

Edit: The Map Generator is now live as of 15th Dec. Steam should have automatically updated. Patch notes can be found in your game library.

We hope that helps explain the update process and if you have any issues please feel free to reach out on the forums or join us on our [u][url=https://discord.com/invite/Foundation]Discord Server[/url][/u].

Cheers

author: {'steamid': '76561197985847263', 'num_games_owned': 746, 'num_reviews': 68, 'playtime_forever': 111, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 24, 'last_played': 1608159944}
review:
I bought this game on a Saturday, thinking I needed more activity in my life.

I set it to Beginner and played a level.  A little winded, but I figured I could do this.  I did three more songs, I think, before I decided to put it down and see how I felt.  Start slow and ramp up, right?  The after-song stats for one of them told me I did 44 squats.  I have no idea how many I did total.

Here I am two days later and I still can't feel the inside of my thighs.

author: {'steamid': '76561198242422762', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 1511, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1193, 'last_played': 1635431016}
review:
Well, I got caught writing a bad review for a game with a GREAT customer support team. I experienced some bugs/issues with my controller configuration, and the support team was quick to jump in and help. Now that everything is squared away, I am forced to strongly recommend this game/simulator.

I say both game and simulator because it can be treated as both. DRL has provided and experience to hone your flying skills and paired it with an interactive community to drive competition. 

The graphics are beautiful and more importantly, the control and feel of the drone will relate to real-world flying.

Shout-out to KaNoodle for the excellent help!

author: {'steamid': '76561198006629866', 'num_games_owned': 215, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 1171, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1025, 'last_played': 1563602054}
review:
Pretty fun game. I really enjoy the atmosphere and the narrator is fantastic. Certain parts are fairly dumbed down compared to what you would expect in a typical RTS, but I don't consider that a bad thing (in fact I would say it works great in this kind of game). Your minions are mostly automated and will do their jobs and train themselves but as the underlord you can of course micro them as much as you want. I also find the idea of you as the dungeon master having a mana bar as a resource to cast spells, build defences, and hire workers pretty unique as well. 

Now that's not to say the game doesn't have some problems. Even though your minions are autonomous they are sometimes kind of stupid and don't sleep, eat, or get their paycheck quick enough and you'll often get messages that they're unhappy. This can usually be solved by just clicking on them and dropping them into the area they are lacking in but I don't really think you should have to do that when you don't have them assigned to anything. 

The worker flag is kind of irritating too because you can either force all workers to work on an area (sometimes I want like  2-3 still working on the other side) or you can let them decide what to prioritize and sometimes they'll just dig walls or run off to another task instead of placing all the floor tiles down while I'm waiting to make a room. Note that this may just be me not being good enough at the game to figure out how to assign workers properly.

The economy system is kind of wierd too. You get unlimited gold from workers mining these "gold shrines" which are big rectangular boxes. I think if maybe gold acted like mana where you could mine a big chunk of it, but it wouldn't start recharging until you stopped mining it for awhile it might be better? I'm not sure. This isn't really a major complaint but it's something I dislike. 

Overall, the game does have a number of issues, but nearly all of them can be overlooked or are very minor. I do highly recommend trying out War for the Overworld because it does feel really unique to play as an actual bad guy for once. The gameplay is solid and so far the campaign has been a very enjoyable experience.

author: {'steamid': '76561197968660912', 'num_games_owned': 70, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 3197, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2103, 'last_played': 1627534926}
review: playing through the baldur's gate series - particularly the second game but also this first installment - was one of those childhood experiences which forever altered the way i looked at video games, and my viewpoint of what a good video game was.  it was hard, it was beautiful, and it was fun.  the artwork, the music, the level of detail, and the amount of character customization - this game had my friends and i mesmerized for what seemed like years.  even as a kid, it was obvious to me the amount of love the creators put into this game.  to this day, i dont think any rpg series comes close to touching this series' legacy. ive replayed this thing so many times its sick. ive finished every quest, met every companion, killed everyone worth killing, gotten all the most badass magical shit, and romanced everyone in between.  these were the kinds of games which impacted lives on a level deeper than any regular game youd came across. it imprinted something onto my imagination which I will gladly carry with me. yeah its getting up there in age, but play this series through, at least once. its a classic.

review: CASH GRAB PAY 2 WIN GARBAGE! WHAT ELSE IS NEW??
developer_response:
AQ3D is a free to play game, not play to win. We are confused why you are stating that AQ3D is pay to win and where you see that in our game as that is not the case. Our packages are a one time fee and no one is obligated to pay. Those players who generously purchase optional packages help support our game and keep it online. Then those funds are directly put back into the further development of the game and to pay for our servers, staff and resources. This is the same exact model all of our games have used since our first original game AdventureQuest was released 17 years ago. 

If you do have any helpful feedback or suggestions for our game, you are welcome to update your review - player feedback and suggestions have always been taken to heart and has helped build and shape our games for almost two decades. Thank you for checking out our game.

review:

You are given a pistol, an SMG, a sniper rifle and shotgun, but most of the time you can stay at the beginning of the map and kill everyone with sniper rifle. developer_response:
Hey CMDR,

It sounds like your steam account is linked to a different account than the one you've originally accessed the game with.

The launcher will not be able to detect your game access correctly and is therefore, stuck on the update required message.

Please send us a support ticket via: https://customersupport.frontier.co.uk/hc/en-us/requests/new and provide us with your Steam Key if applicable.

author: {'steamid': '76561198014946264', 'num_games_owned': 288, 'num_reviews': 29, 'playtime_forever': 102, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 102, 'last_played': 1481782115}
review: Minions won't follow banner, you have to drag them one by one while getting attacked... tedious
developer_response:
Hi The Old Man ,

I'm not sure when you last played but we've made huge sweeping improvements since your review in 2016. We released the game in an unfortunate state in April 2015 but never stopped updating it. With over 80 updates since then, 7 major updates containing tonnes of new features it's an entirely different game.

Most importantly the performance and stability of the game has been now greatly improved after thousands of man-hours of development from our two-man code team. 

There is also now the second expansion, the Crucible survival mode, that was free for all! 

If you've not tried the game for a while now might be a great time for you to jump in and see how far we've come since release! We'd love to hear what you think now.

Cheers,
Cian

author: {'steamid': '76561197973129069', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 239, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 206, 'last_played': 1558315929}
review:
I agree with reviewer IDK, that the levels have 1 gimick to figure out per level and seem difficult until you figure it out then you're like "how did I miss that". and the no fighting is nice as well (my wife loves puzzles/adventure and dis-likes violence so this is great!).
the levels are as pretty as I've seen from other games on the Rift headsets so far, and there is the perfect mix of "Oh look at that" and not so many visual things that you forget or can find the puzzles items. I love the castle dungeon theme without any grotesque items ment to make you sick
I got this game on 40% off sale awhile ago and I would've gladly payed the full price now I've played it

author: {'steamid': '76561198127735616', 'num_games_owned': 137, 'num_reviews': 20, 'playtime_forever': 1547, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 808, 'last_played': 1635988564}
review:
Chernobylite, A violent, twisted, story driven game about a man in the search of his wife. 
You play as that man, a scientist teaming up with two mercenaries to infiltrate a stronghold that is Cherno's own Nuclear Powerplant. As visions of a bi-gone time flash before your eyes you and your companions find a reservoir of an unknown substance of virtually unknown power. As you take an sample to leave this depressing foundation a man in a black gas mask teleports in. He guns one of your companions down, wounded the other and takes the picture of your wife. Vowing to hunt you down, you escape before he could lay his hands on you. Now in a place that almost looks like the Matrix you see a path ahead... slowly you start down the trail.

Heh, Every review I try my hardest to make a scene for you as the reader. The problem is I have no idea how to describe the visuals. It's like if the Matrix was taking place in Russian, was now a horror movie, and instead of Agent Smiths running about it's abominations brought by... well I rather not spoil it.
Let's lay out how I will review everything as I have played till the stopping point in the story, met all the characters, and generally have seen quite a bit of what the game has to offer in my 13ish hours of playing. Let's start off with the story, then move on to the characters, the weapons "my favorite", and then finally an overall opinion on whether or not the game is worth your time.

Story - Now the story involves time travel "I think" and some inter-dimentional bullshit to put it bluntly. I find it personally interesting and is a more Supernatural version of game series like Stalker and Metro as people commonly point to as an comparison. While more than likely inspired by both those games, this is nothing like the two. In terms of the Gameplay and Story. This is not a tale of survival in the traditional sense. Your character and NPC you house have to eat and that is one of the main priorites, managing supplies. However multiple times throughout the story your character is told he could simply leave and go back to civilization. No this game is a Love story, a tale of a hero trying to save a princess. It just so happens this princess is in through some Science mumbo jumbo inter-dimentional crap with visions of death and destruction thrown in for good measure. While trying to save your wife, you will also discover that this game is like those old detective games. You will piece together clues and facts to find out the why? Why did my wife disappear? Who is this Black Stalker hunting me? And many other questions that will need answering. 

Now the folks you will meet will help you on your quest. However each of them have their own reasons for joining you. After all the world is not a charity. That starts with supplies, food, etc. Or helping them with their problems. Ranging from helping a town in need to blowing up a Antenna Line to disrupt communications between the enemies. However each main story action has consequences that will affect how these NPCs will view you, and can even cause some to abandon you if you don't find that happy medium of friendship between everyone. However what I think could use some improvements is while I had a guy absolutely hate my guts, I generally found his decision making stupid and could get many people killed, every time I talked with him he still had his personality as if I just met him. No varying lines referencing what you've done in the story or how pissed/happy they are with you. Just general jargon. Unfortunate, but can be fixed and does not knock these characters in the slightest. 

Oh boy my favorite part, GUNS! Man the person you play as is a generally level headed individual who hates killing and violence because he is a damn hippy or something. Then when I played I slaughtered the entire level several times over on the hardest difficulty. I just found that thought line in my head funny, Anywho! This game has 4 main Weapons, one that I will not cover, but is basically the BFG from doom. First the Nagant Revolver. This is absolutely one of the most satisfying revolvers in gaming. 2 shots to a typical enemy and the ammo is plentifulish. The sound is just simply devine coming from a gun fellow and the reload is both realistic and strangely efficient for the main character who renounces violence. Now to go from a great revolver to a almost DOOM 3 shotgun. It either hits like a damn run away train that is on FIRE or shoots candy. Very weird, but still not a bad shotgun. Works very well against the Monsters of the levels, not so much the people. Finally the one I was looking forward to, the Automatic Kalashnikov 47. It's meh honestly. The full auto version I find, with maxed out perks, to be very weak at distance and not as good as the wonky shotgun at close range. The Sniper/Semi Auto version is pretty Ok, It has great range and is generally a good long range weapon. The problem is the ammo and that the Revolver is god's gift to you the player. 
(Warning Rant about Guns Incoming! Skip to "Rant Over" if you want to go back to the review) Now I am a bit of a gun guy, so the customization of the weapons was appealing to me! However some of the choices and wording of the upgrades made me just question them. Example the Nagant Revolver holds 7 rounds in the Cylinder and is reloaded using a rod that pushes the empty case out of the chamber like the Colt Single Action army of the Wild West. In this game there is a 9 Round Cylinder that gives just a bit more ammo for longer reloads as the downside. Which is fine in game play. The problem is that the 9 round Cylinder apparently uses "Smaller Rounds" so that it can take up the same space, but have more ammunition. Firstly, this is a bad idea due to headspace in a typical firearm. If your barrel and round don't have a snug fit, the resulting explosion from the round will BLOW up your damn gun! Secondly, even if the character changed the round and barrel to fit the new round there is another issue. The rounds from the 7 shot cylinder and 9 round cylinder do the same damage. While bullets vary in real life, the general case that I've seen in games is the smaller the round is in a game the less damage it will do. Take 9mm vs 44 Mag. 9mm has more ammo in the magazine, but much less damage than the powerhouse of a round the 44 Mag. Finally they could have fixed this shower thoughts in my head by simply just removing the "smaller rounds" part. Metro Exodus has a revolver that can change it's cylinder from a six shot to an eight shot cylinder of 44 Mag. While the pressures exerted on the cylinder may eventually blow up the gun, I find that far more believeable, that somebody found an new and interesting way in the wasteland to make a revolver hold eight rounds than completely milling out a new barrel and cylinder in a backyard shop. This happens a lot in the game, where I read what the attachment does in game and think to myself that's just wrong. Personally it's a bit of a gripe that shouldn't affect many other people besides me.
(RANT Over)
Finally, should you buy this game. That depends. Do you enjoy story games, ones of horror and adventure in a ravaged hell scape? Did you enjoy Stalker and or Metro and are looking for something to hold you over till the next installment of the games? I'd say go for it then! There are many underlining problems. I think the AI could use some work, I once fell out of the map and stared into the void of a level. Even with these problem I had a blast. Once these kinks are ironed out I can see this game being a pretty damn good one. So place that Gasmask on and let's head into the green haze of a Russia to find love once more.
developer_response:
Hey!
Many thanks for so deep and interesting review. We hope you'll enjoy the game even more when it comes out of Early Access.
Cheers,
Chernobylite Team :)

author: {'steamid': '76561198050750548', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 598, 'playtime_forever': 1161, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 109, 'last_played': 1563068505}
review:
15h update:

TL;DR is an entertaining game but has big flaws on gameplay and features:  movement is meh, bullets collision isn't consistent and the minions can walk/shoot through the geometry and there is no reward for killing/wining a match :/

Is entertaining game however falls very short on the gameplay and progression. Higher level weapons make less damage (wtf). 
Also the current state is unplayable because the mechanics aren't helpful. The spawn point is next to a base instead of the HQ - making harder to save your base :( ... and the bullets go where they want. The minion NPCs are way too overpower and 90% of the time spawn on top of me and kill with 1 hit (maybe is due the lag?).

There are only 2 game modes which limits the playability and there is no music (RIP) either in game or in the menu.

Finally, the AI is just broken.The enemy team has better weapons (more damage, accuracy and fire rate) also the AI NEVER runs out of bullets and can hit anyone from afar.

The thing I hate the most is that the few human players I encounter just camp ._. 

Nevertheless, this is a good indie game and the price is just right. I hope to see some improvements/features over time.
developer_response:
It's sad that you didn't like the game :(

Maybe I can help you to understand some design goals of this game.

1) No weapon or class or vehicle is better than the other, they should be "different". You can find slow and inaccurate, but powerful weapon, or fast and very accurate. They are all procedural, so yes of course there will be some luck involved. Find the one that suits your style and mood and stick with it for some time.

2) Teamwork is essential. You simply won't survive without your team. Want unlimited bullets? Get a team mate who plays a tank nearby. Hovers give health, copters give shields, tanks give bullets and artillery give spawn points (you should not be under attack for some time to receive resources)

3) Spawn point is on the base and on the artillery class team mates. The artillery class should be behind the lines (sort of), that's why they have only long range weapon classes. You should protect them, and wipe out enemy artillery if you want to stop the attack, because if you don't they will continue to respawn on artilleries (so should you too if you want to continue attacking that point).

And I can assure you that there are simply no cheats in AI, they play by the same rules as you.

author: {'steamid': '76561197998932657', 'num_games_owned': 165, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 96, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 96, 'last_played': 1461994163}
review:
Let me just make this clear, this is just my personal opinion. You may think completely different, and that is 100% okay!

So I was very much excited for this game. The music sounded cute, the art was absolutely stunning and the story seemed really awesome! Fairytales and a dating sim? Heck yeah I'm down for this! So I bought it the day it came out.

.. and refunded it about 2 hours later. I want to like it, I honestly do. But there is just so much about that either doesn't sit well for me or I just simply hate and with a price tag of over $30 I just can't justify buying a game I'm not in love with.

Some problems I had included very minor things like spelling mistakes, the default name being said which was rather jarring, the third person perspective was okay at first but I felt so disconnected from the Protagonist that I couldn't get as interested in the story as I'd liked, and around the 2 hour mark my game wouldn't stop lagging, which really surprised me.

But the most jarring thing? The actual romance. After refunding the game I looked up a quick summary/review to see what I was going to be missing out on and holy-! The amount of NTR in this game is awful, and some of it is impossible to avoid, which really didn't sit well with me. 

Again, this is my own opinion and don't let this stop you from purchasing it. Am I glad I refunded it? Yes. Completely. Would I purchase this again in the future? Honestly, yes. But for now the price and the uncomfortable romances have turned me off.
developer_response:
Sorry you didn't enjoy the game, but thanks for giving it a chance.

Just wanted to note that the issue with the default name appearing after changing the main characters name (along with some typos) has been fixed by a recent update.

author: {'steamid': '76561198039183932', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 409, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 409, 'last_played': 1528154993}
review:
When I first reviewed this game, I did not recommend it and said "wait a bit". Well I forgot all about this game until I saw it offered for free on humble bumble, so I decided to fire it up again and must say the wait is over (probably by a long time!!).   

This is a fantastic puzzle game that really captures the feel of being a 'hacker', including using tools inspired by real world hacking tools, a 'linux' like interface and a bunch of other nice touches.  Take your blood pressure meds, it can get quite stressful! 

I don't know if it is still possible to get irreversably stuck.  But so far I have not seen the issue that stopped me dead in my tracks previously.

So,  wait no more :) Play it! Get hooked!
developer_response:
Hi Paranoid Dualist!

Just wanted to stop by and thank you for your review. I'm sorry that your experience with Hacknet hasn't been ideal, and we are in the process of fixing these issues that you have come across. Also, nice touch with wait "a bit" :)

We're a very small team, and while our internal testing was solid, we had unexpected issues come out as the game hit a wide number of systems. 

We have just released a blog that explains our priority right now, number one being the save game issue. It would be great if you could check it out here: http://steamcommunity.com/games/365450/announcements/detail/132083641497684826

Also, I'd love to just chat and apologise for the issues you had. Please contact me on community AT surpriseattackgames DOT com, or add me on Steam.

Thanks again! 
Steve - Community Manager

review:

EDIT/REPLY: 
Developer says this doesnt effect gameplay?
imagine someone soaped the steering wheel of your car, and every single time you make a turn your hands slide into that direction on your steering wheel, no longer being where they were before the turn.   <--- that is how incredibly awful this is for people who play your mmo the way ALL other mmos are played (by using rightclick holding as the exclusive way to turn the camera). it ABSOLUTELY does effect gameplay to the point it can not be played after 1 minute of experiencing it.
developer_response:
Hello. Thank you for your feedback. The devs don't have plans to hide/freeze the cursor yet, but this is something they may add in the future. The cursor shouldn't affect game play.

 The devs are constantly working on fixing issues and releasing updates/patches weekly. This has been a constant balance as an indie game company with a small staff. Please check out the Game Plan and Design Notes for updates - https://aq3d.com/news/ & https://aq3d.com/game-plan/.

author: {'steamid': '76561198402588414', 'num_games_owned': 339, 'num_reviews': 240, 'playtime_forever': 158, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 158, 'last_played': 1613269871}
review: It has been 2 years, 5 months, and 4 days yet this product still lacks in adequacy. There are numerous technical/logical errors, so I will merely list those worthy of note: reloading animations fail to function properly; enemies can shoot (and see) through walls so long as they have been triggered by the player; dismembered limbs are classified as endamageable objects; aquariums (if shot and not automatically shattered) will have bullet textures on them and not leak; violently slung objects will do nothing to enemies except slightly shift them, and not all doors can be unhinged (specifically the ones that open/close by themselves). Yes, one could easily argue that this product is evidently overpraised as it currently is. In the long term, this computer game is unoriginal in concept, extremely repetitious, plainly errorful, and should not be purchased by any means.

author: {'steamid': '76561198004846271', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 42, 'playtime_forever': 4044, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 21, 'last_played': 1619052775}
review: can't play won't get past login always says connection error. I have no idea what is wrong with this game so I cannot recommend a game that I cannot play due to bad servers.managed to fix the issue by changing servers.apparently the default server either don't work or it's for another country. played for about 2 hours almost as a rogue. the classes seem to have 4 skills and an auto attack and leveling up gives buffs to your skills and such. kind of basic in terms of skills, tab target combat that allows players to move and avoid some telegraphed attacks. would be much better if they implemented a action combat system since it seems like it would be capable but as it is the combat is bland and boring the graphics are pretty bad but it is also a phone game so that is alright. has a lot of classes to unlock but I have no idea how to unlock them yet but you can only do 1 class quest a day so it is probably pay walled or time gated big time. crafting is time gated and can be bypassed by a ingame currency which is probably real money. the game lets you pick any item even the ones with stats to wear over your characters currently equipped items as cosmetic so you can be wearing full platemail and it can look like you are wearing a robe. would be cool if they gave an option to hide the helmet of your character..or they may have and I could not figure out how to do so. as far as I have played in 2 hours it is too boring to recommend since the classes don't get enough skills for my liking (this reminds me more of trove in terms of classes/skills than the usual mmo games like ever quest and wow which give so many skills and hotbars that you can no longer see the screen :P which I prefer since it gives the option to choose what you want to do unlike this where you just gonna hit like 3-4 buttons for each fight. will update if things change for me as I continue to play. : 8 hours in same as before not much changed, tried mage and warrior too and mage seems to be the best and easiest of the starters and takes no skill just spam the dmg skills than get mana back from frost skill. the warrior is brain dead as you would expect in a way as you have no resource requirements but when you max the resource after using a skill enough it boosts the damage of the next skill so any brain function in this class is simply using the damage bonus on what skill does the most damage from it and the rogue is the hardest of the three starters as you have the option to skillfully time skills and your auto attack to apply stacks of poison as fast as possible and then turning it into better poison than reapplying regular poison fast again and using your cool downs well timed for the best potential dps. I am working on unlocking the archer next than I will try to unlock paladin but every class is very time gated to 1 class quest a day for a bigger boost to your class tokens which are used to unlock classes and very limited quest that give a small amount of tokens. it is unfortunate but this game that people say has no pay to win in it actually does with one of the classes being locked for a big price....I hate it when devs lock stuff behind real money like that and considering almost everything in this game is super time gated it will probably take a long while to unlock all the classes that can be unlocked for free. would be cool if they implemented a skill augmentation for more customization for instead allowing someone to pick a sub class that would give bonuses to the skills of the main class as added effects for instance maybe making the mage a subclass for something like the archer could maybe make some of his skills do an aoe explosion for extra damage and another skill maybe shoot an ice arrow to freeze an enemy so the class has more than one root for the passive making it a bit better and more useful. doubtful though that the devs will see my post or implement any of these ideas. I have unlocked all classes at this point but not gotten all of the skills for each...games far to boring to bother leveling up or playing at all anymore and it was from the start. still can't recommend  playing this.
developer_response:
We are sorry, we don't know your account information or location to investigate why you are having this connection issue. Our servers are monitored constantly and a new one was just added last week. We unfortunately don't have any control over any issues a player would have with their connection based on their WIFI/router/ISP and location. You can always try all of the troubleshooting options via our help page - https://support.artix.com/hc/en-us/articles/115001580572. You can also contact Artix Support via artix.com/contact. 

Thank you for your feedback for the game. The devs are constantly working on fixing issues and releasing updates/patches weekly. This has been a constant balance as an indie game company with a small staff. Please check out the Game Plan and Design Notes for updates - https://aq3d.com/news/ & https://aq3d.com/game-plan/. AQ3D is free to play, so classes, crafting, etc can all be earned/obtained for free. If you don't want to wait or play through the class quests, you can choose to pay, but this is completely optional and is a similar feature that other MMO's have. The devs will continue to improve the game based on player feedback.

author: {'steamid': '76561198176559694', 'num_games_owned': 209, 'num_reviews': 23, 'playtime_forever': 1526, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1494, 'last_played': 1703106378}
review:
This is an absolute gem and any review will undersell it.

The more you play the more you will enjoy it. It feels like a true Sandbox RTS where, although I have my main mission, I'm free to complete that in any way I deem appropriate, or fun.

Build up your base however you like, recruit individual units or multiple units at once. Get your base ready in Horde mode and take control of your Operator to get on the front line and help your troops carry out your orders, or go for the long haul in pandemic establish a few footholds and organise a mass evacuation, before focusing all attention and resources to finding Patient Zero.

Want to play as a Peacekeeper trying to contain chaos and restore order - go for it
Want to play ruthlessly ensuring no possible chance of the virus surviving - have fun
Want to take it as it comes and react with a constantly changing environment - enjoy

This game is worth every penny - and a steal when on sale.

Fans of RTS will find a refreshing approach full of challenges, a game world that keeps you on your toes with a fantastic blend of satisfying functioning aesthetics.

review:
The Tale of Bistun is based on an old Persian poem, yet a charming story with equal parts passion and tragedy,
in the game you are a stonemason who wakes up with no memory of where he is or who he is,
and the only thing that guides him is a mysterious bird that takes him from one place to another.
The revelation of the man's identity will, of course, be broken down over the course of the journey.

Watch a short gameplay here: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=rneMQeZdRZ8

author: {'steamid': '76561198038037146', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 38, 'playtime_forever': 1812, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1274, 'last_played': 1677864316}
review:
I had low expectations. The art is ... um. Low-budget indie. It is of course basically Terraria / Minecraft under the hood. And on a keyboard + mouse, it can be a little tricky since side-scroller platformers for me are just kind of anchored to a hand-held controller.

And then I kept playing. And every time I went into one of the pre-built maps to explore or do a quest or something, I kept encountering some interesting little platformer obstacle course to navigate or discovered a secret hidden chest or was surprised by an uber mob I'd never seen before. And although the English localization is absolutely swamped with spelling errors and awkward phrasing, I found the dialogues and plot to be, well, charmingly sincere and executed with the distinct style of a well-worn song that is performed perfectly, without wonky gimmicks or kitschy in-jokes. Movement and combat are precise and responsive which is pretty important for this type of game. Base building and supply management is satisfying without being horribly grindy (though, let's be real, a *leeeettle bit* of grind is why we play this genre anyway). And although the sprites are... primitive... the variety of fashion options for personal customization is larger than I expected.

My main complaint is that the variety of active skills available is extremely small. You'll be using the same spell or type of weapon for basically 90% of the game from the tutorial on. And almost all of the talents just give you minor passive scaling to keep up with the hit points of enemy creatures as you go. Which is painfully boring and a waste of the game's potential as a platform adventurer. There are also some pretty glaring balance problems which can saddle you with a burning resentment after you realize that you can't respec your character for a long time yet but getting more points is going to take forever and all the points you've spent so far don't really matter because your summoned rats and wolves do pathetic damage and die instantly, even after wasting all your gear to pump them. Meanwhile even the weak ice bolt is doing twenty times the damage with one shot and you haven't even got any gear equipped for it and hardly any points spent in that tree. And your ice bolt goes where you tell it to instead of sitting around next to enemies, unresponsive.

The developer is (slowly) continuing to work on it. It's got all the potential of Terraria but has a far more narrative / RPG architecture with some absolutely fantastic level design. Hopefully they address the combat powers / talents to make them more interesting and varied soon.

I have to admit it's worth the pricetag even if they don't, though.

author: {'steamid': '76561198055294891', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 35, 'playtime_forever': 137, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 28, 'last_played': 1636241664}
review:
So i bought it and left a negative review. The developers saw it, reached out to me on reddit (of all places) and mentioned that they saw the review, made some adjustments and wanted me to look at it again (with a key for free). I did pay for the game initially then refunded it.

Updated review:
So they have made a lot of improvements to the menu system and overall music selection. It's definitely better than before. I initially bought this game (and returned it) for it's advertisement of electric swing titles that all seemed to require a DLC to obtain. Since they sent me a free key, it seems like most of them are now included in the game.  Cool beans. Game play seems to be slightly improved since my last review but still generally the same. Kudos to the vendor for listening to customer feedback and acting on it.


Original review below:
The same is a called "Synth Riders Electro Swing", only you have to pay for all the electro swing. False advertising IMO. The game isn't bad, i just found it a bit boring compared to more popular titles. Good selection of music though
developer_response:
Thank you for buying the game and sharing your feedback! 

The Electro Swing Essentials consist of 10 songs, 5 paid and 5 free, available to anyone who owns the base game. The free Electro Swings songs (including Jamie Berry) are already in your library, please look for them on the Electro Swing Pack playlist.

We hope you will enjoy the free selection of Electro Swing songs!

developer_response: Hi there Texmexquisite! We're sorry to see that you've had disappointing run in the game. The loot system and the overall game, as it is currently set up, caters towards hardcore survival enthusiasts as the game is envisioned in such a way. The game is still in Early access and there's still a lot that we have to do as we're nearing the full release of it. In fact, the upcoming patch will be addressing the loot drops in the official servers which should make it more rewarding in that sense. Alternatively, you can try playing on private servers where loot drops are modified in a way where loot drops are increased. All this being said, we hope that you'll give the game one more chance and that you'll find more enjoyment in your future playthroughs.

Ubisoft is a horrendous company. Please do yourself a favor and buy forza.

author: {'steamid': '76561197983225082', 'num_games_owned': 864, 'num_reviews': 321, 'playtime_forever': 1540, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1514, 'last_played': 1531279720}
review:
I really like this game. That being said some of the graphics just drive me up a wall! Once you enter a space station its a little tiny screen that only covers about 30% of the screen the rest of the stuff is just random flashing artwork. Ugh. The weird and slightly strange menu system is also a bit of a pain. Its not very streamlined at all. So those are two very annoying points in this game. You have to read all of the dialogue and its very funny stuff. So I do enjoy that part of the game. Its just those really ugly menus. I wish they were bigger because again they only take up about 30% of the screen. 

Outside in space is wonderful. Its bright, it takes up the full screen, its easy to navigate. Its fun. Navigation is easy enough if a bit cumbersome. I really wish the game would direct your actions a little bit more or give out helpful hints on where to go. I have to hit the map menu a lot more then I should have to. The inside of the space station feels like it was ripped from a game where 640*800 was common place. That being said I have enjoyed playing the game. Its easy to get around and to play in space.

UPDATE: I just finished this game. It was a fun ride. The game does continue even if you do finish it. I dont finish many games so this game held my interest all the way to the very end. Great job developers.
developer_response:
Hi baddog993, I'm glad you enjoy the game. I just wanted to reply and say that you're right, the game was made 10+ years ago when widescreen just wasn't around. Everything was developed and hand positioned for a 1024x768 resolution... which is why you see the black bar space on space stations.

To be honest they drive me up the wall, too!! 

Thanks for taking the time to leave a review, really glad you're enjoying the game.

author: {'steamid': '76561199213452626', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 21080, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1349, 'last_played': 1651049319}

author: {'steamid': '76561198082430537', 'num_games_owned': 1182, 'num_reviews': 50, 'playtime_forever': 622, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 42, 'last_played': 1664598436}
review:
As much as I absolutely love this game to absolute oblivion, I simply cannot recommend this game because of how it uses Steam.

 This port of W101 is just simply "You can now play the game on Steam now have fun". Number one problem about this game is that you cannot link your W101 account. This is absolutely unacceptable. Keep in mind this is a game where you have to pay to open areas where you can progress the story, and not being able to use your account where you spent real money is just bad. Keep in mind that this game is 10 years old, imagine the veterans like me that want to experience the adventure again with the same account you have been playing for almost 10 years now and thrown dozens of dollars into. How much of a dissappointment this is.
     2nd problem being is that you still have to use the W101 website to pay the microtranscations. This is the Steam Version, this should not be here at all. Keep in mind that even Ubisoft of all companies lets you purchase DLC through Steam, even when it uses 3rd party programs. Just set up a heccing digital currency pack in the DLC section. It is not that hard.
     3rd problem is that there is only a free version. I would happily pay a 20-35 dollar fee to have access to all areas permanently so I would not have to give in to the mandatory microtransactions at all. A 1 Year membership (Access to all areas, digital currency pack, etc.) is like $50USD for 1 year, THIS GAME IS 10 YEARS OLD. Just have a purchasable version for around 30 dollars, but still allow the purchase of digital currency for optional mounts, pets, etc.

It is so sad to see one of my favorite games ever be mishandled so poorly when this game deserves it. Other than that is still the lovely RPG I played through 3rd grade. I'm not going to play it on Steam if I want to experience this game again.
developer_response:
Hi ness, thanks for playing Wizard101 and being part of our community!

We understand your concern here. We try to provide as many opportunities to adventure freely through the game as possible. This includes many ways to acquire Crowns as you adventure. We will keep working on this balance of access vs being able to support and grow the game.

The Wizard City revamp is just our first effort in "everything old is new again". While you do see original graphics after Wizard City, we want to eventually revamp graphics elsewhere when the resources become available to do so. Your feedback here has already been valuable in understanding what the community finds an interest in seeing changed.

We also apologize that you are not able to port over your existing account.

Please feel free to contact us directly if you have anything else you wish to share!

author: {'steamid': '76561198037425823', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 26, 'playtime_forever': 586, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 586, 'last_played': 1677431942}
review:
Game balance is whack, and gets increasingly more whack every time I try it. I want to like this game, it has a great concept and the devs have done a lot but ultimately I cannot find a fun experience.

For the dev:
I've already addressed this in my survey that is opened when you uninstall but buildings are near useless, Tier 2 fence taking 3 swings from infected before falling to 2 blips of health. 5 Infected almost overwhelmed 2 MG turrets. Took the engineer a whole day to patch ONE fence piece and most of the corner piece. 

Changed the day juggernauts spawn, they still spawn on day 2. Infected soldier shows up and one shots my engineer and soldier, and proceeds to soak up bullets from 2 said MG turrets for an entire minute, only falling to almost 3/4ths health and then Juggernaut shows up and destroys the turrets and barricade.

Game balance is so skewed towards the infected it's crazy. I've completed Pandemic mode in the past (well I cleared everything and chased around an invicible Chelsea) and the balance was good then, but my buildings and soldiers are shooting nonlethal and the fences are made out of twigs and twine.

The pangu virus has become the kevlar virus.

This is on experimental. I had to play experimental though as non-experimental seen absolute zero infected spawning. Well, sort of, the police faction obliterated them the second they spawned. I had to use a lot of drones to find that out.

I look forward to you fixing your game, but after 2 years+ I'm going to have to give you the thumbs down. This game is so far up my alley, a lot of issues I had were addressed in the past like bad pathfinding for people and vehicles, new things have been added but it's just not enough for me to be interested and frankly I'm annoyed that it was in a more playable state in the past compared to now.
developer_response: Please explain why you dislike the current game  balance so we can address it

review:
[h1]No updates since November 2018, don't buy until you see more activity[/h1]

Old review:

[h1]Monstrously good promise[/h1]

Let's hope it delivers.

Game has beautiful models, tight controls and great aesthetics. It really brings the dark fantasy Victorian setting to life.

Controls (the most important part of a brawler imo) are good and tight, I got into them in no time. Sadly enemy AI still need to get better.

Game is far from finished, and I've [b]found a bunch of glitches.[/b] Let's hope this game keeps up in the direction it's going, and doesn't fall short of the big promise the devs are making. If you want a finished game, I'd recommend you to wait and see how the game develops.

[b]I appreciate this running natively on Linux[/b], I really do.

author: {'steamid': '76561198056596594', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 8207, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 189, 'last_played': 1578439201}
review:
First: it's my personal opinion. And i love ALAWAR. My Mom also plays a lot of Alawar's ))))

STEAM offered me 25% discount and i ended up somehow buying this game with 20% off (((((). Yes, it wasn't expencive. But still i do not think it is worth it's price.
I enjoyed playing beholder. Played it till the end only once. During the second time i was bored...
So after the "special" sale and commercial that it is from the creators of the Beholder or related to that game sort of... i bought it.
I liked the idea, the introduction. But my eyes got tired very quickly. Although it may be because i set the brightness as the game recommended and played late at night. Not sure. But i can play much more comlicated games and this is the first game in 5 years that got my eyes hurt allmost instantly. Oh no, there was Evil Within with the same effect on my eyes.
No problems with the gameplay. Each "hero" has to deal with 3 problem: hunger, tiredness, cold, - check health and find "the way out" to the next level. For the game of this level it is enough.
My biggest issue was that you can't restart the game if your players die. The game saves your progress. You return, where you left the game. But if you die, you need to start from the beginning. 

WARNING, there may be SPOILERS: in my exact case one of the players bled out to death. I used 2 med kits (whitch do not stop bleeding dkw, although the are of 3 components and can be made only in 1 room at the map) and 2 shots of adrenalin and still he died of bleeding. It was just bad luck i couldn't find clean bandages 2 levels. Unlucky object respawn and i need to play all over again. Too complicated for Alawar game and for "easy" mode. It is supposed to be fun, entertaining and relaxing. If i am not tired and have free time i'd rather play L4D2 or anything else next time.

Left with the strange feeling: this is a game for girls. I played on "easy" level and couldn't walk through 3 levels. Wanted to play more but then get riminded that i need to start from the very beginning. It is the 21 century. People invented savings and checkpoints. Pity...
developer_response:
Rogue-like survival - it even sounds challenging. This genre is supposed to have no manual saves as it would ruin the core. 

Please, feel free to adjust brightness to your taste.

author: {'steamid': '76561198019749901', 'num_games_owned': 116, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 97, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 80, 'last_played': 1525934189}
review: It looks like a great game but the connection in co-op mode is so bad! Can you fix this issue dev?
developer_response:
1. Launch Steam client and go to Library.
2. In your library, right-click on Distrust and chose "PROPERTIES".
3. On the "PROPERTIES" window go to "LOCAL FILES" tab and select "BROWSE LOCAL FILES...".
4. The Explorer window will appear and you will see a folder with game files.
5. Inside that folder you will find "Logs" and "Distrust_Data" folders.
6. If the game ever crashed, there may also be a folder (or folders) with crash report, it will be named something like "2017-08-23-153045".
7. Inside "Distrust_Data" folder you will find "output_log.txt" file.
8. Press Win-R, type "dxdiag" in the opened window and click "OK".
9. In the opened window (DirectX Diagnostic Tool) click "Save All Information..." and save "DxDiag.txt" file. 
10. Zip "Logs" folder, folders with crash reports, "output_log.txt" file and "DxDiag.txt" file in one archive and send it to support@distrust.info.

author: {'steamid': '76561198117991560', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 70, 'playtime_forever': 547, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 80, 'last_played': 1697856219}
review: As a fan of Artix Entertainment, I do believe that AQ3D has potential, but if you were to ask me how I would rate this currently, I'd give it a 2/10. The graphics for this game are atrocious for a game that started development as recent as it did. AdventureQuest Worlds (aq.com/play-now), or even AdventureQuest (battleon.com) provide a far better gameplay experience than this. As much as this feels like there is effort being put into it, I think this is simply one more thing that will draw attention away from other games that Artix Entertainment has produced, similar as to what AdeventureQuest Worlds has done to AdventureQuest, although both are updated regularly, AdeventureQuest Worlds has received much more attention over recent years. I'm glad that AE is expanding into 3D game development, but I honestly don't feel that AdentureQuest 3D will or should survive. Furthermore, I feel that AQ3D feels more "pseudo-3D" rather than an actual 3D title, the movement is clunky as well as the viewing. The game overall isn't worth your installation.
developer_response: Thank you so much for your review and feedback. It is always an honor when a legacy player of ours helps test one of our new games! AdventureQuest 3D is inspired by our original games AdventureQuest and DragonFable and is quite different from AQWorlds. AQ3D is still in open beta when AdventureQuest has been active since 2002 and AQWorlds has been active since 2008, so it is not really comparable with our other older and much more extensive games. It has always been our dream to create a 3D MMO and first started creating AQ3D in 2012, before Flash decided to drop support on its new 3D program, so we were forced to learn Unity 3D then opened the Tech Demo for AQWorlds Members in November 2014. The headway we make on AQ3D, which is our first cross platform game, will help us work on improving our older 2D games and make them cross platform as well! Regarding the graphics and movement, we do suggest going to the in game options at the top left of the login screen and tweaking your graphics quality, camera options and resolution as this has helped other players who reported issues with the graphics and movement in game. You can also change your key binding options to see if that helps. The devs are constantly working on fixing and improving issues and releasing updates/patches almost weekly. This has been a constant balance as an indie game company with a small staff.  We also have a Game Plan posted here that is updated every Monday - https://aq3d.com/game-plan/.
