author: {'steamid': '76561198022546530', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 84, 'playtime_forever': 190, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 42, 'last_played': 1543204065}
review:
I will have to wait to give this a thumbs up. For a game that just came out this year, the graphics look more like something from a game that came out in 2003.  Also I don't like the fact that you cannot change the key bindings. That would really help. Long loading times are another minus . Gameplay is not that smooth but rather stilted or awkward.
Also in one area actually had an enemy appear out of thin air right next to me. And that of course killed me in the game.
Maybe having a difficulty level in this game might be a useful feature to have.
developer_response:
Thanks for checking out the game.

It is currently in Early Access and many more updates to improve the game will be coming soon.

One Note: The graphics are rendered using the Cell Shading graphical overlay to promote a "comic book" artistic style.

author: {'steamid': '76561199587442752', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 71, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 71, 'last_played': 1710340062}
review:
I understand that this is a free-to-play game but that doesn't really excuse this game's genuinely bad dialogue. I genuinely did not feel very immersed into the game at all and I was personally honestly kind of bored the entire time I did spend playing this game, I don't know how to describe the writing other then it being very unimaginative and being down right cringe at some points.

First of all I just want to also mention that I do like the style they went for with the player and npcs models and the clothing in game is actually not bad in terms of having some pretty good aesthetically pleasing however the actual world itself just isn't great at all, the graphics look outdated as fuck for the backgrounds and in general the camera controls feel very stiff and clunky.

Besides the dialogue being stiff this game also doesn't do anything innovative with it's combat system which like a lot of other MMORPGS it's clearly following a runescape sort of design that a lot of them follow but just isn't even comparable to runescapes system since the main ui for the different tabs is overcrowded as fuck and isn't helpful in the slightest, it is also really annoying to have to constantly go through said menu.

Overall, I wouldn't recommend this game to anyone even those who are really into MMORPGS personally rate Save yourself the frustration and play literally any other game. 
Overall my personal rating for this game is: 4/100
developer_response:
Thank you for your feedback. All Artix Games have a similar tone and dialogue, which is meant to be fun, engaging and humorous. We always use a lot of puns and memes in our games, and AQ3D is no exception. There are instances where you can skip dialogue/cutscenes and the devs may work on updating any older dialogue in the future. 

We understand that AQ3D’s stylized graphics aren’t for everyone; we’ve tried to keep the spirit of 3D MMOs alive with our current look. While a more modern look isn’t out of the question for AQ3D, our team is proud of our legacy and we are happy to honor it with our current graphics. If you are more concerned about graphics issues on your end, please go to the game options and make any changes in the graphics settings.

We hope you check back in to play AQ3D again in the future, as we have weekly releases and the game is always updating, changing and evolving. More information can be found via AQ3D.com under the News and Game Plan.

author: {'steamid': '76561198140952339', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 921, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 322, 'last_played': 1693248408}
review:
Football, Tactics & Glory (FTG) is basically a Turn-Based Strategy game dressed up as a football/soccer game, and yet, it mostly works!  I was looking at Football Manager and other spreadsheet type management sims, but this really isn't that.  A lot of people reference it being like X-COM (possibly my favorite PC game of all time), but it's essentially a simple tabletop game with RPG elements - your players will level up and acquire not only better ratings for passing, shooting, tackling, and ball control, but also roles and traits that become MASSIVELY important.  I'll admit to still not being very good at this game yet, but I'm still so happy to score a goal or grind out an ugly draw that I keep wanting to play more.

The game is bolstered by slick presentation and charming cartoon player models, not to mention a wealth of customization and community editing options.  (There are plenty of Steam Workshop downloads for real-life leagues and kits).  

If I had a criticism of FTG after the first few hours, it's probably that the gameplay itself can feel repetitive and there actually isn't that much to do in the menus.  Yes, it's a full-featured franchise mode with player transfers, but the transfer window is closed most of the time.  So, if your team is bad, you basically have no recourse but to grind out XP week after week and manage player development.  We're looking at another DLC package in late 2021, so I will be interested to see if the dev considers how to make this a richer long-term experience.

That aside, I'm very pleased with this game.  If you've played FIFA into the ground, and aren't ready to hand your life over to Football Manager, FTG is a clever, satisfying alternative.

author: {'steamid': '76561198078634264', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 1087, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 673, 'last_played': 1484270557}
review:
I haven´t completed this game yet at the time of writing, but [u]I need to see no more before I make up my mind[/u].

BUY THIS GAME! It's unlikely you would regret it.

The game is exacly what the store page leads to belive, and than some more.
The game is not too short, like some other games in the genre. There is enough content to enjoy.
The puzzles are not very hard, but also not completely obvious. The art style is robust but very good!
The voice acting is falwless. And The game is filled with (mostly sarcastic) humor. Humor is difficult to do right, but I assure you this game is done just right!
You can tell work and love was put into this game. It wasn't made in one day, so to say.
The storyline progresses as you progress in the game, keeping the game even more interesting. I find the story original and interesting. Not predictable, but once you progress it makes sens. A good storyline!

The game will make you laugh, it will show you beutiful places, it will spark you imagination... It's just worth buying! Buy it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198043682538', 'num_games_owned': 336, 'num_reviews': 21, 'playtime_forever': 501, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 501, 'last_played': 1388737056}
review: This game is awesome. It seems like a simple point-and-click adventure game at first but it's full of surprises. The puzzles in the game aren't complicated but are still challenging enough to make you stop and think about it. There are a lot of different endings and multiple ways to complete the end goal. It's world is very engaging and it was the first "point-and-click" game that I wanted to keep playing after it was over. Art style, music/sound, characters, and story are all wonderful. I am looking forward to see what else the developers are working on next.

author: {'steamid': '76561198038133830', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 31, 'playtime_forever': 487, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 487, 'last_played': 1481525390}
review: 7/10. Good game but not great. The setting, the music, the art style, and the writing are all good, but the sameness of the aesthetic does get a bit monotonous by the end of the game. So much brown and gray everywhere. It's also a little on the short side, and has the usual flaws of point-and-click adventure games. You know, like "I'm stuck because I didn't see this tiny object that's barely visible against the monochrome background." If that doesn't bother you then you will probably like Primordia more than I did.

author: {'steamid': '76561198363218375', 'num_games_owned': 128, 'num_reviews': 20, 'playtime_forever': 136, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 48, 'last_played': 1661378393}
review:
not really fun at all, but has lots of potential.
some things i would like to see:
-various tutorials (including combat, deck building, blueprint, specify the win conditions please)
-map themes (currently is green and gray, but could randomly be blue and white etc...)
-a mechanic to prevent the game from lasting 20 minutes
-a "confirm" feature, where when both players are finished their turns, the timer is immediatley expired
-upon winning a game, you are rewarded with a new card
-after turn 15, you get 2 crystals per turn
i could see myself playing this again.
developer_response:
Thanks for your feedback!

We'll definitely look into adding a tutorial to the game.
I watched your gameplay video as well and saw that you were having trouble understanding the game.

The "skip turn" button actually does what you want the "confirm" feature to do.
But the name can be a little confusing.

But when we make a tutorial soon, I'll be sure to add in that the skip turn button does that.

author: {'steamid': '76561198020882946', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 160, 'playtime_forever': 4514, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1067, 'last_played': 1567046323}
review:
Bottom line, game is fun. Other players can make it frustrating and its hard to get friends. Needs a clan system and a little bit more slots where crafting is concerned. I get that its a free to play model but man does it limit like crazy right off the bat. Resources, Junk and crates are all part of the same inventory. You'll be forced to make a lot of hard decisions about what to keep and what not to keep and it has nothing to do with the game. Pretty lame. Market is really good and it seems like most of the items you get after a certain point are either crafted or bought from the market where somebody else has crafted it and put it up for sale.

Just noticed they responded to my negative review. Well anyways, after I wrote it I kept wanting to play in spite of a series of bad experiences with other players. Are some of these bots?
developer_response:
Oh. It's sad that you disclike the game overall. But give us a chance. We have certain problems at release which made online less than we expect. Join our official Discord chanel it's always easy to find a team there. 

Talking about economics we're going to make certain changes to make it more friendly for new comers. We also will improve junk indication.

author: {'steamid': '76561197990920088', 'num_games_owned': 221, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 649, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 588, 'last_played': 1444555734}
review:
I recommend this game to Those Who prefer to command a troops not a city . (Battle for Europe)


Fight system is just awesome . It matters if you are holding the ground on the hill , it matters if you have high morale on one of your squads, it matters how experienced the squad is; you  have to check your coal level too because if it drops to zero, your troops wont shoot the enemy. :S


 Do not turn on the Arcade mode! :-)

author: {'steamid': '76561198004499559', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 669, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 669, 'last_played': 1356076800}
review:
Short but very good. Its set in a post apocolypse setting, with all robots. The story follows our hero and a robot built by said hero on a journy to get back somthing stolen from him...

Its an adventure game, not a lot of action, most things are acomplished by trying to use items on things in the world, or on eachother. Most of the puzzles are pretty simple, and the game isnt very long. The story is very well writen and the voice acting is top notch. The games reselution is SUPER LOW, but the art work is still atractive....would have been nicer at a higher reselution but eh, what can you do.

For $10 its kind of short (assumeing you get every puzzle right instantly, or dont want to see a diffrent ending that requiers you to play with diffrent outcomes) but is still very sweet.

author: {'steamid': '76561199003894036', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 122, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 122, 'last_played': 1626090223}
review: Freezing every 10 minutes, you have to restart game to play again
developer_response: Heya, COCOT! I am sorry to hear about the freezing issues you have noticed in The Crew 2! To address this further, I recommend that you [url=https://ubi.li/cpsff]verify your game files[/url] and follow these [url=https://ubi.li/gxhFR]PC troubleshooting steps.[/url] Additionally, I suggest that you check out this  [url=https://ubi.li/Vsw7a]connection optimization guide[/url] to be sure your setup can communicate directly with The Crew network. For any questions regarding the port forwarding process, please refer to [url=https://ubi.li/Dbiwc]this site.[/url] If you encounter any additional issues, please grab a copy of your [url=https://ubi.li/lOylM]MSinfo/DxDiag Files[/url] along with a screenshot of your forwarded port configuration and any error messages you notice so that our [url=https://support.ubisoft.com/en-US]support team[/url] can get a closer look at this situation for you!

author: {'steamid': '76561198004237534', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 28, 'playtime_forever': 1617, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 202, 'last_played': 1651050957}
review:
Unless you're completely still when you initiate the auto docking, it will betray you by gently gliding you into the exterior of the docking station, forcing you to bounce around inside the station before you explode, losing all your Tobacco.
If you try to hyperdrive to a system, there'll be a planet nearby you hadn't noticed stopping you from warping; not close enough to make the 'mass warning' light come on, just close enough for the rings around it to immediately disable your jump after it starts. And instead of telling you the reason you can't warp, the game spawns in a fucking pirate to demand 1 ton of your repurchased tobacco, and when you refuse, he'll fly directly into you causing you to die again.
Finally, when you lost your 7 tons of quest Tea when the pirate rammed you, you'll warp all the way back to the station you received it, buy some more, and fly back to the station waypointed for the quest, only to realise the quest can't have any old tea, and you've got to abandon the mission, wasting your time, money and life.
Play Rebel Galaxy Outlaw instead. Atleast in that game, you lose your money because the bot you're playing pool with cheats.
developer_response:
Hi there!

I'm sorry to hear you've had trouble in-game! Please get in touch with the team via https://customersupport.frontier.co.uk/hc/en-us and we can take a look!

~ Viking

author: {'steamid': '76561197995060335', 'num_games_owned': 227, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 5742, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 5118, 'last_played': 1567041682}
review:
Ok fun game besides the Pay Wall BUT, whilst at Basic Training my account was hacked into and i lost EVERYTHING. Hours of work and money. I tried going to their site to see if recovering my lost items would be possible, 

-"Account compromised
    According to our Terms of Use you are solely responsible for maintaining the confidentiality of your login information:"

It was confidential, my password is random letters and numbers like every other password, so random i have it written down at my desk. Who ever got into my account MUST have gone into their servers. 

So beware spending time/money on this game. 
All of that could be lost in a day, and you can't do **** about it.
-Enjoy.

Edit: Years late i know, but here's extra clarity. 

"avoiding dodgy links, downloads and not leaving your information on case shop pages are also quite crucial for keeping your account safe." 

That is a total lie, as i stated above i was away from home for a few months with no access to my laptop. So no links or actions were done in that time on a machine that was OFF.
On top of that I used a different PC for browsing and emails. Gaming was the only purpose and use of this machine. Account hacked regardless.
developer_response:
Thank you for your feedback. Please note that the account security relies not only on the quality of the password itself: avoiding dodgy links, downloads and not leaving your information on case shop pages are also quite crucial for keeping your account safe. Also a 2-step authentification tied to your phone will make it impossible to hack into your account and we recommend to set it up. 
 Please be sure to contact our technical support for other issues related to security.

author: {'steamid': '76561198266359860', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 49, 'playtime_forever': 196, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 196, 'last_played': 1563457315}
review:
One thing for sure, this game is a blast.  Those who miss old school 90s Doom and Wolfenstein, will love this.  Such a fun game.  Super old school 90s FPS.  I highly recommend even though playing under max settings, there is a lot of drops and performance isn't very good.  Seems like dynamic shadows takes a super heavy toll even for my Ryzen 5 2600X and 1070 TI.  

Using an XB1 controller FYI.  Very smooth, it takes a bit use to the button layout but overall, I have zero issues besides some awkward timing on the jumps from time to time.  

They just need to fix that random craziness that goes down when you pick up the green pill.  Sometimes you get stuck randomly for a few seconds and can't move.  Very odd and annoying at times.  It makes me avoid picking it up.  

Here's a video of playing it under max settings:

https://youtu.be/T_aJeermyAs
developer_response: Glad you enjoyed the game.  We'll work on improving performance during early access.  I looked at your video about the green powerup and that seems like a bug, good catch ;)  Will fix.  Come to the forums for more feedback.

review: Great visuals, OST had a Stalker touch, combat mechanics were somewhat decent, the story was engaging for sure. Between that and how realistic the maps looked, it felt like having a trip to Pripyat and exploring that abandoned city and its surroundings, seeing the remains of a bygone world power. Hello HELLO:^) 
Thank you for your feedback. 
Would you mind going into a little more detail? 
We have added a tutorial to the 0.95 update which addresses all of the game's features and provides assistance. 

The game is admittedly hard and has a steep learning curve. Requires a careful approach if you wanna thrive, not just survive.

I would recommend crafting a stone axe and an improvised bag out of materials you can find ANYWHERE on the Island. 
Also, try playing on a private server with loot boosted to get the hang of the game before going on an official server. 

We hope you revisit the game and perhaps change your mind. 
Have a great day!

author: {'steamid': '76561198011382847', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 2239, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1058, 'last_played': 1651342198}
review:
This game is incredibly enjoyable and really captures the old Dungeon Keeper spirit, while adding a few tricks of its own.

I avoided the rocky, buggy launch at the start and have come in a bit later into the game. Boy was it worth hanging back, as the recent review score shows (81% as of writing this)

The expansion is great, the campaign is fun (better then DK2 I would say as there's an emphasis on variation between missions) and the old sandbox and skirmish maps are there. 

What really made the old Dungeon Keepers stand out was the player made maps. Getting PCGamer magazines as a kid with the disks that contained the odd extra map, or downloading them achingly slow off of third party websites on dial up, all that fun. I'm glad to see the workshop in action to allow some great player content.

I cannot recommend this game enough if you're after a real successor to DK3.

author: {'steamid': '76561198018124881', 'num_games_owned': 397, 'num_reviews': 105, 'playtime_forever': 90, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 32, 'last_played': 1588506140}
review:
I'm not sure if I should post a positive or negative review for this game. It seems like solid game, just not built for VR experience.

Pros:
This game gives a solid 'man in space' feel (as long as you do not look inside man made structures). Overal atmosphere is solid.

Cons:
1. Movement. You can't push yourself of surfaces, you can't use environment to decelerate, you can't attach yourself to surfaces. I might have a relatively high 'VR in space' movement standards, but I feel like these ones are definition of what movement in space should be like.
2. VR games in general tend to favor interactions with environment, in this game there are no VR-like interactions. You see container with oxygen - you look at it and press 'A', it just changes color to dark and your tank indicates that it got more gas. Items that you pick up with 'A' just disapear. You click on a panel and item appears. There are no on-screen buttons. Lack of interaction is notiecable and immersion breaking.
3. Controls. These are not controls for VR spacesuit, but controls made for keyboard and mouse that were mapped to controllers. While I agree with overal control type (you need to engage thrusters to rotate or move), I think controls (at least for oculus controllers) could have been done better.
4. Environment. Most structures do not give a feel of something made for space and do not add properly to environment. Lots of unused surfaces, bare walls and ceilings, most things are uselesly huge (I understand that spacesuit is large and need large passages, but not everything). Not enough 'fillers' be that toilets, tables, suit locker, equipment or whatewer else. Example: the most defining feature of airlock are two large screen (one with vent below) and how bare it is: no railings, no places to lock cargo, no ports where suits were supposed to connect their safeties or life support, no override ports or notiecable access hatches.
developer_response: Hi andreykl, thank you for your valid feedback. Detached was made for VR three years ago, and we appreciate that you took the time to write this detailed review. We will take your opinion into consideration while we focus on Gamedec - our newest project.

author: {'steamid': '76561197986204235', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 40, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 40, 'last_played': 1550723816}
review: What a mess! Use an X Box controller and nothing works. Use a PS4 controller and everything except DPad works. Go to forums for support, dev tells you to download third party app to solve problems he is too lazy to fix. Can't believe this guy is working on a Nintendo switch port while he can't even get PC right. Just a pure money grab. Even at the 50% off I bought it for it's still a rip off. If you're looking for a fun zelda like game that actually works, go with shotgun legend.
developer_response:
For what it's worth, the game does say 'Partial Controller Support" on the store page. This is due to engine limitations. Because the controller support is *Partial*, and not *Full* - which would be a lie -  I recommended a 3rd party app so you can still enjoy your playing experience. I like to think that this is a kind gesture, rather than saying something like "just refund it." I am trying to reach out with kindness.

Calling it a 'cash grab' is rude. I am not in this business to scam people. We worked very hard on this game, so people could enjoy it!

Anyways, as demonstrated by the many positive reviews and videos, the game clearly works. I encourage you to keep playing despite the problems from the partial controller support! I think you will enjoy it. 

--Update--

For what it's worth, I did find a new Controller thing for Adobe AIR, so it's possible a fix might happen.

author: {'steamid': '76561197980845618', 'num_games_owned': 471, 'num_reviews': 33, 'playtime_forever': 107, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 107, 'last_played': 1595635943}
review: Beware of this one.  Devs are more concerned about defending DLC practices than putting through the game's first seriously needed patch after months.  Already on sale before any patch.  Very pretty game, but absolutely cannot recommend with such practices.
developer_response:
Edit:

The 1.2 content patch is out now! Including new boss, challenge room, item gallery, progression overhaul, bug fixes and much more!

We've also updated the experimental branch with much more content to try including new enemies, puzzles, music and more too.

You can read the full notes here: https://steamcommunity.com/games/788100/announcements/detail/2952633082352515389

We really hope you give the game another shot! 

Hey there,

Sorry you feel upset about the Loveable Rogues DLC, however, this was originally an early adopters bonus like a pre-order bonus, no extra work has gone into it since launch. People who bought the game in the first week of launch got it for free and it became on sale since then.

We are also very close to a new patch releasing here on Steam, though you can already play many of the changes in the experimental branch - https://store.steampowered.com/newshub/app/788100/view/2753339286193349785

We also did patch the game following launch with a lot of quality of life changes requested by the community.

We hope you'll give the game another chance!

author: {'steamid': '76561197960934791', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 41, 'playtime_forever': 86, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 86, 'last_played': 1503525921}
review:
I think the other early reviews here are a bit biased. 
Maybe from the devs or people who were hyped?

I just discovered this game today and I find it quite boring. 
And I don't like how the game plays or looks;
Firstly you have all these outlines around your characters and things you can interact with.
This might be handy, but it makes exploring boring; you know excactly where you can search for loot.
It also takes away the immersion. I was hoping for a more realistic look like Fallout 1 or 2.
I would also like to have more control of my character than just clicking where he needs to go. 
This would have made combat more fun.
I give the game a 2 / 5 stars rating.
developer_response:
Dear 127Tom!

Our developers didn't write any of these reviews. Not our methods.

It seems like you wanted a completely different game. But all features in Distrust are well-thought-out and included on purpose. Some are for the atmosphere, another are for the plot, etc. 

Pity we didn't meet your demands.

review: GOLFVR just left beta and I have to say its pretty amazing. author: {'steamid': '76561198066425326', 'num_games_owned': 348, 'num_reviews': 26, 'playtime_forever': 73, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 46, 'last_played': 1612741778}
review: Worst interface I ever saw in a game, I have a Logitech G920 and I never found out how to configure it, I had to see videos on how to play this game to be able to play it, actually I don't even find how to EXIT the game, I have over 1.000 games on all platforms and this is by far the worst interface I've seen...  Even if I try hard I would not be able to make a bad interface and non-intuitive game like this.
developer_response: Hello there! I'm incredibly sorry to hear about the issues you have experienced in The Crew 2. Since the Logitech G920 is listed as a [url=https://support.ubisoft.com/en-US/Article/000063450]supported peripheral in The Crew 2[/url], you should be able to configure the controls for it in the game's settings. If you've been experiencing technical issues, however, please [url=https://support.steampowered.com/kb_article.php?ref=2037-QEUH-3335]verify the game's files[/url] in Steam. Doing so will replace any missing or corrupted game files that could be causing this, then ensure that everything else required for the game is installed correctly. Afterward, please complete the rest of our [url=https://support.ubisoft.com/en-us/Article/000061047/General-PC-Troubleshooting/]technical troubleshooting guide[/url]. Those steps are quick to complete and tend to resolve various technical problems, while also improving game performance. Ultimately, please do not hesitate to open a case at support.ubi.com to receive further assistance from our technical support team. In your case, please provide as much detail as possible regarding what is preventing you from configuring and using your wheel in-game. Our team would be more than happy to help!

author: {'steamid': '76561198034361451', 'num_games_owned': 78, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 964, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 964, 'last_played': 1597927411}
review:
The game is fun to play, but SUPER Pay 2 Win.
Pros: 
- Story Mode
- PvE 
- PvP
- Nice car builder garage
Cons:
You have to payyyyy to get stuff!!
Even if you want to craft stuff that you took time to collect the materials, it costs REAL Money + Crafting Materials to upgrade your crappy item. WTF!?!? Sadly, for that reason I will not continue to play this until this is fixed.
Tip for new players: If you want to start this game, know that you MUST use REAL MONEY to progress!
developer_response:
Hello DbK,
Crossout is a free to play game, and many players enjoy it just like that, without purchasing any packs. Purchasing a pack can save some time in obtaining a certain part or a weapon you want, but it won't guarantee winning: Crossout is a game of skill, and the success in battles relies heavily on your personal fighting style and correctly chosen tactics and weapons/builds for that style. Also teamplay can add a lot. 

Everything the packs contain can be obtained from the ingame market for the ingame coins players earn for selling their loot or crafted parts on the same ingame market. The same goes for crafting - real money is not required, you use only the ingame currency! 

Also weekend specials sometime include free workbench rental to craft parts and discounted fusion when you need 2 identical parts instead of 3 to fuse them and upgrade the resulting part, so it would be prudent to keep an eye for the announcements about the weekend specials - we make them in our social media, forum and in the game too.

author: {'steamid': '76561198115234946', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 22, 'playtime_forever': 11675, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3179, 'last_played': 1578066099}
review:
If you bought this: ask for your money back.

My crew dies of hunger because my biologists don't prioritize high yield crops. My structures are in disrepair because, even though the "out of spares" message flashes every 30 seconds my *single* engineer decides to make semiconductors instead of spares.

This game lacks a decent NPC AI, especially since you can *not* guide or command them yourself. Until they fix that DO NOT BUY.
developer_response:
Hello there, thank you for your feedback,

We are always listening to the community and fixing any issues in the game.

You might want to have a look at our AI FAQ here:
steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=577310241#898896

This explains the behaviour of colonists in more detail, but if you think you've found a bug you can send us a savegame to "bugs at madrugaworks dot com" and we will investigate ASAP.
(Saves are in Documents/Planetbase/Saves)

Thank you!

author: {'steamid': '76561197999779103', 'num_games_owned': 1414, 'num_reviews': 29, 'playtime_forever': 426, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 350, 'last_played': 1417341209}

author: {'steamid': '76561198081412864', 'num_games_owned': 919, 'num_reviews': 33, 'playtime_forever': 7900, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1008, 'last_played': 1647628940}
review:
Like most games AQ3D does have its pros and its cons, but look at it through the eyes of the people who have been dying to see this for years and they do not care. I would have liked to say the story is why most people play, but I believe it to mostly be for nostalgia purposes, as i have played the original aq since the beginning. 
It IS in beta, so you need to realize the story isnt all there, but like most AQ games, it is being worked on while you are playing.
PROS
-nostalgia
-dragon chickens
-tactical (on occasion)
CONS
-LOW EXP (like all AQ games)
-no customizability (unlike other aq games, you cant use the same weapon for "fashion", this time it is all for stats)
-You are a weak baby. (you start the game WEAK, like most games, but with the exp not levelling your stats up fast enough and the equipment you get that is only barely pushing you above what you already have, makes this the slowest rise to power you could think of in an MMO. You will probably die, over and over, unless you decide to BATTLE ON! with friends or anons, combining forces to take down things, but realize that if you decide to be the tank, you are as soft as spongebob squarepants on the frontline)

The exp grinding is fucking ridiculous. I'm still level 9 in doomwood, can't "grind" because its hard to find anyone going in the dungeons in doomwood. the story questline itself should push you to the level you need to be.
I used to recommend this game, now i just dont
developer_response: Hello! Thank you for your review and we apologize it was missed! We are going back through some older reviews so we can gather more feedback. The game has grown a lot in the last year or so and the devs are constantly working on fixing and improving issues and releasing updates/patches almost weekly.  This has been a constant balance as an indie game company with a small staff. We also have a Game Plan posted here that is updated every Monday - https://aq3d.com/game-plan/. We appreciate your valued feedback and hope you will check the game out again in the future! It is always an honor when a legacy player of ours checks out our new games.

author: {'steamid': '76561198031260394', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 14, 'playtime_forever': 169, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 169, 'last_played': 1491229734}
review:
I previously played War for the Overworld way before it launched. At the time it was pretty buggy and unbalanced, so I wanted to leave it a while before fully judging it. The team had a pretty rough launch, it seemed but having given it a go again recently, I'm really pleased with how much work they've put in to the game since then. 

They've clearly worked very hard to make it as close to the original Dungeon Keeper games as possible, in all departments. Style, gameplay and soundtrack all feel very familiar but with lots of new twists and gameplay features. It very much feels like a spiritual successor to the original games.  

It's also really clear to see how they've listened to feedback from the community and worked on improving the game continuously for such a long time after launch. It's a thoroughly enjoyable experience, and it's only more likely to carry on improving. 

If you're a fan of the original Dungeon Keeper games, I'd highly suggest picking this up.

review:

It's under an hour long with no replayability other than endless mode, which gets quite repetitive with small maps and small loading times between each wave that kill the pace of combat. author: {'steamid': '76561197972340288', 'num_games_owned': 959, 'num_reviews': 62, 'playtime_forever': 169, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 169, 'last_played': 1536084009}
review:
Update: The developer has updated to game to address some of my concerns. That is *very cool*. 'Easy Mode' has been added, which is still very hard.

RE: Unapproachable Controls: Slight turns are now possible, and a fun drifting mechanic has been implemented. This is a big help. 

RE: Powerups and road hazards look similar. Helpful icons have been added over power ups that help differentiate them from hazaards.

RE: Death walls. The walls of the arena electrocute you, and cause damage to your car. A front end collision with a wall is basically a death sentence. This is still a frustrating way to end a match.

Carsteroids is coming along well, but it still feels like an early access game. It's not quite fun yet, though it definitely has the potential to get there.

I am giving this game a positive review based on my experience with the developer, and my confidence in the future of this game.
developer_response:
Thanks for updating your review, I really appreciate that. 
The difficulty setting has been adjusted and some new items help your fight. The power-ups have different icons and they are more recognizable during the game. The walls are now less dangerous, especially if you upgrade your armor. 
I am still working on the new content and I'm heavy testing the game. Hope you are still enjoying play!

author: {'steamid': '76561197966649882', 'num_games_owned': 2002, 'num_reviews': 90, 'playtime_forever': 143, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 143, 'last_played': 1497043387}
review:
[h1] Detached- [i] Feeling small and insignificant in the vastness of space has never felt so good ![/i][/h1]
6 degrees of motion is a term i have heard hurled about a lot, and very rarely is it true or if true very rarely is it good to control, detached uses the motion controllers in a very good way (once you get used to them) allowing you to control your direction and angle very well.
It is also one of the most beautiful games i have seen (we are starting to raise the bar in visual quality for vr games, as developers get more used to the strengths and weaknesses of the system and as the engines they use get better and better)
 
[b]ROOMSCALE / ENVIRONMENT[/b] 
The area you will be spending most of your time in the single player game is very well designed and the first time you go into space you really well feel somewhat small and insignificant against a large open space of ...well space.
Oh man that feeling as you look across at a huge asteroid beside you and see your shadow as it sails across it, tiny in comparison. This game really has got some good environments.
Now roomscale…. You are in your space suit and this is done very well so long as you do not move about too much in your physical room, which let's face it you should not do because there is zero gravity and if you want to keep to realism you would not be able to move, but if you do the suit does try to move with you and sometimes it jolts, i also had to use the re-centre button a lot more then i really should of. I tried the game sat down and found i was looking up way too much to make that comfortable.
So if you are stood and do not move about too much in the real world then it is perfect...if you are a fidgeter then be prepared to put up with the odd minor inconvenience (and minor they are)
 
[b]GRAPHICS[/b] 
Again they are great, even when i managed to get an extremely close look at the textures on an asteroid they looked very clear. The assets used are good too. This is one of the higher tier graphical games (i am noticing that Unreal engine seems to be cable of some really nice visuals these days)
 
[b]PERFORMANCE[/b] 
A mixed bag here, first let us clear up one thing, the performance in terms of framerate is spot on, no problem there (though i did lower the pixel density a little due to recording in HD was causing a tiny judder) 
However i experienced two bugs one major and one critical, a door control failed to appear until i left and returned. And the critical one is related to story progression a couple of hours in. To mention the critical one in detail would be a major spoiler, these are bugs that really should not be in a non early access title, but both have been reported and i am sure the developer will fix them.
*EDIT 10/06/17 The critical bug is actually a product of unintuitive design, where the player believes they should do one thing and are meant to do something somewhat crazy. This while still bad is much less bad then a critical bug (and i am told will be fixed in the next two weeks)
 
[b]INTUITIVENESS[/b] 
There is a little learning curve but once you grasp how the controls work it is actually really intuitive. No complaints here.

[b]MOTION SICKNESS[/b]
Make sure that your options are set low enough for you pc to not be reprojecting frames and you should be fine. The fact you can see your helmet around you gives you something to ground yourself with and the even though you will feel like you are moving (at one point i was close enough to a wall for the chaperone to appear and for a minute i really thought it was stupid of the game to rotate the chaperone wall with the character i felt that much like i was the one moving….hard to explain). In all honesty though i do seem to have somewhat of an iron stomach when it comes to vr.
 
[b]MULTIPLAYER:[/b]
I was unable to test this properly, it has 1v1 multiplayer and the devs did say they could organise a game with them for me to try it, but i wanted to try it as any normal person picking up the game would…. I could not find a single player. Even with a heads up posted on the forum and a 30 to 40 minute wait (not an exaggeration i really did sit and wait for nearly 40 minutes) there was no one playing, get this for its singleplayer content not the multiplayer.
 
[b]PROS:[/b] 
[list]
[*] The movement system is really well done
[*] The atmosphere and feeling of floating in space of being small in a very large area is perfect.
[*] Freedom to achieve your goals in the order you want to do them in.
[*] Graphics are superb.
[*] In my first test i thought i had only played for 15 or 20 minutes, turns out it was double that, sign of a good game!
[*] The developers engage with their users on the forums, can not tell you how important and major that is.
[*] The few cutscenes for the single player are so good. 
[/list]
 
[b]CONS:[/b] 
[list]
[*] No online community.
[*] It is a tad on the expensive side, worth it for the single player but only just, a lower price point may solve the lack of an online community.
[/list]
 
[b]The first try video:[/b]
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=9rzallYGxsQ
 
[b]VERDICT[/b] 
I have 2 hours invested in the single player already and once the bug that stops me continuing is fixed (and i am sure it will be given the devs commitment to the game) i will play more. This is a breathtaking game visually and atmospherically so hell yes i recommend it….just do not buy it for the multiplayer.

author: {'steamid': '76561198195471543', 'num_games_owned': 209, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 601, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 376, 'last_played': 1687112467}
review: I should start by saying that I played this game long before it ever came to steam when it was in its infancy and free to download online. Since this game moved to steam it has been improved dramatically! And while there are still issues with it and bugs, I would say this is one of the better walking-based horror games on steam. The plot of this game is interesting, yet character development is not something that is a fundamental focus of this title. Therefore, one should not expect to play this game for rich character development, like one would expect in SOMA, or amnesia. The main reason I play this and the main reason I would recommend somebody else to play this is the atmosphere. The atmosphere and environmental design in this game is fantastic, and while I have never been scared by playing this game it certainly does have an in-game environment that leaves you wanting to come back for more. Overall, even though this game does still have some bugs and grammatical errors as English is not the native language of the developer, I still give this game a thumbs up, as I think it is a great choice for anyone who wants an immersive atmospheric horror game.
developer_response:
Hi!

Thank you for your feedback.
Please, show me the places with grammatical errors. We will be able to fix it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198201919969', 'num_games_owned': 2298, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 1762, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 317, 'last_played': 1559149251}
review:
I've been following this game from the very start. As a matter of fact, I've been following the developers ever since Dragonfable, some 10 years ago. 

The game has some rather simple-looking graphics, though of the kind that I love. From the start, it was clear that AQ3D was heavily inspired by WoW. Take the mage with their fireball and casting time, for instance. While they're not so special in that regard, they really excell in what they always do: their very own lore and puns. 

As it is right now, I find the game a charming MMORPG, that seems to work a little better on mobile than it does on PC, though they've optimized it for both. The crafting system with crafting time is something that fits particularly well with playing in quick bursts on a phone.

author: {'steamid': '76561198168739678', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 11, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 11, 'last_played': 1668965068}
review: DO NOT BUY the game will crash for no reason no matter what your graphics settings are
developer_response:
Hi there!

We’re now looking into the crashing issue, and it’d be a great help if you could send your DxDiag file to info@breathedge.com.

How to get it:

1) Press the Win + R keys to bring up the Run command
2) In the "Run" command box, type in "dxdiag" (without quotes)
3) Press Enter
4) Once the DirectX Diagnostic Tool appears, click on the Save All Information button at the bottom
5) Save the file

Thanks in advance!

author: {'steamid': '76561198001448028', 'num_games_owned': 3265, 'num_reviews': 80, 'playtime_forever': 62, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 54, 'last_played': 1709763864}
review:
While the premise of visual novel and racing game sounds awesome on paper, the execution is very poor.

The visuals are nice, the VHS vibe with 1980 cyan and pink colors is gorgeous to look at, the story is mystical and interresting but the gameplay is absolutely horrible.

I wish I could say that it's purely skill based, but in the end, luck is the only factor that matters when controling the ship.
Tracks are sloppily put together, there are small gaps in the environment over which you can pass without any problems, fall trough or even get stuck for eternity. Several parts of the track are also based on pure luck with no proper thought put into it. Go to the left and proceed? Or turn right and have absolutely no chance to finish the race because the route you chose was not intended for you to drive on - what kind of gamedesign is this? If it was atleast a tougher route which leads back to the main track, okay - but it was made to kill youor never properly tested.

But the worst part are the controls. The jumping is an absolute desaster. The game never communicates that there is a double jump, however, there is one and you need it - the problem is, it only works in 70% of the cases. Jump height is inconsistent, sometimes the double jump works, at other times it does not at all - it seems too often that if you jump once, the game thinks that you are still in mid-air, even while on the ground for several seconds.... only to have you execute a whimpy leap over an obstacle, killing you.

Unity is an easy to learn engine with a lot of tutorials, games like these have been pulled off flawlessly in the last 30 years so it baffles me how the basic gameplay and controls falls so badly on its face.

I hope for a patch soon but for now I cannot recommend it at all.

author: {'steamid': '76561198219821031', 'num_games_owned': 376, 'num_reviews': 103, 'playtime_forever': 1211, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1211, 'last_played': 1702462688}
review: it's an ok game at best, with basic, not so great combat. They really want you to do the "attack cancelling" they explain in the game's manual. To say i was unhappy is an understatement. Music and Art are ok, Story barely exists. A mid game but that crash really pushed it into the negative for me.

author: {'steamid': '76561197972208117', 'num_games_owned': 344, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 5035, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1220, 'last_played': 1622953181}
review:
[h1]Update - 27 January 2016[/h1]
The game has become more stable overall, but is still struggeling to run smoothly on larger levels later in the campaign.

[h1]Recommendation based on v1.0[/h1]
This game could be as good as DK 2, if only you could play it properly. There are some real show-stopping bugs where you can't even progress in the campaign - Level 3, Seriously? It's like playing an episode, waiting for the next patch to come out so that hopefully you'll be able to progress.

Sure, it'll all work in a week or so. But I cannot understand the reason why anyone would release a game in this state. There is no objective excuse for it in regards to the customer - especially since it has been in early access for so long - period.
developer_response:
Hi eaxs,

I'm not sure when you last played but we've made huge sweeping improvements since your review in 2015. We released the game in an unfortunate state in April 2015 but never stopped updating it. With over 80 updates since then, 7 major updates containing tonnes of new features it's an entirely different game.

Since then we've been regularly updating the game with 7 major patches, over 80 minor ones and four expansions. As an early access supporter, you even have the first expansion for free, and the second expansion was free for everyone! 

Most importantly the stability and performance of the game has been now greatly improved after thousands of man-hours of development in out two-man code team spent patching it up.

If you've not tried the game for a while now might be a great time for you to jump in and see how far we've come since release! We'd love to hear what you think now.

Cheers,
Cian

author: {'steamid': '76561197997833857', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 16, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 16, 'last_played': 1552208109}
review:
While this game is still in early access, there are A LOT of bugs that really put a damper on the experience. Primarily, there is a lot of erroneous hit detection which sends objects flying in random directions resulting in you needing to return them to a proper place for the first process. Having to switch between tongs and hammer manually is rather slow and cumbersome, which allows the metal to cool too quickly before you can really begin to work the metal properly, which means another trip back to the smelter so drop the hammer, pick up the tongs, drop the ingot in, find the thermometer and try to the find the spot where the thermometer picks up the temperature, which typically is no where near the ingot. Frankly, I would prefer either a mouse wheel rotation, or a button press to switch between hammer and tongs so those precious seconds aren't lost between forgings. Also, attaching the thermometer to the forge itself and using a method of color on the ingot to determine whether or not it is ready i think would be a much smoother process in the long run.

All in all, the game really captures the concepts of forging quite well, but I think right now it is just missing the mark on transitioning comfortably between tools and awkward hit detection. Should shape up to be a solid game in the very near future.
developer_response: During these months we have been working on the game to fix a lot of bugs and add more content to the game. Please try again to play the game, maybe you will change your opinion.

Hey Medic! I'm incredibly sorry to hear that The Crew 2 is constantly crashing for you. I apologize for any frustration this may have caused. Firstly, please try [url=https://support.steampowered.com/kb_article.php?ref=2037-QEUH-3335]verifying the game's files[/url] in Steam to ensure that everything is properly installed. Any missing or corrupted files will be replaced, as they can typically cause technical and performance issues. Afterward, please try running the game  [url=https://support.ubisoft.com/en-GB/Faqs/000025662/Run-applications-with-administrator-rights/]as an administrator[/url] to see if that helps to lessen the crashing. You can also try [url=https://support.ubisoft.com/en-US/faqs/000025721]disabling your background applications to make sure that there are no programs interfering with the game's ability to run! The other steps in our [url=https://support.ubi.com/en-US/Faqs/000025947/Basic-PC-Troubleshooting]technical troubleshooting guide[/url] would be beneficial to complete. 

However, if none of the suggestions provided help, please reach out to our team at support.ubi.com for further assistance. They would be more than happy to investigate this with you!

author: {'steamid': '76561199135058059', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 3033, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 39, 'last_played': 1711010184}
review: Upon playing this game for solid 50 hours i realized that this game is more of MMO than a fun multiplayer racing game. Every car,boat,plane is so damn expensive to purchase. You can play NFS or Forza Horizon game for 50 hours and purchase everything those games have to offer. But in here after playing for 50 hours i only got 4 cars and few boats&planes. It takes ridiculous amount of time to purchase something. Controls are kinda janky i played it with kbm and dualshock 4 and it felt like game tried to act like half sim and half arcade but in the end it couldn't do either of them a justice. It's not a terrible game though, graphics are fine and it's cool to take your favorite vehicle and ride it through map of whole USA. In the end the game couldn't satisfy my needs and disappointed me. I apologize for the grammer mistakes i did. I'm not a native speaker.

author: {'steamid': '76561198025889632', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 4357, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 252, 'last_played': 1677600620}
review:
Small disclaimer. I spent most of my time playing on my phone. This review isn't entirely objective, because there are somethings that may not be bad overall, but just bug me the wrong way. 
tl;dr I was really excited about the game, but I wouldn't recommend the game at it's current state.

Cons:
There are elements of p2w. Which I will explain in detail in the text below.
Areas are a little unbalanced. 
There are huge class balance issue.
The game feels like it's in Alpha - lots of unfinished stuff. (more on that below)
PC version could use a new UI with a normal hotbar, instead of using the phone's UI, which is really weird and annoying.

Pros:
Cross-platform.
Has potential.
Well optimized. It's only 50-60 mb and it doesn't take a lot of resources to run. 

I used to play AQ a long time ago when I was a kid, then went on to play DragonFable and then AdventureQuest Worlds. I think I've got the general idea of what to expect in this game, considering it's also free to play, just like the previous games, and it's made by a company that exhibits the same core ideas and mechanics in all their games. Before I even entered the game I expected the game to be somewhat grindy, which is exactly what it turned out to be. It follows pretty much the same formulas as the previous games. However this time it's in a 3d format. 

CONS:

-Classes are NOT balanced. (I haven't tried out the Guardian yet, it's a premium class)
From my experience Mage right now is overpowered. The class can kill a target before it even comes into attack distance. 

-There are elements of p2w. Which I will explain in detail below -
You want to heal, bruh? Well, you can't. Potions in the game are bought only with premium currency. While writing this I wanted to see how they work.(You receive 10 potions for free at the start at the game.) They restore a small amount of your health and have no cooldown. Essentially if you have the cash, you are immortal.
Currently there are 4 classes. For those of you unfamiliar with the game, you can equip classes like an item. Equiping the class brings new skills along with it. The classes right now are Rogue, Warrior, Mage, Guardian. You cannot heal with any of the classes that are freely available, you can only heal with the Guardian which is a premium class. 

-Areas are a little unbalanced. 
After I finished the prologue quests I was teleported to the town of Battleon. I was level 2. The first area outside of the town already has monsters that are level 4. In terms of other MMOs this wouldn't mean much, but here you'll get your ass beat if you fight with monsters a few levels higher than you. The issue mainly here is that they made the spawn to be around trees. You've got a tree with 2 level 2 lizards which you need for a quest where you have to kill 15 of them. What you'll need to do, which i found out after walking around for 5 minutes, is to shake/attack the nearest tree so that they can spawn. Maybe I've been left with the wrong impression, but that's what happened with me.

-The game feels like it's in Alpha.
Don' take this as a huge con, really. The situation is actually good.  Let me explain. 
The town of Battleon has around 5-6 buildings. Some of them still haven't been completed and you cannot enter. When you try to enter, a window pops-up showing what the building will be. That shows that the devs at least have something planned, which will surely be implemented in the future. 

-PC version could use a new UI with a normal hotbar, instead of using the phone's UI, which is really weird and annoying.
It just feels like a mobile game on a PC with that UI. The devs should really try to think of a UI for the pc gamers. 

-You are limited about how many dungeons you can do.
Not sure what they were thinking here.

PROS:

-Cross-platform. 
Really cool if you want to play on the go. 

-Has potential.
It sure does, but it depends on how the devs will do from now on. Hopefully it won't turn really p2w.

-Well optimized. It's only 50-60 mb and it doesn't take a lot of resources to run. 
Enough said.
developer_response: Hello! Thank you for your review and we apologize it was missed! We are going back through some older reviews so we can gather more feedback. The game has grown a lot in the last year or so and the devs are constantly working on fixing and improving issues and releasing updates/patches almost weekly. This has been a constant balance as an indie game company with a small staff. You can now buy potions with gold! We also have a Game Plan posted here that is updated every Monday - https://aq3d.com/game-plan/. We appreciate your valued feedback and hope you will check the game out again in the future!

author: {'steamid': '76561197996469501', 'num_games_owned': 758, 'num_reviews': 80, 'playtime_forever': 260, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 260, 'last_played': 1616621317}
review:
Primordia is the best kind of point-and-click adventure game. Aside from the obvious (unique art and an interesting setting), you're able to ask your sidekick for guidance. He doesn't give you the answers, but he often offers a sanity check. "Maybe what we need isn't in this area, boss." Similarly, your character offers up sanity checks and just-helpful-enough advice such as, "I'm not here to fix that", so you know you don't need bang your head against the wall trying to fix it.

This may be the first point-and-click adventure game since I first got access to the internet, where I didn't get so frustrated with a puzzle that I gave up and looked it up. Sometimes you just need a little nudge in the right direction to know where to apply yourself without giving away the solution, and Primordia walks that fine line well.

In addition to the style, setting, and great voice acting, the story outdoes itself with multiple endings that involve doing different solutions to the end puzzle, instead of just letting you pick a different dialog choice (though a few of those are on the table as well). I highly recommend Primordia to fans of point-and-click adventure games.
developer_response:
“This may be the first point-and-click adventure game since I first got access to the internet, where I didn't get so frustrated with a puzzle that I gave up and looked it up.“

This made me immensely happy. We spent an absurd amount of time on the hint system, for just this reason. I’m so glad to hear it worked (for you, anyway) and that you had such a positive experience with the game!

author: {'steamid': '76561198030305825', 'num_games_owned': 351, 'num_reviews': 199, 'playtime_forever': 581, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 572, 'last_played': 1584528904}
review:
Great story, post-apocalyptic setting.

 Humanity mysteriously vanished. Only robots remain.

You as ''Horatio'' and your friend ''Crispin'' wander around the wastes and the new city to unravel what it hides.

It's a classical adventure game. One of the best ones I ever played and a pleasant surprise to see it have so much content and replay value, albeit some repetitivness in the level design by the end of the game, as you mainly have to run around in circles for some puzzles.
You do have your friend who can offer you hints, but some of them are vague which is a slight issue compared to the general narrative message.

 Play this if 90's "Point & Clicks" are your passion.
A big thank you to the developers for the ambient soundtrack and to "The Vintage Feeling" for generously gifting this game to me.

author: {'steamid': '76561198152595126', 'num_games_owned': 302, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 28178, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 120, 'playtime_at_review': 4193, 'last_played': 1712541432}
review:
Really fun open-world racing game. Possibly the best motorsport game I've ever played. This game has so many different disciplines of vehicles, like cars, bikes, hovercrafts, airplanes, rally cross, etc. The open world is a huge map of USA with various cities and it's really nice and fun to explore. I enjoy driving around with nice looking cars since the graphics are so good (and decently optimized). 

The physics are arcade-y and it isn't the best game for racing or flying etc, but this game has it all in one package with a huge variety of races and events that it doesn't get boring. There's lots of NFS style customization for most of the vehicles too. Huge selection of cars (around ~360) and bikes (around ~40) and other vehicles. And there's weekly Summit events that keep things interesting when you're bored with single player or multiplayer races. Almost perfect game for me except for some minor quality of life things.

author: {'steamid': '76561198025300946', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 1354, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 624, 'last_played': 1613567361}

author: {'steamid': '76561198047977341', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 523, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 381, 'last_played': 1468340272}
review:
One of the best point & click games I've had the pleasure of playing. Despite the 'outdated' graphical appearance, the art was top-notch, as was the overall feel and atmosphere. But what really seperates fantastic point & click games from the mediocre ones, is the writing and the quality of the dialogue and plot in Primordia is absolutely stunning. Characters were also very likeable, in part due to the great voice acting.
 
Planescape: Torment is a major inspiration here; the initial hook of the story, Crispin/Morte, emphasis on the past, it's all here. Much like Torment, Primordia is filled with sad moments, funny moments, philosophical themes and one hell of a cathartic ending (at least the one I got).
Puzzles were decent and quite logical, although at times the game had too many red herrings going on, which made some puzzles a bit difficult for me. Still, only in one puzzle I had to go to a walkthrough and check it out. 

All in all, a very solid old school adventure game with insanely good story, one that I am unlikely to ever forget.

author: {'steamid': '76561198014353729', 'num_games_owned': 774, 'num_reviews': 121, 'playtime_forever': 10, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 10, 'last_played': 1594600557}
review:

Gunplay seemed [i]okay[/i] from the literally one single time I got to experience it properly, though the lazy-aim could get removed entirely, that'd be really cool.
At any rate, this review is already far too long for how little there is to this game.
Really not worth $10

Thanks!

author: {'steamid': '76561198067323324', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 271, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 271, 'last_played': 1516269055}
review:
Holy cow.
I do enjoy a point and click adventure but I often find them lacking.
Then there's Primordia.
It's epic.
The atmosphere is coherent and consistant. Characters are really fleshed out and interact well with eachother. The side kick thing at first seemed like a bad idea but boy was I wrong. 
The art is amazing. The world has a hidden story to it. 
Even the villan that seemed at first "oh another power hungry boss..." in the end gave me valid arguments to doubt my actions. 
It might not seem like it but it's a gem.
I do hope they will expand the universe and make another one.

author: {'steamid': '76561198009596311', 'num_games_owned': 5864, 'num_reviews': 168, 'playtime_forever': 315, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 315, 'last_played': 1469975604}
review:
Review updated to match updates in game: Now 0.0.3.2, the game added multidirectional support for the machinegun and shotgun, eliminating my initial complaint with the artificial difficulty. The Dev fixed the save problem I had with the save points in the game

Still suffers from the Secret Areas being mandatory for getting upgrades as well as the other issues I had with the controls, but is now in a playable condition to recommend.


ORIGINAL REVIEW:

This review is based on Alpha version 0.0.2.4. I was getting tired of the game by the end of mission 2, but kept going until the midway point of mission 4. 

Overall: Good with frustrating controls and annoying enemies.

Pros: 

- Music is passable. I don't hate it at all and the trance style they used makes it easy to forget how long one is playing. Very good choice since this is mostly a 2d puzzle platformer.

-Nice quality of life for the upgrades to choose from, ranging from faster oil recharge to extra damage for the 3 weapons and additional health.

-Great having a cheat sheet in game to tell the player if they found everything.

-Great layout design for enemy location and trap placement. You will need to learn all the tricks to pass certain areas effectively.

Cons:

- Controls are very stiff. Weapon can only be pointed straight one way, which is fine if there wasn't floating balls of goops rushing at the player. The jetpack allows for multiple boosts in mid air, but as soon as contact is made on the ground, it takes close to 1.7 seconds to be able to jump again, adding artifical difficulty to some areas.

- The game pretty much requires finding the secret areas for upgrade tokens, The upgrades are vital, making the secret areas more like mandatory areas.

- No significant indicator of when a level ends. The only clue players have is the screen stops scrolling while you see an opening. This is important due to having to replay the entire level over again if you missed the upgrade points on the current level.

- There is no backtracking in the campaign. This combines with the previous two complaints and should be highlighted.

- Save spots in the game cannot be reactivated, so if you activate the beacon before entering an important room such as a location with an upgrade capsule, you'll have to do it all over again on death and that is horrible design considering how difficult the controls make it to survive until the next save spot. Please make a manual save when arriving at those hubs.

Conclusion ------------------------
Great idea for a game with some troublesome attributes that will hopefully be corrected as the game is in development. As of now, I cannot recommend the game due to the problems with the game in it's current state. I do recommend keeping an eye of the game because it shows promise. All the negatives I had are minor fixes for major faults with the game, which is great to see for an Alpha release since those can be quick to fix as the game is being worked on.
developer_response:
Thank you for updating your review. 
If you're uncomfortable searching for upgrades, you can always buy them for score from the upgrade screen. Each one costs 1000 score.

author: {'steamid': '76561198000127592', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 1967, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1967, 'last_played': 1706149996}
review:
Diarmid Campbell, if you're reading this, hats off to you for a brilliantly designed game. I have been recommending this to my friends constantly, and thank you for mentioning the AVOW diagrams.

I think the reason why the last level was so difficult for a lot of us was because it seemed to combine more concepts all at once than the previous levels. My inability to imagine the circuit's flow in its entirety is on me, but perhaps if there were more mini-levels prior to this one that introduced the concept of current flow being reversed in the same wires (for example, the way neutral wires work in AC), it would have helped more fellow struggling gamers (or smooth-brained folks like me) to progress easier.

Having said that, my curiosity for starting my own electronics projects has been piqued. Thanks again for the time and effort you put into making this game, and making Ohm's Law much easier to understand on an intuitive level!
developer_response:
Thanks for the nice review. Yes, I think the difficulty curve is pretty uneven (gets a bit bogged down on the middle and then gets hard to quickly at the end). I did record a walkthrough of the game, which is on YouTube (in case anyone else is reading this who got stuck).

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=NtBTHk3CWvI&list=PL6kJKunQqOm2No2rgOoHV1bWmHv9sBXwQ

author: {'steamid': '76561197961990268', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 925, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 907, 'last_played': 1458185037}
review:
I don't often leave reviews, but at this point I really had to.  I was very excited about this game.  I absolutely adore resource management games and civ simulations.  I've played for a few hours, starting over dozens of times, trying to find that perfect build that will get my colony seed going.  I love that it's difficult and your decisions matter.

Then it happens.  Maybe an hour into a map, and the AI just gives up.  Out of my 7 starting colonists, 6 of them are hungry.  There's piles of unprocessed food in the storage building waiting to go into the processor, and no one will move it.  ONE lonely engineer will stop what he's doing, grab some veggies or meat and takes them to the machine for himself.  He eats, and then goes back to his tasks.

There is no way to schedule or rank work.  (The max build queue is kind of a joke.)  There is no way to manually assign tasks or override a colonists broken path.  A sandstorm hits, and I have a colonist that walks out side and just stands there in it for no reason.   My bots finally broke down.  One engineer walks right by, and the other is standing right next to it, but refuses to attempt repairs.  I have piles of spare parts and materials waiting to be used.

If a game doesn't have a strong AI to actually simulate well, it needs to allow for granular manual control.  This does not.  Once you've reached an equilibrium the game just stops working.  I love difficult and challenging games.  This isn't a challenge, this is an infinite loop of broken.  All in all it's a very simple game that had the promises of complexity, but failed to deliver.   I would say the AI is a joke, but there would actually have to be an AI to rate.

Do yourself a favor, give this one a pass.
developer_response:
Hello there! We noticed this review is quite old, and the AI and pathfinding issues have been fixed since.
We'd appreciate it if you'd try the latest version (1.0.7), to see if the improvements make you change your mind about Planetbase.

Thank you!

author: {'steamid': '76561197963360231', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 53, 'playtime_forever': 29, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 29, 'last_played': 1536462593}

Thank you for the interest in our early access game.

If instead you meant that you can't change key to use with the one you want it's due to an engine limitation that requires a third part plugin that we will implement in future.

author: {'steamid': '76561198261526807', 'num_games_owned': 184, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 12559, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 12183, 'last_played': 1711093618}
review:
I don't write reviews very often, but I feel the need to in this case as a long time fan of Artix Entertainment games. I have supported AE on kickstarter and have followed many of the updates as time went on, I waited to write this review as I know developing a game takes time and the small team making the game is learning as they go. 

I am going to break this review down into 4 sections: my thoughts, current state of the game, the possible future, and suggestions. 

My thoughts:
I have played and still play aqw to this day and have spent a ton of money supporting what I think is a game with massive potential. The core mechanics of aqw is to do quests, fight monsters, and level up to obtain more powerful classes. The complexity of the fights are simplistic, but are still engaging as some bosses require multiple people to defeat. The art is amazing for a 2d flash game, its some of the best you'll ever find in my opinion. The game rewards hardcore players with gear that provides bonuses like a weapon that does 51% more dmg to all monsters. The end game is very grindy, but makes up for it by rewarding the player with amazing gear. 

However, the longer I played I realized that I wanted more complexity in regards to the classes as the gameplay loop became repetitive and I had nearly collected all the cosmetics and gear I had wanted. When I first heard that AE was realesing a new game, this time a 3d one, I got really excited at the possibilities of new class mechanics, some that could be complex and add creative new ways to play the game. 

Current state of the game:
The gameplay is level up and rank up your classes to become more powerful. The more powerful you become the more classes you can unlock. Each class has 5 main skills (cross skill included) alongside a few passive upgrades. The gameplay loop over time becomes repetitive as 5 skills is not much to experiment with, fights are simplistic as the player can spam skills and still come out on top in most fights. The trade skills are not worth going for as they do not benefit the player in game in any meaningful way. For example, old school runescape is a game made by a small team and leveling certain skills unlocks shortcuts in game to help the player bypass certain areas improving gameplay. The social aspect of the game is hurt by the low population playing the game as many old areas will be barren, I feel as if veteran players should have an incentive to go back to old areas. The content updates are a bit too slow, I have been waiting for housing to come for years. I know the development of a game can take time, but with no progress plan to show players and reassure them it feels like I am waiting for something that may never happen. I am not going to talk much about the free to play aspect of the game as I think AE is doing a decent job at making it fair for f2p players. 

I love AE as small indie companies with heart seldom exist anymore, but I feel like the game is falling short of what it could be. 

The possible future:
The game is lackluster for the amount of time it has been out, but that does not mean there are no positives. The games art I find quite charming and unique. The story in the game is great and easy to follow. However, for the average player who has not been with AE for years this will be something that they stop playing after 5 hours or so due to the aforementioned issues above. The updates add new areas, but with the same quest structure that reward players with things that do not change game play in any way. 

Some suggestions: 
-add a few more skills to the classes (players can unlock one new skill at a time and slowly "master" a certain class)
-make battles in general more complex (players might need to combo skills in a certain way or use a specific skill at the right time)
-add meaningful rewards that showcase a players skill or dedication (like a cape for reaching the highest level in fishing) or maybe reward players with a fishing rod that can catch more fish or unique fish that craft into endgame weapons.
-incentivize old players to revisit old areas so they are not barren when new players start to progress through the game 
-Maybe focus less on cosmetics and more on changing and add features in the game based on in game surveys 

Many of my friends laugh at me for still playing this game, but I laugh back because I know AE never drops or gives up on their games. This game can improve, I simply feel as if it may take too long before its too late :(
