author: {'steamid': '76561198031619146', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 62, 'playtime_forever': 6560, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3194, 'last_played': 1479131940}
review:
When Foresight first launched I wouldn't have recommended it  based on my first impression.

What seemed like unfinished product with clunky ui proved to have  more dept than I thought, being unrefined to modern tastes but not unfinished.

Ever since then game has improved weekly, problems that are posted are getting fixed and improvements that make gameplay clearer are being added.

I have reported numerous  things about this game and I have noticed they all get fixed in matter of days.

Foresight team doesn't seem to be afraid to do major changes either to not just to make their game sell, but to make it really good.

While I write this review the game still ways to go, but it's the kind of game that grows on you when you give it a chance, improving along the way.

More about the setting : http://foresightrts.com/introduction/


[u]Lets get this party started.[/u]

I have prepared three different secments : Interesting, meh and the " "why oh why" section.



[b]First interesting stuff:[/b]

 [i]Fleet system with levelling commanders [/i]

 Commanders gain passive abilities when their skills improve and they have their own AI personalities, such as defensive,competent, intelligent.

 - You have  fleet bars with  information in them, allowing you to use all your number keys for buildings and scouts while focusing larger groups to fleet F-keys.

- Fleets ask for units and post suggestions: like " requesting five fighters or want to go sector x" , you can just double click to approve them.

- Killing fleet commanders hinders your control over them. You need either main hero or alive commander to control fleet.

- Ai controls fleets in combat automaticly hitting their strongest targets and based on commanders personality either flee like chickens or take it like a man.

- Commanders can die and will try to escape to other ships when they are losing.

[i]Unique take to scouting.[/i]

- Every  ship has  limited detection range and larger attack range... because this game has detection units.

- Scouting is vital. Scouts allow you to shoot farther and recon new areas and secure sectors as beacons.

- Dormant mode allows wide area fleets scans. You know what I mean when you try it.

[i] Weaponising resourses [/i]

- You can use stuff like gas clouds as minefields.

[i]Factions [/i]

- UNC  ( United Nations Confederation ) is an anti tecnology faction that uses " safe" tecnologies as railguns and missiles, being the " standard"  faction. Asia based.

-SS ( Slavic Sirerians)"the aliens" : Use chemicals and bio weapons ( yes  chemicals and bacteria in space.) Are mostly male and somewhat ....manly. Slavic based.

- NSAU ( North-South American Union)  : Is high tec faction that uses beam weapons, shields and .. this one was new to me check it out : Portable power generators AND mobile resource harvest buildings. America based.

[i]Zone based space travel[/i]

 Fleets use wormholes to travel  splitting all maps in to sectors enabling tactical attacks from multiple sides or really nasty choke points. 

You should REALLY read the story about why there are wormholes close to earth: http://foresightrts.com/wormhole-anomalies/

[b]Background story and progression[/b] 

[i]Background story itself  is good, but its presentation..[/i]

- You live on humanity's own mess up pile, they nuked their own planet, messed up space travel in worm hole experiments and fight against each other in the progress.

-  Read  background story before you play the game, more of the stuff makes sence then. Voice acting being one of them. 


[b]   MEH aspects.[/b]


[i]How the story is told. Is a huge potential meh [/i]

Some of the charecter commendaries are confusing and then there is voice acting. There are tons of negative comments about it and it can "Sound" atrocious.. least till you  bothered to read faction backstories from the web page.

- UCN is mostly asian based none of them have native english its just common language.
-Slavic Sirerians have intented slavic accent.
-NSAU , well they are english. If you want to hear english : check out NSAU

Voice acting actually was on most part design choise, also I heard from Jeremy that most of the voice actors were Volenteers, this is a small budget game after all.  (update : He changed pug's voice now ! )

[i] The Artificial intelligence [/i]

You really either hate or love this.

I got my ass kicked when I commanded everything myself. I had to learn to " let go" in mass fights and let the ai do its job.  It's not clever enough to start entire sector wide campaings with blizzard level of magnificience but its good enough be left to handle mass fights IF you do not order them too much.

I have seen ai do stuff like
- Cautious AI commander abandonts its fleet and runs. 
- Clever one focus fired enemy commanders down
- More ruthless one totally ignored defense positions and just blew generators to kingdom come.

Then again I also saw this : " Requesting attack to sector x" .. my OWN base was on that sector. 

[i]Music and sounds[/i]

 Mostly background style music on neutral level, not something you'd want to burn on your harddrive and listen as separate ( As example age of wonder's sound track),  don't expect that, and the music's and sounds are good.

[i]Graphical presentation[/i]

Apparently game was made by choise somewhat simplistic, to allow larger fleet fight. This means there is not much eye candy.

Nor eastern eggs, nor cards. Stuff like that is on works. 


[b]And now the "why oh why"[/b]

[i] User interface[/i]

 I will first state that this is on rework apparently next patch.  Currently its complex.

- Makers made the keybindings based on their own localisation, this resulted some farts like: repair key being altgr + 8 for eu player .  

- Creating fleets and assigning advisors is clumsy.

- It's hard to remove units from fleets and to add them to other fleets.

-Fleet view at times doesn't view fleets but instead your main commanders face.

And small stuff like that.

[i] I want my skip button [/i]

While they already added options to skip things there is no way to skip in game cutschenes yet, and seeing them half dozen times on retries can be a pain.

You can't skip end and defeat score screen either.


[i] Steam ui hates this game [/i]

Standalone game works fine, but run it in steam you have issues like game crashing on alt tab.

[i] Multiplayer needs work [/i] 

 Multiplayer is somewhat complex and well, de syncing on large games.

[i] Simple design makes game bland[/i]

Not much to explore in this game, it focuses on execution and battles so the space is just full of small stars, not much debris asteroids or things like that.

[i] Polish in clarity needed [/i] 

Some things are hard to pick at, fleet locations, ally locations, you have to access minimap manually instead seeing it all the time but this is on works.

[i] Tutorial sucks[/i]

But can be skipped !



[b]Summary :[/b]


Foresight is a space game placed on era where humans have nuked earth and ruined space travel with wormhole experiements, telling story of Thomas Locke UNC commander who will see quite a bit duing the game.

Game is simple on the eye with decent sound score and good but optional backstory accessable from webside along with three fairly different factions and playstyles, that relies on semi ai controlled fleets  that can be used to fullest in zone based combat areas.


While having lot of potential, it currently suffers from few ui optimisation issues as well as background based voice acting.  

The game itself doesn't have fatal bugs.

As the game is now I'd give it 67/100 but it has potential to be  75-80 game and it will be, the dev's are very active, contact players and discuss their ideas openly.  Give it a chance, I did and I don't regret it.

You are probably understood our text on Patreon incorrectly. Additional funding required to make development safer, easier, faster and more quality. Additional support for development is absolutely normal. It does not means that development will be abandoned, we never said that, so this is totally wrong conclusion.

The game 100% will be complete and released.

author: {'steamid': '76561198036344588', 'num_games_owned': 731, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 877, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 70, 'last_played': 1705993484}
review:
Edit: As of Jan 2024, changing my review to recommend since the game has changed and is way, way better than it was before. Hours of content for a currently EA game and more is to come!

(From Test Build experience since this EA release is no different from the Test Build)

Imagine this, you're playing the tutorial levels and having a blast. You see you have equipment and is excited to use them. You see you have rope to use for ledges. Great! You use them! 

You don't see a counter for the ropes on the UI unlike the Drones and Explosives and assume they are infinite. Just like your grappling hook! Even more great! Now you can even reclimb the rope when you've finished exploring! 

So you explore the map more and more, killing freakish looking aliens until you reach the second character which has a different specialisation. Now you have 2 characters to play as. Cool! You then get to a point where you have to use the rope for the other character. "No problem!" you think, "i'll just whip ou....."

Wrong.

The ropes are gone. There were only a specific amount you couldn't see and now they're gone. The games asks you to use the rope to progress. But you can't. No ropes to pick up during the level apart from ammo. You are essentially softlocked. 30+ minutes gone. Now you have to replay the mission.

Its fun. Really fun. And this is just one of the issues this game currently has. There are mild irritations and annoyances with it which hopefully will be added and/or fixed. So wait before you buy this game until its further into development. Not currently worth the asking price of 19,99€.
developer_response:
Heyho,

Thanks for your feedback - Early Access luckily gives us the possibility to listen to this feedback and iron out the issues - like for example having not enough "things" when you need them - we are on it.

Though saying "no different to the testbuild" is just plain wrong - you should be easily able to tell that a lot of work has flown into the game since the testbuild, especially considering that we are talking about one single developer here.

Again, we are sorry that you and others had this frustrating experience, but we are already on it and working out a quick fix for this.

Best Regards,
Penta, Daedalic Entertainment

author: {'steamid': '76561197988099900', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 38, 'playtime_forever': 431, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 431, 'last_played': 1634474694}
review:
Interface is both better (more visuals) and worse (too much text) compared to RimWorld.

I might recommend if they improve the sound effects, but they are highly lacking in this department, which is not good for a game of this price. For example, when a giant dragon appears on screen you don't hear anything. When the weather changes it doesn't sound any different.

Overall, the game has quite a bit of potential but it needs a lot more polish. It feels as if they have this great complex idea but not the level of care needed to really make a great player experience.
developer_response: You should hear a special sound when Dragon appeared, it might be a bug we will check it and see what's going on.

author: {'steamid': '76561198037979338', 'num_games_owned': 198, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 871, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 861, 'last_played': 1511828330}
review:
In its current form it's very hard to reccomend this game. I feel like this game could become really great and i will definitly continue playing.

However i feel like someone who isn't a fan or has not played any other AE games may find it difficult to get into this game.

Pros
- A lot of quests to be done
- Not Pay2Win from what i've seen
- Cross-Platform play

Cons
- The biggests con for me personally is camera controls, holding right mouse button to turn youre character and youre mouse gets stuck on the edge of the screen not allowing you to turn anymore (may just be for me idk)
- The grind  on this game is too much
- Difficulty of monsters feels too high
- UI is not the best

Some things i personally feel should be included
- Some sort of grouping/party system for free world and dungeons
- Being able to track more quests
- Bag sorting or different tabs for different things (eg materials, weapons and armor)
- Having a way to compare items
- Having some sort of equiped items screen to have a better feel for whats equiped
- Personally for me having played a lot of BattleOn and AQW, having more classes would be interesting (i know its early access and more classes are probably coming)
- Leveling up is nice but apart from general stats going up having a way to level up abilities or gain new or upgraded abilities would be cool

Remember these are my personal suggestions and may not appeal to everyone and i understand that.

If the game improves and keep getting updated i will hopully be forced to recommend this game as i would love this game to succeed.
developer_response: Hello! Thank you for your review and we apologize it was missed! We are going back through some older reviews so we can gather more feedback. The game has grown a lot in the last year or so and the devs are constantly working on fixing and improving issues and releasing updates/patches almost weekly.  This has been a constant balance as an indie game company with a small staff. We also have a Game Plan posted here that is updated every Monday - https://aq3d.com/game-plan/. We appreciate your valued feedback and hope you will check the game out again in the future!

review:
Pros:
+ Being able to see parts fall/fly off as cars take damage

Cons:
- Downloads only 3 MB on Steam; the rest is acquired through the game's launcher
- Random fps drops despite low system usage
- Seems awfully grindy
- Gajin Net Updater aka gjagent stays active after you quit the game and does not uninstall along with it

The grind combined with the sketchy launcher turned me off of this real fast.
developer_response:
Hello!
 - Steam is just a place to distribute the game, not a publisher.
 - If you have any technical problems, please use this link to contact us: https://forum.crossout.net/index.php?/forum/59-bug-reports/
 - Please tell us more about it.
 - Gaijin.net Updater is used for updates of all Gaijin games. Deleting one game should not interfere with the performance of others.

author: {'steamid': '76561198041343796', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 90, 'playtime_forever': 118, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 118, 'last_played': 1530132741}
review:
Doctor Flow is a Cost Management Automatic Filter Game!
The mechanics are failry straight forward but allow for a number of very interesting optimization puzzles. I think the game captures the idea of using different tests to diagnose a patient very well.
The biggest issue I have is the fact that the illnesses are not equally distributed which makes it really weird and unintuitive to get the optimal score in some levels.

More details and gameplay: https://gaming.youtube.com/watch?v=TfIAC3eOkvY
developer_response: Hi th_pion, In your review you mention that the distribution of diseases is not visible. With the newest update we've added an indicator that shows how the diseases are distributed among the patients. This allows you to better optimize your solution, with less trial-and-error. We hope you like the addition!

author: {'steamid': '76561198388716341', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 10523, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 10150, 'last_played': 1524209124}
review: THIS GAME IS A COMPLETE WASTE OF YOUR TIME AND MONEY! DO NOT BUY THIS GAME! Every time I (or my friends) try to go into the in-game Settings tab the game crashes and after closing the game it continues to run in the background and will not stop until I restart my computer. I would say to give this game a try for fun but with the constant rubber banding and connection issues (even while using official servers) it's very annoying and gets old relatively quick. My friend has a high-end gaming pc with 1080 Ti and this game fails to run sufficiently enough to play on any setting or internet connection. This game also has no main objective other than to kill dogs for resources/materials and build space ships. BUYERS BEWARE!

author: {'steamid': '76561198062404538', 'num_games_owned': 173, 'num_reviews': 35, 'playtime_forever': 4899, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3285, 'last_played': 1618853092}
review:
TL;DR: wait for a few patches and a sale

As someone who has been playing this game since Early Access, I can't help but feel a bit disappointed with the final product. There are a lot of good things about it sure: the visual design is stunning; the music is great; and the story, while not the most sophisticated I've ever seen, is still interesting enough to keep you playing.

However, there are still plenty of things that don't seem to have been fixed at all since the EA stage and some things even got worse somehow. For starters, the game is still littered with bugs. NPCs will often pass through objects like ghosts (when they're not just falling through the floor). My favourite is when you're sitting on a bench, reading the paper, and an NPC just comes up and sits on top of you, trapping you on the bench until they decide to leave.

Second, a lot of the quests - side and main - are poorly designed. One quest had me sneak into [spoiler]an abandoned military base[/spoiler] in order to steal a key from one of the rooms. Problem was when I got there, the only way in was to pick the lock and I had no bobby pins left. I spent the next two hours creeping through the entire area looking for more pins but there were none to be found. Because this was a main mission, I couldn't even leave to go back to the Garden District for supplies.
Sadly, this sort of thing happens a lot although thankfully(?) it is usually only in the side-quests

My biggest gripe, though, is the gutting of the survival mechanics. In the original version, the game had your standard survival meters - hunger, thirst, sleep - and you had to keep them filled to ward off death. A later version gave you a mode that disabled them completely. The final version seems to have gone for a worst-of-both-worlds compromise: the meters still exist but instead of being a life-or-death feature, they simply offer you buffs if you keep them filled. The buffs themselves aren't all that usefull but at the same time, not having the buffs can make playthroughs just that much more annoying. IMO they should have just stuck to what they had before and make the survival meters optional.

There are a bunch of minor issues too. wonky AI, clunky combat mechanics, the constant jump in frame-rate, and so on. All in all, this game isn't ready for final release. I'm not saying I haven't enjoyed it so far and will definitely keep playing but that's only because I already had it. I wouldn't recommend buying it fresh in its current state. If it had been priced at an indie level - say US$20-30, then that would be one thing. However, it's got a AAA price tag so to release in such an unpolished state is... well actually, that's about as AAA as you can get these days. Still, the game is in desperate need of a few patches before it is worth the price it is asking for.
developer_response:
Hey, thank you for the feedback and for giving the game a try. 

The survival mechanics was something we struggled with a lot during development. We started with this vision of a hardcore roguelike survivor and once we launched on Early Access, players hated it with a passion. We had to rework it all in a small amount of time and resources. We understand and acknowledge it is not perfect. 

As for the glitches, we have released 4 patches since the game launched and are currently working on another one. Most of the issue you've mentioned have been fixed and further work is still being done to continue to polish the game.

Cheers,

author: {'steamid': '76561197989396964', 'num_games_owned': 488, 'num_reviews': 49, 'playtime_forever': 20506, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 104, 'playtime_at_review': 7585, 'last_played': 1711369408}
review:
EDIT : OBT LAUNCH

Well what could I say. I am really pleased to see this game come back in my library after a few month of chaos. Indeed I was the waiting the OBT wipe. Now it's done so I can play again and what a pleasant suprise to see the manies upgrades the game have received.

More items, more weapons combination and more.

Can't wait to play more to test tham all on the battlefield.

Keep your good work devs, believe in your community and this game will go Gold.

Cheers ! 

----------------------------
CBT REVIEW :

I do recommand this game, quite fun and easy to build the "car" of your dream. It's still EA so, at highter level you'll find yourself fighting against vet players who allready have everything unlocked, but still, even with low level parts you can win a game by yourself, it's all about strat and not being caught by the ennemy team at the wrong moment.

I do enjoyed my first 35h of building and fighting with my strange design.

Surprise your ennemy with a moving wall filled with medium turret is still the best thing i've done so far.

Looking to unlock futher components even is it's take ages to do so.

TopCake/10
Do try it and replace ingame braindead bots. Thank's. Love. Candy. Patatoes.

developer_response: Hello, due to our player's feedback, we have made Gaijin.Net agent entirely optional during a Steam installation (now you can decide whether you want to use it, or not). Please note: Gaijin net agent is completely harmless and useful software, and not using it can lead to delays in updates, if Steam updates are switched off/or not efficient. We still recommend using our solution, it is essential to keep your game up-to-date to be able to play!

author: {'steamid': '76561198049049987', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 536, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 536, 'last_played': 1562976356}

Great world-building and atmosphere. The characters are likable and easy to get invested into, puzzles made sense and were fair.

author: {'steamid': '76561197982983235', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 1276, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1233, 'last_played': 1592354878}
review:
The interface is unique, the flow of combat slow, but the black antagonism of white people is what takes away from the user experience. White pergoritives such as "white boy" "Southern Cracker" are all used within just the first 2 missions! It's anti-white and tiresome. Of course in this age the black protaginist is without fault and even has a white gf and his family and blacks are fighting "the good anti-war fight" in the game. The immersion was just suspended at that point. 

For as little content and UI is given in this game along with the above mentioned revisionism, I would not recommend.
developer_response:
I only wanted to add that you can turn off the narrative dialogues in the options menu if you don't want to experience "revisionism".

BR!
Jacob

author: {'steamid': '76561198427374233', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 235, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 235, 'last_played': 1680790881}
review: I was looking forward to this game.  Liked the concept but there are so many bugs it's ridiculous.  I've gotten a grand total of three hours in and have encountered just as many bugs forcing me to restart.  First bug, set up an interview for a job... showed up early/on time and went to speak with the person for the interview and it didn't list an option for being there for the interview.  Then the game tells you you're late for your interview and that you missed your chance and to try again.  Second bug, got the seed planters, put them in my apartment and filled them with dirt, planted seeds and harvested a couple times then it suddenly wouldn't let me plant anymore seeds.  There was dirt in the pot but wouldn't let me plant seeds.  Third bug, went into the grocery store, bought some groceries and then left the store and the entire screen just went black and stayed that way.  I wanted to like this game but the number of bugs are just frustrating.
developer_response:
Hello. We apologize for the bugs you encountered. :(
We wanted to provide you with an update. Since your review, we've implemented improvements to the game and addressed some of the issues you mentioned, especially bug 2 and 3.

However, we require additional feedback on bug 1 and bug 4.
Bug 1: Could you specify which job it was?
Bug 2: Which grocery store did you encounter the issue, and what items were involved?

If you recall and are willing to share, please consider sending us an email with these details at info@urban-tale.com. Your input is valuable to us.

author: {'steamid': '76561198163639643', 'num_games_owned': 783, 'num_reviews': 74, 'playtime_forever': 1399, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 509, 'last_played': 1699539145}

author: {'steamid': '76561198039518115', 'num_games_owned': 830, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 70, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 52, 'last_played': 1637560917}
review:
I love early access games and I expect bugs.  This one is still WAY too unripe.  No tutorial but figuring out the interface isn't that rough.  It was probably the fourth or fifth time that I watched helplessly as a coconut which I was trying to smash with a hammer rolled off into the ocean as I helplessly pursued it that I got a little miffed.  You'd think the island was made of polished marble, and the slightest degree of angle is enough to send that coconut racing off into the ocean where the big shark lives who does not seem to be troubled by sand and air.  This might be a nice survival game eventually but this is REALLY early access.  My first save game set my hut somewhere in the air above the ocean, when I had only saved the game to go back to the main screen and look at the command list again.  Lots of stuff to be worked out here.

Edit - dev quick to respond with helpful info so switching my thumbs down to a thumbs up, as it was kind of a 60/40 thing anyway - I'll surely check it out again soon
developer_response:
So sorry, some bugs have not been resolved, we will solve these bugs very quickly, the coconut can be picked up directly to the backpack, or use an axe to open it,Press the Tab key. In the build list, you can craft an axe that is easier to use to open the coconut and cut the tree faster. The collision of the coconut will be modified into an irregular collision to prevent it from rolling into the sea.You need to build a simple shelter to save the reborn position.The game will be saved automatically in a few minutes and does not need to be saved manually.I will test and fix the bugs about saving the system, because it is a Chinese New Year holiday, I have to fix bugs in a few days, please forgive me and give me some time.Thank you！
Edit ——I have fixed these bugs and released the patch, and once again said sorry, I have to return to my work place of more than 100 kilometers from my hometown. I will fix it again if there are problems. Thank you for your understanding!

author: {'steamid': '76561198256532060', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 128, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 76, 'last_played': 1704774704}
review:
I found this game a few months ago when I did the search for The Elders Scrolls. I was intrigued by the thumbnail so I went on the game's page for more information.

When I saw the preview trailer, I thought it seemed like a nice game so I told myself, why not give it a try. 

You spawn in what seems to be a prison cell, then, you fall asleep on the bed and the adventure begins. You appear in what seems to be a snowy valley between two mountains. Everything is filled with snow and the music complement the cold atmosphere. There, you meet your first enemy, a skeleton. 

Although the animations seem on point, the game lacks sound effects, because of that, the hits are silent and so are the enemies, so next thing you know, you're losing health so you turn around and there's a skeleton bashing you.

After a dozen of enemies in this frozen landscape, you reach a portal that brings you to a dungeon. There you appear with a torch and your stuff is lined on the walls next to you. The drone music aggremented with the poor visual field that the torch creates adds to the tension.

There are a few different paths you can take at that point but i'll stop my review here and skip to the goods and the bads of the game:

The goods:
- Absolutely fantastic atmosphere, the snowy mountains are wonderful and the dungeon creates a very stressful ambiance with a well-chosen set of colours.
- Wide array of items and weapons.
- Great music.
- Great animations.

The bads:
- Lack of sound effects (sword sounds, creatures sounds, etc).
- Issues with the interactions between the protagonist and the world (in the pillars room next to the spawn in the dungeon, it is very hard to reach the end of the pillars' parkour because the player keeps lagging on the pillars, also, the creatures are faster than the player and they have a hit advantage; you need to stand still to hurt them while they can hurt you while you move).
- Lack of description of the elements (ex: in the dungeon, you will sometimes meet stone gargoyles' head on walls blasting what seems to be glitter of different colours, you have no clue what it is so you reach to it to investigate and next thing you know, you're dead).
- Lack of a save system; you spawn back at the beginning of the map when you die and you lose all progress done during your last life.
- Once you quit the game, your game won't be saved locally, so next time you'll play, you'll start off from the very beginning.
- Lack of structure; you don't know where you need to go first and what to do. When I entered the dungeon, I told myself that I needed to complete the pillars' parkour first, so after close to 50 attempts, I managed to do so and next thing, I was flabergasted by three level 8 skeletons in the adjacent room with absolutely no chance of success (also there was this big red tree with these same gargoyles I mentionned earlier blasting red glitter, still not sure what they do).

Conclusion: 

Average game, incredible potential, still a lot of work to be done but could end up doing a massively great game.
developer_response:
Good day. Thanks for your review. Since writing your review I have made significant changes.
- Thank you for turning my attention to the lack of sound when attacking enemies, I added it.
- Enemies have become a little easier and you can now escape from them, I made a parkour with columns as an optional part of the dungeon.
- head gargoyles I removed. Previously, the red ray instantly killed, and the green healed.
- Improved the save system. Now saving occurs when you click on the statue in the city. I checked several times, the progress is saved after re-entering the game.
- Added a ghost that gives clues to the player indicating where to go.
-Made lvl scaling now wherever you go the enemies will be approximately equal in strength.

author: {'steamid': '76561199212858380', 'num_games_owned': 4, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 770, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 508, 'last_played': 1707687097}

author: {'steamid': '76561197970557579', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 77, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 59, 'last_played': 1592356507}
review:
Holy shit, fuck this game so hard.
Ok, let's start at the beginning.  The game didn't want to load.  Just took forever, nothing showing in task manager to force quit, but steam still showing it as running.  Finally loads into a launcher, and it wants an account.  For a single player game.  Ok, fuck it, sign up for an account, website terrible, and it kept telling me I hadn't bought the game.  No useful information on their terrible website.  Close the launcher, and like when it opened, it did not want to close.  Closed steam to see if it would force close the crappy launcher.  Relaunched steam, relaunched the launcher, and again, miserably long load time, but at least this time it acknowledged I bought the game.  Started playing it, and guess what.  The control scheme is absolute shit, with no way to configure it to something playable.  That's where you start to notice every yes/no button dialog is no/yes.  Assbackwards.  Ok, so fuck the game, I'm not having fun, exit to desktop, and a fucking arbitrary timer before it will allow me to fucking exit.  And even now, after having closed the game, another short delay before it let me close the launcher, forgetting and finding where the button to leaving a review is, and typing this whole thing out, steam still shows this worthless piece of shit game as "running."  Yeah, give me a goddamned refund.  This game is irredeemable.  I can't believe they got that many positive reviews without some kind of fraud.
edit: and after getting my refund, it won't fucking uninstall.  This is a company that deserves to go out of business.
developer_response:
Hi CMDR,

Sorry to hear you had a bad experience. Just to clarify, Elite Dangerous is an always-online multiplayer game rather than a single player one which is why an account is necessary.

It sounds like you took a wrong step somewhere - did you perhaps purchase from a third party? They have a tendency to sell game access without the correct instructions on how to redeem it. Alternatively your Windows installation may be missing some libraries necessary for the launcher to run.

If you're having some trouble uninstalling please do feel free to send us a support ticket and we can see what might be going on: https://support.frontier.co.uk/topic.php

Regards,

CMDR Delta
Frontier Support Team

author: {'steamid': '76561198078749351', 'num_games_owned': 221, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 990, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 734, 'last_played': 1707648230}
review:
I've played "Papers, Please" and I loved it, so I was really really looking forward to the release of this game. After playing the main storyline through once (planning on doing it again the rebel way), here is my thoughts:

Spoilers ahead!

The game delivers really really well, and even exceeded my expectations in some parts. I enjoyed playing it to the point where I wasn't willing to stop playing. You guys at Crazy Rocks really did a very good job with this game! As with any game, there are pros and cons, so I'll list them here:

Pros:
- Actual stuff to do outside the border station, missions, transport prisoners and contrabands and missions. The map is also larger than I expected. 
- Upgradable border station.
- Get to actually interact with searching vehicles and actually putting in the effort to find inconsistencies in documents, smuggled items etc.
- The overall environment looks beautiful!
- Main storyline missions have variety. Sidequests are also fun to do.
- AI during Border Station attacks actually knows to take cover and use grenades, and just doesn't run up to us like headless chickens.
- Interaction with the vehicles! You get to even turn on and off the siren, load up stuff into the vehicle and such.
- I love when newcomers have a chance of just trying to escape from the station as well. We get to actually chase people.
- The game runs REALLY well as well.

As for the cons:
- The amount of ambushes feels a bit too much from time to time. I would get up to like 6 ambushes in one trip, delivering prisoners and contraband. Maybe have the amount tuned down, but make the ambushes more intense.
- I feel that the AI during ambushes and sidequests aren't bad, but I feel like it could be better. Sometimes, although not annoyingly large amount of times, they would rush you like headless chickens. Maybe have them take more cover and use more tactics and such.
- Cars sometimes feel like they are weak in terms of durability, and would start breaking apart and combust into flames quite quickly, specially after a small ambush. I would add some durability to them.
- Interacting with your police comrades and NPCs outside the border station is out of the question in this game, unfortunately. Unless it's during a mission which has dialogue.
- While the sidequests are interesting, there could have been a bit more variety and amount to them.
- There is no endless -mode. This would have been a good addition to the game as well.

Along with pros and cons I have some suggestions:

- I think there should be a chance for a smuggler to appear at the border, which doesn't have any of the smuggler marks, or appear on the board under the "smugglers" -note. Basically, they would be carrying some amount of the contraband inside the vehicle in hiding spots which don't have the mark (like under the seats, dashboard etc etc.), but is visible if paying attention. It would keep us on our toes and pay attention if we see anything inside, for example while unloading the cargo.
- During the war episode, I was expecting vehicles rigged with explosives to come to the border, which there were none. I would have added the chance for rigged vehicles to come to the border, and we would have to be careful with opening doors and such, otherwise the explosives would go off. And then have us go through a procedure of how to handle such situations, like having us make them safe to handle and such.
- Never during the game would I have been required to check under the vehicle themselves, which can be used as a hiding spot for contraband and such. Usually during vehicle inspections on checkpoints and such they would have mirrors on a stick which they could use to peek under the vehicle and see if there is anything there.

But overall, I love playing this game. It's super fun! Keep it up devs,
9/10.
developer_response:
Thank you! We love such extensive reviews :)

We've already published an update that balances the ambush mechanic a bit, we will improve more elements of the game in the future!

author: {'steamid': '76561198138239165', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 14, 'playtime_forever': 538, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 538, 'last_played': 1588983752}
review:
I found this game to be infuriating and poorly designed.
You can't adjust volumes or other settings in-game, just from the main menu.
When saving a game, it doesn't allow you to choose the name or file path of your saves. I don't like that lack of control. I want to know where on my system files are being put so that I can remove them if I so choose, and keep my drives clean.
As for the game-play:
Natural disasters are predetermined; a meteor strikes a critical building? Going back to a previous save point won't help you. It will just keep striking the same point over and over and over again. Getting the infrastructure going to get to the point where you can shoot down the meteors is much further into the game than when you actually need it.
The building required for getting your people inside when a sandstorm hits is also too deep into the game, as you get hit repeatedly with sandstorms almost from the start. Your starting bots and supply of spare parts will quickly get burned through.
Base personnel seem to be intent on doing everything except for the jobs that you need them to do, even when you prioritize a particular building. And, you can't prioritize a particular production component in a building, just the entire building. So, you really need bioplastic? Too bad, they'll just keep producing metal. Unless, you set up two different production buildings, which is too resource-intensive early-game. Besides, one or both will just get wiped-out by a meteor anyway.
You can't research new technologies; you have to buy them from traders who charge exorbitant commission rates. Even when one had a low trading skill (6), it was still a 40% commission. Not that I had anything of value to trade, because anything of value is too far into the game, and you need to trade to get it!
Seriously, <expletive> this game!

author: {'steamid': '76561198028604783', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 16, 'playtime_forever': 5, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 5, 'last_played': 1530546876}
review:
Gaijin spyware/malware agent and launcher should be blocked by default by any AV software.

Also, make sure tol remove agent from your PC, because that s**t will stay on your PC in "%LocalAppData%\Gaijin".
Same applies for game, it will most likely stay in your steam library where you installed it.

EDIT for dev who responded:
The only way to disable it would be with antivirus blocking start up. Why gaijin needs 2 applications (3 if we count in steam) for a simple update, I have no idea, but agent running in background like a malware (since task manager is the only place where you can see it running) after closing it and deleting the game is fishy. Just because you can "deactivate" and close it does not mean it is not running. Sorry, but that is not acceptable.
developer_response: Hello King, Gaijin Agent can be deactivated in the game launcher by a single click of a button and its only purpose is to update the game. We have notified all users that the game requires 3rd party software on the Steam store page and we are also asking whether users want to turn on auto-updates during the installation process. It is not harmful in any way.

author: {'steamid': '76561198167069402', 'num_games_owned': 200, 'num_reviews': 44, 'playtime_forever': 147142, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 137583, 'last_played': 1693533873}
review:
I have 2k+ hours into this game. Post survival update I will never play again. I quit and uninstalled like when they killed medieval. "lets make this sandbox less free form and more tedious" is never a good idea. Enjoy your downward spiral. You make me sick.

Edit: at the request of friends I did a quick test to see how things are.

 The main reason I quit [mmo bs] was totally rolled back. In place of having to jump through hoops to have assess to all the tools in the sandbox you have to pay them more.

  The inventory full reminder is rather frequent. 

No default settings button so rather then uninstalling removing everything to get a totally fresh outlook I just uninstalled and won't be reinstalling any time soon.

 The tutorial tells you how to toggle camera before telling you how to get out of the cockpit and won't detect the toggle to progress the tutorial until you exit the cockpit. Had to go look at controls for a refresher.

 Momentum seems more broken then ever. Very slippery, like thrusters have less power when they're actuated as part of dampening. 

 I'm particularly offended that the DLC seem to just be remakes [if not straight rip offs] of other peoples mods that they are now charging money for...

 This data was collected in minutes...

   Any self respecting dev of my generation wouldn't need to be told...

      Enjoy the downward spiral...
developer_response:
Hello, SOVOS.

Thank you very much for writing this review. We really appreciate your feedback and all of the other comments we receive from our awesome community.

We encourage you to submit any additional feedback here: https://support.keenswh.com/spaceengineers

Thanks again for your detailed feedback.

Kind regards,

Keen Software House

author: {'steamid': '76561198163443179', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 254, 'playtime_forever': 185, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 78, 'last_played': 1573548554}
review:
I haven't played any other tennis games in the past, but it seems to me this game is the best in its genre. The feeling of the match is very authentic and the graphics are very good even if the game is quite old. You have a career mode and also training mode. You can customize the looks of your characters and various stats like weight, height, speed, etc but as far as I've seen you can't rename them. I might be wrong tho. The only bad looking graphics are the menus UI. They feel like they are from a 90's game at best and they are like a mood breaker but this shouldn't keep you away from having the best tennis fun.
If you like tennis this is the best game you can get on Steam at this moment.
developer_response:
Hello,

in the Training Club, you can change the name of your player by clicking on it.

in the World Tour, you cannot change your name ; you have to start a new Career and edit your name during the creation of your player (still by clicking on the name).

And thanks for the nice review ! :-)

author: {'steamid': '76561197985136429', 'num_games_owned': 479, 'num_reviews': 32, 'playtime_forever': 91, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 28, 'last_played': 1553454172}
review:
A poor imitation of Dungeon keeper. Far from completed (despite their claims). It's basically a copy of dungeon keepers assets and style without the balancing or planning.

I very much regret buying it, not because of the money, but because I supported this garbage.
developer_response:
Hi 123,

I'm not sure when you last played but we've made huge sweeping improvements since your review in 2015. We released the game in an unfortunate state in April 2015 but never stopped updating it. With over 80 updates since then, 7 major updates containing tonnes of new features it's an entirely different game. We have added so much content that the install size has more than tripled to a still tidy 5GB! 

We'd love to know what you think of the game and the new stuff, here are some features we've added since release:

- Map Editor & Workshop Support with full scripting to create custom campaigns
- Overhauled Main Campaign
- Four Expansions with dozens of new features each. Two of these are completely free for you!
- New Game Modes
- Improvements across the board to the core game.
- Aesthetic Improvements
- Vastly improved framerate

Looking forward to hearing what you think,

Cian

author: {'steamid': '76561198364526517', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 1223, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 372, 'last_played': 1621715803}
review:
Don't buy this game, if you think it is good, but could be improved. It is not going to be improved. It is in a very early stage, but totally abondoned. I think the devs expected the modding community to make something from the game. This could have happened, but it didn't happen. Wouldn't recommend! Maybe if you like mount and blade a lot and want to change it up. 

Examples of it not being finished (encountered in 4 hours of gameplay):
I got stuck two times. Couldnt move anymore in battle. You need to wait the battle out, very annoying.
I couldnt command my troops one time.
If you shooting with a higher magnification, the accuracy of a gun becomes worse (yeah i know wtf)

author: {'steamid': '76561198007102925', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 17, 'playtime_forever': 2533, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 371, 'last_played': 1657759178}
review:
I bought this game months ago in early access and it was unplayable. Graphics looked like i was playing on a toaster they where unbearablely bad. 

Went back into it after the recent update. Graphics are great now and gun play is very solid. 

The devs are active and are updating the game and improving it. 

The gameplay its self is a blend of mount and blade and a FPS. 

The gameplay is bland and not allot to do other than just build up your party and kill stuff. 

But its fun and if the devopers keep working on it, I would say it has a bright future.
developer_response: Thank you!😊

author: {'steamid': '76561197980206308', 'num_games_owned': 3971, 'num_reviews': 149, 'playtime_forever': 282, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 282, 'last_played': 1551068930}
review:
Atmospheric horror game full of fairy tale charm. The game doesn't rely on gore, jump scares or cat'n'mouse mechanics. Cute visuals, great sound design, dense atmosphere and unique design choices together make a immersive exploration-based experience. It's not a walking sim (and you can actually die), but puzzles are very simple and the majority of the game is walking around, getting spooked by your own shadow, enjoying coziness of bonfires and feeling 'something isn't quite right' kind of feelings.
Very enjoyable game and well worth the price for anyone, even outside of horror fanbase.

author: {'steamid': '76561198325906067', 'num_games_owned': 160, 'num_reviews': 46, 'playtime_forever': 424, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 211, 'last_played': 1669665340}
review: Were you a kid in the 1980s, had a Commodore 64, and a subscription to Compute! Gazette magazine? If you did, you, like me, very faithfully typed in the code for Richtofen's Revenge, saved it to tape, and wasted many hours of your young hours playing that game to see how far you could get shooting things in the air. This game's setting is in outer space. Richtofen's Revenge was not, it was set on Earth and you were flying around in a plane shooting things in the sky and bombing things on the ground below. However, both games share similar characteristics that I love and turn me into a goofy little kid playing Richtofen's Revenge all over again: shooting things, avoiding things, trying to stay in the air. In this game, you crash if you touch the borders of the window and you are not side scrolling, but it's the same diff. Modern technology also allows you to pick up powerups and, as in Ricktofen, you gotta watch your fuel and ammo. Collect that ammo. Keep shooting things. I totally love this game and play it often. It has that 1980s vibe that makes me feel like a child again, yet I'm all grown up and enjoying improved gaming thanks to all the things that make technology better in the 21st century. If there's a sale, you can grab this for a few cents like I did. I feel bad and wish I had paid the full price, which would have been still under a dollar.

author: {'steamid': '76561198307717326', 'num_games_owned': 153, 'num_reviews': 112, 'playtime_forever': 41, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 21, 'last_played': 1531449023}
review:
Pros:
Humor. Lots of humor. Panties and bunny slippers and a wire collander. Just think about that.
Better movement than PUBG or Realm Royale at least.
Decent amount of guns. Hitreg actually isn't bad.
No tower defense mechanics.
The gun bunker! (you'll have to play it to understand)
Smaller lobbies so you don't need to wait too long.
Free to play at least as long as you download it before the 25th.

Cons:
Bad movement. Lots of rubber banding.
Keeps crashing on opening or fails to connect stating files are corrupted even after verifying.
Loads a hidden malware in the background every time the game opens (my antivirus removes it, but annoying).
Map is very homogenous and bland.
Weird server locations causes ping issues and connection issues.
If you don't download it before the 25th, you'll have to pay for it which will make it not worth your while.

It'll probably get better. Maybe. But there's already much better BR options out there that deserve your attention.
developer_response: Hello Phoenix, the auto-updater can be turned off in the launcher permanently by single click of a button. We are currently experiencing server outage, we are adding servers right now - that should fix the connection and ping issues. Additionally, you can choose server based on your location in the main menu. Thank you for understanding.

author: {'steamid': '76561198085637266', 'num_games_owned': 228, 'num_reviews': 46, 'playtime_forever': 275, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 53, 'last_played': 1535291708}
review:
Pros:
- cute pet game
- free
- kind of game you can play when you feel like "I dont have any game to play"
- easy achievements
- im surprise how the star turned when I overfeed them xD

Cons:
- didn't find any so far

To dev:
- please make similar game like this but with multiplayer features... i need this kind of game in my life.. something like pou... but on steam... with steam community... hmm
developer_response:
Thank you so much for your kindness and support ♡ 

I remember showing this to the lead designer, and we both agreed we would love to explore multiplayer at some point. It is unknown territory so far, considering we mostly do single player games - but we would love to do more and hopefully better for the game. 

Right now we are working on a MatchyGotchy sequel called MatchyGotchy Z, which is twice as more content as we originally have in this free build. We have a store, we have a currency trade store too - bunch of new food, mini games and all that. I just wanted to let you know that we are certainly growing the MatchyGotchy world, and hopefully we can find a way to make multiplayer work if possible :)

author: {'steamid': '76561198044862094', 'num_games_owned': 153, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 183, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 182, 'last_played': 1564537132}
review:
Don't Listen to the negative reviews they obviously are not a Melee and/or Project M player. The game is basically Project M considering you know why. It has wavedashing, wavelanding, ledge camping, auto L cancelling, Normal Up-B Recoverys, and netcode seem decent enough so far. It feels exactly like Project M, like a hard mix of smooth and clunky. This is potentially the game everyone has been waiting for or close to it (since they probably want a Melee HD version for PC from Nintendo, that'll never happen). No more Dolphin with trash netcode or Brawl rip off games. A nice Meleeish style with tech skill and decent netcode for PC (and steam) with controller Support of any kind. 

Upvote this so people can get REAL feedback of the game. Enjoy!

author: {'steamid': '76561198446807385', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 4716, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 4716, 'last_played': 1539909829}
review:
I love this game! Ive been playing for over a year and its the only game thats lasted more than a month or so on my phone and pc. There are so many items you can customize your character with. They keep adding more and more to the game and have special events. There are some pretty cool classes you can choose from and my personal favorite is necromancer. It isnt a pay to win game. There are however items that you can pay for that do not give stat bonuses or anything like that. I love that it is a free roam game and that you can hang out with friends anywhere. You get to meet so many new people. The devs and all of the ae team are very nice and will hang out and interact with you in game. Thanks to the entire ae team for all your hard work!
Battleon!

developer_response:
Hello, Gaijin net agent is not malicious software in any regard. Its only purpose is to update the game - during installation, you are asked whether you want to turn on the auto-updating feature. We are not doing anything without your consent. If you want to turn off the auto-updates, you can do so in the game launcher with a single click of a button - including several other options (like seeding any update to other players).

The software will remain on the computer only if any uninstalling is executed incorrectly by the user (do not delete the folders manually - it has to be uninstalled!).

author: {'steamid': '76561198049490615', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 35, 'playtime_forever': 2291, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2291, 'last_played': 1496301110}
review:
//SKYFORGE//

Climb the ladder to godhood by quelling all threats that plague Aelion and its people.

/PROS/
Dear zeus the visuals are amazing.
By jupiter's beard are the classes fun to use.
Missions and sidequests will leave you busier than sisyphus.
Levels that give daedalus a run for his money.
Plenty of events with ample rewards behind them. Sadly can not earn a god pun as a reward.

/CONS/
Warframe levels of unfortunate mediocrity.
Very grind happy, especially the most reccent update. (red flag one)
Not entirely solo friendly so grab a buddy asap.
Went through the entire game feeling as if i was juuust below adequate sufficiency with weapons and abilities.
Delete the game and you delete your save, think twice!
On the cusp of being a vacant game dispite being free to play. (red flag two)

Not many fond memories with this game so im keeping the conslusion of reasonable length. Skyforge is the very definition of a gilded turd. This game will fish you in hook, line, and sinker with its enticing easy start and then sets up a pretty thick grindwall with the in-game store just in sight. I'm not knocking the devs for trying to make money i'm knocking them for making me play a repetitive content devoid game then asking for donations. Players will only buy microtransaction money if they feel the game has respected their time and gave a solid experience in return for their patience and effort, this game doesn't do that in the slightest nor has it shown signs of trying. Even after pouring real life money into this game you will almost never feel as if the purchase was justified as there will just be more grinding to do afterwards. The game is a low wage discount magician that has one trick and asks you for a donation after doing its sole performance twelve times consecutively with the promise of doing it twelve times more.

Destiny was a better MMO, and that game was a failure to itself and its playerbase.

Solid 5 out of 10.

(will return later for revisions)

author: {'steamid': '76561198157364832', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 32, 'playtime_forever': 2005, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2005, 'last_played': 1683103885}
review:
As much as I wanted to like this game during the hours I played I just can't recommend it. It promises rogue-lite x boomer-shooter elements but it fails to deliver on both ends. The overall gameplay loop is also pretty annoying: complete "nightmare" or arena levels, play mini-games to level up, repeat. This dragged on for too long in a fast-paced shooter.

On the rogue-lite side, we get to carry over one level-1 weapon after each "nightmare"; you can upgrade this in the skill tree. Each world consists of 3 levels, but these "randomly generated" levels felt boringly cloned with few differences. I would've preferred to play uniquely designed levels instead. There are also some events that occur based on RNG but it doesn't really make things more interesting. That's it. Did you notice that I didn't mention perma-death or difficulty options? Unfortunately, these don't exist in the game.

On the boomer-shooter side, it can actually be pretty fun and fast-paced. I enjoyed the weapon variety. The 2D horror art design and visuals are on point. The puzzles and backtracking elements are also pretty interesting, but they get super repetitive when you're playing the same level layout 3 times per world. If a difficulty option was available I think I would've really, really enjoyed this game: I was super disappointed when I melted the final boss.

All in all, Nightmare Reaper fails in its attempt to marry the rogue-lite and boomer-shooter genres together. The level design suffered heavily due to the "rogue-lite" elements. The mini-games interrupted the fast-paced shooting gameplay. And the lack of difficulty options is a BIG negative for both shooter and rogue-lite genre fans alike.
developer_response: We're sorry you didn't enjoy the game.  You can equip pills in the topaz minigame to significantly increase the game's difficulty.

review:
I didn't know what exactly to expect going in... I've played the three Dungeons games, and I love the original Dungeon Keeper 1 and 2, Bullfrog made some of my favorite games ever back in the day.

After playing through a few levels I can say that this is Dungeon Keeper to the T, These guys got every little detail right. It feels like playing Dungeon Keeper II with a modern engine plus benefits. You'd think the Bullfrog guys made this, they even got the game map right.

Work like this needs to be applauded, the makers obviously put a lot of work and heart into this!

author: {'steamid': '76561198206063319', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 389, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 389, 'last_played': 1676451874}
review:
A gorgeous and well-crafted game. The writing was very well done, and while the puzzles were a mix of extremely satisfying and occasionally head-scratching, the worldbuilding and memorable characters more than made up for its shortcomings. 

I did appreciate being able to 'incorrectly' solve certain puzzle chains, and that the game tries to tell you that you've done something wrong. One such instance led to me reloading an earlier save and doing the whole sequence again, which ended up being an *extremely* good decision. 

If the game had one major flaw, it would be that its climax felt a little rushed and underwhelming [spoiler] (the underground section in particular, it felt a little strange to have control taken away from your character in such a pivotal moment, and it was too short for the return afterwards to feel meaningful) [/spoiler] but other than that, the story was very good and the underlying mystery kept me invested the whole time.

Also, bonus points for including a character that talks only in rhyme. I don't know why, but something about that trope gets me every time. Some people find that sort of thing insufferable, but me, I find it quaint. The fact that there's only one instance of this, I think shows great restraint.
developer_response: Thanks so much for the lovely review and kind words. I think you might also enjoy our follow-up, Strangeland, which also features a rhyming character . :D

author: {'steamid': '76561197973149646', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 71, 'playtime_forever': 582, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 582, 'last_played': 1613308239}
review:
Although the game is very relaxing and the dev did a nice job with the atmosphere, I cannot recommend this game at this time.
It's not because it's a bad game, it just doesn't feel finished at all.
I think the dev has came a long way to making a really nice game and I truly hope they continue to work on it, but it's just not finished at this time.

1. The animal respawns and AI are not yet completed.  I see eagles frozen in mid air, waiting for the player to walk near them.

2. There are keys you cannot rebind. When consulting the developer, they said the key was bound in game.  Sorry, game building 101 says never, ever hard code a key.

3. Building mechanics have issues.  You build a foundation, a few walls, then the game refuses to build a ceiling (no roof pieces yet). So to build the ceiling, you must destroy the walls, and sometimes the foundation then rebuild the structure and maybe, just maybe it will let you add the ceiling.

4. Placing a non snapping item on the ground like a planter is not a good experience. It's because of the character animation. When swapping to first person character, please turn off the idle animation so the player doesn't feel drunk when trying to place a part.

Food and drink are good.
Animal attacks are good.

I love writing reviews that help the developer with their game. Saying a game sucks is useless information.

author: {'steamid': '76561198109041809', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 19, 'playtime_forever': 36, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 36, 'last_played': 1700929347}
review:
tl;dr: If you want a deepish rpg/roguelike experience go play Barony instead, this is more of a FPS.

Honestly, for what it is it's an okay game, but you can't go into it and expecting a dungeon crawling experience like Barony (which is a great roguelike game which I highly recommend).

What this is however is more like a FPS which you're supposed to enjoy with friends. Exploration is minimal and the enemies are predictable and come in waves. Levelling up and powering up is also trivial.

I think overall this game wasn't marketed correctly, so take the above into consideration before buying!

author: {'steamid': '76561197992384886', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 36, 'playtime_forever': 14483, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 8330, 'last_played': 1697492709}
review:
Superb wargame that occupies a middle ground between Panzer General-likes such as Order of Battle on the one hand, and real deal grognard games like Gary Grigsby's War in the East on the other. What sets it apart from the simpler hex-based strategy games it resembles is a well-realized supply system. Friendly and enemy supply enters the map at set places, runs freely along rail lines, and can be extended by creating supply depots. Disrupting enemy supply while protecting your own is a core part of the game.

What impresses me about this system is that despite being simple and abstractified, it organically drives you toward realistic tactics. In most non-spreadsheety strategy games I've played, a lot of the maneuver I'm thinking about is kiting enemy attack ranges, protecting ranged units with direct combat ones, that kind of thing. There's absolutely nothing wrong with that, but in this game I'm thinking about breakthroughs and encirclements, shoring up my flanks, and counting how many hexes forward I can go without outrunning my supply. It's impressively [i]realistic[/i] for how simple it is. 

Well, I don't want to oversell how simple it is. There's definitely a learning curve and you'll definitely have to refer to the manual, but there are no spreadsheets here; everything is there for you on the map itself.

The scenario design is solid. They're well-grounded in real history, and provide a stiff challenge, mainly by asking you to keep a strict timetable. You have the initiative, which in practical terms means you have the superior force and are thus able to force the issue, but what makes it hard is taking objectives on time without suffering unnecessary losses that will make you weaker in future scenarios. On classic difficulty you'll face some pretty wrenching dilemmas. On normal difficulty you get one extra turn on everything, which really takes the edge off and makes flawless victory consistently achievable with proper play.

The AI is seldom irrational, and is good at punishing mistakes. If you leave a division in a vulnerable position, it will destroy it. If you leave an exploitable gap in your lines, it will drive a mobile division through and overrun a supply depot or cut off your vanguard forces. If you cross your "t"s and dot your "i"s, it will pretty much just stay in its fortified positions and hang on as long as possible. The game supports hotseat multiplayer, but it doesn't seem to me that the enemy side would be fun to play in almost any scenario. You'd hardly be able to DO anything that doesn't just make you lose harder, unless the other guy screws up.

My only real complaint against the game is that it kinda ruined Panzer General style games for me. They just feel too gamey and unrealistic now, its unsatisfying. I never had this problem before. The UoC2 devs better keep releasing expansion campaigns if they want to make it up to me!

author: {'steamid': '76561197990946910', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 20, 'playtime_forever': 302, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 300, 'last_played': 1541359958}
review:
I have been a wargamer since the late 60's--yeah, old guy here...  I have learned over the years that simplicity and ease of play typically triumph over details, details, and more details.  Now, don't get me wrong--deep dive simulations can be very enjoyable.  It is easy, however, to lose yourself in the thicket while the world passes you by.  

This game is easy to pick up and easy to play.  There are no supply rules to worry about.  There are no cohesion points to finagle.  In short, this is wargaming at its most primitive.  And...for some odd reason, it works!  Perhaps it's the ferocius AI or maybe it's the simplicity.  Regardless, as the German player you feel the desperation as the Soviet hordes slowly grind you into dust.  They maneuver smartly, they attack smartly...as I said, ferocious AI.

Now, this game does have its problems.  The manual is basically non-existent.  You have to figure a lot of things out on your own.  Stick with it though, and you'll soon be telling your wife "just one more turn" as you watch your units slowly get strangled by the Russian juggernaut.  Highly recommended--fun game that captures the spirit of the desperate Korsun defense quite well.
developer_response:
Hi alejes02

Thanks for your comments. I realize now that I seriously underestimated how much detail to put in the Manual. Lesson Learnt. I am gradually updating as I get feedback.

Regards

author: {'steamid': '76561198033846452', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 41, 'playtime_forever': 13671, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 4305, 'last_played': 1609913312}
review: So they charge 60$ to give us the things we were supposed to have for the first $60. Just like I'm sure the people that get the third installment of this will likely get the content they were supposed to have in the 2nd and and the bug fixes for the 1st. As far as business strategys go this is pretty low, one of the lowest things I've seen a developer do. I will never purchase another game from this developer. I encourage those of you that have already left reviews to go edit them as they are relying partially on poor information between gamers to pull of this heist. And those of you bros in part II please remind people so that people that buy into the second installment at minimum know who and what they are dealing with. $60 I totally wish I could take back for moral reasons. Not to mention that game is pretty bland.

author: {'steamid': '76561198058585879', 'num_games_owned': 450, 'num_reviews': 15, 'playtime_forever': 65, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 65, 'last_played': 1638831484}
review:
Surprisingly enjoyable despite not being my type of game. Obviously fairly dated and could do with some of the modern features current FPS games have but I can see there being a niche for this. There's obviously still somewhat a playerbase around (provided that they aren't all AI but didn't seem to be). 
Although seems to be the vast majority playing as Nazi Germany which is mildly concerning to say the least.
